review: Never written a steam review before but I feel I have to after all the Negative reviews here. TL DR at the end. Some reviews complain about hords of Chinese hackers on Games which i've seen videos of but have not seen any in my own playtime (EU servers). Some complain about a 'myrad of technical issues' but do not elaborate beyond it taking up ALOT of RAM and VRAM which may be true since with 16gigs ram iv'e no issues. Rubberbanding has never happened except for the time the entire house had internet because my country has a data cable from the 1970s or something and hackers are nowhere as prevalant as some people say. Not encountered any blatant hacking yet and the inclusion of the Death Cam is a great help in finding hackers especially with aim wall and recoil hacks.IMHO this is an incredibly fun game to play transitioning from relaxed looting to suddenly tense and almost panicky moments as another player/squad find you or you realize the blue circle is closing in on you and youy have no car. Playing with friends is an absolute blast especially if you all have a similar sense of humor as after every gunfight or funny mishap while driving you can all make a few good jokes about it.TL DR Extremely fun game to play alone or with friends with funny calm and tense moments all over. It is also one of the few games I've played where I do not feel crushing dissapointment when I don't win as long as YOU think you did well you have fun.Loads of fun bring friends and enjoy the massacres.

review: Overall it's a challenging yet fun game but the hackers with aim and esp cheats (especially Chinese players) have been a plague since beta and Chinese (yes I am being redundant) players amassing in North American servers cause severe lag and rubber banding. If the devs would proactively work on getting rid of the hackers and limit people in their global regions to the servers setup for their specific geographic location to get rid of the plague on North American servers it would be a fantastic game. If you are going to play you will at least need a CPU with a minimum clock speed of at least 3.5 GHz (AMD Ryzen CPU's work great although I do have a friend who plays the game successfully using a AMD Phenom CPU) and a good mid range graphics card (minimum of GTX 1060 or AMD RX 480) if you want to play on anything but potato settings and get frame rates above 60 FPS. I can't and won't recommend the game until the aforementioned issues are addressed and taken care of!

review: This game is seriously a mixed bag. Sometimes it's really fun and other times the most frustrating piece of crap out there. When it works fine it's fun and enjoyable to play. However the times the game runs well is very rare. Almost every game I play there is massive server lag. While driving my friends and I will hit invisible walls get shot through walls and supply box crates and have even been killed a couple times by people driving cars through entire buildings. All of these issues have been around since the start of the game and none of the devs have done ANYTHING to try and fix their terrible servers. Because of these reasons alone I cannot recommend the game to anyone. Pros Really well crafted "king of the hill" gameplay mechanics High skill cap that rewards good players for playing well High strategic requirements forcing you to think on your feetCons VERY poor optimization (I have a 1070 and 1700x with low settings except for view distance and only get a max of 90fps with many frame drops and only utilization of 3 of my 8 cores/ 16 threads) Terrible server quality Main menu doesn't even work properly (have to refresh page to ready up every time a teammate joins) Numerous glitches I understand this game is te ally early access but the devs have hundreds of millions of dollars at their disposal and they seem to be focusing more on adding a new map instead of improving performance with optimizations and better servers.

review: If you have a decent computer that is just over minimum specs but still want to lag want to hear white kids say the N word more time than you can count run for 20 minutes to avoid the circle just to be shot by a camper because you lagged and your shots didn't count or want to develop high blood pressure? Then this game is for you!I have never enjoyed or hated a game more in my life. PUBG is a fantastic game at its core and the DEVs have done an amazing job updating the game. There are high promises that I look forward to them fulfilling hopefully. I have slightly over 150 hours into the game and feel at this point I can provide an honest review.Pros Community. I know what I said earlier but it s true. I have never played a game where three random people fight so hard and communicate toward a common goal. Yes you will have dumb children screaming in your ear as your plane loads (it will hurt). But overall I have yet to have a team that didn t try to help for a win.Gameplay. It s what you make of it. If you want to play slow and methodical as you slowly loot buildings and scraps left behind you can. Or run and gun the second you have a pistol and build your arsenal from the corpses of your enemies. It s up to you. Obviously one is harder than the other but both are equally satisfying.Matches. For the most part I have yet to wait more than a minute or two for a lobby to load and have us all loaded into that sardine can of a plane.Weapons/Balance. At the moment the guns feel different enough to warrant actually picking. Shotguns for once in a video game are useful and frankly amazing in the right circumstances. Tweaking is being done for balance and accuracy which is to be excepted of an early access. Cons Connection/Performance. My specs are an i5 8GB RAM and 2GB video card with a 100MBps internet connection. I know get a better PC . But bare minimums exist for a reason and I will be the first to tell you the listed specs aren t accurate. Prepare to be shot after peaking behind a while due to desync issues and for the lower end computers to freeze or stutter as you enter through a building. Matches. Some games can last upwards of 35+ minutes so be prepared to invest into a game. For any older gamers with kids this is not something you can pick up quickly for a match or two and jump off. Due to the circle in the game without a vehicle it will become a running simulator. There is nothing more frustrating than fighting the circle and be shot by someone camping a window.For anyone who is running lower end PCs I recommend you wait a little longer for them to optimize the game. Otherwise it s a definite purchase.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS a fun and a laggy way to entertain playersI was sceptical if this game would make some popularity at all because many other games had battle royale modes. Turned out I was very very wrong. And I also understood why because of it's simpicity (perhaps) in game mode style. You loot find some weapons and go kill everyone till the very last one. Gamemode itself is pleasant enjoyable. I like the idea of 100 people dropped from a plane on an island to slaughter.But there is a very big downside to all of this......and it is the way how this game has been built. Currently as of 16/11/2017 this game is in Early Access probably not far away from full release with a new map and (weapons?). Devs do (maybe) try to fix the problems with this game. The biggest issue I can adress right now is it's performance. I have a PC setup with GTX970 4 gen i5 8GB of RAM. Somehow when I land near houses they still seem not loaded properly. Tried various fixes including setting the game to lowest possible but nothing would work. So while you are running around that house you want to loot quickly because an enemy landed nearby and is willing quickly to deal with you there is nothing I can possibly do. FPS is fine but not the *unloaded textures cmon. And that's how often I get killed in very first few moments. Probably the record has been 3 minutes of no housing. And also lately hackers seem to get into matches often. BattleEye? Meh. More? De syncs optimization probably coding also...not satisfying at all.Overall I can say that PUBG is an engaging experience to try out but to fully enjoy this game you need a strong PC setup. That does not deny the hackers though. I am giving currently a negative review on this game until devs improve the problems with performance and hackers. I am going to play it nevertheless because as I said the game is fun and giving some adrenalin. Hopefully in future I can change from negative to positive.... UPDATE 22.12.2017They bloody fixed the performance. No idea about the hackers tho. I can recommend this game cuz it will run on toasters.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After playing 70 hours of PUBG I think it's safe to say that I have some skill in the game. I am no where near being above average in terms of skill but I enjoy it nonetheless. My only problem with the game is servers and the rubberbanding issues. In my opinion BlueHole should focus on improving the games server issues in order to provide a more enjoyable experience to the games players.Another issue that some people have with PUBG is the games optimization issues. Personally I don't have a proble here as I play on low settings to make targets easier to see at a distance. I can run the game on ultra settings with a high FPS bnut this is not my preference.I think that with the latest update BlueHole has bougfht some time in order to focus on these issuen. The gunplay and vehicle seem fine for now even though many people would disagree with that. There is no need for any new content as of yet.Also I feel that a skill based match making system may be in order.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: With the game being officially released I feel confident recommending this game. There are plenty of ways to find out what this game is so I'm not going to bother reviewing it in depth. The important points for me are as follows 1) The game is much better optimized now. For reference I have a gtx 1050ti and can get 60+ fps most of the time. The loading area and plane are the exceptions still but this doesn't affect gameplay.2) The new map is great.3) The replay system allows you to watch whole matches from other peoples pov so you can learn how to get better.4) It's still fun after 100 hours and I plan on playing much more. Whether with friends random people or on your own this game caters to everyone.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Unloaded my mag on someone on the other side of a breakable door.He peeks through the broken door and killed me in 2 shots.Play Squad with random team members.Rendezvous with teammate.He kills me because he wanted my 8x scope.10/10 would play againOut of Early Access EDIT Considering that Bluehole/PUBG Corp. got the game out of early access within their promised time window and improved the performance by a whole lot since the first time I played it (both servers and in game performance) pretty good and would recommend especially if you have friends. It's still a little buggy in some places physics for example but it's probably going to be ironed out soon and not game breaking (and is actually hilarious at times). It also has a pretty fair price for being a multiplayer only game.I shrug off the occassional cheaters once in a while because getting rid of cheaters 100% is impossible anyway and because of how quickly you can get back into the action anyway.

Rubber banding is hot atm. Orginal map gives a ton of rubber banding that it didn't had before (to high setting to detect cheaters?) FPS drops at more places than before.I'm not running the game on a potato PC. If I can run ARK SURVAVAL EVOLVED on Ultimate settings with 60 fps than this game with medium to low setting should do just fine. But since the launch update not anymore.So keep it in your wishlist but don't buy it for the 30 euro/dollar they're asking now.

review: I have had this game for some time and as much fun as it is to play it has just as many technical issues. Rubber Band Man the song by T.I. written in 2003 was dedicated to Brendan Greenes' future creation of PUBG. The game is extremely buggy even with its 1.0 release and reminds me of what you would get when you try to combine a tactical shooter like Ghost Recon Wildlands with a Bethesda standard buggy unfixed open world game. Although i believe Kotaku Official review of this game describe exactly how I feel about it the most it is a perfect disaster of a game. For some reason despite all of the bugs the appeal of the gameplay completely revolves around its Battle Royale/Tactical Shooter game type. Other developers out there....Cough.....Cough.....Ubisoft.....Could take a game like Ghost Recon Wildlands create their own Battle Royale mode and easily make a game that is more polished. For 30 bucks this game isn't so bad unless you are playing on Xbox One at the moment. Definitely will put out a buyer beware notice to those that are more picky than I about the current state of this game.

review: Between the test server and the full game I have played close to 210 hours of this game. Often times it can feel like a loot simulator running around endlessly looking for better only finding fights every 5 or so minutes. It can be incredibly frustrating without a doubt. To me that doesn't matter this game keeps you coming back. You need the win you want the feel of that quick adrenaline when you get in an unexpected firefight and your back is against the wall. The feeling when you win the firefight against all odds. When you get the win your heart is racing that final zone is intense your hands shake you can taste the victory. All in all this game has a love hate relationship but more than anything it has raised my situational awareness more than any MOBA ever has I love this game and anyone who is on the edge of buying it for the release should definitely give it a shot. Loot Simulator Best Simulator

review: After every match you have to reconnect that is really annoying and sometimes it takes longer than expected or throw a "server busy" even though you were just play that is ridiculous.I am from Brazil and play on the "South and Central America" which from what I heard the server is located in São Paulo yet its lag as hell in some games I have a 120mb connection its awful to play sometimes.I don't have anything against China or Chinese people but the server I play is full of Chinese people where the vast majority of them are unable to speak English this game highly depends on communication for DUO and SQUAD it would be nice if you guys implement something like what Dota2 have done if you play on a server where your ping to the server is bigger than the average allowed you will be put in a low priority matching that will make you wait a LOT longer before you get a match thus forcing them to play on their local servers.Which bring us to another point people with high pings will often perform poorly due to the latency against other players with 9 50ms over those with 200 500ms trying to play there.If I want to play DUO with random people it needs to stop putting me back on the solo after the game ends that is very annoying that I have to select DUO or SQUAD every single time I have to pick a game.You should add some ability for players to check their latency/fps/net graphs to the server during game play similar to the net_graph that exists on counter strike its very useful and helpful to all of us.If you are in a team on the lobby or in game you should make voice available for the team it would be very nice that we don't have to cut the voice communication during or after the game when we go back to the lobby.

review: I will write a short review on this game. It's a good game a popular game but even with all that has major issues that make it unplayable like rubberbanding registration issues clunky mechanics and graphical optimization issues. With that in mind I thought all of this could be bypassed and still enjoy the game but I (personally) didn't it's just not my cup of tea. So if you came here and read this ask these questions before buying this do I have a good gaming enviroment that overcomes the technicall issues that the game has at it's current state? and do i have the patience to run for huge amounts of time with the uncertanty that I might kill or get killed? if so buy it if don't get other game for the same pricePS. I'll give it a recommendation. Just because it doesn't worked for me doesn't mean can't work for some one else.

review: They are now adding microtransactions. They promised from the very beginning they would not add them until the game was done. Looks like another H1Z1.So far a great game. They do need to change the system requirements. The game is not optimized right now. There will be issues since it is in alpha. I would recommend a gtx 1050 and at least an i5 processor. Even with a gtx 1070 and an i7 6700k I only peak at 120fps. I mainly stay around 70 to 80 fps. They should work on fixing these small issues before adding more crates. I just hope this does not turn into H1Z1. If you have a computer that does not have some of the best hardware out to date right now dont even bother buying this game. The fps is getting worse by the patch. This is another Daybreak company at this point of time. If they do not start to focus on the FPS side of this game the game will start to fail. Who wants to play a $30 with a ton of FPS drop. This might be an alpha game but if they contunie to microtransation then they have no excuss to push updates every other day to help improve the state of the game. They have the income to do whatever they want with this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

However keep in mind that there isn't anyone else that has a 99 player battle royale game that takes place on one big map that requires constant rendering and generating.That being said this game has a lot of potential and the team behind it seems determined to try and make it as best as it can be. It will be a long while before we get the ideal battle royale game however this is the one that I belive will achieve that goal.

review: Honestly the game plays like you got your delayed actions like opening doors getting into cars and picking up weapons. Most people (usually h1z1 fanboys) like to point these things out and I could sit here and tell you everything that is wrong with h1z1 but I rather talk about this game. This game is amazing it's one of the few games out there that you can play by yourself and still have fun. Playing this game with a bunch of mates who arn't actually looking for a reason to hate it is amazing. The friends I play with most frequently do not have this game and it is a shame but ive met so many people through playing this game solo so it doesn't even really matter. You have the option to solo que by yourself into a squad game which is fun but also randomly queing with people who you dont know but share the same love of the game that you do is amazing. Despite the "China number one and you mother" pregame lobby this game is not full of toxic players (10/10 for the community alone) the that this game isnt makes the game every thing it is. The amount of intense gunfights and funny moments makes this game one of the best games out there right now. This game doesnt even have skins! WHAT'S THAT?!?!? THE PRODUCERS ARNT GREEDY BASTARDS TRYING TO SQUEEZE EVERY OUNCE OF MONEY OUT OF YOU??????? THEY ACTUALLY WORK ON FIXING THE GAME AND TRYING TO MAKE IT BETTER?!?!?!? &lt what was written in caps should be enough for you to atleast try this game and if you find that it is not for you you can always refund it anyways&gt

review: There are still so many issues with this game it's barely worth it to play sometimes. As of now the rubberbanding at the start of matches can get so bad that you can't move for up to a minute while people around you loot guns and eventually kill you. There is still pretty rampant cheating especially on the Asian servers (which the game defaults your location to no matter where you are). So you regularly face cheaters with less ping/rubberbanding and when you do end up getting good loot and murking some fools your kill cam will show you clearly behind cover while your killer shoots to your side and gets a headshot.

review: Since I'm living in a country where "cable" is a foreign word I'm forced to use a 4G modem. Everyone knows using radio waves automatically means a higher latency.Although my average ping is at about 50ms ping spikes can occur ( 120ms). This happens at least once a game. That means I can't play a single game without getting kicked by a nice pop up titled "Network lag detected".I would appreciate a feature to rejoin the game.Unless then I can't really recommend this game although it would be a lot of fun to play...

review: Tons of fun. However there are quite a few things you can do in the game that aren't readily apparent. Be sure to look at the controles and look up some tips online about how to play. That said there are still quite a few bugs in the game. Have gotten stuck inside a door and could not open it again to get out. Exited a car next to a barrier and it put me in mid air between the car and barrier and would not let me move. It eventually killed me by "falling". I'm looking forward to a first person only mode.Edit 9/27/17 Most of the bugs and glitches are now fixed. The game still has some performance issues but it has come a long way from where it once was. I'm still really enjoying the game. The new foggy weather mode is great as are the new weapons that keep being added to the game. The developer keeps making the game more stable and adding new and welcome features. I love first person mode and look forward to the new maps being released.Other reviewers have mentioned being banned for stream sniping. I personally have not experienced any of these bans. The chat on the plane and in the pre game hub area is as toxic as ever. I do my best to try to start friendly conversations by saying hi and wishing others well but that is usually met by someone saying "shut the F*** up" or someone shouting racial slers over and over again. I'd like the option to be able to open a menu to see who's talking and just mute that person. All in all it's a fun experience and would recommend you give it a chance if you can.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: To start off I know this game is in early access and I aware that most of my complaints against this game will be resloved(or I hope they will be) I have been playing since April or so and I have seen some awesome improvments on the games quality and balance. Right around the start of the Gamescom tournament this game was running very well when I pressed F to open a door or get into a car it was as smooth as butter with an FPS of 50 60. I was excited to see such a great improvment to a game I thourghly love and the smoothness made it very enjoyable. This also showed me the devs commitment to improving the game for the better. With that said this last week or two the game has been a nightmare. The server lag is disgusting for a game that just reported a net worth of 4 BILLION dollars. My frame rate is still decent so I know the optimization if we can call that has not changed much so it has to be a server issue. It seems like the game has regressed to what it was when it was first released which is insane considering how much money bulehole or as others say buleballs is bringing in. That is my back story If you want this game get it its fun but it is not worth 30bucks its worth 5 10 bucks tops in its current state. The loot drops are terrible you can clear a large building at the start of the game looking for something as simple as a pistol and not find one. Grinding for BP points is crap and the item box rate of dropping anything worth vaule is also crap. Playing since near the beginning and still have not recieved gloves or a coat. 200 + hours into a game should be worth something more than pretty lame aperal. My game defaults to the AS server I am in NA so that is super annoying and can't be that hard to fix. This review is to remind the devs that they have a responsibility to their consumers to make progress on their game and not to back peddle once they have made mass profits off of a tournament and purchased crate systems. I know most of that money went to charity but I also know you guys are not going home hungry. Improving server lag would be enough to get you guys a thumbs up but I still think the balance in the game is atrocious at best when it comes to wepon drops and vehicle drops. I mean come on I am only asking that you at least improve the rate at which I can find a single wepon to defend my self at the start of a match. As a potential buyer of this game wait until either you can get it for free as a gift or until it hits steam sale.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I didn't want to give this game a bad review but THE CHEATING AND HACKING IS GAME BREAKING!!! It's so bad that it almost out weighs any good quality I can think of. I encounter cheaters/hackers at least 1 out of every 3 games. It might not seem that bad but when you spend 30 minutes playing a match have a decent chance at winning and there are 10 15 people left the last thing you want is to get domed by one shot to the head with a Kar98k from some dude sitting on a hill 3KM away the second you run out from behind a wall or hill.It's such an easy fix ban the cheating players from playing it. Forever. Make them buy a new account just like CS GO if they want to play again. Or something. All I know is I haven't encountered cheating in any other FPS like I have this one. Sorry Bluehole. Fix the cheating and I'll give it a good review.Also the general server connection is sub par. Net code sucks and latency can sometimes screw you. I'll run around a corner and then die my body lying where I was before I ran around the corner. Sometimes I'll pick up an item about 5 or 6 times before it goes in my inventory. It's noticeably worse when the game first starts but gets much better as it goes.In general it's fun and has a lot of potential. However the problems are still there. The cheating/hacking in particular is what made me give it a thumbs down.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First off yes you should buy the game... Unless you run on a laptop like my friend who i wish could play (Likes 1. Top 100 "I GOT THIS"... Top 50 "Oh no im scared "... Top 10 *hearts racing* *sweat running down face* *gets shot* "..."2. Kar98k... all i have to say )3. Sniping and shooting people at long range is really good and fun. Hard but fun.4. The supply drops make it very interesting in my opinion. Ive had someone to my right and left in a duo... it was a 2v2v2 and that was really fun to battle it out over probably what was just a m249 but still really fun.Dislikes 1. You have to have a god pc to run at medium 2. Bit of lag issues in terms of just landing out of the plane3. This one has nothing to do with the game but how bad i am... I HATE GETTING KILLED CAUSE I CANT FIND A GUN!!!! Yes I'll admit I could not for the life of me find anything to review about but i wanted to say something because its a great game. So I did and its honestly just a really good game. You might have some issues if you dont have a decent pc tho so keep that in mind when buying the game.

review: 游戏很好 最近一直在玩 我写这个评测的目的只有一个 我想说美服中国人太多 有很多素质真的很差 很影响游戏体验 不会说英文你可以不说 但请你别一上来就叽哩哇啦的讲一大堆中文 我听着都烦 想杀外国人你可以去杀 但请你不要影响别人的游戏体验 凭心而论 我和外国人玩的时候大家都愉快的聊天 偶尔和国人也可以这样游戏 但为什么绝大部分的情况都是上来就 操你妈 China No.1 之类的话 有什么意义 不是很懂 说实话 感觉很悲哀 10/26 更新更改评价为差评 上述问题愈演愈烈并发现了新的问题 挂 在蓝洞能找到较为稳妥的解决外挂的情况下 差评不变 并且不推荐购买此游戏 反正还在EA 不如等等 做不好也免得花冤枉钱 12/23 更新正式版上线 做的不错 已经可以开始准备降价时入手了 就个人而言 外挂 帧数问题少了很多 然而国人问题依旧 For those do not understand Chinese The game is great but I will not recommend you buy it. There 2 main issue that need to be dealt with. 1st is that there are simply way too many Chinese playing in the NA server and it is annoying since most of them are not friendly and you simply can not communicate with them. Yes even they realized that I am a Chinese myself. Surprise! 2nd is there are a lot of hackers and apparently Blue Hole (who made this game) have not yet found any nice solution. Until they found a way to deal with this kind of outrageous behavior that runinning this game I will keep advising everyone not buying this game. Just save your money do not waste on this game like me.12/23 UpdateMore fun with the 1.0 coming out. Less hackers for sure. Still too many Chinese. If you really like this game I recommend purchasing it when there's a discount.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. My friend gifted me this game and it was nice of him to do that so I thought I'd give it a try. Now the concept of battle royale isn't that bad I like it in other games like in the divison (not a popular opinion lol) but it's not that i hate battle royals I hate this game. I tolerate now since I'll play with my friend who kindly bought this for me but with the lag glitchy bugs (one being I take damage for some reason when i parachute down) and repetitive gameplay it makes it hard to play. For example in the division's take on the gamemode they have things like thirst hunger cold etc. PUBG doesn't need to have those specific gameplay elements but it should be more than a running sometimes shooting sometimes driving and sometimes looting simulator.

review: This game is great it contains everything a battle royale game needs. You can decide to land in popular areas to fight to the death or just land in rural areas and get your loot safely. It also has two maps which are very different a europian map with alot of cover and vast areas. And then there is the desert map which is mostly mountainous and has hardly any trees this map is not a favourite but will do fine if your computers FPS is bad on the Russian map. I think that they should add map pick instead of going into the desert map continuously hoping you get the old map. The main downfalls of this game are FPS Issues and rubber banding which i dont really see that much on EU servers but can still be frustrating and finally hackers. As i have not experienced any yet i don't really have an issue but i have heard it is mostly Chinease players joining EU and US games. This can be revoked quite easily if they add REGION LOCKING.

review: CHINA NUMBER ONE was the first thing i hear when i jump into the game.round 1 dive toward the ground aimlessly run around for 15 minutes to get snipe.round 5 just want to kill some people and everyone telling me to go to school... HOLY WHY IS THERE 30 people here.round 10 br&gt round 50 br&gt round 100 going to take 20 minutes sitting in this bathroom for some loot delivery service.round 200 hmm i can play smart and get some chicken dinner or charge in to get 6 kills..... LEEROYYYY JENKINNSSSSupdateRound 1000 hmm they finally fixed most of the bugs... oh wait.. i guess going to have to throw that grenade to knock my friend out of that location.P.S. this game actually has suprising depth and smart play. slow and steady gets you consistantly to the top 10 most people think rng is everything in this game but knowing the map positioning in a way that you dont get destroyed by the red zone. knowing which building are the most high likkely to spawn good loot not getting greedy in fights knowing went to back out and when to press the attack. This game got me into shooters and i am really happy it did.EDIT i am really mix feelings putting thisi game in not recommended but i have to i gotten to the point in which i get to top 10 70 80% of the time and every single time almost i play in TPP i get killed by a hacker you can say why not just play FPP i do it fun but some times i still want to play TPP it not my job as a consumr to worry about hackers the fact that almost every single game i play in TPP is affected by a hacker concern me. i carefully play for 20 25 minutes getting in good positions sneaking up on team making correct choices by taking detours with a car to less populated area for what? a pistol 300 meters 5 tap to the head? for a winchester headshot throught 2 windows and a town? really? fix this shitbefore hackers kill this game.

review: The concept is great. The gunplay is pretty good. The actual gameplay? Naaaah.The circle which you are supposed to reach does not take into account any variables at all like loot distribution plane path vehicle spawns or geography. This means that you all too often find yourself at the opposite side of the map without a vehicle or a gun having to run for miles just to get to the safe zone only to be absolutely overrun by people who got lucky and found everything they needed in the first building they entered in the middle of the zone.The random elements are far too many and far too distracting to call this game "good". It has redeeming qualities such as the fantastic gunplay with weapon attachments and handling but the core mechanics need a lot of polishing for this to be a game that people keep coming back to without feeling like they got screwed by no fault of their own.

review: Honestly at its core PUBG is a really great game. Bluehole are really trying to fix their issues with the game at the moment and its a great thing. While some bugs havent been fixed and are still a problem people choose to ignore the issues that have been fixed. I feel like the PUBG fan base has a negative feel for the game now and nothing PUBG does can satisfy them. They always have somthing to complain about even if PUBG pulls out a great patch fixing many issuses there are allways people screaming in the comments about somthing that hasent been fixed. PUBG wasnt the best on launch but recently they have really been improving it and the game is moving in the right direction. All in all PUBG is a great game and while there are issues they are being fixed and the game is in a much better state than it was at launch and continues to get better with every patch. This game is a lot of fun and defiantly somthing to jam with your mates This is a recommended buy.

review: So a bunch of my friends bought this game because we really like playing H1Z1 King of the Kill but we realied tht game was glitchy. My other friend showed us the trailer to this game and it looked really fun so we bought it. When i got in I wasn't expecting much but I had a lot of fun although the game is not prefect.Pros 1. The gameplay and the controls are pretty good. 2. The map is a lot bigger than KotK 3. The weapon costumization is really fun and it really feels like a challenge to get things without dying 4. Guns do not feel like peashooters 5. SpectatingCons 1. The game has a lot of glitches although I get it that it is an early access game that just came out 2. Things like backpacks can be really hard to find but I assume that the game is supposed to be like that 3. The price is a little expensive Other than those two cons the game is really good. It is a better alternative for KotK.Although I would not buy this game though if you do not have friends to play it with. Another thing i would buy this if it was on sale and not at full price because $30 is a lot. That is really all I have to say on the game. I rate 7/10

review: Issue #1 Load/Render time. Buildings don't render even though my computer meets the max requirements and I run on Very low graphics.Why is this a problem? The very beginning of the game is a trying moment when you're un equipped. Often I must stand outside the buildings I land at for 2 minutes before they render. Giving people time to get weapons and shoot me and the barrier to close in on me. It also makes aiming jumpping because of lag.Issue #2 Fault default server. I want to automatically match with americans because I'm america. Why am I matching with asians by default?Why is this a problem? Because I speak English. Because it lags more when the server is meant to be across the world.Issue #3 I can't cancel a match make.Why is this a problem? Mostly because of Issue #2. Because I manually have to change the server EVERY GAME I often forget and can't change that if I press 'play' and then remember.Issue #4 Lots of items 0 customization. I guess this is more of a suggestion.. Make more of the cosmetics free. Or make it where you can buy them with in game currency without random selection.Why is this a problem? I like customization. I like having achievements and reasons to continue playing outside of (&amp as well as) gameplay. I hate random number games. I hate grindy games. I hate that I've opened 6 crates and got stuff I will NEVER use because the default clothes are better. and I hate that I went with a default look just so I can immerse myself in game play and then find out I have to pay to change it.

review: 300+ hours played since release gone through the numerous updates. I'll UPDATE THE REVIEW AS THE GAME UPDATES JUST SCROLL DOWN As I edit this 1.0 DROPPED finally &amp boy has the game taken a much much better turn for the better. The new map is wide open big and in a desert yet you almost never have to worry about not not being in the zone as the map is filled with a great amount of vehicles and the new additions are nice. It is done really well and i'm glad to have had so much enjoyment playing the game in the last two days since the offical release. Now as early as I am editing this the game still suffers from early game dsync when you first land in the desert map it's not unplayable but noticeable when you try to open a door and it won't and such but goes away fairly quickly. In addition to the new map we get 4 new guns 2 on the original map and 3 on the desert map (i believe sorry if i am wrong). The car physics/mechanics got a change and it makes driving feel much more smoother and comfortable to the player. The game got a good amount of optimization and it runs really well but still not as good as it could given my RX980 i'm still running the game at about 70 80 on very low to low. The gun play feels a lot smoother &amp crisp I have so far no complaints on how the guns feel and / or shoot. I think the new scopes are a great addition and removing the 8x on the m16 was a smart move.The new UI is cleaner but is kinda weird to get used too and for the leaderboard it appears to not give you all the options to check your stats if you wanna see DUO FPP you can only see duo TPP unless you are searching for duo fpp then i believe it gives you the option to look at it? It is kinda weird at times.In the time that i have played the devs seemed to have tried to tackle the boring quiet mid game phase and it works out unless you are a being a mouse and off alone trying to avoid everything. The blue zone damage got a buff and i would say it's almost perfect almost some slight tweaking but the way they have adjusted makes you almost not wanna be in the blue because of how quick it can dwindle your life.If I missed anything I will be sure to update the review. As of right now on 12/22/2017 The game is very playable comfortably and very enjoyable especially with friends. The optimization is what it needed and got. Still there are a lot of bugs I have run into especially when doing squads having to reboot the game or lobby for unknown reasons just to be able to play another round which doesn't take long but is a minor inconvience. At the current state I can proudly say I can turn this game from a not recommended to a recommended game but it is still not out of the wordworks as it has a long road ahead of it and still needs a lot of work and polishing but the game is headed in the right direction as of right now. I feel confident to say you can put your money into this game and within a couple of hours have some enjoyable moments if playing with friends. I still would maybe tell someone to wait on a possible sale but being how fresh and popular this game is that would be a while but I highly recommend this game if you have a friend or three and like battle royale games to pick it up.

review: TL DR The circle and big city map design encourages people to fight like a Call of Duty and over half the server is dead within the first 2 minutes of these 30 minute matches further making the already boring mid game worse.I've won 4 games (two on both maps) and I regularly get at least one kill per match so don't get me wrong the game is fun but needs to be improved way more. Current game meta ruins the game and it is completely influenced by the two biggest features in the game the circle and overall map design. Pay attention to the player count in your next few solos ever notice how half the server will die before the first circle closes in (or before it even starts to close in)?The circle hasn't changed since it was released in Early Access and even then people complained about how boring the mid game was. The issue is that the game had so many more problems back then and now when the developers officially smoothed out optimization and vaulting people just completely forgot about gameplay inconsistencies. Since people just accept the circle as it is everyone drops into major cities fooling themselves with that "High Risk High Reward" nonsense and instead are going to those cities actually wanting a intense gunfight. Fighting like it's a Call of Duty or Battlefield game players literally can't stay alive longer than 2 minutes ruining the experience for those who want to play the game as intended as a survival experience. The game is advertised as a 100 player free for all but in reality you're lucky to have 50 players by the time you grabbed enough equipment to really have the game begin. With this low player count you'll have trouble finding people until the 3rd circle closes thats 17 minutes of boring looting. Also the only people alive after these 17 minutes are the sweaty try hards that mastered the bullet drop for all the guns so don't fight anyone at a distance or they'll quick peek headshot you while you are shooting tens of bullets at them.And that brings me to the other point the map(s). I have no problem with down time I played over 2000 hours of Fallout New Vegas on hardcore(No Fast Travel) before I finally built a PC I can handle a little walking simulation. But when the maps are designed as they are it further amplifies the problem the circle is giving the gameplay. Loot spawns in more tightly packed areas of course are going to provide more incentive to go to larger cities (creating the whole "High Risk High Reward" philosophy). However since half the server plays the game as a parachuting simulator rather than a Battle Royale survival game the maps grow empty fast. Whenever I drop into a smaller town to avoid being mowed down by a Shroud Prodigy too much of the game is me running between towns searching for loot I get too used to not finding players that I don't expect to be shot which is the complete opposite of what this game should be. And when I do drop into a populated area the store bought asset buildings still have the problem of having one route through the house meaning that people camp in the houses and hold the only corner like its Counter Strike. At least in CS there are multiple routes and better utility to level the playing field but here we have players choosing to wait multiple minutes so they can play a easy game of wack a mole rather than having a shoot out. The maps could be made to encourage more player diversity early game lettting more players survive throughout the match."Winning doesn't entertain me Killing does" Shroud 2017After watching the interview podcast H3H3 had with PlayerUnknown I doubt this will be solved. Sure he talked about changing the circle to where players have a chance to catch up to the white circle when it spawns too far away from them. Unfortunately he talked about the ability to camp out the game like its a revolutionary feature that I don't think he will change the game for the better. I feel like he won't improve the mid game to blend together the chaotic early game with the strategic end game. mid game (which is the vast majority of every match) will continue to be a boring walking simulator where you sometimes feel like the only person on the server.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While this game is still in Early Access I would like to review this. Basically the game is fun but has some flaws that the Devs have acknowledged.The Devs have set up a schedule though to fix it. Unfortunately though one of the main problems I have are my teammates. Basically they are trash and I can only reliably win in solo and DUO. Please allow me to have better teammates. But other than that the game is fun! I would love to see more weapon types and some balance changes to sub machine guns. Scopes can be really hit or miss in main weapon spawn areas but other than that shotguns are fun submachine guns have their place and assault rifles and snipers are good up until the last circle. Killing people is also really satisfying but keep up the updates and I ll continue to play just maybe with better people now.

This is a good alternative for H1Z1 because its very similar but the devs actually care enough to fix game breaking bugs that people exploit. Its highly addictive to play but there are some cons to this gameCons Houses sometimes don't fully load and its impossible to get inside for the loot. Sometimes while loading you get put on the planeand you dont load until you're ejected off the plane. Laggy at timesPros In depth gun stats Decent graphics Great map Devs fix game breaking bugs (like the one where people would hide in buggy rocks and other terrain) Intense atmosphereTL DRGreat game needs more developement but its really fun to play alone or with friends. IMO seems to have a better future than H1Z1.

review: Don't buy this game it's really inconsistent. I shot a guy in the neck with a 7.62 kar98k once then 3 times with a 9mm uzi and he killed me with 3 hits from a 5.56 m16.The sound also isn't consistent. You can hear someone from a mile away yet you'll have somebody walk up to a tree and shoot you from 10 feet without ever hearing them.You also tend to tradekill.EDIT Just killed a guy in 5 hits with a 5.56 SCAR L. Same round full health level 2 vest level 2 helmet got killed with a 9mm UMP9 at 3 hits. Seriously???? I don't know how this game calculates damage but it's ridiculous along with its hit registration netcode and server lag.

review: Rating 3/10Of course this is an actual review so please understand the rating is a personal opinion and I will explain the reasoning behind the low rating as well as rating from 0 10.Initially as of right now I'm currently on 901 hours in game I had left a great review when I had first bought the game and reached my 100th hour. However after a short amount of time and a minor upgrade (From I5 to AMD with increase of RAM and CPU) I started running into a few issues which seem to never get patched.First lets start with the common bug AMD Processors If you're running an AMD you probably know what issue i'm talking about Yes the requiring to ALWAYS change your affinity during game or upon launch up this has been a known issue for me personally about 4 months now however i've heard others have had this issue for longer only person I know personally who has this issue was my older brother whom I game with Of course my older brother has the better computer as he upgrades as often as possible. However even he consistently crashed day after day after day of attempting to play PUBG because of the affinity bug until finding out about the supposed fix to the problem.Second The Fix PUBG button wow did they really put a fake FIX button? I'd personally love to send Bluefoal all the issues with the game however they seem to run away everytime we have a complaint about the game and why of all things name it FIX PUBG but then have it link us to a website with them 'stating' what they'll do to fix pubg when clearly on the website it has nothing we're looking for to be fixed on the list.Faster &amp Smarter match making Bluefoal are you ing stupid? We wanted region lock cause you allow players with excessively high ping to play in a country they don't live in then we either have to deal with the fact we got shot from an invisible player teleporting around or a language not native to NA.Third Event mode TPP optimization 3 times I went into event mode forced as TPP with my friend I encountered this bug If you swap to FPP while on the ground and end up dying FPP you'll respawn in FPP and be unable to move your character until swapping back to TPP or dropping on the ground.Fourth Anti cheat now this is where the jokes really begin idk how many times i've seen cheaters but man let me tell you this will never stop as of today there was a new cheat going around where players are allowed to swap from FPP to TPP during a FPP Squad match. Previously my teamate today was using it I confirmed it by watching him camera peek players while on a FPP server after reporting I went for a new match me and my squad made it to last 5 where suddenly the last player was tilt peeking and instantly sniping everyone in my team I made sure to test the player and see if he was TPP cheating I pretended to poke out but only tilted enough to have my full body behind the wall however when i had tilted without actually peeking out he started to spray directly at me each time i attempted to peek he shot directly at my head (aware it was my head because whenever i rotated to the opposite side there were bullet holes all in the same spot never straying from where i was standing).After dying to him and spectating him I noticed he was on TPP as well.Personally if you have friends to play this game with it's fun lots of action and very extensive mechanics to allow many types of playstyles however if you're a solo player or play games often alone paying for this game will only make you regret wasting your money as the community is extremely toxic and null of common sense when working as a team (You'll find players reeeeeeing in voice chat or players who are in discord unwilling to work with the rest of the squad)I enjoy playing this game however as of late this game has just been getting worse and worse and likewise with the community as I've seen more hackers and more players who aren't capable of speaking english or just start talking to teamates then kill them.As for the reasoning behind 3/10I gave it 1 point for mechanics 1 point for realism and 1 point for content as for the rest of the points this game misses is Community 1 Bluehole's lack of affection for their community 1 Server lag 1 No region lock/Max acceptable ping 1 Long term bugs not being patched 1 Adding content and creating more bugs instead of resolving previous bugs 2.As I said before I initially gave this game a better review as I was on I5 and didn't care so much for in game bugs however after switching to an amd and constantly having to deal with the Affinity bug finding more bugs during my games or hackers makes it all the more stressful to even bother with this game.

review: I changed this Review to positive after seeing satisfying performance improvement.But I change it back to Negative because Menu suddently decided not to load.After finishing a match I got back to menu and I can see the car area with blurry background and no menu buttons waitted some time no results. Restarted game same result. Such things are unacceptable for a 2018 game and I withdraw my positive review. The Main Menu lags more than in game. Just pathetic.I was playing this game on one of my friend's account a few months ago. I had so much fun back then. Now that I bought it myself it changed so much and for some reason I can't have the same experience. Although the performance is much better so I slowly start to enjoy the game as much as I did back then.The gameplay is so much fun the guns are fun to use and all I like those aspects. Now it somehow can't be so much fun anymore. IDK maybe I lost my skill and I just suck xd.A thing about music the most recent music is so obviously a rip off of the Call of Duty 4 Modern Warfare Main Theme... and the previous one was also an obvious rip off of Battlefield 1 Main Theme... please be original with music a good memorable and ORIGINAL theme is key on making a game feel epic when you launch it. Although the BF1 like one is just fine.Finally i hate loot boxes culture so bad it just makes me see a game less seriously when I see it. It also gives me the impression that the game thinks I am stupid that I will spent money on cosmetics on some pixels...

review: Before purchasing this game I used to think it was a bad game that had no potential and would die out very soon. However from the consistent asking of my friends to buy it I decided to purchase a copy. Due to my poor experience with that piece of H1Z1 I expected nothing much and intended to refund the game after an hour. Within the first hour I was hooked. I wanted to write a review then but I didn't feel like I had enough experience. I can safely say now though this game is worth the money. It's a fun game with friends and competitive at the same time. The game looks beautiful and the community is growing. However these come with issues. The amazing graphics puts a lot of people at a disadvantage. Most people can't purchase a PC powerful enough to play this game. I run it with everything set to max and get an avg of around 100 fps but that's me. I own a very powerful computer. I've got a friend with a high end PC at around 800 who struggles to run this game on medium with some settings on low. Although there are a lot of problems with this game It's only in early access and I can't blame it for being bad. If the game hasn't improved the issues in it by this time next year it will only be another DayZ. Otherwise this game has some serious potential. Highly reccommend as long as your PC is powerful!

review: Eventually GOTY at this point in time. It hasn't been announced yet but almost for sure it will be.That being said let's really talk about the game. Fun unique in its own way huge map and lots and lots of different locations to be fighting against other people.I can also say that the game feels slow buggy and from to to time boring and to me it doesn't matter if it is an Early Access or not besides its a nomenee for GOTY so it should be looked at as a released game (not finished) which makes it a buggy mess and still not safe from the hacking community.What we need to be looking for is the effort that they are making to make this game as the view they had for it at the start and we can really see them pushing harder and harder to put new content out there. Props to them for that.Hopefully we will have modded content in the near future and hopefully they will fix the game in time.For now I can still recommend this game to anyone that likes BR games or wants to try it.I'd give it a 7/10 for now depending on their approach to it in the next couple months.

review: Go and play Ring of Elysium instead. The following information is about ROE not this dead piece of game. It's free the crates can be unlocked simply by playing and earning points. Haven't run into hackers yet. Servers need some work (There is no OC server at the moment so bug the devs about it) Even though I have to play on AS servers at the moment the ping is barely noticeable. No standing around for a minute before the game starts maybe 30 seconds to find a game. You can snowboard zip line and hang glide. The whole game has a kind of realistic and interesting implied story. The weapons system is intuitive with most attachments being automatically managed if you ever swap a weapon of the same class the attachments will automatically be removed and placed on the new weapon. The game has hitmarkers and more visible rounds giving it a bias toward action there is still stealthy elements to the game but even though there is less people in each server I get into more fights. The game is god damned beautiful and doesn't have color puke graphics so you can actully see players.GO AND PLAY RING OF ELYSIUM!

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Edit as of 9/23/2018. Game is great now. Developers have finally picked up the ing ball and have made some great changes. New vehicles new weapons new map with another coming soon some great quality of life changes. Amazing FPS with a 7700k/1080 on video settings geared for FPS over quality (without losing sharpness or resolution though) I generally stay above 170 FPS at 1440p. Hackers are always a thing but its just about 1/20 games to see a hacker that I'm fully confident is hacking either by blatant ESP or aimbot. Hacking is largely overblown. Region lock is soon to added into the game and map selection is coming back which will both be absolutely amazing. Buy it and don't listen to the naysayers the competition to PUBG sucks. Blackout sucks BF5 ain't out yet but will likely be just as arcadely ROE is unoptimized with smaller games and too arcadey ION is dead and Fortnite is a good game but just appeals to a wildly different audience. PUBG is the best on the realism best on the tension best on the graphics (until BF5 comes out) and best on the gunplay. Cannot beat it and I know I will probably be playing it for the next two years. Edit as of 11/24/2017. I win roughly about 30% of my games and have 4+KDR. Hacking is an overblown issue. Especially in the later hours. In the morning times though expect 1/5 games to have a hacker in it. Probably worse in non FPP servers. What is a issue though is the horrible tickrate and the foreigners flooding NA servers to an absurd degree. The developers could add a region lock dependant on who the party leader is. This would fix horrible issues of landing lethal shots but then dying .5 seconds after. Dying once your in cover. Dying immediately before you client even receives info that you've been shot. This singular aspect of the game is beginning to eclipse all of the pros. Before on game launch it was fantastic. Its been going downhill and because the developers haven't implemented this single easy fix to these problems and it has made me lose absolutely all respect for them. I would guess 50% of players on NA servers are Asian. Worse in the morning. Better in the evening. Its mostly unplayable unless you play in the later hours. Such an easy fix and they just won't implement it. If you are thinking about buying this just look at the discussions from 8am 2pm EST. It will give you a highlight what to experience on NA servers. Edit as of 8/25/2017. The game has been out for 5 months. Within the first month of ownership Bluehole (The developers) managed to do what Bohemia took years to do with Arma 3. Within the major cities of the game due to the amount of objects players were experiencing low FPS (30s 40s. Within the first monthly patch that FPS went from low 40s for me to 90 120 FPS. This was a major thumbs up in my opinion. In the five month period we have seen one new vehicle introduced and one variation of that vehicle. There has been several gameplay changes but nothing so huge as to change the core gameplay. There has been four new weapons introduced. Vaulting is on the horizon which will change the meta largely as well. Most importantly First Person Only servers have been introduced. I cannot talk this one up enough as it makes the game much more intense and thrilling having to risk yourself to gather intel. This servers are just as if not more populated than the third person ones. Hard to say since queuing into either one is instant. There has also been paid crates introduced. The developers broke their promise on this because they stated they would not introduce such things during EA. Principally this is wrong. However I do not care and still enjoy the game to the same amount as before. More even to tell the truth. Every round played rewards the player with x BP points depending on how well they did. The released three crates one of which required a key to open. You could then purchase the crates with the BP (that can not be gotten any other way besides playing). Some people decided to open crates both free and paid. I sold them instead on the Steam Market. I have made over $40 selling crates on Steam Market. I also opened 3 crates. Out of the three I got a shirt that was worth $5 some trash item and a jacket that is currently selling for $17. With those items as well I have made over $60. That is double the price of the game for items that do nothing for you in the game and many of which you will find on dead people or in buildins. So while I think crates is principally wrong I don't care. I love them even. I recommend the game ever more than before. Thankfully as well when I bought it the player base was at 30k. It peaked yesterday at 715k. That is absurd growth and I'm wondering when it will peak. Here is my market historyhttps //imgur.com/a/paQtGOld review posted 3/23/2017Very polished concept as compared to H1Z1 Battle Royale mod and other competitors. I would easily say this is the best. I'm writing this review on launch day. So far during this launch I can say these facts and I have never been able to say them before During the entire duration of gameplay (roughly4 5 hours) neither I nor did either of my two friends I was playing with experience a game crash or any bug whatsoever. The game ran smooth for all of us I generally got 80 90 fps on all ultra 1440p with a 6700 at 4.6ghz and a 1080. Game looks decent nothing exceptional but nothing inhibiting. Gunplay is really where it shines though. Gun handling is fantastic guns feel like they have weight and impact. Accurate amount of recoil and definitely rewards well placed shots. Initially I was concerned about third person as I am primarily a First person only player in such games as I hate people just sitting behind walls or explotive things in Arma 3. There isn't any first person in this but the camera does a well enough job that it prevents explotation. Not perfectly mind you its just close enough that people cannot pan it over a 12 foot wall or peek through buildings (like in Arma). If they had a bit more variety in terms of weapons and clothing then I would say they should have just launched the game outright instead of bothering with EA nonsensse. As a sidenote thankfully there isn't any ridiculous looking COD yellow tiger stripe nonsense that I was seeing in H1Z1 streams.

review: Hi So let's write a review about this game.It's a fun game. Easy to understand how to play. You should definitely play it with your friends and if not there are plenty of Discord servers where people are looking for a person to team up with.Compatibility My PC has no trouble running it I have a R5 1600x 16gb ddr4 installed on an ssd and run with a GTX 680 (cost me about 80 ). You really don't need a newer card the older ones work as good as the new. If you can get a GTX 780 or higher. (Please look up any GPU for example GTX1050 GTX680 the 680 has better performance. Look up some information about graphic cards.The game itself runs smoothly if I may say so even beter than the early days in which early access was released. In the early days there weren't even Test servers (so that's really a good feature).I love the maps they're different and soon they'll make the mapchoice 50/50. I presume they'll add more maps in the future with more items. The lead developer said that the game will be updated frequently with more features throughout its existence.I love the killcam in this game I hope they add some sort of camera rotation in the killcam.I love the ability to choose whether to go First Person or Third Person mode along with the squad or solo or duo option. Also selecting what region you want to play in is a sweet +.The few problems/issues right now as of 25/12/2017 Early game 1 2 minutes rubberbanding (an issue that is caused by probably too many players pressing F to pick up items early game the gameserver gets overflowed basically). High latency players (soon there will be a region lock so this issue will be resolved). Hackers as you all may know any game that has a high player count a fixed percentage is always going to be hackers. (Anti Cheat is doing its job pretty good even better than CSGO if you ask me.) Some physics vehicles tend to be a bit buggy if rammed into eachother also player characters that tend to bug from something invisible like a wall or a hole. (Sometimes this occurs when the GPU is not loading the textures properly).These aforementioned problems/issues will surely be fixed in time. As this game has just been released. Just like many other games release it needs time to settle and grow on.A big thumbs up from me. This is a game that has changed gaming if u ask me. It's a trendsetter and we should accept and acknowledge it's existence. Not many game developers listen to their players (I'm looking at EA Battlefront here). And to this day they're still listening you can check it on Reddit for example have a look on the official Reddit page of PUBG https //www.reddit.com/r/PUBATTLEGROUNDS/So if you have read any negative reviews and now read mine try the game I can assure you it's fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is overhyped...it's been buggy since Pre release and now version 1 is even worst game crashes so frequently that I barely get to play. Here's the things that pisses me off1. Unoptimized graphics seriously lowering the graphics seems to make things worst.2. Bad connectivity to all servers infact I'm in South East Asia and playing in Asia or even NA server seems a tad bit better. But still not playable when you are rubberbanding around.3. Serious crashing it bugged out so bad that I had my whole screen turned black and graphics went bonkers even in windows!4. The game controls feels sluggish after playing Fortnite theres a good comparison on how a 3rd person view should be.This game has sucked tons of cash through it's early access...this shouldn't be the case but many people made a hype and paid them anyways nonetheless how did it get off its beta stage with such bad quality graphics and unoptimized servers and graphics????

review: Please save your money this Christmas and do not buy this game in its current state you will thank me when you look back and realise you have spent the time doing something meaningful and not wasted precious time on this Earth like me winning meaningless matches on this game where the leaderboards are flooded with cheaters. The only thing this game was good for was the Twitch gear getting me some free money on Steam.Right here's some reasons why this game is absolute excrement Runs like fecal matter More hackers than legitimate players Creator of PUBG is a jumped up bellend Makes for some funny moments but cars flip at the slightest knock Gaps in terrain Zone is poo Never find weapons Runs like crap Conveniently no map selection so have to play desert map non stop Massive oversight to not add map selection how the fk can you spend that long and not add it Every time you click something "servers are busy" The English text in the game is poorly written in some areas Fully released on Xbox and 10fps Was given benefit of the doubt when early access but now even worse Rubberbanding around like a bloody yoyo Vaulting only works on some specific objects not actually fluid parkour Might be fun for a bit or was fun for a bit but this 1.0 at the moment is just terrible No battlepoints for wins at the moment basically scamming people out of the only reason to win Crashes more than Richard Hammond Runs like total br&gt I have faith that the development team can come through with something positive eventually but right now this game is absurdly terrible and nowhere near worth 26.99 it's not even worth 10 save your money and buy your mum a bouquet or something because once you buy this even if you refund your money will be trapped in the Steam economy never to see the light of day again unless it is to buy another early access pile of doo doo because video game culture at the minute dictates that early access great. This wasn't very Christmassy was it.

review: The gameplay is really good. But I cannot recommend the game in state even on 06/16/17. This game has some severe technical problems which are quite honestly plain bad for a 2017 game(even for early access).1)This game can induce random BSODs during gameplay. Yes a BSOD in 2017. 2)Horrible server optimization. Rubberbanding is the norm.3)Game feels way more resource hungry than it should be. Its hard to find a game that looks as poor as it does for the amount of graphical fidelity. 4)Crashes galore. Random crashes no reconnect option. Wait for the developers to prove that they can fix these things before investing in this game(both time and money).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is the game that players wanted from H1Z1 but didn't recieve. If you are debating about getting this game keep this in mind.(1) You will not be good at it at first. Someone is going to be better than you but as soon as you grind and keep getting comfortable with the game you will grow to love this game. (2) You will not get bored of this game. People say this game is only fun with friends. Although having friends can lead to a more fun experience having friends does not matter. about 40 hours of the game i've played (i have 50 at this time and plan to exceed that) are playing solo and I haven't found a dull moment yet. (3) Remember when you were a kid and you played minecraft? IF you have ever played the gamemode "Survival Games" on minecraft and enjoyed it this is very similar. (just better everything pretty much). (4) you like raging? In a solo game I survived the until there were only 2 players left. Me and someone else. The white circle is closing and i am decked out in level 3 equipment a Vector and a Kar98k. As i enter the house the white circling is closing upon I get shotgunned by someone camping behind a door. So 10/10 would recommend. Have fun )

review: I have nothing against the Chinese. It's actually cool that they can play alongside us Westerners. But I have literally in the last hour alone joined and exited 11 games (and climbing as I type this) because I could not find a single English speaking player to play Duo or Squad with. It is becoming ridiculous. Again nothing against you if you're Chinese but I would prefer to have some English speaking teammates when in Duo or Squad. Communication is key when playing this game with randies... Until there's some sort of prioritisation for NA players on NA servers I can't reccomend this game to anyone who wants to team up with random people. Only play this game solo or with your NA friends.Edit If you're looking for English teammates to play with check out the PUBATTLEGROUNDS reddit Discord. There's constant LFGs and very easy to team up.

review: Since another patch. Game has now decided that it would like to tinker with things that are not broken rather then work on fixing things that matter.After some Patching. They have now balanced it where you get a good balance between the two maps. Hit box's continue to be a issue but until they come up with a system where they place you in server based on ping they will always have issues. Part 2 of the hit box issue is that it depends on client side what this means is that you might get shot all the while on your screen you are safe behind a tree or wall etc etc. So until they find a nice balance between these they will always struggle on this front. However with the ammount of cheaters I see daily I can no longer recommend this game. It is disgusting how blantant the cheats are and you have no clue if your report has even done anything. The reward is to survive and having cheaters take that away all the time makes it a pointless waste of time. Hacking is was and will continue to be a problem with this game. As they come out with anti cheat measures the cheaters in turn come up with new ones. Problem with cheating in this game the whole premise is to survive and in 1 swift second a hacker will ruin this for anyone that come into his path. We have come into servers with hackers taking bots around to farm the in game currency. They then go on to sell the items they farm and if they get banned they have made more then enough to just buy another copy wash rinse repeat. Some solutions to this would be having the bans go hardware rather then client as it would be more costly to replace computer parts. They could also make a server for cheaters and once guilty lock them in there and let them play with each other.Overall with the hours I have put in you can see that I enjoy the game it's addictive to chase the dinner but be warned if you have a temper move the expensive stuff away.Since Full Launch.I miss School!Full launch Review.They have taken strides in dealing with hackers but you at times still find the odd one. Otherwise it is a highly addictive game that is enjoyable with your buddies up until they kill you by mistake when you walk into a room and scare the out of them. 8/10 would rage on my friends all over again.Early Access Review.Hackers have taken over!

review: Great game with great core mechanics. ive been around since about launch. Squads is the way to go and is always a blast with friends but solo and duos also suffice. My only complaint? this game has reached 2 MILLION concurrent players. that is good but for being such a poorly optimized game that is alot of players. my specs are good and i run everything on high with 60 fps. but it still feels klunky. the fact that the game is so popular makes me worry that PlayerUnknown may think the games current state is approiate which it isnt. other than that solid game. 9/10Edit 1.0 Just dropped and i upgraded to a 1070. Game optimization has made leaps and bounds and PlayerUnknown really outdid himself. Bravo and cheers to a fun filled future.

review: I LOVE THIS GAME AND ALSO HATE IT SOMETIMES !!! im finding it addictive and very fustrating (mainly beacuase i never won a game or get to last 3 8 people alive and then get killed by someone i cant see which most annoys me)like every early access or not totally finished it has its bugsbut would recommend it to anyone thing i like . fun and addictive . every game is different every time . keeps me on my feet . looking forward to new content such as weapons accessories and items maybe even a new map adventually . lots of gear to find . ambushing/rare close encounters are fun . solo is fun but also i like squads equaly as much. can go all tactical or go full out madness . everything seems well balanced and glad to see the one hit kill weapons a really rare to find . supply drops make it fun . like the random zones not just wend up fighting in same 5 places like in other games.holding out in a building is fun but game makes it so you have to move so it never always best option things i dont like . it early access needs polishing and fixing a little bit. cant identify well where the hell people are hitting me from . melee weapons are a bit none threatening once everyone has a gun which most of the time is straight away !!. invisible door blocks get me killed . probably could have couple more ranged weapons ( dont get me wrong there is lots but felt like ther could be loads more variety ) . i feel like supply drops are too few or keep trying to go to the boundry or out of it to get the gear rather than attracting people to the middle or closer . needs more vehicles also pedal bikes would be quite cool little bit faster than running but a lot stealthy. beingable heal on the move if your a passsenger of a vehicle maybe restriction if your on moterbike . vehicles need horns and more variations . languages barriers make this game a lot harder on squads . need a chat box as a lot of people dont talk on mics . red zone should vary in size and also maybe have different ones like gas or activates/deactivates minefields just find most people can walk through the artillery unscaved . maybe needs some deployable cover would maybe a little bit more interesting . needs traps! like claymores bouncy bettys or mines make them really rare but could change gameplay a bit more fun or make someone think differently before going gun blazing edit 1 . the new vss sniper is pants kinda give the public a non threatening sniper rifle and uses 9mm rounds so cant really use it as sniper unless you shooting point blank lols .submachine gun/mac should be a sidearm rather than a full pledge weapon as this weapon is never used. lack of cover outside of towns i get a bit fustrated withe tree as it seems like people can still hit you through trees .i like the map but i would like to a snowy map or snowy version of current map or a big city map also night map would be cool but i have won a couple of games now and i still recommend this game looking forward to the new vaulting and climbing also new zombie mode but please dont relaease another pants weapon like the vss

review: I regret buying this game. It may be fun with friends but alone unless you're extremely competitive and take advantage of exploits and cheap tactics you'll not have fun. Connection is iffy hit reg is terrible (for various reasons). You could blast someone with a shotgun point blank and kill them then do the same to someone else several times and they will just look at you jump at you and punch you in the head and kill you instantly. Pretty dumb for a game that is supposed to be semi realistic.Though it's an early access game it feels so far from finished and polished considering the game is "promised" to be out in the next 3 months. This game infinitely lacks polish. Sound design is pretty terrible considering how important it is "supposed" to be. Compared to a game that also focuses on sound Rainbow Six Siege Battlegrounds falls flat. Sound clips sound so generic and sampled. Hopefully it improves but I'm staying away until full release.Also it crashes occasionally but not too bad.UPDATE FOR FULL RELEASE Just installed the game again to give it another go considering it is "out" now. Game still runs like butt stuff looks like crap on max settings (GTX 1080 R5 1600 16gb 3000mhz) and of course is full of BS moments. Wish i could've gotten my money back and not played for over the 2 hours mark hoping it would have gotten better.
