review: Cheaters. Cheaters everywhere...(12 March 2018 18 07)DO NOT BUY!!! CHEATERS EVERYWHERE!!! DO NOT BUY!!!(30 Jan 2018 10 56am)There are too many cheaters in this game it is not a game worth playing and definitely not buying.It's funny for the first couple of times you get to see cheaters they headshot you and your friends at rediculous positions run faster than cars etc... But after those "couple of times" it just becomes bland. Really bland. A here we go again kind of bland.You should come back and buy this game when those cheaters actually get banned and they stop getting top scores on the leader boards. Until then not worth buying or playing or doing anything with this game.I used to have a very positive review for this game which I will post below.(6 Nov 2017 4 42pm)Definitely worth buying.I agree that the lag is intense with this game and I also agree that the sound control is pretty terrible at the moment and you'd have to blow your ears out from airplanes vehicles and gunshots if you want to hear any enemy footsteps.So it probably doesn't suit people who care about their kill/death ratios.With that being said whether you play this game for victory or for laughter the amount of fun you can have with this game with a couple of friends is simply put amazing and nothing like before. Personally the purchase was worth every dollar.To sum things up if you have friends who already play this game already or if you have friends who are willing to purchase this game with you go on ahead as you and your friends will most likely not regret it. If you are a lone wolf type who wants to play competitively go and make some friends first and then you should come back and have a go at this awesome game.(19 Jun 2017 2 25pm)

review: It's not as good as the mod but it's really quick to get in a match and play in a team. Some pros lots of cons overall a fun game.However half the time i get put in a team with non english speaking ppl who have no idea what theyre doing and cannot communicate effectively which is a shame. One of the worst aspects of the game is that it contains loot boxes which contain useless cosmetic items so are of no interest to me. But this kind of predatory gambling practice takes advantage of people with impulse control issues and mental health problems not to mention children who play the game. It's shameful.

review: Today is September 6 2018. This is my first letter to the blue hole official. I'm a faithful Jedi Survival player. I've been playing this number for more than 500 hours and tonight's announcement shows the game's banned tips. I don't understand why I have to ban my account. I have never opened a plug in card BUG. Such a ban is unacceptable to me. This game has been playing for a long time and I have known a lot of good friends and I have been working hard to buy nice clothes and firearms for this game. At the same time I have been studying and practicing hard to practice my skills. But it is very painful to see the result. I hope the blue hole official will check it carefully.

review: Pros This game is great. Obviously meant to be better. The physics and realitiness are on point. One of the best games ever. Cons I know this is weird but I refunded this piece of trash. Without the recommended nVIDIA graphics card you can't play without terrible framerate. The people in game are toxic and many are hackers too. Don't get this game unless you have a good gaming PC and a good nVIDIA graphics card that they want. I mean CSGO recommended a graphics card I didn't have but I still get 60 fps or over but this game isn't like that.Overall I would get it again if I get a better nVIDIA graphics card which is my B for not having one. Just don't get it if you dont have the recommended graphics card.

My ony notable dislike/disagreement Is the date of the official release. I feel that the game needs at least another 6 months of testing and tweaking. review: REAL REVIEWFun game i usually play it to past time between other games. Its a great way to keep things interesting. Now im no pro player by any means i dont play alot of shooters and i have yet to win a game but ive come oh so close at least 3 times. so with that said lemme give you what its like.FUN the game is fun to play by yourself but joining a twitch party or even playing with your friends further the entertainment and can provide some good laughs or just good times in general.COMPETITIVE Weather its the coins your after the bragging rights or that number one spot this game STAYS competitive. Well its obvious with 100 people on the map at once but you get the point.COMMUNITY Turn down your mics in the lobby cause kids screaming in your ears and loud people crowd the starting lobby. But somehow I've been blessed with nothing but chill decent teammates which most had mic's which helped and made things kinda fun. Also there is a HUGE following of this game now so hardly any wait times now.GROWTH With the future content thats in store as this game makes its way to xbox this game just looks more and more exciting with a new map and possible cross platform gaming incomming. This game looks and feels like it has a lot to offer in the future and will only get better with time.Now with the goods there are bads most people fail to realize that this is an EARLY ACCESS GAME which means all the bugs and unwanted crashes are gonna happen. But the only problems ive ever had with this game was server crowding one day and the wall glitch but I dropped out of that game in a heartbeat. But other than that i cant really complainOh and the issue with the in game cash shop not a problem. Clothes dont affect anything........But all in all for an early access game this is awesome!! Better than H1ZI love playing this game weather i have friends to play with or just solo'n up by myself.THIS IS ONE AWESOME GAME I RECOMMEND IT!

review: This game is a horrible mess and as the time of writing its getting worse and hacking has become a problem i would suspect there is at least one person using esp in every game now 1 % is pretty realistic. The core game is always going to suffer from desync and lag regardless of what they try and do anyone who knows this engine will understand that so either they rewrite the entire game or accept that they never knew it would be this succesful and now they have a huge mess on thier hands. The time to die is horrific spend 30 minutes carefully looting and hting just to get 2 tapped from some unseen enemy. Its massively unsatisfying but strangely addictive. Until they fix this time to die issue its just not worth playing. The game rewards camping and hiding not exploring and hunting which is wrong. Overall its one of the most frustrating games i have ever played and even with all teh hours i have put in i am hovering over the uninstall. Personally i would suggest saving youur money until they at least attempt to fix the game and stop focussing on releasing to xbbox and all the terrible marketing crap they are in to now. so sad to see money becoming the dominant driver in everything i think alot of people thought playerunknown would have more integrity
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: "Hunger games with guns. A 100 player massive battlefield where the fights will get your blood boiling and your heart pounding. Go in as a squad duo or solo lone wolf and survive to the end. You'll be wanting to keep on playing!"I love the intensity of this game. I've only ever played a handful of survival games e.g. 'The Culling' but this fires me up! Just being in the top three players left in a mexican stand off out of 100 players in a solo match. Its all or nothing! Playing with in a duo or squad makes it even more fun (and easier to survive) especially when your giving tactics or screamming down the mike calling enermy positions. )However I do hope they add more to the game such as different maps more weapons and maybe even (as a thought) 50vs50 big team battles. That would be insane!!! p
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I debated with myself for a long time wether I was going to purchase PUBG and reluctantly I finally did. As much as I wanted to like this game I can't bring myself to do it no matter how many rounds I play. The feeling of this game is super sluggish clunky whatever you want to call it. I even bumped my graphics down from ultra ro high from high to medium and I get the same laggish feeling. I run a high end PC and still get regular fps drops after attempting every work around solution. The game is just poorly optimized.Man the pregame period where you're in an aircraft carrier waiting to deploy... never have I experienced something so toxic. Although the game may top H1Z1 the community does not pure mic spam and just plain ear After a couple times it got to the point where I just removed my damn headset until I deployed.I wish I could recommend this game but I can't bring myself to do it. At the stage it's currently in it's wiser just to save your money.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: ive experienced a few game crashes but other than that its an excellent alpha game
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Simply put the best battle royale game out there right now. Unfortunately since so many games have abused the "Early Acess" tag. Everyone thinks this game is going to follow the standard all these other games have set. Which is either no to minimal patching and support. But let me tell you they have in no way been like that. They have been on target with everything they have been saying they are going to do. It will only get better and smoother from here. Do i think their minimum settings to run the game are low? DefinitelyI used to have a 2nd or 3rd gen I5 with a radeon R9 380. I was struggling to get 20 to 25 fps. Now that i just upggraded my motherboard and new i7 it runs much smoother with 40 50 fps but there is in no way an i3 can run this game. With the i5 i was getting massive stutters in gun fights or areas with lots of movement. The r9 380 isnt a terrible card either so it shouldnt be this tough to get 60fps. If you ran the minimum system requirements it would be unplayable. That is my only negative but i hope they aim to get that mimimum requirement playable as i have said it is in Early Access and they are still working on smoothing out the game. I just wish they would 100% focus on optimizing the game vs putting in new content. But i understand they have to keep their player base engaged by adding new stuff when they can.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Its very tense fun and sometimes rage inducing. Playing solo will leave you looking over your shoulder every second looking at every tree bush and window for an enemy sometimes youll see them too late sometimes youll surprise them and sometimes you both panic and get into cover for a good fight until one of you dies. Playing with friends makes it more fun and less tense having a full team of friends to accompany you and watch your back is always nice alot less angles to watch and someone to speak to until you hear the words "PEOPLE OVER THERE!" I do recommend this game highly. More content is on its way and i cant wait to see what else is to become of this game new maps and more however hackers are an issue at the minute and im sure it will get fixed soon. I havnt ran into many but ofcourse it does ruin the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is the apotheosis of the Battle Royale genre. Highly enjoyable chaotic fun lending itself to squad tactics and teamplay especially in the 4 player variant. The game still has its fair share of issues but the recent patches have tremendously increased the user exeperience improving both performance and gameplay proving that the dev team is active and listening.My favorite aspect of the game is probably the varied arsenal at your disposal each weapon fitting a certain role and taking time to master favoring a risk / reward approach some weapons are easy to find and good out of the box while others require finding upgrades for them making taking them an important decision in and of itself.

review: At first I didn't like it it was kinda hard to get into. After a couple of hours though it gets better. My biggest frustration is that the controls and actions feel really sluggish just like DayZ. But once you get used to it it isn't awful. Overall the game is really fun. The fighting is deadly and tense. If you're looking for run n gun though look elsewhere. Sometimes you'll go most of a game without seeing anyone. Part of the fun is seeing no one cautiously looting and wondering if you're about to walk into a trap. Haven't encountered any hackers yet. From what I heard they're all in third person mode. So sticking to first person seems to make a big difference

review: Where to start. The game has good elements as well as bad ones.The general gameplay is fun and feels good. But sometimes you will experience being stuck at the loading screen while the game is still going. Meaning you don't know you should be dropping in or where. Then you have to disconnect in order to hopefully rejoin and not get merc'd.I will say it is still enjoyable when you don't run into problems like that.Moments are intense and remind me of some of the clutch times I used to have in Counter Strike.I have yet to run into any cheaters in this game but I have started playing after this came out on Xbox One.Be thankful you don't have the Xbox One version. I have both and this by far is the way it is meant to be played.Winner Winner Chicken Dinner.

review: The idea of the game is great. I was quite intrigate by this type of game but I also liked it.The downside untill now is that the game is unplaybale because of the framerate drop which is terrible and makes gaming awful and... impossible after all. It's not a HW issue but more a SW. My PC will play WWII at medium high settings at a stable framerate. But this UPB although it has a pretty low leveled graphic interface it's framing and it gets me crazy. I tried lots of solutions that other users on the internet recommended but nothing changed.The low framerate dropdown ussualy happens when there is another player arround. I thought it's my internet connection. It proved it isn't.I hope it will be improved and become reasonably playable.I recommend it but pay for it only if you are sure from existing players that this issue has been solved.

review: Short Review The combat is great and more realistic than other games in it's genre. It has a large set of bugs that get more and more fixed every day. The amount of weapons more realistic and gritty feel to it and customization keep me coming back as opposed to its competitors. It's a great way to make sure you never see friends or family again.Long Review I am a very active player of PUBG I play it almost every other day and if not that much at least make sure to log in once a week. I have seen every corner that this game has to offer. So when I say this I say it with full confidence. This game is for the most part realistic gritty and intense. It does something that it's competitors in the same field and genre haven't been able to master yet. While PUBG itself is no master of its craft it is still great. I have found so much fun and haven't felt this contected to a game and my friends while playing a game since the days of Halo 1 and Halo 2 online. I would recommend PUBG. It is a great game. While I'm sure my reviews will get buried among the millions of others just know it's worth it. The game is hard to learn harder to master. You will fight hackers cheaters and flying magic killing cars. But in the end you can find that on any FPS game in the market (Maybe not the cars) the difference is this one keeps me coming back after that.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds has come a very long way since the first time I played this game by the end of April it had about 150 thousand daily players which is really good for a game that just came out.Despite the performance issues it was super fun and catchy and we can see that by it's growth. In September it broke steam's record for most online concurrent players which belonged to dota 2 (1.3 million) it's been 3 months since that record was broken and today PUBG is averaging 2.7 to 2.9 million players.Many people may complain about performance but they surely don't even have a decent computer the latest test server update which introduces a lot of new weapons vehicles and a map also features a HUGE performance patch Blue Hole Studios promised and delivered a great game with regular updates.There's no complaints about it right now.

review: Personally i am loving this game and is one of my best buys of 2017.Pros Regular updates.Guranteed to find a game.Realistic gunplay.Fun gunplay.Big variety of weapons attachments vehicles and medical supplys. Can be played without friends.Can be played with friends.Cons Poor optimization.Driving physics are bad and glitchy.Poor servers.D sync while spectating.(not very important)Hackers arent to common but are a thing. (as with all games)Overall I recomend buying this game if you have a fairly good pc and are willing to be prepared if the game does fail as it is in early access. However though of 02/06/2017 i highly recomend this to anyone who wants a good PVP battleroyal large scale shooter. UPDATE 27/01/18 Its now fully released and its awful for a fully released game. Hackers everywhere. Game breaking glitches every over game. New map is trash and you can't even play the old map by choice its by chance. FIX YOUR BLUEHOLE.

review: This is one of the hands down worst games I've ever played. Even the cheap knock off version is better. Rather than list all it's shortcomings I'll just detail my first match I spent my first five minutes trying to connect to a game lobby. After it finally refused my connection I spent my next five minutes joining another.I spawned inside a plane which then froze in place for several minutes before vanishing leaving me falling from the sky at the edge of the map. I spent the next 3 minutes bumping into invisible buildings trying to get to the items inside. I found a jeep when the buildings eventually started appearing and proceeded to drive it for a full 30 seconds before it fell through the apparent ghost bridge I was driving it over and sank into the river. I got out of the river and spent 2 minutes standing there while the game continued to load things in long enough for the wall to overtake me. Several minutes later I died from radiation (being outside the wall).

review: I really really really like Fortnite. The only problem it has is the lack of FPS like pubg does. One thing is for certain if they had it i would TOTALLY switch over. PUBG developers and such are sapping money away from its players while doing no real fixes. Yeah over the last year the game has made leaps and bounds but why does it feel like we recieved an Alpha that just finally became a Beta? With every update annoucments they are always an hour or 2 behind schedule. Today they released a new update that made the game UNPLAYABLE and its been an hour with no update from facebook or twitter. Let me save you a headache. If you want to play a rubberbanding LOW quality graphics game. Buy it. Until the stone has been polished i would just wait. ALSO REGION LOCK CHINA. No hate on my asian family but the NA servers are legit OVERRUN by chinese team players and hackers that will headshot you 300 meters away while hipfiring with a crossbow.

review: (I Recommend this game but please read) This is all coming from a (non pro) competitive h1Z1 player(h1Z1 is another BR game) and yes I know h1Z1 is dying but hear me out. PUBG has some amazing qualities as well as some down flaws. I personally don't have the patience to play this game too much as I prefer fast paced game. What I relate this game to is if you're a fan of Call of Duty small mapsc face pace shooting then this is not likely the game for you. If you are most of a Battlefield type of player that prefers big maps with a more tactical approach then this if definitely a game you might like. Overall the game is great but just not my type of game as I prefer a more fast pace and quick reaction type of games. Good Luck and have many "Chicken Dinners" if you play!

review: Your respectful non bias review Player Unknown s Battlegrounds (PUBG) is a battle royals shooter game with the ability to switch between first and third persons. It s fun popular and you can customize your clothing and appearance. Although this game may look fun at first here are some pros and cons for you before you buy this game.Pros Somewhat addicting Ability to switch between 1st/3rd person beautiful graphics realistic with bullet drop and long range combat (You can snipe people from long ranges) One of the most realistic gameplays satisfying shots and kills cars and trucks great game to play for youtubers and streamersCons Can get boring after playing for awhile cosmetics aren t that fun there s really no goal to achieve while playing (aside from achievements stats and cosmetics) although cosmetics is something you can aim for when playing PUBG s cosmetics are boring to an extent and there s not much fun in themOverall I would totally buy this game and suggest if however this game is (in my opinion) a mini game in a sense. This game is pretty fun overall however if they should add anything they should focus on new cosmetics that you can aim for and other things. Because right now it s pretty boring after playing for an extensive period of time it can get boring not because aiming for cosmetics is boring but the cosmetics they have to offer isn t that... entertaining. I think this game should be a bit cheaper but the detail on it is insane. Note This review of PUBG is as of March 2018 if there s a new update that adds something mentioned above please understand.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The gameplay is amazing love the concept. I have sunk over 700 hours into the game. As of now though I am going to have to say I would not recommend this game why? The cheaters/hackers from China are out of control over 80% of the game deaths are due to cheating. Until this is fixed I am currently not recommending this game.

review: Don't waste your money or time. I can't get a refund on this or I would. I just installed it been in five matches.Extremely few mics fewer actually using them to speak English and not troll.Out of the five matches I've only searched "Squad Third Person Perspective". I've been placed four times into First Person Perspective games.I'm using a M/K but because I have an Xbox controller always plugged into my computer it apparently refuses to show me M/K commands instead of the Xbox commands.Stay away from this game.Update Tried searching for a few more games. Same exact issues. The last game I played I couldn't turn all the way around so obviously I couldn't play the game at all. Somehow my mouse just wouldn't respond after a certain point.Many people just turn on Chinese text to chat on their mics.Then there's also the issues of hits registering lag etc. Utter nonsense.This game is a prime example of what is wrong with multiplayer games community wise. Since nothing has been done about region locking/trolling it also conveniently is a prime example of what is wrong with games devleoper wise as well.

review: Recent update has improved the games preformance allowing for some of the best gameplay i have had in years. If you have ever played bf3 and loved sniping players from the tower in Gulf of Oman this game is for you. The constant suspense that comes with checking your six every other seccond while you have been been crawling through mud for the last 10 minutes and then having to make a split seccond decision that determines life or death there truely no other experince like this for sale right now. With monthly updates improving the games preformance and adding new content i would reccomend you buy this game right now asuming you have the specs to run it.OLD REVIEW BELOW Terrible performance issues to the point where the game is unplayable. I run a i7 920 3.2Ghz and a GTX 960 and even after follwing online instructions to maximize preformance i was hitting nowhere near 45fps on average with the lowest settings possible. The game looks fun but it is so broken at the moment that you should save your money. Edit Normally I am able to run most modren games at 60fps at medium to high settings (example Just Cause 3 on High settings and Rainbow Six seige on medium/high) also i aquired my gpu and cpu/motherboard cheap from friends in the tech industry hopes this helps clarifyUpdate I am now useing a i5 7600k with the same gpu and the preformace issues are still terrible where have to keep my settings at medium low in order to maintain 50fps. i can understand that is is still in early acsess but the FAR from being a "playable" king of the hill style gamemode that we all wish for. All you can do is wait for the dev's to work their magic.

review: Pubg is one of my favourite games. However saying that its not a game that I would say should ever be game of the year. I so far have 180+ hours in it and I've drawn a few conclusions.Pros The gameplay is consistentThere is a level of skill required to play itYou can regularly do well with more practiseIt is very fun to play with friendsThe servers minus the occasional hiccup run smoothlyCollision between items such as grenades is done amazinglyWeapon physics such as bullet drop and recoil is easy enough to get used to yet not too easy to master instantly you need to spend time on the game to do thatCons The driving mechanics are brokenThere are a lot of hackers (admittedly Bluehole are doing a lot to counter this)The frames are based a lot off RAM I've never seen this before in any gameThe community is.. questionable to say the least and thats saying a lot after playing CS

review: I honestly did not expect to enjoy this game as much as I do. Its extremely fun when playing with friends and not too bad when playing solo. The best bet to get some enjoyment out of this game is to find a friend or two and hit up duo servers or squad servers and just have a blast sucking or winning. Either way you'll slowly be sucked in to the competitive vibe and tense moments as the matches zero in on the last few people. Needless to say I'm having the time of my life for the first time in a while. I have had the game for about a month and put close to 75 hours and that number could be much higher if it wasn't for finals. See you guys on the Battlegrounds!9.0/10Pros Fun with friends graphics aren't too bad and is surprisingly easy to run developer response has been great tense and competitive. If you get killed you just pop into a new lobby right away almost no wait times.Cons Can be glitchy and laggy at times sometimes this bites you in the butt. On a side note Random loot spawns can be both a blessing and a curse if you have to spend a long time time trying to find stuff. Its kind of a neutral fact that you may or may not like. I think it keeps things fair.

review: I was really unsure as to whether to buy this game. I read all the reviews mentioning hackers and the ones about streamers banning players etc. In the end my friend encouraged me and I bought the game! So glad I did! In my first 2 weeks i somehow fit 40 hours of gametime in which is unheard of for me as I don't game much these days. In that time i've not come across any hackers haven't got on the wrong side of any streamers and as such i've really enjoyed this game! If you're on the fence give it a go! There is enough people playing now that the chances of coming across a hacker is slim to none and even if you do theres a good chance someone else will blow your head off with a Kar98k anyway.Buy this.

review: The game is an addictive game yeah. It is decent yeah. But there are a many things I absolutely dislike about this game. Here are a few 1.) When I shoot a player it's very difficult to see if you hit them or not even when I have "blue blood" enabled it's still very difficult to see when you hit your target. It'd be amazing to see hit indicators in game.2.) The movement is just weird.. When you move your character and stop moving your character still proceeds to move for an additional mili second or so which makes it difficult to stand still when you need to.3.) It's hard to tell where you are getting shot from at a far distance.4.) The loot on the Battle Royale maps is very difficult to get except for on the Mini Royale mode. 5.) It's very difficult to land where you want to land and there's times where you're gliding for 10 seconds extra eventhough you are already on the ground.Other than those few issues the game is pretty good to an extent.. Another thing which I'm sure people who have a weak PC would love is for the minimul system requirements and the overall performance to be slightly improved without their systems overheating or causing their weak GPU's or CPU's to thermal throttle and lack performance. But on a serious note.. It's okay...

review: This is a maybe recommend for me but more cons than pros.It can be a fun game with some friends but theres no progession things to unlock or other game modes at the moment so im not sure how long it will keep me engaged. (I dont care for cosmetic crates)Youre not always killed as soon as you land which is good although the world can seem rather quiet and desolate until youre shot suddenly Ive been lucky so far and havn't had problems with cheaters.The guns are quite nice but I would like some more.BUT the graphics are quite dated (Kinda looks like ARMA 2 graphics I guess it shares a similar engine?) Despite these bad visuals it doesnt run smoothly which really lets it down for me Ive tried it on various settings but its still stuttery so frantic gunfights are often frustrating and looking in the distance is just vile. Its just not a smooth game at the moment.Overall its a fun concept at an OK price (I got it for 18 which I think its worth in its current state) but its just too clunky to say any more.

review: INTRODUCTION What could I tell you about this game? Well for starters if you really like realism then you should totally get this game. It's a lot better to play with a friend or a group of friends so if you don't have any friends then you're out of luck. To put this simply you must be the smarter player. However there are a lot of dumb players who end up winning somehow by luck and not skill. ENVIRONMENT Oh you wanted to know about the environment huh? What do you expect? You'll hear gunshots from everywhere people hiding behind trees and going prone in foliage and if it rains you'll have a hard time driving that dune buggy. The environment in this game is actually fairly decent and is great for cover. One thing to note if you drive a car going 5 miles an hour into a tree then your health will deplete a little. COMMUNITY Lol it's worse than the CS GO community. There's either a twelve year old yelling the n word out loud or a random dude screaming "ALLAHU AKBAR" at 2 in the morning. In this community it's either kill or be killed (literally). Players define you by your skill and will crap talk you every chance they get if they die to your ghost bullets. EXPERIENCES In only a mere 13 hours of playing this (as of right now) I have made it first place only once. I was on top of the church in Polinchki and had the kar98k with an 8x scope. I would sit on top of the church and snipe down everyone until it came down to the final two (note that I had around 14 or 15 kills at this time) and I saw the top of this man's head behind a rock and sniped him luckily with my remaining mag. This experience was heart throbbing. My last experience I'd like to share is when my friend and I went into the flooded city and a boy who sounded about 12 or 13 had started calling for help he was stuck on the roof and if he jumped fatal death. So as being a good player I decided to calm him down and start talking to him and asking where he was from because he had a polish accent. His name was John. As John was stuck on the roof we went on a rescue mission to try and get him to safety all that ended when we got shot as soon as we were getting John and watched as John's head was filled with a dozen AKM bullets. CONCLUSION All being said this game is really fun and like I previously stated better with friends. The environment is healthy and could use a bit of patching up here and there and maybe not reuse old buildings? There is constantly new things rolling into the updates every single month and it's hard to get bored of this game. What do I rate it? 10/10 Johns. This game is a fun experience and if you love survival games you'll love this one. And not only that it's listed at a fair price with all the content you receive. John would sacrfice himself for you. Just think of that.

review: Pan headshot. 10/10Edit after the 1.0 release If you buy it don't take it seriously. Competitive play is still a nice dream and that's probably the best it's gonna get. Maybe buy pubg if you want to have some silly fun with some friends and kill some random dudes in weird ways. If you want a polished game worthy of your time and of the money it earned on early access.. well.. wait a while. They'll either fix this or something better will come around. I really liked this game at first but it has already lost its potential because of all the server issues it has. I mean who cares that "the servers are too busy" for you to actually play a game you've paid for here's some crates to waste more money on. Nevermind the lag or the chinese hackers ripping you apart with a bloody scar from the other side of the map through several walls while you drive at 100 kmph get a new pair of cheap blue jeans to make you feel better. Also the netcode and the server refresh rate are so bad you can literally shotgun somebody 2 times in the face and they won't die. Who cares let's add a poorly designed map so people have to exit to the lobby every single time they get to play on it. Sad. It could've been good but it's basically turning into h1z1 at this point.

review: Updated (18MAY2018) This is the 4th time I have edited my review the game has had its up and downs. Current status? Good. Cant I recomend it? Meh.. game is good but the little issues and lack of region and ping lock can make gameplay unfun. As of the writing of this I am again in the top 1k(190th) place for TPP Solo NA. I have enjoyed the game very much. That being said the wave of hackers since last November(2017) still happens. While they have take some steps to ban hackers(they have banned millions) the issues still remain when you have 5 10% of your matches having cheaters another group playing with high ping/lag it can make some matches very bad. The de sync still continues to this day meaning you can get killed after a 0.5 seconds behind cover in games. If they would just region and ping lock the ing game it would solve so many headaches. but when 75% of your playerbase is Chinese you cater to that crowd I guess and it is what they have continued to do. Updates are always during NA primetime(every single week on a random weekday for 3+ hours) Chinese infest the North American Servers causing lag and unfun experience Chinese spam ads for cheats and porn in the server lobbies. No region lock and a halfass pinglock that I dont think anyone believes works Cheating still happening after 8 months of constant issues.(it was so bad in Jan the company had to publically admit it) In game currency has been regulated to almost worthless as all new equipment constantly required real world cash to buy keys to unlock crates. Map development has been slow and not very transparent... next map? The winter map they teased 6 months ago? who the knows... could be next week or next year... Games future seems bleek... lack of innovation seems to regin supreme. North American Player base has been shrinking fast and may be dead by DEC unless things change and they stop catering to only Asia. The game is now easily 3rd and well behind DOTA and CS againduring NA primetime... it wont belong before its 4th... 5th. and then gone.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game itself is very fun however it is difficult to master. It is extremely competitive and therefore there are also many people who chose to hide throughout the game which can sometimes be annoying but it is part of the game. Once you understand the way people play and their tendencies you can take advantage of their situation by for example nading a house which they are inside of. The final 20 is usually very intense especially in Miramar where there is very little cover. Luckily the game provides three different maps Sanhok Miramar and Erangel. All three are different with Miramar and Erangel being large and spaced out while Sanhok being smaller and the games being faster. In order to be good you have to learn how to play on each map. One of the things the game could use is offline mode or the option to have a shooting range to practice such as in CS GO. I wish I could practice using different weapons as I know that would improve my gameplay a lot. I also wish the queue time would be shorter as a couple weeks ago it was great and has since became quite horrible. Overall I would give this game a solid 7/10 as it is very fun and time consuming however the terrible server waiting time and the lack of practice facilities is something that makes this game hard to commit to.

review: TL DR I started playing in February have 500 hours in so far and I still love it. The purchase has definitely payed off as I've had tons of fun playing with friends and I can only recommend it.Now here's the long one.There has been an on going negative reviews campaign going on for a while you can find that from Reddit from example.To me this is unjustified. Yes the game has had it's bugs most are gone by now and they've lately improved graphics performance too. Now they're working on desync issues and netcode optimizations according to the FIXPUBG campaign they launched.For me there have been many games with zero issues where everything ran smoothly and responsively. There have been games where the experience was less enjoyable too but an online multiplayer game with 100 people depends on so many factors that I think it's unfair to downvote it to hell for that. The backend is being worked on and so far it's been getting noticeably better so I don't see a reason why that wouldn't continue.On the other hand there are people saying it's a dead game with no new content or something along those lines. The reality is that in the past 2 3 months they put out a whole new map (Sanhok rocks btw!) three new guns two new vehicles and a ton of skins that were obtainable for free (either via Twitch Prime or during the PGI tournament).In the end it is just a game. And a bloody entertaining and addictive one too. I recommend and intend to keep on playing.It is still by far number one on Steam too. All those negative reviewers _are_ actually playing so there's a hint there.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: "Fix PUBG" ? Dudes this is the type of campaign you should have launched WHILE your game was in Early Access not almost a year after it launched full version. This game has great potential but the constant crate and cosmetic updates are given priority instead of performance and quality of life fixes. Sorry but this is just too litle too late for me I can't in good conscience recommend that anyone spends 29.99$ on a game that will cause more frustration than fun.

Lags and rubberbanding are ridiculous. The game also doesn't allow you to choose the map you want to play on. It just knows better. Right now according to my own statistics you have 80%+ chance to play on the new broken desert map. While I do enjoy playing it I'd wish I was not forced to be a beta tester after a full release of the game.Fix your game Bluehole.Edit as promised they fixed the lags and most bugs that I've encountered therefore I'm changing my score to thumbs up.

review: I am a long time player of this game (as is evidenced by the hours). In early access it was easy for me to forgive a lot of the bugs and FPS issues (particularly because I had a op back then as well). However in September of last year I purchased a high end gaming laptop. Specs are as follows GPU Nvidia GTX 1060 (4GB VRAM)CPU Intel Quad core i7 7700k 2.8ghzRAM 8GBNOTE This rig is capable of running VR at a stable 60FPS when not locked at 30 i.e Fallout 4 SkyrimIn its current full retail release this game is straight garbage. Allow me to explain. Many of the FPS issues and lag problems still occur. For instance whenever I take damage my game will freeze from anywhere between 0.5 2 seconds (I am not kidding and have recorded gameplay when this happens) despite having the beefy above specs which ultimately results in my death. Additionally occassionally aiming down sights causes a freeze of 0.5 1 second which actually caused me to lose the drop on someone and get killed in a match I just finished. Texture loading is still unoptimized as again despite the rig I have FPS drops still occur even after having been on the ground for a couple minutes.tl drI have a beefy rig and this unoptimized pile of garbage game still runs like

review: The game little by little has become unplayable. Either you have horrible dysnc issues texture bugs or parachute issues all of which have been around since the beginning and still haven't been fixed. Not to mention the connectivity issues with the game and the server maintanence that happens daily because after over a year they still can't keep thier servers running for more than a day. The horrible in game rewards where most of the time you get crates where you need to buy a key for $2.50 (have about 50 sitting in my inventory) and if you do happen to get a crate that does not require a key you end up getting the same garbage you already have 5 of. I have close to 2k hours between both my accounts and i can say without a doubt it is not worth the $20 they are selling it for.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game Title Should Be "Crawl Hide Shoot"Feel Great immersion you feel like an ant in the map but not so much you have to run for an hour. Gun battles are intense but will leave you scratching your head at times. Sounds need to be tweaked can't tell if slow walk can or can't be heard by others you'd think there'd be stealth in a game if you go slow?? Doesn't seem to be. Also swapping weapon sound makes me think someone is near me everytime!I have only played solo but team play would be interesting and another level of fun. Be prepare to be camped ALOT but there in lies the strategy be prepared to get where you need to be. Plan your journey keep cover and learn when fast and loud beats subtlety...Much time will be spent spawning and dieing at about 30 to 40 players left but then you'll have some luck and live till the top 10 and your adrenaline will almost make you yourself. Never fear when death takes you it's only another 2 minutes wait till your parachuting again towards doom.Technical I've read people saying the game needs tweaking sure. But it runs ok for me and seemingly a lot of other players. I'd like to see the FOV and sounds looked into. It just doesn't sit right. FOV needs to be adjustable (aparently it'll come soon) and they need to off or change the gun swap sound and make you "silent" when going walk/crouch. Note If you see a person run into a house and leave a door open you *should* be able to sneak in behind them and use that to your advantage...aparently not in this game...Only other technical gripe is hacks. I've seen a few 'odd' things. A few instances of "you can't have know I was there"...but they still "counter camped" my position while I new they were waiting for me. Had a guy with an UZI shoot me through a doorway (I was waiting for him to come out after trailing him) I unloaded with my AK even though he only briefly swept a quater of his body size) into the opening and back again (without knowing I would be there) they managed to get off enough rounds to down me. I did no damage with the ak crouched and scoped aiming at doorway.Please explain... * *Overall Fun Hide and Seek Shooter. Don't expect super accurate responses. Almost worth the $30 I paid once some more bugs are done sure. Not sure if shelf life will make it end up a long lived title.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well where to begin...This game is an absolute gem. You'll read all these reviews about how its unoptimized and buggy and while that is true its part of the fun of it. Watching your teammate drive a bike into a doorway only bug into the wall and blow up is pretty hilarious. It's not like it happens every game you play so that's why its easy to take it so light heartedly.And to further discredit all of these negative reviews about optimization the new patch on the test servers right introduces some immense optimization changes. I play on a potato of a laptop and with this latest patch it runs quite smoothly. As for game mechanics I give them a 6/10 rating. The map is big enough for each game to be different. Though its the same map so you can memorize it like a Call of Duty map. But wait!!! NOW THERES TWO MAPS!!! And the second map is amazing. Gun play used to feel a little loose in previous patches but it has been slowly refined and is fairly close to a Battlefield 4 feel right now. Bluehole is definitely improving their game.Now on to the premise of the game survival. From the moment you drop in it feels like a constant fight for survival. At the initial drop you are in a rush to find a powerful gun. Afterwards you are in a rush to find transportation. And after that comes some incredibly intense firefights. These battles will truly test your ability to aim plan and execute. Playing with squads is also a completely different dynamic than playing solo which I love. By yourself its all about stealth. Shoot only when the kill is ensured. In squads you tend to be a lot more visible to enemies due to there being 4 of you but you have 3 other people to watch your back so you can afford to take pot shots with your kar98k.The challenge of this game is one of the most endearing qualities. Its a true test of skill against 99 other players. Winning a round feel so much better than having a 2.0 k/d in call of duty.tl dr 6/10 Game Stability Bugs are funny take them lightheartedly and have a luagh. Optimization is getting better.6/10 Game Mechanics While the gun play is getting to a point I like it the blue zone moves too fast and you end up in a running simulator if you drop at the edge of the map8/10 Gameplay intense games juicy headshots and fat lootz.Overall 7/10 worth a buy (if Xbox goes smoothly look at that too)

review: I would say that the overall game is very servicable. The gunplay and mechanics are superior to Fortnite BR. Only issues here is that perhaps the game costs a little too much for this kind of experience not to mention bundling it up with microtransactions when there are still fundemental problems needing to be fixed. My experience so far with said problems has only been related to a few minor load time issues and one busy server timeout. With the "Fix PUBG" campaign making decent progress it looks like perhaps this game could get back up on its feet to remain a decent contender. If you don't want to buy the game for Bluehole's business practices then I understand completely.

review: Ok where to start... Being new to this battle royale genre of gaming I learnt a lesson very quickly. You will die and die and die over and over. There is no secret to this game it comes down to mostly luck and some form of skill. Some games I manage to get to the top 4 or 10 and then I dont come close to it for days. The challenges in this game are finding loot quickly moving cleverly and having good reflexes. The next big challenge is choosing a place to land some places that had good loot before are not going have the same loot next time around so it's a guessing game that can either benefit you or be to your detriment hence why I say this game is mostly about luck. The next challenge is the aiming and zeroing its really hard to master and when you are only getting a few minutes of gamelpay each round it's hard to get the playtime in to master the aiming so you are just left playing over and over hoping you get the right shot the right distance and you have the right gun or scope. The final thing is this is the only game ive played where I have to turn my settings down to gain a competitve advantage my rig can run this game on ultra but im stuck having to turn most settings to low due to rendering mechanics of the game. In conclusion if you are a big FPS fan then this will be great if you dont have a beefy graphics card or pc then this is for you however if you are not really into FPS games and have good pc then stay away or wait for a special.

review: I am pretty fond of this game when you can get a game. Matchmaking never seems to happen now. Wait 15 minutes (when it says expected wait 13 seconds) then abandon it and go play something that works.The idea of this game is great and I like the 'realistic' map style but it feels a long way from a AAA title. More like a one person game remake. Maps can get boring you tend to land in the same areas after a while.Missing lots of features like a test range or sandbox mode. Really hard to get better because you run more than shoot. Number of people logged on would help dont wait if there are too few.I like the new smaller map the blue zone is too punishing on the big maps. I die to that more than to the enemy. Seems like quire a few hackers sometimes hard to say You can die real fast to someone you never saw. I do like the death cam where you can see from the other persons point of view.I will only continue to play if the matchmaking improves and I would phttps //store.steampowered.com/app/578080/PLAYERUNKNOWNS_BATTLEGROUNDS/#robably give a positive review if that was fixed. Until it is though.....

review: For right now I cannot recommend this game. It's a fully released game but it still feels like the Early Access it was a year ago just with better optimization. My 970 can finally get 80 FPS average after the 1.0 update but the graphics are still lacking. Way far away stuff are buggy. A texture will load then go away at a fast rate. I get these weird lines on the shorline. Stuff is fuzzy sometimes depending on my location. I can't see players all the time when they are far away. Sometimes I completely miss them when they are in front of me! Maybe I need glasses I don't know I already need them for my near side eyes. Game crashes every so once in a while but at least you can join back if you are in a safe spot. Killing people is the major problem though. I can unload half or even a full clip into someone and hit the majority of those shot but they dont go down. And if they do go down but they are in a group it takes another half of my clip to finish him. But when someone shoots at me it takes a few shots and I'm toast. Who knows maybe I just suck. But something does not feal right. My guess is the high latency issues with players in the lobby. You have people all the way in Fuqing China (It's a realy place) that are in any server they can get to. Everytime I go in a NA server half to pretty much every god damn person is Fuqing asian. A simple region lock would fix this issue. I do not think this game should have been released so soon. I would be happy if it were still in it's early access stage because it is a great game. But once you put it in fully released stage this game is terrible. If this game never had a early access program and released it the way it was I would have refunded my money. The devs should work more closely on the main issues before doing anything else...like loot crates. I do play this game a lot but mainly with friends cause they distract me from the issues I have with it.Edit (7/11/18) It's been a while since I wrote my review (over 6 months) and I think it's time for an update. It seems like every step forward the devs make is really just four steps back for the game. The UI is lookin good I'll give them that but why change somethings thats working right now? Why not change the mass desync on the servers that happen almost everygame instead thats been a problem for almost a year now. (I believe I had desync issues way before it became prevelant with other people). Some decisions the devs make don't make sense when trying to create a good game that PUBG can potentially be. Optimization is still terrible. When I said I can get a smooth 80 fps that has now changed. I had to lower my graphics settings to keep a constant fps. I get around 60 fps now and it still get dips to 30 which affects my gameplay and messes with me when I am in a hot area. But let me go back to "the devs are making decisions that don't make sense." In a view to make the game better this is true. However if you look at the root of all evil it becomes very clear. Bluehole is just in it for the money. Can't blame them I guess but it is starting to feel like a disgrace to the video game community. All these loot crates season passes buy level ups buy this buy that feels like a kick in the face to me as a consumer. Why would I pay more for a product that is not even fixed? I mean I payed $30 for this game thats a good price but thats when it was alpha stage. Which even though it has been out for 6 months still feels like the alpha that I was playing last year. Just with more features added into it. I would rather play fortnite which I have been because its free to play looks and plays great. Yes FN is cartoony smaller and the such but they are doing it right. They add different events every season they don't have game breaking bugs and they seem to care about their customers. Now I am not all against PUBG and I am not a FN fanboy. I used to love PUBG. However they are not taking the right steps to make this a good game. I don't like cartoony bs in a game. I like realistic shooters with great graphics. PUBG would be amazing if the devs would not constantly think about how they can get their pockets bigger. I would think making a flawless game that makes people come back to it would make hand over fist in cash over a game that is half and made for people to buy loot boxes. I play FN right now because I love the battle royal concept and I don't feel like the game is getting in the way of my skill (if I even have any) and fun. I would still not recommend this game at it's current state. Wait till CoD or BF5 comes out with a superior battle royale mode. The devs will start sh*tting their pants then when they realize they don't have the niche market of a realistic battle royale shooter. Hopefully it will be better then if not just get some other game. Not this one please save your money.

They've made improvements since the beta and release but it still feels like the same old PUBG. It's even worse now with more paid in game items. So until they get their company ideals worked out I'll stick with other games.

review: I really never got to play the game. I was banned a year ago without reason with no warning. Then after almost a full year of asking for help on forums with the dev and BattlEye I never got an answer other than the dev and BE pointing the finger at each other. BattlEye assured me the ban was not from them and the proof is in the pudding... I played Ark A LOT.... if BE was going to find anything bad... it would have found it while I was playing Ark both immediatley before and after getting this pointless ban.Then on Apr 25 this year I was banned again..... uh... my first ban was never reversed and I did not even have the game installed..... Then they added a third ban on Apr 28..... How exactly can they keep banning someone who does not even have the game installed?Oddly it still only shows as one game ban on my record but still makes ZERO sense... I went to the steam community to seek help and was greeted with masses of hate and being called a cheater.... pretty funny because my ban does not say I was banned for cheating... I have asked the dev if perhaps my username was an issue but no response...I would like to give this game a fair review but again.... they have banned me for NO reason.... not helped me resolve the issue... and apparently I am not the only one who has been treated this way.Just tonight I sent BlueHole another request to review my ban...... hopefully they actually provide me with some details for my ban.... but I seriously doubt it... I will be honest.... after receiving my second ban I started looking into the banhammer issue and apparently the dev is on a banning rampage. I surely hope they fix this as I cannot get a refund and I am barred from accessing content in which I payed money for. 0.4 hours of playtime and most of it staring at a "you are banned from Steam" message......Do not recommend at this time.Perhaps if my ban is lifted and I can actually play the game a few times I can change my mind.

review: Horrendous monetization for lackluster cosmetics unsolved cheater problem less than ideal optimization and an update frequency for new content that is far than acceptable for a paid with monetization. I'm not going to go in vast details as others have already done much better than I could and this is my personal review anyway.The only credit I can give is for coming up with an interesting concept for the Battleground genre but when it comes to supporting and building upon that concept over the years? The PUBG Corporation or Bluehole have proven incapable of doing that.This game company as also taken legal actions that question their very integrity toward game development and in my opinion have crossed the line from defending their game against clones into trying to appropriate themselves the very concept of Battle Royale. Not only are these actions motivated by greed for profit as their competitor are performing better on all points listed in my first paragraph they seriously threaten to limit the artistic expression and interesting new possibility that emerging developpers can create in the future if their vile lawsuit succeeds. For all these reasons I advise against supporting this game and the company behind it.

review: This game has 2 million concurrent players and completely blew up thanks to the hype from twitch streamers. Sadly the game has been out for 7 months now and It's still just as completely laggy and un optimized as the day it was released for early access. It's truly sad that a game with success like this is going to get away with terrible business practices such as micro transactions and just being lazy when it comes to working on the game. You would think with the success of the game bluehole would be constantly working on new content such as new maps fixing their servers or atleast making it to where a normal person can run the game above 20 fps. But instead all they seem to have added is a few vehicles and weapons here and there and truthfully this game feels the exact same as the day it was released. Truly sad Bluehole. Hopefully in the future game developers will learn to start caring about the players but it looks like Rockstar set the bar for the rest of the game companies.

review: tired of game companies limiting your gaming experience? then this is the game to buy to tell them that you will not put up with their crap. 64 max player count for the last decade and this formerly small company gives us a 100 player count game. Not only that they gave us maps that are so much larger than those in games that only support a maximum of 64 players. This game made me realized how little competition there were in the gaming industry. Well competition has finally arrived and it's apparent that other companies are trying their best to kill this game and company. The issues with the games are there but are due to the fact that this is a 100 player fps style game being implemented on a mmo size map with player having the ability to move very fast via driving or flying. No game engine can truly support this well so pubg corp is pushing the unreal engine to it's limit. Until there's a breakthrough regarding network technology and a dramatic increase in the minimum requirement for pc's this may be the limit as to what can be done in a 100 player battle royal type game. If you've been playing fps style games for the last decade it's time to try something new. This feels nothing like a fps game in that you have to actually play tactically. Positioning and planning will carry you to the final circle while your fps skills will get you the chicken dinner. This is a thinking man's game. Should you take a car and risk revealing your position via the engine noise? Do you have meds? If it's early in the game you can scavange for it but if not then you have to fight for it. And then you add in the ability to play with 1 or 3 others in squad. do you have a sniper gun? I can give you a 8 time scope. thanks here take some first aids. Anybody got a vehicle? I will go get one you guys keep looting! who threw the smoke grenade? I think somebody's in the building. we all push together. I'm down the guy is upstairs camping. Ok got the guy! Squad play brings a whole new level of dynamics that make getting that chicken dinner all the more chaotic and so much more fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TLDR They killed it with bad PR bad/not enough updates and most importantly an event pass system that deserves to end a game.This game man can't say I hate it but they just shot it out of the sky. Battle Royale is here to stay just not in a buggy format with CEOs that rather sue everyone than use the revenue they get to develope the game further. Implementing an event pass that can't be earned through playing was the last nail in the coffin. I have no problem with past sale revenue coming from skins and other cosmetic items if the money actually goes towards fixing the game and new content but how these guys are handling their game is just dumb. They not only killed the PR but also the game itself. Props I had high hopes especially because I hate the overly cartoony skillless game that Fortnite was and is becoming even more nowadays. Pls just make a BR game that looks realistic and isn't buggy laggy and full of monetisation make it 60 bucks if ya have to hell make it 80 for all I care just don't produce a f*ck up like this.

review: Edit/update The de sync has become unbearable. I no longer recommend this game due to that with the other shortcomings that can be looked past. Such a shame because it has so many other things I love about it but it's just unbearable to play now.Previous review I use to really enjoy this game. I still do enjoy it but not as much. While I still recommend it its become quite a time sink due to the wait times both to get the numbers for a game and also because the 1 minute countdown starts much too late. The wait time has made solo unbearable as you can spend 10 minutes looting only to be killed out of nowhere or by a camper. This in turn makes solo worse because there are less people queueing for solo making the wait time longer and making this game harder to want to come back to. Squads with mates is still quite enjoyable unless you have the misfortunte of dying early and your squad living on. Definitely still has a lot of potential but needs a lot of refinement.

review: The game has a great concept and even though it is repetitive as hell it is still addicting. There's still a lot of work that needs to be done to this game I'll list those below. You will run into cheaters here and there. Once they stop dragging their feet on actually making updates on this game it will be 10 times better. All in all it's a fun game for $29.99Things that need fixed Servers are not the best The lag is real (By that I mean they have random network lag messages that pop up in game and everyone stops moving. When you're first dropping in on a spot it takes time for stuff to spawn. When you first land to take any action either to open a door or pick up a gun the delay is way to high)This game is a resource hog for not being a very graphic intensive game. For this game being in early access for7 months it doesn't feel like they've done a lot to improve it.

review: I kept my original review below. My stance has currently changed on this game. If you are an AMD user and I don't just mean a ryzen but FX processors as well just stay away as of update 20 in Aug 2018 they broke the game and have not fixed it. Update 21 has now been released and well it is still broke. I can't play I can load the game get to the menu sit on it for about 30 seconds and then crash if I attempt to start a match in that time I will crash before the match loads. This is incredibly disapointing as I loved this game and it doesn't appear from their forums that they are taking this issue seriously.I love this game. The matches are quick only lasting up to about 30 minutes if you can make it to the end. While there are still some lag issues the team building the game is constantly working on optimization over adding stuff so. The game's performance seems to always be at the for front of their work with additions as only added benifits when able. The three current main modes are well fleshed out and they are still working on making sure drop balance is right. Which I've found the recent update to drop balance and randomized cars and their directions a really good thing for the game. It is well worth the cost and I feel I have easily got my moneys worth out of it already.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG could have been good if they had been willing to listen to their fanbase. Instead they decided everyone who wanted to play on a team with people who spoke the same language were racist. Then they decided to add insult to injury that instead of adding meaningful content that they would just instead add loot boxes. Now pubg just sits in my library and every week when it has an 11 GB update I question why I haven't uninstalled it. If you actually still have friends that play this game it might be worthwhile but be aware that is only now trying to turn a new leaf after a year long journey of on the fanbase and now is trying to recover its failing playerbase.

review: This game had the excuse of early access previously for performance issues which to its credit where near enough non existant however since this brilliant 1.0 launch this game is an absolute mess. It isnt worth paying anything over 5 for as half of the games you will actually manage to connect to will be a rubber band filled lagging buggy mess. The fact the developer has made all the money from this game and release it in such a terrible state is a testiment to todays gaming It is an absolute joke of a game filled with technical errors and much like the console release worthless. Pros Kind of fun when you actually find a game.Cons The rubberbanding is an absolute joke its the worst I have ever witnessed in any game I've played.The amount of glitches and bugs like teleporting while running and teleporting through doors is unreal.The price of the game is an outrage its a buggy indie mess.The graphics are poor running with a GTX 1080.The FPS bounces all over the place from 20 140.Honestly wait for a deep deep sale do not waste your money especially when games like Fortnite have the same concept for free. Is Fortnite a better battle royale game? Not so much. Is it a better technical game? YES 1000x over.Do not support this heap greedy developer.EDITED AS OF 11/01/18 The game is now full of hackers and at least 1 in 3 games you will be ruined from miles away by someone called something like "amdhfhs". Again avoid it like the plague.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: im going to start this out by saying that i do REALLY enjoy this game. its a lot of fun to play if you have people to play with although not as much if you dont. but none the less is a great game. now lets get into the reasons im giving this game a negative review preformance and cheating. Preformance this game has some SERIOUS preformance issues on even midgrade hardware. im not saying i have a beast system but i can run arma and medium at 50 55 FPS stable. this games map is roughly 1/18 the size of altis (and the new map is slightly smaller) and im lucky if i get 30 FPS with ALL of my settings turned to very low after 1.0 this got better but that was just the frame lockups i experienced every 15 or so seconds. and this still happens but about every 30 instead of 15. so needless to say this game runs like trash and unjustly so. there is no reason i should be able to run arma 3 on medium at 50 and this game on low at 30 now on to my main reason i dont recomend this game Cheating this has a lot to do with the Chinese playerbase which really deservers a section of its own but it ties in with this problem so well i didnt see a point. (according to battle eye 99% of the cheaters in pubg come out of china) but Cheating is a huge problem in PUBG in the last 30ish matches ive played ive had maybe 4 5 where my killer wasnt obviously using an aimbot of somekind and no im not joking that few. as i stated above chinese players make up 99% of the cheaters in game and they also make up almost 1/2 the playerbase in the game. there is a very simple way to solve this problem and thats region locking the game not just for this issue but also because of the ping that the chinese players present and the garbage netcode this game has its literally worse than battlefield 4s was on launch. also dont use the "but its quicker to find matches on NA servers for them" when its not they make up almost half the playerbase. your arguement makes no sense in conclusioni love this game although it is plagged with issues i will continue te play it but these issues need to be addressed. if the situation improves i will change this review. but until these issues are resolved i do not recomend that anyone new buy this game and i encourge you to avoid it like the plauge until Mr. green decides to take these issues seriously itstead of calling the community that made this game sucessful "xenophobes" for presenting a straightforward solution to a problem
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: You can buy loot boxes with BP. One loot box and more to come can only be opened with keys that cost $2.50 a piece with no way as of yet to earn them in game. I see what you're doing Bluehole and it's scummy. It is on par with how scummy EA has been with battlefront II. And to think I defended this game as being made from a developer that wasn't greedy you changed my mind incredibly fast. Should have known microtransactions would come in sooner than later but I am completely shocked at how you expect your players to buy keys for loot that is already subjected to the most unfair RNG ever. 0.01 percent chance to get a face mask in the newest crate. I am hugely disappointed at this mess it's one thing to offer cosmetics at a fixed price. Fine I'll give developers that. It's quite another thing entirely to subject loot to paywalls that don't even guarentee you getting what you want. It's a gamble and it's a damn shame the developers are using their platform to subject loyal consumers to business practices due to cooperate greed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When I played their Early Access release it was buggy and the game had terrible framerates. Upon release into the 1.0 system the game ran smooth and I had a very enjoyable time besides the occasional aimbotter killing me across the map with a handgun one or two shots. Now with this new release today the game is like stepping back into the Early Access and saying screw all to the previous framerate and lag issues.I'm hoping for the game to stabilize again but I doubt it and with the issues from in the house for the company with their BattleEye hackers as well as latency I can't give this game a positive rating.

I'm sure the game will be more fun and worth the money when it is close of being finished. At least with Steam refund you can test it out and decide and for this very reason I would recommend to at least try it.

review: I have been trying to give this game chance after chance to fix the issues it has and every time the devs patch something they break something else. They have been so focused on adding new content that they have not fixed some of the unrealistic and quite honestly immersion breaking animations sounds and items. Not to mention that audio does not seem to be working properly at random points. In multiple instances I watched players land and run by me without a sound. This also led to numerous deaths and losses and made me not want to play. Additionally the devs try so hard to communicate with the playerbase but fail to add things that players need and want until long after it is called for. This is a major reason why Fortnite though a little harder to get into coming from Battlefield games has become not only my new favorite but also the gaming community's new favorite.

review: So its been a few months so i think its time to update the review. This game is still very fun but there is a few factors to consider before you buy now. First the game servers. Yes we get it its an early access game and we know youll have issues with the servers but with it happening multiple times in a day you would figure by now they would have it figured out. But the bright side is they will keep you updated through social media about the issues and when they are resolved. Secondly the game is starting to flood with hackers. Thing is they make it obvious when they are running 3x the speed than everyone else and insta headshot you without looking. They do get banned but i shouldnt be seeing hackers every day. And lastly WE DO NOT NEED ADVERTISEMENTS. Even though its hard to say wait this game out till full release and hopefully by then Bluehole will have upgraded potato servers.

review: Firstly I do still believe in this game and desperately hope they can make the game we all wish we were playing when we run this hot mess. I was going to hold off on reviewing the game until full release. However with recent decisions being made by the development team their grace period for forgiveness in my eyes has ended. This is quickly turning the way of DayZ. With the title of "Biggest Game on Steam" comes a certain standard of quality or playability that is not being met. For the first 40 hours I had a decent amount of fun. There's a steep learning curve between the massive map different weapons and mil sim tactical gameplay all of which appeal to me as a gamer. I could excuse the rampant bugs glitches and optimization issues since it was Early access and I knew what I was getting into purchasing this game in that state. But as more of my friends bought the game and I spent more and more time in the world the issues that now cause this game to have a "Mixed" review rating became less subtle with every single match I entered. This game is poorly designed for competitve play. Firstly there is no practice range or training mode (which is a basic essential for any competitive shooter). That in itself wouldn't be as much of an issue but it requires the unpleasant experience of joining game after game simply to die in order to understand the game's mechanics. Since there is no killcam or "death report" breaking down your damage received or given there is no way to tell whether you're even doing damage during an engagement. A new player will die from seemingly nowhere and without the information on HOW they died or WHERE they were shot from it will discourage them from wanting to play. I would describe this as "User Hostile" and deters players from coming back. The number of friends I have with less than 5 hours on this game because of this exact issue is staggering. I've heard the arguments for how a Killcam or Death Recap would take away from the immersion or experience and while I can understand that point it's an invalid argument when put in the context of a competitive game. You cannot grow without knowing how someone outplayed you. There is no "get gud" when you're being left out to dry on exactly HOW you died so you can anticipate the same situation in the future and adapt to it.Next the framerate stutters heavily even on the most powerful and expensive rigs. I have a higher tier rig and I MUST play with most everything on "Very Low" to get close to 60. Ask any competitive gamer how important getting a steady 60 MINIMUM is for their performance. Especially during gunfights when the game will inexplicably drop frames because you. Finally we have the most glaring issue server connections. Between the MASSIVE desync and server connection problems I cannot reasonably call this game "competitive". There have been times where I have dropped from full health to none THEN I hear the gunshots after I am already dead. I have been riddled with bullets and survived with no damage. The number of times when I have been completely in cover THEN received hits from a few seconds ago is uncountable it happens nearly every single game. This issue right here is what breaks the competitive play as what the server thinks is happening is NEVER 1 1. The amount of t headshots I've gotten on people most likely in cover on their games is equal to the number of times I've been in total cover then received damage. It's not a connection or ping issue this is a game issue.I still have hope for this game. I hope they can fix the frame stuttering the desyncing and make it more user friendly. But until then while they continue to roll out new game content for a game with broken basics I cannot and will not recommend this game to anyone.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: In regards to microtransactions They are adding them for a brief amount of time in EA to Fund a tournament Test the system Donate the rest to charityAfter the short window they will remove them again until the game is released fully.All the people rating it negative are overreacting a scary amount and you shouldn't let them dissuade you from the game.That being said there are still a few bugs and the servers can be laggy although in my experience Bluehole usually fix these issues ASAP so they are a non issue (in my opinion).The addition of first person only mode has been seriously fun and it's like paying once for two games because third person and first person just play so differently.I've had so much fun with this game I bought my friend another copy so I had someone to play it with.Would recommend even if the game was released in its current state with no further updates.At the end of the day this is a video game. If you buy this video game you will not regret it. If you buy this video game then get involved in all the out of game drama that doesn't affect you it may ruin your experience but if you are buying this video game to play this video game it is well worth the $30
