review: Ok ill give this game a short oppinion ! CONS very unoptimized ( gtx 1070 or better for good constant framerates ) graphics are not too good as most of the map /objects are blurred SOUND is the weakest point in this game ! its so badly done it can be better you can't'even hear someone passing 10ft from you if you dont have your headphone maxxed out... and somethimes you hear nothing at all ...PROs briliand ideea of game alot of potential for future updates/improvements very good aim shot realistic weaponds graphics can be improved but for the moment it isnt so ideal ... (most of the titles out now that uses UE4 has that blury image and slow loading objects... hope it get fixed)CONCLUSION The whole game is the best in this genre but it needs alot of improvements and optimizing as i have friends with older gpu's GTX 660 and cant play it its the main cause that games like this(no name needed) got alot of players out (optimizing promises not delivered) Ill give my positive with hope for the future !

review: Ok let's get on with it. Many of the game's mechanics are dumb.Car physics are dumb.Jumping inaccuracy is way too low.Super glitchy and bug abusing thrives.Pretty much is a cash grab apparently it needed microtransactions during development to "pay for the tournament".Even the devs know that the red zone is stupid.Not optimized especially for SLI/Crossfire. Yet after all of this I still play it more than CS GO now. Although this game was only released as early access so the devs have an excuse to put out a buggy game just so they can make more money during development it's still a good game even in alpha. For some reason you have a will to just try and get far and win. Although I started with negatives let me list the positives. First Person Only mode. (Third person shooters are dumb you can stand in cover and still see a push coming.)Active devs that listen to the community. (H1Z1 take notes)Combat is fun even though it can use some work.Although RNG is annoying at times I think it adds to the excitement and challenge to the game. Some mechanics are great such as the airdrops that rewards aggressive players.Motivates you to play for some reason like an itch to win and this game doesn't get too boring because of it.For a game in Alpha the settings are pretty in depth. Ultrawide support.Duo and squad are worked out pretty well and are definitely super fun. My personal favorite mode is Duo.One problem that doesn't affect many people though bans are easy to get. The staff are too serious about stream snipers and team killing but that is already a ranted about topic by the community.Overall I recommend this game. It's just fun and it can be casual and competitive.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Edit This game is complete Desync never fixed. And after a month hiatus I come back and the sound of the game is at unbelievably low default levels that I can't even increase within the game. So now I can barely hear people when they're walking around without making adjustments to my computer's audio settings. Game just isn't fun anymore and the incessant problems that arise that WERE NEVER PROBLEMS before is hilarious. Uninstalling and never looking back. I hate fortnite but it's only a matter of time until someone halfway competent makes a PUBG style BR game and then this ultimately turns out to be what everyone always thought it was a pump a dump from a korean company.Edit This game has improved and I actually bought a new computer because of this game. While this game still has a plethora of issues and bugs it's a fun game that actually runs. It's still poorly optimized but content patches are constantly being updated to the game along with client improvements. Really the only positive since the game came out is that the game receives regular updates. Which is a good thing for an early access title.This feels like a game that I could really like further down the line. At the moment though I cannot exactly recommend it. It's in a very early access stage. Most of its problems right now rely on its horrible optimization. I'm a little fearful if this game will ever solve its performance issues because so often they never get fixed with a lot of games but I've been proven wrong plenty of times on this. I suggest waiting on this one if you're truly on the fence but I will admit I'm having fun playing it.

review: This game is by far one of the worst overhyped games I have ever played in my life. First of all the mechanics suck the gameplay is not smooth at all you get stuck on edges and ledges every chance you get. The menu navigation is ing horrible nothing is organized everything is lumped up in the same category. Secondly the gameplay this game besically take no skill or stratagy its all about being lucky that you get an assault rifle and a car then you are set to go. If you dont have both of those things you will 100% lose. The entire game is based on getting better gear before your oppononts do and all of that is based on your RNG. you can land in an area where its only you and one other guy so you both get into different houses and he findes an AK 47 and you find a Pan good luck trying to hit the guy blasting your with the AK while all you have a a frying pan and a pair of sunglasses. Again I state whether you win or lose is based on how lucky you are with the gear you get when you land. Even if you do find a good weapon they still might spawn the circle(the place you have to be in before the timer ends) at the opposite side of the ing map. Good luck going there if you cant a ing car because you will 100% die or an anal lazer infection if you dont find yourself a car in the first 8 minutes so your only hope of having a dignified death would be to shove your frying pan as deep in your as possible before that dumb ing lazer wall burns your Last but not least the ing servers. the connection is so ing laggy no matter which server I play on. Its not due to my internet I have played many games that require good connection(abttle field CoD LoL Overwatch) and I never had as much trouble as this ing game. In conclusion this game is a waste of time and money. Please spend your hard earned cash on something timeless and worth it like the Witcher or something not this joke of a game. The only reason this game is even popular is because the PC master race commuty like praising indie games because they are just a bunch of neck bearded hipsters that enjoy fapping to anime

review: Only one thing I have to say "BEST BATTLE ROYALE GAME EVER"Cons there are already cheaters in game... so take care.Update after 100 hrs Pro Devs really do their job. I mean every week there are hundreds of reports of bugs and cheaters. Small bugs/glitches get resolved in the weekly update. The big update the monthly one really did it's job as it fixed substantial problems. Graphics and grahpic glitches... yess... good graphics.... devs eliminated the glitches... good devs...Gunssssss more gunnnssssss... Yes the devs already added new guns into the game. Vehicles ... yessss... they already added 1 new vehicle into the game.The content is subtantial for a 20 30 minute round. Even now after 100 hrs I discover new places on the map.Con There are cheaters. True fewer than before but still... If you meet one it will ruin your day. And until the devs add "replay" option or history log for the kills with at least a 2D map as they stated on their forums there will be no way for us to have proof of cheating without recording the game ourselves.The game is still a good game... buy it.... now ... what are you waiting for?Update 2018 300 hrs DON'T BUY THE GAME. IT IS LITERALLY UNPLAYABLE. Every 2 3 matches you encounter a cheater. They are banning 50 000 people a day they've reached 1 500 000 bans after 9 months.Save yourself the trouble and go with something else. As much as I loved this game in 2017 I hate it in 2018. It's unplayeble and the DEVS are doing nothing to improve the anti cheat engine.

review: Over 100 hours in and I'm still not entirely sure how to feel about this game. On one hand I've had some really good times playing and sometimes winning high octane games on the other hand I've also been in games where I've spent 20 minutes running only to be killed by someone camping in a bathroom. On one hand I've seen marked improvement since this game came out on the other hand for some reason it's getting a console release far before it can be considered a 'finished game'. On one hand I've had games that have run smooth as butter and on the other hand I've had games that felt laggier and more glitch filled than would be acceptable from a pre alpha demo of a game.My answer is a very hesitant yes. Hopefully the developers will continue to improve and expand this game to the point where I can consider it without a doubt worth the $30 I paid for it but until then at least it's better than H1Z1 and Fortnite I guess.

review: Overall the game has its fun moments and cool stories to share with friends but the core experience is lacking a certain level of polish. The core solo expereince with this game is very much survival oriented and chances are if you're seeing a lot of combat you're not going to last much longer. This at times can make the game feel slow and even when you hide making it to the top 10 just to get picked off by a guy hiding in a bush makes the whole 20 minute treck feel worthless. thats not to say the game isn't fun i have managed a few wins myself but for maybe one of those wins i can say i had fun doing it most of my enjoyment with this game comes from playing with 2 4 people and just having crazy adventures and getting into big shootouts laughing at the glitchy physics in cars or how youre friend just bounced a grenade off a closed window and killed himself those moments to me are more fun then winning by playing bush simulator 2017. the core mechanics like peeking in scoped mode and getting stuck on a tree while you get shot and on behalf of atleast 2 people i play with the loading screen glitches and texture rendering glitches could all use some work but if you've got friends to play with or dont mind a solo quiet camping game the 30$ is definetly worth it.

The game itself is terribly optimized even though they told us they were going to fix that. I constantly deal with framerate issues even though my computer is well above the recommended and connection issues are constantly a problem even though I have good internet. The gameplay itself can be enjoyable if everything worked perfectly at least 80% of the time but the majority of the time you have to deals with bugs and hope you don't get shot while you wait.

review: There's something about this game that keeps me coming back whether it be solos or squads with friends. That being said there are so many small things they could do to make the game more enjoyable (that don't involve netcode).1) Custom matches like they were on the test server. 2 people to start a match instead of 10. I'm sure they must've had a reason to change it the way they did but it's far less enjoyable now. Those couple days of test server custom matches were the most fun I've had in PUBG. 2) If they can't swing OG custom matches then perhaps they could add a firing range like Tencent has in PUBG Mobile. I believe at some point Brendan Greene stated that a firing range wouldn't be in the spirit of the game. If that's really it then it's time to face the facts my dude you're not making an art piece you're making a game. Let's have some fun.3) Arcade modes with smaller circles and/or fewer people (8 minute matches and Mini zone) just like Tencent has in PUBG Mobile. 4) Greater AR/DMR/SMG/Sniper spawn rates. Sanhok's drop rate is pretty good but it was better in the early stages of the experimental server. I'm not sure why it's a gameplay element that you have to hunt around for a good 3 5 minutes sometimes to find an AR especially in places like Po i. Maybe they could do a testing period with increased weapons spawns. If only there was something of a test server to do that on...5) Separate the crates you buy with in game currency and the ones you buy with real world money through keys. The in game currency is more or less totally useless right now and it's really the only thing you get at the end of a match. I read on a forum that this is just how crate systems are and that if we didn't like Bluehole "giving us free money" (by selling crates on the marketplace for $2 3 each) then we could basically shove it. Unfortunately just about every single crate is worth $.03 now so that dude should probably do some re evaluating. Anyway it's frustrating that you can't just spend the in game currency and know you'll get a crate you can actually open without spending $2.50.6) Please set the default firing mode for freshly picked up weapons to full auto. It would be extra cool if they came loaded.7) If there's not going to be test server like custom matches or a firing range a dedicated deathmatch mode (or permanent War Mode) would be great to get some practice before hopping into a match or just messing around. It can be rather difficult to find a good match that will actually fill up on the custom games as is.

review: I was always a fan of console gaming until I decided to buy this game a fair distance off launch. This game has changed the way I game. I pre ordered WW2 on PC initially bought Destiny 2 on PC and a few other different game im looking into buying once they release. This is huge for someone who has never really played PC other then occasional WoW from time to time.I strongly recommend this game to anyone with a decent computer I had to upgrade a fair bit in order to play on high / ultra settings but I didn't spend a whole lot.There are a few points that I must point out 1) When a team member dies in squads or duo it places a large white skull on their body making it impossible to see anyone beyond or looting that said body.2) FPS drops quite a bit in many matches this isnt a huge thing but it does get annoying when in the middle of a gun fight and your guy decides to spike all over and place.3) First person mode is extremely fun and enjoyable if you can get over the fact you feel like you 4 foot tall. All the door handles and windows are eye level and after playing a few matches I begin to get a headache.There are a few other points but at this time I feel those are my top 3 they are very small points and they dont effect my review of this game. For being early access I would buy this game before the full game releases and the price doubles.

review: This game gave me a few memories that will stay with me for the rest of my life which I could only say to a few games. some things that made me want to stop was the fact the loot crates are now mostly locked and selling them is also not worth it. crates shouldn't be the selling point for this game but when you introduce any mechanic into a game it will and should be reviewed as a part of a game. Crates or loot crates will make or break a game (EA) mind you yes PUBG crates are just cosmetic but they are still selling for a pretty penny. This to me was probably the most looked at when the developers wanted fans to keep coming back and yes I almost agree with that to me that kept this game fresh for me and I even get locking a crate once every other season or two would make sense to me or why locking them would make the hacks less interested in playing this game. but to me as an actual gamer it isn't fair. yes the game lags and I got sniped with an impossible headshot a few too many times. I almost feel bad because I genuinely enjoyed this game. it makes my heart pump and my mind think of ways it never had before. I'm not a coder by any means but I believe you are all thinking inside the box and should start thinking outside of it. Maybe adding a lvl system too the player base may start helping out the bots become less involved in the later part of the game once you reach lvl 30(or more) then you can start getting points and can start buying crates and thus forces the hackers to go through the game legit. For me I Believe this would be a great idea and as long as the community checks their death cams with this kind of idea you should have a cleaner game.

review: Game has improved immensely since its release. The devs have been doing a better job of communicating changes and explaining the direction the game is going. Is it an amazing game? No. Is it GOTY worthy? No. Is it fun to play with friends experimenting with different ways to mess with the enemy? Yes. Are they consistently rolling out updates that are moving the game in a better direction? Yes.I've been hoping for a long time that I'd be able to one day update my review from a negative to a positive and I think that day has finally come. Like I said the game is not perfect it's nowhere near perfect. But it's the best game in its genre and has held my attention for 500+ hours for a reason.

review: Graphics HorribleTolerableNeutral I would say some explosions grass and environment effects are nice. Up close a lot of things look pretty bad. You can get lost in some of the big open maps (lost in a good way...visually).GoodAmazing Gameplay HorribleTolerableNeutral The movement feels very floaty and clunky. You can get caught on trees when parachuting and there are tons of bugs. However I thoroughly enjoy the gunplay especially up close. It also has more of a realism to it with the bullet drop bullet velocity etc which does come into play for longer snipes. This isn't a fast paced bunny hopping game like Fortnite. It is much more strategic and literally every step you take should be calculated.GoodAmazing Audio HorribleTolerableNeutral Good I would say Audio is key in this game more than most other aspects of the game and its more important than in other battle royales. With that said sometimes things do feel off. People complain that they can't hear footsteps until its too late.Amazing Audience KidsTeens YesAdults YesElderly Difficulity Too easyEasyNeutralHard Once you learn some of the gun mechanics movement audio queues etc...it becomes a bit easier. But its tough to master a lot of the aiming bullet drops strategies what attachments for what weapon etc.Too difficuiltSummary I currently love playing PUBG. With its flaws bugs and lack of developer interaction with the community its still a fun game to play if you are into the BR genre and want a more realistic take on it. If you want pretty graphics bunny hopping cute skins but general fun gun play then Fortnite is probably your jam. If you want something that takes a bit more practice more realistic more customization options in terms fo guns and how you want them to work for you strategy and tactiful gameplay...then PUBG is your jam. Just beware you will second and triple question some of your deaths.

review: I'm late to this party and that's because I did not want to pay full price for this. I was almost never going to buy this game after reading all the terrible reviews until I got drunk and bought a key. I'm reviewing this with a slight comparitive slant toward Arma 3 since 'Playerunknown' made the mod in Arma before going on to make this one if I'm correct. So my honest thoughts? It's fun for a short while. I've found since I got it I like to play it for an hour although playing any more than that the game gets irritating. Getting the chicken dinner is hard. I got into the top ten at least. BR is personally a little lame to me. I essentially put it in the 'wasteland' style of play except in this game there are no military vehicles to watchout for and the game forces you to keep moving or die so someone magically wins the 'king of the hill' or the chicken dinner which usually ends in a 1v1v1 or 2v2 in teams type situation.The good The maps are nice I like the detail on some of them. Player models are good. Character customization is to me optional okay for people who like it.The bad Not enough rifles. Looting buildings sometimes sucks. No night maps which could make for some interesting gameplay. Characters have stiff movements. Footsteps are too loud. Adding a sneaking walk would do good. No shooting range/training mode. Other game modes are pretty much empty unless you get in on a private server. Not having a TDM just for fun. Can't change your name in game which should be simple.Edit I have run into at least one hacker who knew my exact position pretending to be swat and However mostly people who killed me were just in right position or they heard my loud af footsteps.I only can't reccommed this game because I think it does need a lot of work not just with their anti cheats. So I'm giving it a weak thumbs down.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: (RATE this Review UP if You Want ReGion Lock/ or No sqaud friendly fire!!!!!)LETS GET NOTICED.i owned this game during early access about amonth after it first came out the game orignally fantastic. yes thier was chinese people. but realy i played tonight and was team killed 4 games in a row by these tards. the last game i landed all the way on the oppisite side of the map just to try to live longer than 5 mins. these traveled the whole map to find me with a sks with not a single attachment a level 1 helmet and backpack. killed me for my gun like really the game is not enjoyable anymore over 300hrs and i can tell u now if u plan on buy this to group up with randoms and battle it out 2 the chicken dinner this is no longer the game for u. i would still recommend this game as a solo game if u want to try to win alone. other than that the community that was once superb and strong has become nothing more than a ****show to say the least.Love the game. review: I used to love PUBG it was a fresh concept that I never heard of before Yes i do know now that were Battle royale games originally It was nerveracking and competetive and it was very challenging in a good way i wasnt the type of guy to care alll about the glitches or frame rate issues. But recently the game is a broken mess. it says that matchmaking estimate time is over 40 minutes that i cant wiat that long and takes for ever to render. Devs never respond and i never thought i would be saying this but fortnite is a miracle compared to this.. at least Epic Games respond to the community. The event pass i didnt even look into and their is no point of playing other then that ''Winner Winner chicken dinner'' that got old so quickly. i prefer the realistic approach to battle royale though but the bugs and glitches makes it seem so unrealistic. They had so much potential but it went downhill so much. it was one of the main reasons i bought a PC aswell /

review: ok played over 300+ hrs have to say love the game even if i dont win much. That being said my bug bares of the game right now.THE CRATESearn points to open crates (ok fine) get my 700points to open the first tier crate and get a freaking locked crate which needs to BUY!!!(yes BUY!!!) keys shrug it off and carry on playing earn my next tier crate 1400points open the crate OH LOOK another freaking locked crate. Have to say yes there Money grabbing with this feature. might as well not put points in the game just earn a crate at the end of the match or just have a store where if ppl wanna buy a box just buy a box the point system is just redundent now.GAME MODESbase game is fine but now they have added custom game modes and it now takes 5 10 mins (even tho it give us an estimate time to matchmake personally i think the custom game modes have killed the base game and ppl end up leavingthe lobby even when you do get a game your lucky to get 80 85 ppl now.Optimization is a given and server optimazation how about more incentive to win the match other than more points how about win the match get a crate key or 2 or just a random piece of clothing or gun skins.these are just afew bug bares of mine other than the game dying right now cause of the custom game mode i think the base game is great.

review: Just a couple months after PUBG came out back in March of 2017 I decided to buy in. It has been by far one of the most thrilling and heart wrenching games I have played. You can sit for hours on end in pursuit of a victory and no matter how good you are at the game you always get that adrenaline rush when you're doing well.After the game came out of Early Access I was extremely disappointed. I did not think that it was ready and the hacker abundance was ridiculous. After taking a break from January 2018 July 2018 I am extremely pleased with the progress the devs have made. Not only have they launched the FIX PUBG campaign which promises to finalize the majority of all issues regarding server lag and optimization but the game's current state feels much better as well. There are far fewer fps drops and the only main concern is the dsync which should be fixed shortly.Overall this has been the best $30 I have spent online.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game gets a lot of hate and I feel from reading and looking at the players profile is unfair. Most have 100+ hours in the game and you dont play a game for 100 200 300+ hours long and not like the game. What happens way to much and not even on just PUBG but people try to play demanding games with potatoe rigs. Is this game optimized the best no but it is still very do able with a decent mid level rig ( Which you should really have to play video games ). Youll need atleast a 1050 ti and a quad core cpu if older or newer better threaded cpu. I have a 1060 6gb OC with an 8 core cpu.Another thing this game is not easy or even advertised as being easy. Its really ing hard sometimes it strives for a degree of realism. Fortnite is an easier battle royal people win a lot becuase of how easy it but PUBG is more complicated and wins can become rare sometimes.Personally this game is amazing to play with friends to around or to try to win. I can recall countless time swhere matches eneded when we all were luaghing our asses off or we were yelling at eachother becuase they didnt make the right move. Overall this game is the best realistic battle royal there is out there. Yes there bug and yes it isnt optimised the best but they have pubilcly announced they are now working on it. I give this game a 8 out of 10 as it is a fun friday game night game to play with the boys

review: I think most people have already illustrated what's wrong with this game. For me it was the downward spiral of in game performance. This game cannot maintain a steady framerate nearly regardless of the system on which it is running. Modern games that have been released since are more graphically demanding and run better and it is abundantly clear that the publisher is more concerned with releasing additional paid content (like the mobile app) than fixing the issues that have been present since day one.

review: I do not get why people write negative reviews on PUBG. This is great game. I have played it before and I bought it today for myself so I can finally review it. I recommend it. And you know what? People over optimisation are playing on potatoes. I have OLD i7 3770 and Nvidia Geforce GTX 560 ti with 1GB of GDDR5. 1GB. That is under minimum requirements. And it is mid range card from 2011. If I tried any brand new AAA games I would need to run them at 720p. But PUBG is SOOOOOO "not optimised" so I get 40 60 fps on 1080p. Very low and view distance medium. 85% screen scale just to get that sweet 60fps most of the time. I could definitely go to 100% screen scale and low. What the hell do people want. My GPU is at least 50% slower than 1050. I thought that It would be barely playable on 720p 70% screen scaling very low. I am suprised. Great game and I dare to say this VERY DECENT optimization. This is my review for now. BUT IF I GET BANNED FOR NO REASON I WILL BE MAD. LOL JK people dont over great game.

review: THIS GAME IS VERY ADDICTIVE. LIKE MEN ARE TO NAKED CHICKS. THE ONLY THING I THINK NEEDS TO IMPROVE IS THE CARACTOR CONTROLS. THEY ARE JUST NOT LIKE OTHER FIRST OR THIRD PERSON SHOOTERS ARE LIKE. MAYBE IF IT HAD SOME GEARS OF WAR MOVMENT. THEN IT WOULD BE MORE REALISTIC AND SO MUCH FUNNER.updated review.iv been playing for a while now.155 hrs ot as much as some with the 1000 hr mark but im not 20 any more. any way still a fun game. the things i would change or add.1st. the damn controls! realy i know everyone playing will say they suck. THEY SUCK. trying to jump on things is flat out WE TODD DID. your going to be doing something abot that because if you cant move your caracter correctly &amp smooth operator like than id just assume play nintendo again. A jump B shoot. 2nd the fact i get shot 1 or 2 rounds and die while iv unloaded a clip in others to see them just shot me dead. stupid. hella stupid. im on my 3rd controler. any one with an extra send them this way.3rd. for some the time is good for other not. im not saying slow itdown for the dead zone but maybe add an option to pick the time. 20 min total game time hard 30 medium 40 get your lollypop options make people happy !!4th. the boxes you give things in for an award are pathetic. talk about some child like fun. i fart in your general direction.5th and last i see a ton of people complain about banning for helping in the BETA testing and not seen any feedback back from te dev. PAY attention to your customers man. we are who make your game great. we play we pay we advertize we dont sleep and without that your still needing to try an pay for your house. we do that for you so respond to the people and respect the ones paying and playing.

I say 1.5 because the 2 newer maps just look like a bunch of copy/paste along with one of the maps being significantly smaller than the previous 2. review: hate to defend BlizzardActivision and Overwatches loot box system but I think people give them more of a pass because unlike other games they don't have a season pass that doesn't get you all the dlc like it's supposed to. To their credit everything they add is free after the price of admission not a single new character game mode map etc. costs a penny more than what you paid to get the game. Hate it or love it mate gotta give credit where credit is due.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is fun when you are matched with players that can speak your language I have noticed most players even in the north American servers are from China that creates a pretty big language barrier even if you both try to understand eachother. there has been a problem with cheaters from what I can understand and I have no doubt I see many death cams showing people hiding in a building or behind a mountain obly to come out and score an immediate headshot on me when i am nearly a mile away. Im not sure what the solution is exactly to fix this situation but I can tell the people at the top have very little respect for a majority of its customer base. Also the crates you get have basically rigged odds they are so low not many people will ever get anything that makes it worht investing hours into. Basically its a fun game if youre lucky to play with people from your own country or that can understand you at least and you are lucky enough not to get killed by a cheater. the gun play is fun graphics are all right though the game clearly still needs better optimization. I hope I can return in a month or so and give this game a thumbs up again. UPDATE This game is still fun in the actual gameply its self as long as you don't get matched with people that don't speak english when you play as a team but the big downfall of the game is the lack of content for $30 it sure is setup as if it were free to play any time you get a crate it almost always is one that requires a key and I cannot justify spending any real cash on this type of a game when they are treating the player base as if we are just a cash cow to be milked dry and thrown aside. still has problems with cheaters and hackers as well... it seems they don't care and never will care.

review: I have increasingly mixed feelings about this game the concept is great the gun play is solid if a bit sparse however I see the potential. At this time I would say wait before you decide to sink 100 hours into it. There is still so much to be done to make this game great. Some of my personal favourite issues are as follows 1. Laggy start parachute lag and rubber banding means almost 50% of the time you will be killed unarmed because the game can't decide where you landed.2. Engagment Lags Getting into to a gun fight almost 65% of time causes a frame drop and lag the game freezes for 1 second and when it finally responds you are dead...3. My game lags everytime a player is within my vicinity it's helpful to know a player is near by but it leads to problem 2.4. No local severs major lag as high as 500ms at times no good for an FPS can deal with 100 or 150 but anything higher is a death sentance unless you catch the player looting or unaware.5. Janky Physics Cars and People don't physics as expected... 6. Sound My own footsteps scare the sh*t out of me... And sound levels still seem completely unrealistic hearing a player stomp about like a disgrunted elephant in the building next door is not realistic...Now for the Pros 1. Great work has been done to improve on bugs and cheating2. Weapons feel real and have heft3. Very engaging and really sells the concept of survival4. Narrative is up to the player/players5. Replay and Death Cam are welcome editions6. One of the best co op games I've played great for teamwork requires focus and dedication7. Challenges the player to consider strategy and skill allows for growth and improvement.All in all I can say I think this will one day be one of the best games out but the current state leaves much to be desired. However I will recommend it to new players...__________________________________________________________________________UPDATED this t... after months/almost years of time and investment of time and energy this game just continues to disappoint. IGNORE ALL MY PREVIOUS COMMENTS DON'T ING BOTHER... PLAY QUAKE CHAMPIONS OR FORTNITE INSTEAD...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The poor quality of updates and the inability to target game breaking bugs has me editing my review. After a year of playing PUBG in the beta and finished versions the $30 I paid for this game is overpriced.The desync is horrible being shot around corners and when not in view. The broken OC lobby with 50 minute que times the inaccuracy of hit boxes items dropping through the floor and going missing shooting a player when being killed at the same time results in no damage to the winning player car dynamics are poor broken sights on m24 rifle invisible players reappearing after parachute deployment cheating loot system is so low chance to drop a decent item that its near on criminal and the list goes on.The good? The first 100 200 hours were a blast. Intense and action packed with plenty to offer. This was a honey moon period for the game and the playerbase expected bluehole to optimize its servers and game to make it a real contender but this was not to be. Now with a playerbase that has begun giving up on the game bluehole is on its hand and knees trying to sweet talk us with a "fix pubg movement". Its sad to watch and quite frankly a little pathetic. Maybe take your community more seriously next time instead of pushing them aside and sensoring their constructive critisizms on your forums.Reap what you sow.

review: So this is Playerunknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG). Even though this game is in Alpha it feels more complete than other games that have been released as a full version. The Developers are constantly updating this working on new features and are trying to get rid of bugs.Speaking of bugs. This game has the habit to annoy you while you are gathering a team to get the game started. Very often you have to reload your game and the status of players is not shown correctly. (Has he clicked ready or not?)Let me say a few words about the game 1. The game is a fast paced (or slow in case you are up against 96 99 campers) multiplayer survival game. In it's core the game wants you to constantly move and forces fights vs. other players. There can only be one (or four) winner(s). You start with up to 99 enemies if the lobby is full.2. The map is great the landscape feels authentic and provides various locations to hide fight and of course loot. The conditions you are fighting in in terms of weather can be sunny rainy or misty. I believe nighttime and nightvision goggles as loot would be a great addition however some players leave the game lobby if it is raining for misty. There will be new maps and I can't wait to play in the sand.3. The loot that you can find ranges from normal clothing over weapons to grenades. The spawnsystem tries to place the loot at random locations so that sometimes you are fully geared within 2 minutes and other times you have a pan only. That is okay given the fact that you can go out seeking for more loot or hit someone with your pan grab his stuff etc. (You are probably dead before that or a lucky chap.)4. That blue hole circly thingy. After being thrown out of the plane and parachuting down to the island you will get notified that you now have a certain amount of time to get into the circle. Sometimes you are in sometimes you'll have to cross the entire island to get into it. It is random.PUBG can be a quick distraction if you want to play and have some action before you hop on to something else. (Quick sometimes equals 4 6 hours.) The real PUBG feeling starts kicking in when you are not alone. You can join or fill a random squad but that often results in them letting you loot just to abuse you as their mule and then killing you for the loot. Do not think it is always that way but it happens more often than I would like. I believe the Devs need to add a Voice system to the starting screen paired with the ability to get into a squad before going in. That way you know with whom you are going to be in a full squad. If you have not bought the game so far I can assure you it is okay. You can buy it. It is fun. There is loads of work to be done but even that does not make the game feel uncomplete.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's a fun game that can make your heart beat real good when you're the 2 only guys left. This usually gets the blood pumping hard for me for about 10min after the match.But my problem with this game is the success sounds weird but it's true. At the start of the game they did a great job at optimizing the game and pump out good updates but now as the game has around 7million sales and 1million players at a time they know and think they are doing a great job and think they can slow down and start pumping out new content. Content is not needed at this moment imo they need to polish the game so much more fix small and big bugs and keep optimizing the gameHonest oppinion on this great game ing . I live in EU Norway and the ing NA servers are 100x smoother and better in every way. While EU is absolute . AS Servers work fine too. Hit reg is super inconistent the first 5mins of the match so the only way to play the game without lag is to stretch to the other side of the ing universe. You'd also think bluehole want's to make people play this game but that's an absolute lie. Got a message on discord and need to tab out? No worries but your screen will go black and you cant tab back inn again. My fav bug is when you try to hit play at times nothing happenes. So you gotta refresh your UI. But your buddies hit play and are wating for you so when you hit refresh UI they get put into the game while you get put into your own.

review: Heavy lost in interest in the game. I tried a match since they ve updated so much again and i can t fully support this game anymore. The company giving back to the community is great but the game itself seems like it was better about middle of their patches. I noticed a period of consistent hit detection and solid gameplay. Then they started patching in more stuff that seemed to ruin it. Their kill cams are extremely off or the opponents that typically kill me have a bot aim of some sort. Can t beat the excitement of getting somewhere and seeing a killcam that shows you 10 paces ahead of someone s sight only to die. On a positive note the new map did feel nice. On a negative note i don t know why someone wants to buy into a battle pass to get more crap. Seems like the game simply found a way to swindle some more money off the top before it goes all the way under. Edit.... with where the game has came still fun. How ever other games picking up the moth styles are proving that pubg will not have a stable server without rebuilding the game from the ground up... (enter ring of elysium *roe*). Even playing america to foreign servers proves a less de sync issue than what pubg has. My new recommendation is a 50/50. If it s on sale sure full price I wouldn t bother with it. old below STILL ENJOYING THE GAME and the server fixes have been AMAZING. A great KOTH style game and i've been hooked since i started playing it. the new patch updates that keep coming in are great. New weapons are apperciated mainly because the servers fixed. I have updated my desktop since initial purchase which helped alot and the most recent server fixes have made the game run smooth as butter. i maintain 80 easy. Highly enjoy this game. it truly does reward the those that know how to remain calm...assuming those people landed in a spot with firearms and amuniton. lmao. the game runs a little choppy with my proessor i have the listed bare minimal. but i have a upgraded one coming as well as a new MOBO and i expect the game to perform rather flawlessly. only change i would enjoy is the character being able to vault some things that are knee high to waist height. being a filthy casual i tend to mess up those jumps and get stuck behind a seemingly easy to pass barrier haha. anyone booting up for a first try my only suggestion is to scramble to the nearest house loot a firearm and gear and hit M to check the map and get your little buns to the playable area. if youre in it already then focus on surviving.

review: First time playing this type of game and it's such an adrenaline rush!I'm not even mad when i get killed it's just such a rush everytime you encounter another group.The devs seem like they care about the game so far and the game is not too hard to get into.Would definitely recommend.Edit (31/10/2017)Pros + Wide variety of guns and modifications.+ Big map with decent map design.+ Fundamentally this is a great concept for variety and fun.+ Competetive but also allows for lots of casual fun.+ The unpredictable nature of the game through it's RNG Loot system.Cons Client Side Hit Detection. No regional server lock. Grass/trees and fog can easily be removed through game INI. The Mini 14 basically ignores the laws of any other gun thereby ruining all gun balance. Third person forces you to shoot with your right side and look for enemies on your right. Attacking an enemy by going/looking with your left side will give your enemy an upper hand as he/she can see you before you can see him/her. Guns will also hit a wide variety of things you never expected it to hit. Aim out a window? you're gonna hit the window frame 90% of the time. Laying on the ground shooting at the guy a tiny bit uphill? you'll only hit the ground infront of you. This games gun mechanics wants you to play it in first person if you play it in third person you will suffer. Ingame advertisements.Until these issues are resolved i cannot recommend this game anymore.Edit 15/11/2017After trying out the test servers and seeing the amount of improvements made to the game i can finally recommend it again! )Pros + Vaulting is amazing and game changing.+ Car sounds are way better now.+ Car handling is so much better now and bikes are no longer a death trap.+ Alot of audio has been improved to not hurt our hearing anymore.Edit 26/04/2018I've been wanting to get back into this game for a long time but the last 6 months have been so dead development wise that i've seen no reason to return. Money money money PUBG Corp seems obsessed with money to an extent where they are willing to kill their game for a quick payday. This game started out so well giving off the idea that they were working harder than any other Early Access game and that they were truly dedicated to releasing a great and finished game. But the game just amounts to the absolute minimum they have to do to make a game at this point. And they seem to be just fine with that as their priorities just seem to be to host E Sports tournaments and release skin after skin after skin to the game. "People keep spamming "Map Selection" "Region Lock" Oh i got it! let's add skins to the guns and ban Reshade! D"I never even knew how depressing PUBG is to look at until they banned Reshade it ironically set a visual theme to the way i felt about the game at that point. The Desert Map This map was so amazing that people spammed "Add map selection" all over their every single steam update. They made a map so good that people were begging not to play it. I hated this map from day 1 it's impossible to drive in it and it's f**king huge. So if you thought PUBG was already endless running simulator then do we have the update for you! DThis map has tons of huge buildings with the most annoying rooms that takes years to loot. People camp their lives away in these buildings shooting you the second you drive anywhere near em. Meanwhile you can just pass by wondering which one of the 20 tall buildings they're sitting in.It honestly really made me appreciate the simplicity of the first map with all it's great spots that atleast felt somewhat balanced. If you get shot at whilst driving in Erangel there was often just 2 buildings the enemy could be in. Erangel also looks way better and has more iconic spots that you can actually visit without automatically losing the game. And you can often expect a certain type of game depending on where you land. This can barely be said about the Desert Map. The only thing you can safely assume about the Desert Map is that you will die in some BS way.One thing PUBG does care about though is being the only Battle Royale game on the market. They've been looking at the monopolies around the world and thought to themselves "So if i just dominate the whole market by removing all competitors i can make bank from doing the absolute minimum? Where do i sign?!". And so the lawyers were set free to hunt and several statements were made about the need for protection of ideas in the gaming world. Cause why would you make a great game and keep working on it when you can just be the only game in town?All of this just seems to show that PUBG Corp is too scared to compete especially since all their ideas are so simple and easy to copy. After seeing all the things Fortnite is doing with Battle Royale i'm having a harder and harder time seeing what's unique about PUBG. The "realism" often just seems to bug the game out immensely. And when there's a huge eco system for hackers in this game (cause of the steam market) a eco system that PUBG Corp themselves profit from aswell. (When they get paid for every single transaction of their ingame items.) and hackers therefore plague the game why would anyone care about realism?Watch me and my entire squad realistically insta die to Usain Bolt with a bolt rifle and see how much i care.PUBG needs to do something special that makes the game great and exciting again. But until they switch their focus to gameplay and away from micro transactions and E Sports tournaments for a broken game nothing will change.All of this sucks cause i used to enjoy this game alot but seeing it die out cause of their greed like this is incredibly annoying. Especially after the whole show of affection and love for gaming in general that they showed in the beginning of their Early Access. In the end PUBG was just like the rest of them a cash grab.Also you guys really can't pay artists for their artwork really? f**k this company.Edit 01/06/2018PUBG has for some reason decided to buff Frag grenades and every single top 5 battle is now decided by whoever has a frag grenade to throw at the other. The amount of BS deaths i've had to frag grenades at this point is making me quit this game for good. this game.Edit 15/06/2018I might be done with this game for good now this game is simply not fun anymore. Dying to some stupid bug or other BS is just not funny anymore.This game is so anti fun it's exhausting. You can't just mess around with friends cause you have to focus at all times looking at your sorroundings and always be prepared for the ton of campers that this game hosts.This game is such a camp fest it's insane. And for anyone who doesn't have a ton of time to play these games that is just a huge deal breaker.The game is also so incredibly high risk but at this point just really low reward.All the endings of this game is basically decided by grenades now. If you have a grenade you win.You can never relax you can never chill. All you can do is loot for 5 years and get shot by someone camping somewhere. And there is no way to survive this unless you play solo with a good headset and no background noise.The Time to kill in this game is so often legit 1 sec. And most of the time it's not even because the game is brutal. But instead because their servers are so incredibly s**t that you can be shooting at someone for 3 seconds but on their screen you only shoot at them for 1 sec. Hence why you suddenly receive 3 headshots in a second.This game is s**t competetively it's anti fun as f it's stressful as f it's greedy as f it's buggy as f it's just all around s**t and i'm so sick of it.F**k this game.Edit 11. July 2018 Now they've put all their ingame advertisements on parachutes and the plane. Worst Business Practices Inc.

review: *******JUNE 23RD 2017___JOKE _Review_____******** "halo 4 clone" *******JULY 5TH 2017___ACTUAL _Review_____******** PLAYERUNKOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG after this for abbreviation) 9/10 PUBG is a shooter that can be played as an FPS or TPS depending on your personal playstyle.The combat makes you feel as if every shot matters when using a weapon that uses bullets and such. Its a mixture of in my opinion H1Z1 and ARMA III. With the difference being no stupid supple crates you need IRL money for and laggy as f**k servers (H1Z1) or no stupidly intense guys playing a stupidly intense semi realistic military battle royale (ARMA III). When you eventually go down from a straight up blast with a shotgun or a "HOW DID HE DO THAT" shot from a sniper rifle 1000m away you dont see a killcam enemy highlighted stats on how you died. Its just "Oh you died this is what number you were and thanks for playing." Which is frustrating since you cant really improve on what you did wrong. **The game is in early stages so any bugs that are currently in the game i wont complain about in this review.My high score comes from the amount of communication and teamwork it takes to survive in the dou (team of 2) gamemode or the squad (team of 4) game mode. I only have 2 friends with the game and when we squad up with the random we recive via matchmaking communication and teamwork are vital like crazy important to staying alive and being the last team left. Even on my solo games by myself i just have to think about every type of outcome that can happen with the 90+ other enemies that were dropped in the big play area around me. My summary?????????? If you want to get a game that is an FPS/Open World/Survival this game is pretty much for you it'll have you yelling because you died or cheering cause you sniped some guy across the field as he hopped into a motorcycle. My only note is try to get friends to play with you it makes the game much more intense or fun however you play with your friends.

They listen to fans and that's what counts the most we asked for more guns and we got them! Thompson and Mini14 gun. Players wanted a First person only mode mode they delivered. Developer connection with the fan base is fansastic and that in itself says alot about the direction this game is going in. review: In this post apocalypse world the rich got bored so they bought a island dump a bunch of weapons all over it then dump poor people from a air plane to fight to the death for the grand prize of a chicken. Oh then they drop more weapons and bombs on them AND IT ABSOLUTLEY WONDERFUL!!! Kill or be killed.Now the story is out of the way what else do you need to know. This is not just a FPS but a triller game. Yes shooting and killing is a main part of the game but what keeps you going is the trill of the ride. Even when you're safe you feel like death is ever lurking over your shoulder waiting for you to slip.There are bugs and glitches still being worked out of this game even after leaving early access but those moments leave you laughing or raging but always coming back for more.This game is unforgiving. No aim assist and sometimes times you can unload a clip without killing the person while getting down by a shot but you will rejoyce in the trill of the kill when you get one.

review: This game is everything you want it to be but done poorly. In well built games you can learn to be better if you so wish. You can examine the mechanics of the game view replays and generally figure out how and why you died and what you need to improve upon. In Pube G you might reach a wall in your learning and find that the game is blocking you from that wall. You can't even see the wall because the game is in the way. You can't trust the replays because they don't represent even close to what actually happened. You can never be certain whether you ran the right way fast enough or anything because of desync. You can't even be sure that someone is hacking because of the absolute garbage way the game runs. All the feedback that the game gives you can't be trusted and that's a huge problem. Sadly this game deserves its negative rating. I had fun with it but that fun was always streaked through with negative experiences and honestly I wish I had never picked it up.Just in case anyone is wondering this isn't a response to a particular patch this is a summation of the overall experience all the way from Early Access through the full release.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: More concerned with adding more skins / lootboxes instead of fixing fundamental issues that have been present in the game since it's release. Bugs Desync Hacking Server instability Poor UI design Poor performance for average playerThere has been zero communication from PUBG Corp to indicate whether or not they are actually attempting to fix these issues. I am guessing that PUBG Corp know that the game will be dead within the next 1 2 years so their main priority right now is milking the playerbase for all they can by adding half features and "Events" such as battlepass to distract players while ignoring the core gameplay issues.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

I mean loot crates all hidden behind a pay wall or if you unlocked them using the BP you've earned can't unlock them without a $2.99 key.Also I've never heard of a company sell a $10 battle pass that expires after a certain amount of time..."You have 30 rewards in total to earn (one for each level gained) that range from BP XP weapon skins and clothing items and accessories. However a few of these will expire at the end of the season regardless of whether or not you own the Event Pass." Sherif Saed from VG24/7.This game had so much potential but became absolute trash.

review: Seit einiger Zeit ist die Karte Miramar in PUBG spielbar. Doch nicht alle Gamer sind damit glücklich. Nun überarbeiten die Entwickler die Karte komplett.Mehr als 20 Millionen verkaufte Exemplare und über zwei Millionen aktive Online Spieler täglich PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds ( PUBG ) und die darin zelebrierten Battle Royale Schlachten gelten als das Phänomen des Spielejahrs 2017. Nächster großer Meilenstein war die Veröffentlichung von Version 1.0 für PC am 20. Dezember 2017. Mit an Bord war auch die Wüsten Karte Miramar die bei vielen PUBG Spielern allerdings nicht so gut ankommt. Entwickler Bluehole hat nun auf die Kritik an der Map reagiert und nimmt mit einem kommenden Update massive Änderungen vor.PUBG Tuning für MiramarAktuell können PUBG Spieler den neuen Patch auf den Testservern ausprobieren. So gibt es auf der Miramar Karte nach dem Update mehr Gebäude und Unterstände zum Schutz. Außerdem finden Sie dann auch mehr Offroad Wege für einfachere Fahrzeug Touren durch die staubige Pampa. Am Waffen und Ausrüstungs Spawn legen die Macher ebenfalls Hand an Während in manchen Arealen nun deutlich mehr Gegenstände liegen ist die Ausbeute in anderen Gebieten hochwertiger. Ferner testet Bluehole in dem Update neue Anti Cheating Maßnahmen. Ob die Änderungen fruchten bleibt allerdings abzuwarten. Sie haben PUBG noch nie gespielt? COMPUTER BILD SPIELE verrät Ihnen im Test wie sich der Shooter nach Patch 1.0 schlägt.Willkommen in Miramar!Wichtigstes Merkmal von PUBG 1.0 ist zweifelsohne die neue Multiplayer Karte mit dem klangvollen Namen Miramar . Analog zur weiterhin enthaltenen ersten Map Erangel umfasst auch sie eine Fläche von 64 Quadratkilometern. Das war s dann allerdings mit den Gemeinsamkeiten denn das Szenario ist ein gänzlich anderes. Statt auf einer stark bewaldeten einst vom russischen Militär besetzten Insel in Osteuropa kämpfen Sie diesmal in einer gebirgigen von Mexiko inspirierten Wüstenlandschaft ums nackte Überleben. Zugegeben das Setting mag auf dem Papier etwas karg und langweilig klingen entpuppt sich in der Praxis aber als erstaunlich abwechslungsreichHauptgrund hierfür sind die vielfältigen topografischen Gegebenheiten sowie etliche Sehenswürdigkeiten. Im Unterhaltungsviertel der westlich gelegenen Industriestadt El Pozo etwa befindet sich eine sogenannte Luchadores Arena wo es in den ersten Spielminuten häufig zu blutigen Faustkämpfen kommt. Begibt man sich von dort in östliche Richtung folgt das nächste Highlight ein verlassenes Gangster Anwesen (Hacienda Del Patrón) inklusive Schwimmbecken Hubschrauberlandeplatz und unweit entferntem Flugfeld wo Kriminelle früher höchstwahrscheinlich einen Drogendeal nach dem anderen abgewickelt haben.Aber auch eine gigantische Silbermine ein heruntergekommenes Elektrizitätswerk eine marode Wasseraufbereitungsanlage ein rostiger Fahrzeugfriedhof ein staubiger Rangierbahnhof ein düsteres Tunnelsystem ein ramponiertes Hochsicherheitsgefängnis verschiedene in Mitleidenschaft gezogene Kirchen sowie eine mysteriöse Ausgrabungsstätte zeugen von der Kreativität der Leveldesigner.Nicht zu vergessen die beiden riesigen von Meteoriteneinschlägen geformten Krater von denen der östlich gelegene den Blick auf eine im Zentrum zerschellte Passagiermaschine freigibt. Großartig was Bluehole hier abliefert! Wolke sieben für ScharfschützenWer bereits viele Stunden auf der Ursprungskarte Erangel verbracht hat dem fällt außerdem die im Vergleich spürbar gestiegene Dichte an Siedlungen und Städten auf. Heraus sticht dabei insbesondere das riesige südöstlich des Kartenzentrums gelegene Los Leones mit seinen zahlreichen nicht fertig gestellten Wolkenkratzern. Da viele von ihnen über schwindelerregende Treppenkonstruktionen verfügen fühlen sich hier vor allem Scharfschützen pudelwohl. Gleichzeitig stellen die unzähligen Gebäudeansammlungen der Miramar Karte eine hervorragende Gelegenheit dar die Möglichkeiten des überarbeiteten Fortbewegungssystems auszuloten. Zur Erinnerung Bisher waren Spielfiguren in PUBG unter anderem nicht in der Lage durch geöffnete Fenster zu klettern über mittelgroße Hindernisse zu springen oder sich an Mauern hochzuziehen. Das Update auf Version 1.0 fügt all das nun hinzu und sorgt damit gleichzeitig für deutlich mehr Dynamik im Spielablauf.Sie sitzen unbewaffnet im ersten Stock eines Hauses fest und hören Ihren bestens ausgestatteten Feind bereits kommen? In der Early Access Fassung kam eine solche Situation meist einem Todesurteil gleich. Jetzt aber suchen Sie sich einfach ein geeignetes Fenster im Raum und wuchten sich mit einem eleganten Sprung ins Freie.

review: Great stuff a streamlined version of the battle royale genre and I do believe the best example of it. This is provided you actually get to play. If you ever manage to catch the game between updates it's maybe a 50/50 chance it will work. Got home today couple gig update sure I'll go make some food. Come back a bit later nice 5 more g to download since they apparently decided to patch something else in the amount of time It took me to eat. Fine. get two games in and then WHOOP can't connect. WHY? IT NEEDS TO UPDATE. but hey. That's fine. it means they must be really on top of their bugs and problems right? hooo boy WRONG common and consistent bugs through every patch so far include but are not limited to black screen once you load into the plane preventing you from dropping getting stuck underground at random times being forced back to the lobby every once in a while and needing to reload the title screen multiple times praying that maybe THIS time the play button will actually respond. Update since the institution of paid loot boxes I can't actually recommend this game. It's still technically in early access as far as I'm aware. Best thing you can say about them is that they're only cosmetic but still. The servers and technical issues have not been made any better with the new updates. Seriously good fun with friends definitely recommended.

review: Be prepped for lag make sure you optimize the game to the best of your ability. Otherwise really fun game with friends. It is in early access so I thought it would just be another H1Z1 mess but it surprisingly holds up really well. I wasn't really into these sort of games because I was afraid of dying getting scared etc. But the game is actually pretty fast paced so you will constantly be thrown into another match to try again so I'd say it definitely is fun in that department. Also the servers are quite good and even though there are 100 player matches my mid tier internet holds up fine. TL DR 8/10 game but make sure you have a decent computer and its more fun with friends.

review: TL DR Buy it! 5/7 two thumbs up etc.The battle royale game done to perfection. 100 people go in 1 comes out victorious. (or 2 or 4 if you're playing Duos or Squads )If you don't like having your heart racing from adrenaline after playing video games then you should go ahead and pass on this game because it will get your heart going almost every single match.I haven't been this compelled to play a game since Modern Warfare first came out and I played that game online for 500+ hours. Not only is it amazing to play it's engrossing to watch others play. If you're unsure about it check out any of the endless people streaming it on Twitch. (Specifically though I'd recommend giving Edberg or SombreroGG a watch.) Yes it's as fun as it looks better even.There is a bit of a learning curve with the game especially if you're more used to playing twitch shooters but if you've spent any time at all playing CS or ARMA then you'll find a lot of the skills (epecially team related) will transfer over. PUBG definitely leans more to the ARMA side of shooters.While there are issues from time to time with the servers ranging from minor lag to unplayable connection problems it's rare enough and finding a new game is easy enough that it doesn't hamper the enjoyment of this phenomenal game.And yes as of this writing (7/9/17) there is only one map available. I promise it doesn't impede the playability at all. The map is 8km by 8km with tons of areas and terrain to learn. Through a little RNG on top of that and the one map alone is worth dozens and dozens of hours of play. That said if one map isn't enough more maps are in the works with a desert map being teased as up next.

review: PUBG Gameplay itself is fine with desync being the biggest annoyance maps could be better as both Altis and Bozcaada in Arma 3 played better and allowed for more infantry movement. Biggest issue is that the developer trying to squeeze every penny out of their player base. Selling the game for a premium price new loot boxes every month season pass (with timed rewards) and now they are talking about having a price for custom games. It's hard to not be cynical about this game and I would only recommend the game if you read literally nothing about it and only play it like a few times a month unfortunately there's no real competitor at the time of writing that is doing the authentic style battle royale.

review: Even though the game has reached 1.0 Bluehole still hasn't optimized the game. After every run the game has to reset which takes about 20 seconds every time. 20 seconds may not seem like much but after EVERY single run it makes you think "is this really necessary?". My game still randomly crashes server lag is not uncommon and desync is still an issue. The fact that this game is 30 dollars and fun is the only reason i can reccomend it.That was my original review back in late december now that i have played the game a bit more i have more to say.Since then all bluehole has to with this game is add some buildings and to the desert map change where you spawn in the pre lobby and fix rubberbanding. You might think "oh wow they fixed rubber banding?" Don't get too excited because desync is worse than ever. You will die getting behind walls many times in this game and when you go to look at your deathcam it will show your oppenent shooting empty space and killing. Not to mention the tons and tons of hackers and chiese players destroying the servers (#regionlockchina). On top of that they're now adding crates you can only open with keys because that's what everyone wants. I'm not saying this game isn't worth $30 but bluehole needs to either add more features (and that doesn't include dumb*ss crates) or get their together before i can reccomend this game again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I bought this game for myself and a friend I saw a lot of people hyping it up and ignoring the hype was pretty hard but I held out for quite a while. I want to preface this by saying that I am TERRIBLE at engaging in firefights in this game. The guns have heavy recoil when firing full auto you have to really pick your battles a lot more carefully than in most popular FPS games. The learning curve seems a little steep if you're used to playing only CSGO CoD and Battlefield like myself. But it's so rewarding to get kills in here. Whether you choose a more aggressive approach or a more stealthy approach the latter is how I have taken to playing I stay away from large towns and hit small clusters of houses on the outskirts and shacks along the way so getting the "best" setups is a little harder but staying low and non confrontational until the restricted zone forces you into an engagement can be super tense and the various strategies you can employ are keeping the replay value higher than most other games these days. After 12 hours straight in one day of owning it I can definitely say that I'm hooked and continuing to improve will be a joy for me. This game isn't perfect but it's a solid take on the battle royale concept and I recommend it to anyone that is looking for a change from the average FPS. This game has potential to be a true 10/10 if the concept is expanded on in the final release and the performance issues are fixed (I have an i7 7700k and an R9 390 I should not be getting dips into the single digits no matter how rare. )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Today is May 4th 2017 i have played 65 hours so far over the past few months since this game has been released.Now there's some important things you need to know before you buy this game! Since it's in "Early Access" this means the game is bound to have several glitches and not be a finished as some Triple A titles would be like Call of Duty Battlefield etc you get my point The game is updated with weekly server updates and monthly content drops all of which have been free thus far and i assume they will keep it that way The map is a decent size but it lacks character. By this i mean you either play with game at day time with clear skies or with rain. I'm not to sure how a night time based map would do but it's something i would like to see put on the test servers Side note to my previous point the game also comes with a second download which is for a test server. For those who don't know a test server is a place the Dev's can implament new items and game mechanic's without affecting the core game kinda like a vitural world. Come here if you want to try out new weapons attachments items vehicles etc. Don't compare this game to H1Z1 they are similar but i personally think Player Unknown does the Battle Royal style much better andmore realistic then H1Z1. Car physics and player mechanics are more like real life compare to an arcady style. I.e you jump out of a fast moving car you will take lots of damage same with hitting tree's or terrian.So overall i think this is a great game to play with friends i wouldn't reccomend this game to people who only play Solo i dont think you will enjoy this as much as other solo games but that's for you to choose.If you have any other personal questions just add me on steam or comment on my profile saying you want to know more indepth about the game and i will surely respond ASAP. Keep in mind im a college student and i have my hands full over with school and homework. But i will do my best to help any newcomers out!Your Best Oak
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Also it often feels like it's not always about skill but rather about luck. I can't complain too much about that however since it's good to have variation and such. To be honest the devolopers seem greedy as hell with a steep price on their game loot boxes and cosmetics being the only goal to work towards being purchasable in the marketplace and being expensive as hell in game. It's far from a finished game and should not be called ''full released'' yet.Finally i'd just like to say that i'm far from a skilled player but this game is not good enough for the price yet.

review: Bought this game as my friends play it. i have to say this game is the best Battleroyal game there is! Realistic Fun Fast paced. I LOVE IT! yes it has its issues but its what you expect with an early access game. if youre wanting a pvp based game BUY THIS! Playerunknown has created a masterpiece that can be expanded onto more into something truly remarkable! I hope one day Player unknowns creates an survival adaption to this game (like dayz) as i would buy it DAY1. if youre looking for a game you can sink hours into this is one of many games to get if youre into pvp games.Pros Very fun Realistic Has Most features from Others games but better Fresh.Cons There is quite a few bugs and glitches something we like to call paint mode where the houses havent loaded in correctly meaning youre stranded until it loads. Lagging issues meaning ive had to lower my settings Lack of character content. the odd crash now and then.Dont let the cons put you off from this game this is honestly a great game with such great potential! support devs like PlayerUnknown as he/she has listened to fans and created a game for all to enjoy! Grab IT SUPPORT THESE DEVS THAT MAKE GAMES FUN!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds dives you into a massive map from a plane with over 100+ players at the current stage of the game. You begin by going into the safe zone whilst the players load in during this time you will be generally calling out the pre order or being a snnnnaaakeee.The goal of the game is too survive as long as you can or ultimately become the winner winner chicken dinner you will begin by everyone in the game put into a plane and having to drop out over the field at your choice. Throughout the map there are weapons attachments first aid items and vehicles for your needs. A plane will also drop off elite items every time the radios decreases as well with no need for micro transactions to acquire just usually ends in a death pool. Each time you start a new game a radius around the map will appear with a large circle the goal is to stay within the main circle with every few minutes closing in the design of this is to keep players constantly aware that they need to maintain in the area of influence so their isn't just a stalemate across the map of people constantly camping.If you are an experienced royale player or new this type of gameplay it is quite a blast you can solo que duo or have up to a group of four others. Personally I feel the game is more fun with others however the options are there. Whether you are a careful player by sneaking into houses and taking people out or holding down T and blasting Ride of the Valkyries their is a lot of fun to be have. Their are a few bugs however weapons not being equipped stuck on doors or the rare crash however these are generally rare from my Experience. My system specs will be bellow and I currently have the game on High with AA at the lowest have no idea whats going on their but it tanks the frames (most likely MLAA). I am currently getting 70 80 FPS most times crashes down like hell though during the initial plane drop however.Patches are generally implemented weekly with improvements and extra additions such as hardcore mode soon to come. System specs 1080 GTXi7 700k 32 GB Ram

review: *Land in area that hopefully has guns ammo armor*Pick up guns ammo armor*Wait for enemy to appear*Continue waiting for enemy to appear*Continue to continue to wait for enemy to appear*Enemy appears from behind*Die*Leave game*Rinse and repreat til above cycle somehow turns into being funI bought this game cause it was suggested by a friend and had lots of good hype behind it. But after playing it it felt very repetitive. It was fun when you actually got to fight an enemy but for the most part that never happened to me. I would just land and then see no one for 10+ minutes. Also the game consistently lagged making the few fights you get into infuriating since you think you're shooting someone when in reality you've been dead for a couple of seconds. So unless this game is on a sale I would not recommend buying it unless you want to get paired up with Chinese people that you do not understand or people whose idea of communication is yelling profanities.

review: Okay I've been waiting for PUBG to fix their problems but the game is still unoptimized and filled with chinese hackers. I get above 60FPS and the game feels like you are playing on 20FPS. Like I use to have a bit of fun on this game before the abundance of hackers who literally will headshot you as soon as you leave the plane. They seriously dont hide the fact that they are hacking. PUBG releases updates that only break the game more with constant lag spikes glitched cars that will blow up as soon as you get in them the entirety of the parachute system is nothing less then cancer. The devs are not fixing this game. But fixing the game doesnt matter if you can throw out an update with more cosmetic items. Cosmetic items are good but why cant we get what we are asking for... better optimization less glitches/bugs region locking China seriously the usual NA server contains about 60 percent of hackers or atleast people with crazy pings. Oh and dont watch the killcams they are completely off (people shooting through walls etc etc) So in conclusion i cannot advise anyone to buy this broken game in its current state. Hope this helps anyone thinking about buying.

review: Battlegrounds is the most excellent battle royale game out there as I'm typing this. Here's what happens a hundred players drop from a plane on an island to scavenge for loot and fight to be the last man (or squad) standing. It's an exciting survival experience that blows the survival genre out of the water. Player Unknown's Battlegrounds is successful because it brings the excitement of survival games without the biggest faults. The game is based on separate shorter matches instead of semi permanent servers. Every player starts off every match on a plane parachuting to the ground with nothing but the clothes on their back. Just like a survival game scavenging is a heavy feature but there is a finite goal to acquire weapons and be the last man standing. You are still building your character from scratch it's just greatly accelerated from the standard survival game. The thrill of the hunt feeling is still there and even more concentrated. You don't lose hours worth of progress when you die you lose ten minutes of looting and exciting skirmishes. The process becomes purposeful constant fun instead of an arduous buildup broken up with small amounts of action. Player Unknown's Battlegrounds provides all of the fun exciting parts of the survival experience but removes the rest that drive people away.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v URT9cvllIm8

review: tl dr Luck over skill not worth the frustration Success depends too much on luck in so many aspects What loot you'll find or how the kill zone is moving is absolutly vital. It's not even a matter of skill. The player with the better equipment usually wins over the player with less valuable stuff in the first half of the match. (So if you are looking for a fair fight go look elsewhere.) Since this game rewards camping so much (which is vital in the second half of the match despite the need of moving from area to area) snipers are most of the time overpowered. If you did not manage to find a good scope and a decent rifle your chances of winning are very small. This produces many frustrating moments and eventually the lack of fun. And this is the main problem of PUBG Frustration gets bigger than fun. This is very sad beacuse PUGB has many good elements and you'll tend to come back to it for a quick round or two but then you get to feel it again... frustration is bigger than fun.What could make PUBG better in my opinion? Looting is an intrinsic part of the game but it would help to start with some equipment e.g. a fully loaded pistol and a backpack or/and to get rid of all scopes bigger then the x2 scope. This could work nicely.

review: well i bought this game again for steam as i enjoyed playing it on xbox 1 and yeah i know it has some issues on the console with loading in and u bouncing around on roof as you franticaly look for gun but still managed toget a few chicken dinner and a lot off laughs on way with freinds and enjoyed unlocking creates for clothes yeah nice THEN to find out that on pc not only do you get extra maps that are not relised on consol sweet thumbs up and then there is war mode an different game modes that are kinda like test servers like it too mixing it up a bit to find out you actually got to pay to unlock crates that i feel like 99.9 % are dam locked ones like really $2.50 per key severaly different types man feels like they taken away the only form off customisation from you which is kinda saddend me not impressed but if u dont mind the grind u might be lucky to get a rare box that ant locked !But still i do play it as it is still fun just not as much as i could be its a gem but she losing her shine to greed
