review: This game is a hit or miss. Sometimes you'll have games that make sense or you'll have game where there's aimbotters or something stupid happen. In my honest opinion this game is NOT worth the 30 dollars. Edit It's almost like this game got even worse after each update. The cheaters are becoming more frequent and every single time I land in densely populated areas it's always the cheater that comes up on top. Every game unless i'm lucky and someone kills or I kill the cheater from behind all you will hear are broken shots that somehow hit you from inside a building without any windows. I wish I knew how much bad this game was going to get . Would not recommend until they fix the game. Loot has been worse with each update too.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While reading other reviews I see a lot of people that are extremely unhappy with the state of the game. While the game is obviously frustrating and can lead to a lot of anger at times I've felt that the game is really good for what it is.Don't expect too much because it is an Early Access game that came upon an insane amount of success for such a small game studio. In my own personal experiences I've met hackers toxic people experienced poor game performance due to optimization and have died because of desync issues. Nevertheless I've had a ton of fun playing this game and I'm gonna keep having fun playing this game because I think it's fun as regardless of the issues that it has.

review: Couldn't hit a barn door from 10ft away if I tried. There is no matchmaking system and every game seems to be full of tryhards that can take 10 rounds in the back jump spin in the air and headshot you before landing.With no shooting range for recreational players to practice in the game is a blackhole to pour hours into looting only to be gunned down by the first player you encounter. Ultimately there are a lot more enjoyable ways to spend your time.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have changed review from a positive to a negative. This game is still unfinished all updates are simply adding more adverts and ways to make money such as "season passes" and loot crates with major game issues not being addressed (server performance hacking bugfixing etc).Hacking is slightly less prevalent than it has been in the past but still around there is no region locking meaning those looking to troll with hacks join whatever region they like there is no modding support as was promised before release and in general this appears to be a very shoddy development by a group who don't know what they're doing.However I can't claim I haven't got my money's worth literally more than that actually considering the money I have made off of crate sales but no I strongly recommend against this game it leaves a bad taste in your mouth after you realise how terribly developed it is and you will not make money off the crates anymore unless you're very lucky.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I would have recommended this game in the begining but not any more. The hackers and devs adding nothing but ways to make you pay them more money make this game bad.This game use to be good but now its just getting worse. They have begun focusing on making money. More and more crates show up with locks and now they have this pass thing going on that adds missions which would have been cool if you didnt need to pay to actually get anything from it. Also just look at thier "DLC". its a pass for somthing that should be free along with that this game seems to be focused on the steam market. Everything about this game is about getting cosmetics and crates to sell or buy they never really add new content.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is very fun. One of my favourite features is that you can add attachments to weapons unlike H1Z1 KOTK.Also I feel as if PUBG is more realistic which personally gets me on the edge of my seat where as H1Z1 has a m ore Arcade type feeling to it.One of my least favourite things about PUBG is that because its a relatively new release and in early access it doesnt have much to it other than trying to become last man standing. New rank feature on leaderboards and if you do end up becoming the last man standing the rewards are pretty pathetic (couple of hundred coins). Other than that its a great game. Dont be worrying about what I said negatively as this can be fix in further updates and as the game progresses.

review: Good battle royale game. Definitely good for people who don't like the cartoon style of fortnite and want something a little more "real". Real doesn't mean it's not funny sometimes though because you can screw around and goof off too. I'd buy this game again. I wouldn't pay any more than $20 for it though.EDIT I don't actually run into hackers all that often to be honest. I can usually go 1 3 games without running into one.As far as bugs/glitches go some of them are really f*ckin hilarious so I can't really complain that much.But the microtransactions with the keys and crates thing. Sh*tty. A better reward system would be nice.

The game runs smoothly untill i am near someone and i then get like 20 fps and cant kill anyone unless i have a shoutgun and blindly fire. I realize alot of people love this game and i know its still in early acsess but in my opinion its definitely not worth the money.

review: Still in Alpha...and my heart. This game might cause headaches if played improperly. One of the coolest concepts for a mod turned stand alone. If you didnt like the mods for it on the other games you have then I dont recomend it. This game is made by the same man who created King of the hill (H1Z1) and PlaNKBats mod for Arma. That being said if you enjoyed a thrilling adventure accross a large map pitted against ninety nine other people then you will enjoy this. The dev team consistently informs the community of impending updates and new additions. Also Mr.Green (the lead dev) is a very ambitious creative designer. Looking forward to this as a complete game but for now it's time to shoot some peeps.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The BR concept is the only thing going for this game. Game has been out for months and all we have recieved are sniper rifles microtransactions and apologizes on FB for server issues . Still needs reshade for the horrid graphics server desnyc is still a major problem unstable FPS drops constant UI crashes and for the love of god....vehicles.....don't even. Aimbots are starting to emerge on both AS and NA servers because they want to go cheap and use our famous outdated Battleeye. I really could rant on but after a couple of months playing PUBG here me out. Don't fall for the hype don't buy it don't play it just leave it be. Let some other complanies other than BlueHole create other BR concepts that actually function and aren't bugged and desnyc'd to the core. "But it's early access"........not going to hear it. Had enough of this 10% game. PU stop eating glue in the back of the class hire 3rd party (like everyone else) staff up and finish your job.

review: The game is fun the gunplay is great the format works. There are admittedly some issues with lag and probably desync and the game does crash more often than it should. Having said that I can't believe people are so negative about the game. It's a fun game does its job has offered some decent updates and the new map is a great addition (now I sometimes even play a solo round thanks to it) and there is another one coming later. The event pass thing I don't really understand but I have never even considered buying it and cannot see how that has anything to do with the functionality/quality of the game. It has no effect on gameplay. Furthermore the game has paid itself back and given another one for free by letting you sell the crates you get by just playing the game. And finally it's not even a full price game (which it definitely shouldn't be either). It's a decent game with some issues here and there. It's not perfect quality and I do hope they keep improving the game but I've got about 400h on it having loads of fun with my friends and it has paid itself back in the meanwhile. It is sometimes a bit difficult to understand the requirements people have with games. You see people with 2000+ h and yet they are unsatisfied? I can't see that as anything other than arrogance. TL DR Is it perfect? No it has some issues and crashes too often. Is it Fun? Yes. Is it worth the money? To me it is and actually it's already paid itself back through steam marketplace anyway.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: We've all wanted a standard game just battle royal. Collect things and survive as long as possable. other games protrayed this but never lived up to it's tittle like this game does. It's best to say that PUBG PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is a game that will most definetly reach new hieghts as time passes. The combat in this game is like any other FPS and the fact that you can switch between first and 3rd person in an instant makes the combat even more better! I love this game because I always wanted a game where you can simply jump in and survive (rather than colelct materials and build a base...because theirs not much combat going on). But this game is truely remarkable. It's a must get! I know their are other games out their like Fortnite which contributes the same genre but this game will always have a serious approach to the 'Battle Royal theme' and that's what keeps it standing. 9/10

review: Are you competitive?Do you like shooters?Do you like realism in games?Do you like slow paced strategic gameplay?Do you like working with friends in a tactical sense?If you answered yes to the questions above this game is for you!Although..Do you like early access hell?Do you like poor optimization as in stuttering and weird lag?Do you mind paying 30 dollars on a promise?Consider these questions as well!But to be honest I love playing this game. I do hate the lag but I'm just lucky I can get steady frames on low preset while theres people with better rigs than me lagging to death. This game is super fun with friends and is HIGHLY strategic and skill based. It's not your typical run and gun braindead simulator. It's slow but rewarding. You're definetely going to get tons of hours on this without even noticing. It's worth the 30 bucks in my opinion considering we have a boss team of developers working on this game. So what are you waiting for?? Just do it! Give Brendan Greene's work a chance!Heres to hoping that theres no major screw up along the way!

review: PROSIntense immersive and challenging game.The weapons feel great movement gameplay is deep (need a climbing animation tho jumping is crap).Good graphics overall.Newbies welcome unlike For Honor even new players can get to top 10. I played 11 rounds and finished 5 times in top 10 including one victory and one 2nd rank. Feels great.CONSToxic community.Collisions bugs.Running simulator (not enough vehicles).Crates too expensive and don't give enough loots ( more skins please).No story mode (would be great to train with the weapons).This game is dope if you like realistic shooters were one mistake leads to death very rewarding when you get out of desesperate situations. I love to surprise foes by moving quietly in their house and shotgun their face. Lots of memorable fights after only 11 rounds.8/10 (hopefully the game will get even better if the devs do the right thing). Please for the love of god add more content and less BS like h1z1
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: FIRST experience I landed quickly ran into a building upstairs and grabbed a shotgun. I heard footsteps below me so I shut the door and waited. The door opened and a body was perfectly in my crosshair BANG first kill in pubg has got me hooked! PEOPLE have been complaining about lag FPS and or hit registry...but I don't know why. I have played 5 matches and not experienced that at all. So the problem might be within those specific reviewers' CPU GPU specs and/or internet connection.OVERALL it is what it is A battle royale with average combat system with decent looking graphics. The timeframe seems spaced out to an average pace it isn't rushed nor does it feel slow. Getting into a match is pretty fast which for what this game is is pretty good. PRICE might be a bit high for early access but overall is worth it if you rationalize price to entertainment value. THIS game or a battle royale type should be in everyone's library. I haven't tried any other battle royale type games but this one will fill that void for a while.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's dusk and you feel your heart start beating faster and faster as you head towards the play area. The further you run without being shot at the faster your heart beats. Surrounded by gun fire in the distance you and your friends are moving quickly through a forest low on first aid low on boosts but still moving with a purpose. CLAP you get hit (and jumpscares you out of your shorts) CLAP CLAP two more land. You've been knocked out. Your friend comes to revive you 10 seconds 9 seconds 8 seconds CLAP CLAP CLAP he's knocked out too. Only one friend remains (the 2 rando's you had on your team dropped on their own and died outside of the play area). He quickly revives you and manages to drop 2 first aids. Your other friend bleeds out. You quickly gather your thoughts use one first aid and your last boost. 5 players remain. PEW PEW a silencer! Bullets hit the tree you have as cover a sigh of relief and then the play area moves. You have to go to them. Slowly you creep along a ridge tree hopping the best you can. PEW PEW PEW PEW shots are fired missing you and your friend. "NORTH EAST NORTH EAST I SEE ONE I SEE ONE!" Your girlfriend wakes up and smacks the back of your head for being so loud. You apologize. CLAP CLAP CLAP you drop one. KERPLOWWWW! You are dead. It was a KAR98K. "You got this." You encourage your friend. He peeks out. PEWshhhh. A bullet flys by his head but he caught a glimpse. The other guy rushes him. BANG! Your friend's S12K came in handy and drops him instantly. One more peek. One more chance to look. Your friend peeks. WINNER WINNER CHICKEN DINNER.

review: Well if you want to meet nice people from all around the world buy it and play it. There are also human snakes i dont know some kind of mutant players! It has different weather like rain! Its so fun to play when you're all soaking wet! Also there is always somebody looking for someone named Thomas. I think he's dead because this is taking too long and by now he's probably rotting somewhere at the island. Oh the island! I forgot to mention you start at an island invicible with all those players from around the Russia Germany and some London guys. There are also some French fries guys! After you all get together you get teleported on an airplane and fly your adventures ahead. After you land your invicibility ends and you are very fragile to punches arrows bullets grenades cars falls some crazy alien narrowing dome etc.So if you want to spend some nice time gaming and loosing your nerves playing solo or with your friends this is the way to go. Go PUBG! Ez.

review: It's no secret that in the field of "Battle Royale" games there aren't an overabundance of choices in the market but PUBG is at the top of the heap for sure. Sure the game has all the same game mechanics that have become standard 100 players parachute in a mad scramble for loot ensues and as the lethal circle of gas / energy closes in fights become more and more intense as the dwindling number of players kill each other for the chance to eat chicken dinner at the top of pile of vanquished enemies.But PUBG has something more while H1Z1 s fast paced neon splashed arcade style unreality is definitely a good time it lacks the depth to truly immerse you into the world they ve created. The rules of the game may be similar but at the heart PUBG is a much different experience one that draws you deeper into the well crafted reality it creates and in so doing provides some of the most intense heart pounding gameplay available.Like any early access game there are wrinkles that need smoothing out (the details of which you can read in the reviews surrounding this one I m sure) but the overall experience of the game is solid and the core gameplay is dead on. However in my 100+ hours of gameplay (at the time of this review) none impacted my game enough that I stopped having fun playing the game. This is a game in an early state but the developer is highly involved and updating regularly and the community of players is large passionate and highly vocal (a must have for a game that wants to stand the test of time. No one knows a game better than its die hard players).TLDR PUBG is immersive challenging high intensity fun. Ever in the current pre release state it s worth buying if you like skill intensive tactical shooters / battle royale games.

review: Amazing game truely is. I'm not a fan of battle royale type games but I love this one!Pros +Good graphics even on very low+massive games (100 I think is max)+Instant queue+Gets your heart pumping (sometimes with rage)+Very Fun solo or with others+Good bullet mechanics+Huge map+And moreCon Some bugs (Not game breaking though) Sometimes buildings don't load so you can see inside of them and see anyone clear as day and you can even shoot them (not sure it does any damage but it's there)Overall 9.5I'm sure there are some more negatives but I havn't encountered them yet. This game is amazing for it's price totally worth. It gets your adrenaline running and it's AWESOME. This game does require strategy so don't expect to run in gun blazing or even decide to camp. The zones get smaller and smaller forcing players into a smaller area so camping isn't really a good idea unless you have area to camp in (middle of safe zone). I was skeptical buying this game because I don't like Battle Royale game types but this definitely changed my mind. The game isn't for everyone but I really do enjoy it.

review: This game hits all the points for online shooter with friends or solo. There is no boring start where we all know who is using what gear no one knows what anyone will get until you hit the ground and start running. The gameplay is intense in the sense that you have no map saying HE IS RIGHT THERE! and you cannot necessarily see the guy about to ventilate your dome piece. If you enjoy the challenge of finding gear and outsmarting apponents through maneuver and engagement this is the game for you. I have seen more matches come to a close based on smoking apponents out (literally) and waiting until the right time to hit them for the win. A must have title for die hard shooter fans and a must try for new blood into the genre. Pros Great graphics Decent selection of weapons Large map (at least enough that it does not feel crowded in the beginning with 100 players) Regular effective updates Solid gameplay and reactive controls. The added Horns to the game 10/10 will charge across the bridge blairing the horn until shot to death again. Cons Graphics settings ( go ahead and put the grass and foliage as low as you can you may be in tall grass hidden with your 1080 to all ready to strike but billy with his dads outdated laptop sees your dumbass lying in an open field with nothing around you.) Weapons can be spotty with damage sometimes you will shoot someone once and drop them other times you will shoot the out of them and they will kill you. (it is alpha and the system is still being balanced) Vehicle mechanics are hilarious hit a buggy with your buggy and fly into the air sailing 5 map grid squars to plunge to your death 10/10 will do agian. Overall if you can get over the minor hangups which come with a well developed pre release game this is the game for you this is the game i stream and play the most with friends at the moment. We have had many hours of hilarious deaths and stressfull butt clenching wins. See you guys in the battle royale!

review: A lot of people are boo hooing BlueHole for 'breaking a promise' on microtransactions. They're entitled to their opinions but BlueHole's microtransactions don't affect anything. They give some flavor potential for those that want to spend some money on the potential for cool skins but you aren't forced to buy anything that would make you more efficient in game. To negatively review a game because you felt entitled to a "microtransaction free environment" is petty and childish. The addition of these transactions literally affects nothing at all. Another lot of people don't like third person. You should know up front that this game is 3P and that affects gameplay in a major way for people expecting to play it like a FPS. If you're in a house and concerned about someone peeking you use your ears position yourself intelligently listen for doors opening or footsteps. The game is amazingly fun and provides an incredible amount of entertainment. The devs are reasonably quick to fix issues. This is far and away the most I've ever played a pre release game and I have no intentions of dropping it from my play queue any time soon.

When you finally finished looting you get instantly killed by someone who camps your All that time looting and you don't get to use the weapons you got. 2. There is too many bugs and glitches in the game. The movement is sloppy and overall feels like a cheap game. This is not a friendly game to start on. There are many better players and if you want to win you have to grind hours just to get the feel of the game.

review: This game triggered me to the point of looking up my early access review where I recommend this game and deleting it / Here's why 1. The game is so janky! First I thought it was cuz of the early access but nope. It feels like you are playing against the game... There is this delay from when you press 'w' and the character actually starts running(No its not my keyboard I've a mechanical one). Vaulting animation takes way too much time and even jumping feels and looks odd in this game!2. Event Pass Really PUBG? You gonna charge 10$ for 4 weeks for a system you literally ripped right off fortnite in which it's got 10 weeks give the best skins but for limited amount of time AND ALSO CHARGE FOR YOUR SKINS! Either be overwatch where you get all skins free and obtainable by gameplay(Not keys) or be Fortnite and remove ing LOOTBOXES!3. Gameplay You know you have a problem when your mobile port gets better ping and overall runs better than the PC version! Console version is a joke and even on PC it crashes freezes to the point where you have to restart your PC!4. Connectivity I get 30ping on mobile playing PUBG but the pc version where I actually paid money to buy the game. Money they can use to get better servers runs like 5. Cheaters So many damn cheaters it frankly makes the game a joke! I was getting 2 cheaters a day until I decided to uninstall and haven't installed it since /Verdict Had a lot of potential when it was in early access but the moment they released this mess of a game it showed that the devs had no intentions of adding any sort of polish to the games mechanics and the drop in the player count shows.

review: Optimizing? nahAdding Event pass that costs money? YESFixing bugs? nah (ok maybe a bit)Adding skins and crates? YESYou can understand where this is going...I will list the pros and cons here + Really fun with friends you can get to really funny situations+ Realistic battle experience with recoil bullet drop shooting modes (single auto burst) bullet speeds and sounds (if the speed of the bullet is faster than sound you first feel the shot and then hear it)+ Kind of good graphics (on high settings)+ Exciting battle situations Lacks a lot of optimization (even on high end systems) A lot of bugs Cheaters (although I never seen one my self a lot of people did) More focus on in game transactions like cases and event pass than on fixing bugs and optimizingOverall the gameplay is very fun but the 30$ that you pay for this buggy game are not worth it. I think that the game just fell into the wrong hands and they are just ruining it. This game had so much potential. HAD.

review: This game is fun no doubt about that. But here is a solo guys review. I have no friends who play this so I always have to play with randoms which I don't mind doing apart from the fact I hardly ever get people with mics. Even when I do get someone with a mic it's a 50/50 chance they're either terrible or they're just there to troll. So in my opinion either play with friends or only play solo games. As for their matching system. It seems the devs of this game are just doing it for the money. I read they're working on climbing instead of the current bugs? The amount of Squad or Due games I have joined and only to be put by myself is stupid. It says it is a full game but I am solo on Squad? That's just stupid. Overall Good game have friends to play with or only play solo. As of Jul the game is Hitreg is awful the game is just super laggy so until they make this game more playable I do NOT recommend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Update3 Winner Winner Chicken Dinner too bad the game doesn't live up to its own memes...I am impressed at how bluehole is not capable of fixing years old issues and going further by adding new issues and making everything worse!PUBg have added 2 new feature to make money they now allow bots to voice spam announcements about bots in game and you have to cope with it since you cannot mute a particular teammate.The other feature is it takes roughly 20 minutes + ( https //i.imgur.com/WwdCj8g.jpg ) to find a FPP game on SA / NA servers during week day for battle royale.I've tried coming back to see if things would be better(played little over 2 weeks) but I guess its finally time to graduate from PUBg forever and move into a real game where the publishers and/or developers actually care about the game and not just releasing gambling crates to monetize it.And yes I did spend money on PUBg keys which I now regret doing so.Update2 Another very annoying issue found 05/14/2018 they are updating the game too frequently(every 2 days? maybe daily at times) and you have to close the game update to play again.Update Started playing again today 05/06/2018 after a long hiatus only to see the game not only did not improve but got worse... they added 2 of the featuers I've requested below to retain the matchmaking options and being able to select a map still its just not enough... They keep taking the game in the wrong direction... how sad it was a good game. Too many Asians that are unable to speak or understand English and insist on playing at South and Central/North America servers.Alright I am done with this game tired of getting teammates that are unable to speak or understand English every single game.As I can see you already lost 600k player base and it will continue to drop if u dont solve this issue!Because of the above my routine to play a single match was checking players name for things like xin qin xao bao too many numbers in name(for some reason Chinese and Vietnamese like to express their names with numbers) if those are found back to lobby and repeat. Usually takes around 10 tries to find a team with people who can actually speak and understand English.Downside is I lose more time finding a match with teammates that can communicate rather than playing the game which is a very bad experience. Server busy and reconnect required after every single game which is very annoying and sometimes u need to click reconnect several times for it to work or restart the lobby. For some reason it will some times change you from NA/SA to AS servers for no reason which is again very unpleasant. Match fails to ready up and requires you to restart the lobby to work again. Why does it need to reconnect every time after a match is beyond my understanding why not just keep the user connected at all times while they are playing and only disconnect them when AFK for longer than 5 minutes while not playing any match! No FPP mode on South and Central America server for DUO. No option to keep the last selected option for the next match for example if I am alone and was doing SQUAD/FPP I have to re select every single time. No option to select which map I wish to play. some times I want to practice a single map and it keeps rotating between both maps a very unwanted behavior. There is no ability to mute a specific team mate during game play there should be a mute button next to their name at the team list. Some times there are racist people or people playing music or that refuse to set their microphone to push to talk and keep making noises making it impossible to hear footsteps or have a pleasant experience in game. The list of issues goes on but these are the main points I want to see addressed before I can provide a positive feedback for this game.

review: Could be way better. As you know de synch is still an issue. Somehow you can put 3 shotgun shells into someones face and they can kill you in 1 punch. If you like to constantly replace your mouse keyboard and headphones from rage caused by game then this is the game for you. Updates come extremly slow and is on par with pokemon go as far as release schedule 2 years in we finally have trading. something the game was advertised to have from the begininng Not to mention that there is hackers who play regularly and get banned and they create a new acct continue cheating and transfer purchase to new acct. Vehicles react in abnormal ways. They motorcycle hits a pebble and pulls a full speed stoppie and kicks you off vehicle to die. Guns glitch causing ADS issues with terrible clipping from map causing your avatar to shake and glitch giving away your position. Would rather play cuisine royal because at least it is polished more graphically although game play is clunky still does not cause same rage as pubg.Not to mention the only way you can get customizable character clothing but at a cost of real money to open 90% of the loot boxes you recieve by purchasing boxes with earned in game currency. Maybe if there was an option to buy keyless boxes separated from premium boxes would be better but not even that is an option The biggest streamers for this game are as well over and fedup with this game and publicly denounce it. My guess is the next 3 updateas and the new map stated to be released winter this year will probably cost money like an expansion pack. In my best opinion you can tell that the company is trying to make as much money as the physically can without doing anything to earn it. Heres some new content that if you want access to you must complete all these quests and pay 9.99 for a month pass.One suggestion i would say to make in game change for the spawn situation. How about we air drop and for the first 2 5 minutes of game you can respawn randomly where there is no one currently looting. That way the long wait for a game to start isn't at odds with a very short game caused by poor loot or slow loading of the game. After that time has passed you no longer respawn and must restart a game.

review: This game's tag line should be YOLO! It's incredibly addictive and very fun as long as you don't take yourself too seriously. A great game to knock back a few beers and squad up with your friends to take out teams of random strangers in the quest to become #1. Oh and be sure to mock your fallen teammates mercilessly for doing something stupid (it's required in the terms of service). Gameplay is mostly intuitive FPS but watch some YouTube vids on controls if you're slow. I love this game and it provides hours of entertainment both active and camping. If you have a decent PC and good internet connection you shouldn't have a ton of problems with loading and lag. Potatoes need not apply.

review: I have no idea what they did to the game. According to leaderboards I'm in the top 2% on solo in NA servers. The ballistics changes don't account for the incredible decline in accuracy. I used to love this game. I used to be decent. Not amazing but pretty good. Ever since 1.0 I hit about 20% of the shots I used to and almost every game I'll be shooting at someone crosshair directly on them at 100m shoot 10 times and get 0 hits.If I just sucked at the game I'd be like okay I'm just not good. I suck at a lot of games. But before 1.0 guns felt relatively reliable. I knew that if I put my crosshair on my target and shot I'd hit them. Now all this game does is frustrate me.I don't know what they did but they 100% ing broke shooting in this game. Why anyone thought it was a good design decision to make guns never ever ever shoot where you aim them is lost on me.

review: At release I was all for this game. It was a good mixture of a survival game like Rust where you get straight to the fighting with very little dissapointment when you are killed you just start a new match. The highs are super great and the lows of losing are gotten over quickly. However the moderation of not only their official but also their community forums (Official and unofficial Discord/Subreddits) are extremely picky and choosey over who they ban or what they consider appropriate content.Next is the statements that PlayerUnknown makes himself. PU is extremely wishy washy on everything he says. Months ago he stated that there would not be ANY paid content until after the release of the game yet here we are with a paid crate system still in early access with a tournament that has a prize pool for a game that IS NOT RELEASED. PU has shown time and time again that he is not capable to be a voice for his own game on social media he makes a joke of himself through the tweets he makes. (picking fights with streamers Creating arbitrary rules for what is or is not bannable)Next off is their Code of Conduct for their game that only benifets streamers showing that BlueHole as a company only cares for the community that helps make them more money. The constant changing of bluehole and their stance on the game and community makes me want to warn all would be buyers to research the game and the company and make an educated decision before supporting a company that is clearly incapable of doing "Early Access Right" as so many people have stated.

review: Broken game! Fun at times but plagued with so many issues. The developers could a less about what the players think and feel which makes it one of the most unpleasant games out there.You'll get stuck on rocks trapped in your parachute killed behind cover (because ping) no region lock established drop rates suck (but are fair right?) and they still haven't fixed the team bug when a player quits the game before leaving the team gotta remake another team. Solid 3/5 as far as battle royale games go. Still better than FortNite. edit Since implementing the fix.pubg.com aspect of the game the developers have basically shouted back at the community. It would seem as though they are making an avid attempt at fixing the game's issues and bugs. Can't wait to see the changes as they roll out. COME ON REGION LOCKING!

review: What? I had just hit a new map and as soon as I got into it someone started pulling out and it took me a long time to get on the plane. There were only 21 people on the plane and everyone was very happy. A few others said that they immediately landed and went to fight. I jumped out of the hotel. If you search alone you're too fat. Then he hopped to pick up the face smashing airdrop which contained three sets of medical kits and AWM. I've never been so fat in all this time. I've seen four Class A's and lots of guns. And then jumped around happily running drugs. In the middle of the trip I met two people who had formed a team illegally. I killed one of them but I didn't think that the enemy in the single row still had a teammate. Then I died a terrible death. Then I have been watching want to see them play after all there are only about 10 individuals. After a couple of diversions I finally got to the final with three survivors left. As the last one or two of the poison circles narrowed my screen got stuck and then I was forced back to the main interface and showed a bunch of code. I didn't pay much attention. After all I didn't mind PUBG's BUG. As the system slowly loads a few large characters appear on my screen and you are blocked by STEAM. At the time I couldn't believe it trying to light the "retry" button. However nothing has changed it is still "you have been blocked by STEAM." At this time I surprised angry helpless. Click ESCC quit the game. Moments later an account alert appeared on my STEAM client. "PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS has permanently blocked you in BattlEye on behalf of game developers. " I couldn't believe it and after a moment of questioning I recalled that I didn't even use the plugin and the accelerator the little black box outside of the third party software. I logged off my STEAM account and re logged in but that's still the case. This missealed incident so that I lost all confidence in your company's game. Originally the game is a good game but your company in dealing with after sale issues in addition to the title really no other point can be recognized by the player. Goodbye PUBG accompanied me for a good time of the game. No longer see disorderly seal blue hole company. I am really sad and feel sorry for your company lost a lot of support for your players.

I have over a hundred hours and what do I have to show for it? Abso inglutely nothing. No clothes sperates me form aanother player who just psent a few bucks no level seperates me as this game has no progresion system. There is no reason to keep playing. They finally added a "new" mode which is just a smaller map. I wanted this game to be something that could replace my love for older battle royale games like the Day z mod. But sadly it letr me down. I have never and will NEVER put money into this absurdly money hungry company again and hope it burns in a ing fire for its practices of trying to monotize everything if it wasn't for the fact that this a digital copy i would of tossed it in the trash so no one else would have to deal with these toxic game devs. Until they fix the loot box system and add a reason to play the game and actually act like they care about maintaining a healthy player relationship with people who actually ing care about the game. IM done.

review: This game had potential however as soon as sales started to decline this game transitioned into "burn the consumer reap their wallets" kind of game. The new Event Pass is a shameless take on the far superior "Battle Pass" introduced by Fortnite to the Battle Royale genre. It would be fine if it was a decent offer with pleasing cosmetics and fulfilling rewards however half of the rewards are considered "Limited Time" and expire after the duration of the pass in hopes of you buying the crates. I do not and will not support these practices and will not support the game any further unless there is a drastic change in Bluehole Studios (PUBG Corporation.)

review: Product received for free. This game shaped the new and growing battle royale gametype the way we play games wont ever be the same. Instead of the comedic reviews I normally do I want to talk about the game as a whole and the way it was built. This game started as a mod for Arma 2 and Arma 3 similar to another similar popular mod by the name of DayZ. DayZ the modm and standalone early access game shaped the open world genre forever the vast gameplay was something Pubg wanted to replicate and they did it amazingly. The way Erangal is layed out is amazing the map easily gets into my top 10 favorite maps. The gunplay is also very fun and it makes for very tense moments. Speaking of being tense the game makes you feel stress like you have never felt it before the way the game makes you feel scared and tight is addicting and fun. The performance is ok at worst for me at least and the settings for me are high medium. The time and weather in this game is also very cool as the fog creates a more sneaky approach and the daytime giving you a couragous feeling(as of now the fog and weather features have been removed for development). The loot system is also very rewarding and fun to work with there are low risk low loot areas and there are high risk high loot areas. But the best feature in my opinion is the squad and duo feature. Out of the 100 hours I have put into this game I only have 2 in the solo mode the duo and squad modes create a lot of fun and memorable moments with friends and you can even make new friends through squads. The game also forces teamwork making you more strong as a team in the 4 vs 100 situations. Overall I think this is one of my favorite games at the moment and I dont see myself stopping there are problems like the hackers bugs server connections and other people who ruin the game *cough* CHINA *cough *cough*. But when you look at the game as a whole its hard to take it apart. Overall the game is great and im happy for the awesome memories my friends and I have with this game.... but seriously tho add region lock
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

(At least as realistic as they can be without overcomplicating the game) Hackers and bugs are constant problems as are random lag spikes. If you like to play for fun its a great game if you dont mind some issues here and there. There's also a pretty steep learning curve especially if you're new to shooters so bear that in mind too. Overall I think this game still has a lot of potential.

review: Edit I kept this game installed to play with friends and found that increasing your page file in windows has a huge impact on performance. Met one too many people with absent recoil and finally uninstalled today. There appears to be a trick where rapidly clicking your weapon in fully auto keeps the reticle on target and people are able to use mouse bindings to do ridiculous things like 50 clicks per click. I don't think this is against any terms but it definitely violates the spirit of any competitive game. It seems like this game isn't for casual players as it's riddled with try hards and cheaters. The only people who seem to be able to keep up with all of the changes in game mechanics are the people who play this religiously. Why bother taking the time to learn these mechanics when they get changed relatively quickly? Spent $20 on loot crate keys and got some of the worst skins you can muster. Resale value on most of the cosmetics was less than 10 cents. This game is so obviously a scam it's no wonder it has terrible reviews and the top streamers are glorified employees. OP I don't have the hours like some folks do but I did play in beta so there's that. I like the finalized graphics and optimization... That's about it. The only thing that increased the recidivism rate in this game were the loot crates you get from battle points and leveling up (because that's the only sign of progression you get beyond increasing your skill). Now in order to open the crates you need to spend $2.50 on a key for each one... You know.. To get a randomized item. This game went from being a "check it out and see if you like it" to a hard PASS. This game didn't do it first it didn't do it best and it won't do it last. The price per content ratio isn't proportionate. I really hope we can get some laws and regulations passed regarding loot crates in games that have an MSRP attached. BF2 "Sorry for our obvious pay to play/win system"PUBG "Hold my beer"

It's really a camping simulator with people that hear footsteps first just camping waiting for the other person to peek. Sure if you have the better aim you will win the fight but the odds are against you. review: I've played 266 hours on this game. I have given it a thumbs down but specifically due to the cheating. I must admit when I normally read about cheating I take it with a pinch of salt because whilst I know cheating goes on in many games a lot of moaning often seems to be down to a reluctance of many players to admit they have been outplayed an opponent played well or good old fashioned luck. However PUBG is different. There is so much cheating going on. Recently had someone exit a car still moving full speed (which should kill you) hop into the air turn and one shot kill me without it even being a headshot (M14). I was at full health lvl 2 vest and helmet and keeping a tree between us (pretty sure he should not have been able to see me). Replay showed him 100% health despite the full speed exit. In isolation maybe not an issue but it is so often. PUBG devs have banned well over a million players now in fact banned more players than games get to start with. Just a shame they cannot find a way to permanently ban players. So they are trying and I will perserve. Why?Well that is because the game itself is brilliant. For all its quirks it is very addictive and compelling. I am not particularly good at firefights and there are a lot of legit excellent players in the game so i would say I lose the majority of head to head firefights and cannot snipe for the life of me. However I am good at movement and planning so often arrive in the final 10 players through stealth observation etc. And I like that a lot. Others will prefer the 'kill 10 blaze of glory' approach. Not me (neither could i if I wanted to!). Each season I have a 40 50% top 10 ratio but my KD is usually 0.3. Only 2 wins but as far as gaming goes they were a real rush! One with 3 kills and One with 1 kill (the final one). Lots of luck on the last one final opponent sniped #3 and it turns out he was right next to me and when I rushed him he was holding his Kar98 so I nicked the win. I'd have had no chance otherwise but the game makes you use the skills you do have rather than the ones you wish you have.If they could do something about grass disapprearing at 150 yards that would be good too but the main thing is the cheaters. Without the cheaters it would be my #1 games. Others I like a lot are RB Siege Dishonoured Styx Thief 1/2/DS Insurgency 7DTD and the Long Dark.

review: I started playing this game back in November 2017 which was when the game really started to pick up steam and a lot of good changes were being made. While there are still many improvements to be made this game has come a long way since the beginning. If you have 3 friends and squad up there's nothing quite as rushing as making it to the end. Yes there are A LOT of fixes that need to happen but all things considered it's still a good game. The loot boxes are annoying and I wish PUBG corp would just make it so that you could just buy the crates separately from the free ones (since I now have 30+ unopened crates that I have NO intentions of purchasing keys for). There's the occassional hacker/aim botter but I'd say 4/5 times it's not the case. There's some other things too but all in all it's an enjoyable game. Fun 9/10Replayability 10/10 Tacticality 10/10Graphics 7/10Glitches 7/10Hackers 5/10Lootboxes 5/10Regular Updates 8/10If you want a game that's fun to play with friends and if the glitches don't bother you definitely pick this up. It is a good one that I'm hoping will continue to improve despite some recent decisions.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I would love to recommend this game but I just can't.Over time its gotten worse with hackers and optimisation that it's just essentially unplayable.I definitely got my moneys worth and enjoyed playing it but it's gotten to the point that I experience so much server lag that I can't play this game fairly against other players.I know it's not my computer or internet that is the issue considering I run it on SSD and have all current gen computer specs 1080ti and all that The death cams don't show accurate representations of how you actually died and they always look so ed up.I enjoyed this game but with more battle royales that are actually optimised and the DEV's actually update the game to be better instead of to be a cash grab this game just isn't worth buying anymore.

review: This game is no good. And maybe that's due to my own lack of investigation upfront. First of all it has you running around collecting anything decent to use against opponents for 20 minutes which comes down to being alone not seeing anyone for the most part. Running is really the major part of your time spent on PUBG along with opening doors and hitting 'i' to collect whatever is better then you're already wearing. And like groundhog day you get to do this over and over again. Or let me be more specific you collect stuff and then you die. at least for me that's what sums it up. Offcourse this is due to 99 5% of players being more skilled in this type of game then I am. Suggestions would be to have some kind of difficulty setting that allows you to be paired with evenly poor skilled people (with less rewards in terms of ranking I don't give a anyway about that). and adding more transportation options along the way so I don't feel like I've bought 'summer olympics' the stupid war like version.

review: Still don't understand why there aren't locked servers on here. Plenty of games do it and it would keep the players who shouldn't be on certain servers (ALL the asians playing on NA servers aka the cheaters) yes I understand there are ways around this but it's at least going to cut down on the t. Getting killed in 8 consecutive lobbies by players with #unkown names and full autod from across the map or insta headshotted really gets old. Battleye is trash. Pubg could easily afford a better anti cheating system.Edit Game has honestly gone downhill significantly. Cheaters galore again and waves of bans that affect innocent players. Company obviously caters to the Asian market ie scheduling maintenance every week during prime hours for everyone but the asian servers. Then theres still the simple fact that for some unknown reason asian players always have latency/desync issues that work in their favor regardless of the server they play on. I still pour hours into this game because it is enjoyable especially with friends but Pubgcorp have way too many issues to not be addressing them rather than pump out paid crates that require paid keys. I wish there was an option for a middle ground on recomendations as the game has a lot of fun to be had if you can wade through the issues

Infact the game has gotten worse.I am an ociana player and its stupid to think that i have to wait 15+ min just to get into a game that i have i high licklyhood of dying in strait away (due to the stupid lagg spikes and late load ins for loot) i know my internet is not the problem because i can play every other game on my comp with no problems (on highest settings as well).Instead of optomising the game the publishers think it is more important to put in advertising for their events and make small changes to the countdown timer (which was fine).Oh and their new anti cheat system? review: The gunplay is beyond stiff. Theres no real fluid to it you get cought on the edges of things all the time its EXTREMELY annoying. I mean Im not asking much interms of being more smooth it doesnt need to be buttery smooth like Doom or rigid yet smooth like Arma 3 I just dont want it to feel like im controlling a lego character. BTW all these reviews talking about the chinese problem its real. The problem is so bad I have played 8 matches total (i know thats low i refunded this.) 3 of those matches im pretty sure I was killed by a hacker. How else does one get headshot in a windowless bathroom and sprinting through an office building. Along with all these wonderful perks of playing with our PC brothers 7 000 miles away the lag makes everything super jumpy. Its hard to play an FPS when the other guy teleports behind you like Goku. Dont get me wrong I dont hate this game. I actually like it but the state it is in feels like a beta. No cheater detection (or punishment) slugish stiff gunplay and movement and one massive server everyone plays on (pfffffftt.... like they couldnt afford more servers). If they fix those things especially the gun play and movement Ill totally come back but for right now im gonna wait for another battle royale clone to come out that fixes this glaring issues.BTW fortnite sucks.

review: This game is fun and frustrating at the same time. The concept is great but the execution so far has been sub par. I've played for 200+ hours and have not really had the crashing issues many have experienced. My biggest complaints are my FPS has dropped 10 15 FPS on average the lack of region control and hackers. I could live with the FPS drop if I could at least play with someone who speaks my language. It seems likely that they might have also been banned a time or two with names like "56894565". The whole point of servers in dedicated regions is to be able to communicate with your squad mates. I hope in time some of these issues will be addressed. My system has plenty of horsepower so that isn't an issue.

review: This game is a good example of how the early access system is failing. While the developer makes huge amounts of money on a half finished product we are left with a buggy and hacker ridden mess. While Bluehole has made some progress on the game it is still full of problems. One of my biggest beefs with this game is the netcode it is one of the worst compared to today's other first person shooters. Hackers are also a big problem you can have to best loot and superior skill but it won't matter when another kid can use his mommy's credit card to buy hacks online. PUBG is also riddled with bugs and performance issues many of which Bluehole has to fix. The gameplay can sometimes be rewarding but it's not worth the struggle to get there.

review: Let's be fair this is a good game five million players can't be wrong but it's a long way from a finished game and like most released may never be. Adding microtransactions to a low on content but nearly fully priced work in progress game shows poor priorities and taking your customers for granted.Microtransactions don't make the game better. It doesn't pay for anything when they are already extremely successful. It takes up developer time for no benefit to the players. It's gating off content despite having very low customization options. When PlayerUnknown posted his justification for why they did it he gave no reasons beyond they were testing the system. He gave no benefits for the players. He gave no business needs "Hey guys we can't afford to run all these servers". The only benefit is their profit.

review: where to begin......It all started so good. the devs while new to the field were off to a good EARLY ACCESS start.then they got greedy. They released to 1.0 way before the game was ready to cash in for the holidays and for Xbox Early access(which i hear is a absolute cluster of failures)They still havent optimized the game all that well.still loaded with bugs that come and go....they fix one cause 2 more. fix one of the 2 new and bring back a old one.The maps (there is 2) are half and half finished. and they dont even make 90% of their assets they just buy them and copy and paste so you end up with a cluster of issues from that.and worst of all is the game is quite literally plauged with hackers. and they supposeddly keep trying new things but because of their lack of experience and lack of willingness to part with their money and hire devs who actually know what they are doing and not learning as they go all they have tried has been 100% ineffective. And the servers/ netcode is complete garbage. lag and desync is ridiculous and the game has a major "laggers advantage" if someone has a higher ping than you your ed as they will be able to shoot you even though you moved to cover because their pc hasnt caught up yet.Its mostly client sided and as we know or you should know that makes it easier for hackers and leads to more desync/lag issues. literally zero server side checks for pretty much anything.dont waste your money unless its on sale for $15 or less. this game will literally die overnight the same day a comptitent or AAA dev studio releases a battleroyale game.3/10 would not buy again. would actually take a refund if i could....BUT it is literally the only semi serious Battleroyale out at the moment soo.......take that with a grain of salt though. as fortnight's BR is already serious competition for it and that game is like 2D counter strike compaired to CSGO when it comes to competitive mechanics.

review: Had lots of time playing it (Since beta) and it felt just right to write a review because a lot of people are reviewing PUBG badly because they tend to compare it with other games (You know what I'm talking about) or give a bad review for an update or the pass and the list goes on and on...Truth is for me I haven't had so much fun in a game since my childhood. Turning on the mic and chatting with people both in game and on lobby makes me happy have got a lot of laughs and rememberable matches like that got a lot of friends that I met in game and make no mistake playing this game with friends is an absolute blast!Don't get me wrong of course there are problems but those will get solved in time. I have enjoyed every single minute of this game. If you are player who loves to laugh chat with friends and have a good time I recommend this game. If you are a go getter (a gamer that plays to win) then you are going to have a little trouble getting good maybe you'll get that stress from time to time (Or at least that's my case) and that'll only make you learn from your mistakes and then You'll get your winner winner chiken dinner!Get this game add me (or not your call) and like in real life Enjoy.

review: i do enjoy this game a lot but if you have a below average computer (anyhting lowere than a GTX 1040) you will not be able to run this game. the optimazation is not good. you have to have a good internet connection in order to run this game aswell. If you are running discord or anything else in the background your frames will be dropped and very low is your only option if that is even low enough for you. i recommend this game but i also reccomend a minimum Gtx 1050.

review: Really fun gameplay (rating 9/10) from really aweful devs (rating 2/10). Game is full of bugs even after full release. Weekly patches during prime NA playtime take all game servers down completely for hours and always get extended often creating as many bugs as the fix. I might look for more battle royale games like this in the future but I will do my best to avoid any games from these guys in the future.

review: 100% DO NOT RECOMMEND.In it's current state this game is total garbage. Which is sad to say considering how many hours I have into this game. It has its moments since Early Access where it has been great. This is not one of those moments.There is terrible lag and desync issues. You can pre aim a door way full auto a guy and still lose the gun fight when hes not even aimed up. This is due to him seeing you way before you see him. Lots of Chinese hackers and laggers in NA servers. This is common sense. They need to region lock the game. Not sure why this hasn't been done despite being requested over and over since the start.This isn't even touching the battle pass fiasco along with many other issues this game is currently facing. Do not buy this game until these incompetent devs fix their game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: המשחק הזה מגעיל בדיוק כמו השם היצירתי שלו.לעולם לא הייתי קונה את זה אלא אם כן הוא לא פותח על ידי ילד שיש לו סרטן.קניתי את זה כי החבר שלי היה מכריח אותי במשך שבוע שלה רק מבוזבז 2 של מרלבורו.גרפיקה מדהימה אופטימיזציה מזוויעה פיסיקות מחרידות.הערה למפתחים תודה על יצירת כמה תפוחי אדמה 3 בעולם המשחק הרוסי אתה יכול להתמודד עם אופטימיזציה במקום ליצור חסר תועלת על שם לעשות רווח. 13010/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has HUGE potential . It is very very fun and you can't be bored .Unfortunately it is not optimized properly gameplay is sluggish and laggy and counter intuitive . If the devs manage to smoothen out the gameplay fps it can be great . I played FPS for 18 years now i know what i am saying . Call of Duty BlackOps 4 has none of the above issues great FPS better graphics smooth gameplay and very intuitive .

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Amateur job with most focus on increasing income not the quality of the game.Too little too late.Chinese ruining EU games because we still don't have region lock. Got killed behind cover or someone shooting your position where you were 2 seconds ago and you die? CHINESE.Optimization is where it should have been a year ago. Better but still miles away from perfect. review: early access review for the current state of the game I will update it once the game is fully released. Pros Exciting gameplay Fast que times / 100 player matches instantly. Fun Squad based gameplay with 1 or 3 of your friends. ( or MM with strangers ) Good Sized map / easy to navigate. Simple but effective loot system. Unlimited replay value. Rewarding victories 1st &amp 3rd person modesCons Poorly optimized / FPS drops stutters Extremely CPU intensive w/ poor results Hit ditection is terrible at times ( most of the time it's sub par ) Desync ( Iv rarely experienced this but many others have ) Gameplay feels clunky at times especially where jumping is involved. Audio / Directional sound is awful / when it's raining on the map you can hear nothing else. Terrible community ( but this is just gaming in general in 2017 ) Developers banning people for exploiting bugs in early access Developers banning people for " stream snipping " Microtransactions in early access after the developer " promised " there wouldn't be any until the game was complete Decent amount of cheaters 1 hit kill HS punches ( like why lmao ? ) Melee weapons besides the pan are essentially useless Lack of weapons 5 are only obtainable through random crate drops on the map. Thumbs down but I won't say don't purchase the game it's still fun with all of its current problems but Buyer Beware.

review: I purchased pubg almost a year ago when it was still in early access. I was sure the devs would never deliver a finished game and gtfo with all the money they made. the countless bugs were part of the early access charm but I still had a lot of fun.the whole reward system was working great. no keys locks and no pay to get content. then 1.0 rolled out improvements were made and I got my hopes a little higher. until the past few months or so.more and more locked crates nuked the reward system. there is no point in using it anymore. sure you don't need this stuff to play the game but blue hole made a freaking built in casino out of it.fair enough... but at the same time there is little to no optimization coming the players' way. the "season pass" is the final nail in the coffin. without you can't really participate in any of the missions in a sensible way making you a second class gamer of some sort. this makes sense in a free to play game ...but not when you paid EUR 30 already.it was a really good ride up to this point. back in january I'd have given pubg a clear recommendation. but the devs prioritized money making over game optimization. tl dr no game optimizations built in casino system edit well me ...I'm still playing and bluehole seems to come our way. switched to recommended!

review: At first I praised and recommended this game but since its release I've slowly changed my tune.Sure the market is now over saturated with battle royale games with most borrowing elements from others and throwing originality out the window but PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS hasn't aged well in the short time that it's been released.The gameplay is fast paced and extremely enjoyable. The guns feel great and for the most part there are few titles that provide such an exhilirating rush as hunting other players while also being hunted.However PUBG Corp has not managed this game well.Despite all of the additions to this game it is still rife with bugs and glitches some even breaking the game. And there seems to be very little hope of them being addressed with the dev favoring new content over fixing older content.And yes the number of battle royale titles have spun out of of control but there are actually cheaper AND better battle royale games out there than PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS.It's still a very solid title if you want to play with your friends but you can do a lot better than this game if you're looking for the best battle royale experience.Until PUBG Corp steps up and takes responsibility for the problems plaguing their game I cannot recommend PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hello fellow consumers Ajit Pai reporting in. As we go through the process of recognizing whether we should add a cost for complaints against the FCC (As we see it as just given that we need to afford a new underground bunker) I would like to take the time from our heroic endeavour to talk about this game. While true I did find enjoyment with this game and truer still it can be fun at times it has lost its luster and has consigned itself to a rather dark hole given the recent plans the developers have initiated (keys more keys crates tickets). Along with a lack of credible updates and further still bugs all around I regret to inform the steam community that the FCC has now rescinded its support for this game. As they say friends are like snow if you pee on them they disappear. And this game and devs have certainly pee'd on its consumers one too many times. Remember trust the FCC for a better tomorrow. Ajit Pai
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Edit 2) Loads and loads of microtransaction gambling crap on a paid game remove them and i might come back one day. You went overboard with these microtransactions i cant support that.Edit1) after recent patch most of the things have been fixed. Server lag is minimal FPS doubled cheaters are banned. Changing negative to positive. Still lacks 1st person only hardcore mode but it has been confirmed to be added in future. Can i recommend this game at the current state? NO!Let just say the game has a lot of potential its a shame it ended up in the incopetent devs. They cash in milions and instead of fixing the game they are traveling on vacations. sighReasons Servers are cancer they made so much money and i dont see them investing in new servers.Takes several attempts to grab a weapon items open doors get in car people rubberbanding all over the place makes CQB a nightmare.Hit registration is off people can shoot you even when u got recently in cover because on their screen u are still outside of cover.Weapon balancing is crap also the game is basicaly who can unload whole mag into another person faster. Ever seen in another game where you unload 15 rounds with beretta to his back and he stays alive like nothing happened just to turn around and 1 shot you with a shotgun?I wont even go on on how unoptimized it is but hey its early access so ..And last but not least about 30% of playerbase are clearly using some kind of cheats and the devs are completely ignoring it and when u talk about the "cheating issue" on forums your post gets deleted. (just look up cheats for PUBG youtube is full of it sad)Coming from games like Arma3 Squad Insurgency 3rd person view abuse is a major issue. There are no hardcore servers with 1st person only. In this game if you dont use 3rd person you will always lose.Conclusion just stay with the bug free mod for Arma3 and save yourself some money and not support incopetent devs.I may revisit this review when majority of the issues get resolved. (if ever by the looks of it)

review: #RegionLockChinaAs a Chinese player I strongly hope that Bluehole can lock China in the future months. Of course the Chinese players will have their own CN server with the new beginning by Tencent.作为一名中国玩家 我希望蓝洞能在未来几个月内将PUBG锁区 当然 中国玩家仍旧有游玩PUBG的权利 他们会拥有腾讯的国服 The reason that I send this request is because the cheating of Chinese players is starting to affect my other games' experience. My friends and me were blamed even slandered as a cheater just because we are Chinese players. I believe the problems of PUBG are rising to the racial discrimination. Many of my compatriots bring the shame to us and they just use Steam as a launcher of PUBG DDDD之所以做出这个请求 是因为PUBG的外挂问题已经开始影响到我在其他游戏的游戏体验 仅仅因为我是一个中国玩家 我就要被侮辱甚至无故被污蔑成作弊者 我和我的朋友们在近几周遭遇了不少类似状况 我相信PUBG的外挂泛滥已经成为一个现象级问题 或者说 是一个现象级的种族歧视问题 我的部分同胞们对中国玩家这个群体造成了严重的抹黑行为 而他们之中的大部分人只是将Steam作为PUBG的启动器 It's not about the honour of Chinese. It's simply a Chinese player want to get his game experience back (not for PUBG only). I pay for the games just like most of you. There's no reason that I get a different experience. But Im not going to refute the accuse with any standpoints (if I have). Because I know if I am a foreigner I will do so.这无关中国民族的自尊 我也不认为一个游戏应该上升到这样的高度 这单纯是一个中国玩家想要找回他应得的游戏体验 就像绝大多数玩家一样 我是通过购买来获得游戏的 但我却没有得到我应有的游戏体验 我应该反驳那些攻击我的人吗 不 因为我清楚 如果我是他们 我也会这么做 作弊玩家给正常玩家造成了非常糟糕的游戏体验 就像愤怒的外国玩家对中国玩家们做的那样 If Bluehole is a responsible firm then it should start to consider about the region lock after the open beta of CN server.如果蓝洞是一个有责任感的游戏公司 那么它应该开始考虑锁区的问题了

review: Product received for free. I've put a lot of my free time into this game. Overall I have had many likes and dislikes about this game. Bad things being like optimization gun physics server laging. At first when this game came out even though running it on the lowest of the low (I have a AMD A10 7850k and a HD 7870) I had tons of fun with it. Then as the updates came out I saw it go into a downward spiral for me having server lag losing frames and having overpowered guns (the mini) But after all of that the test servers came out and I played those. I was amazed how far they came with those test servers. Everything felt so much better and it ran way better. I loved this game then I hated it and now I give this game tough love. Overall I recommend this game only if you have a decent computer that can run it.Update So after the rough months since this review I still have tough love for the game. I barely play it now because it just doesn't run to my liking at the moment (I am still with the same system as mentioned above but gonna be upgrading in about a month or two) I still get server lag optimization can still be better and overall devs just being weird and super just bleh. I do recommend though because of it being the most "realistic" in a way kind of battlegrounds. I've taken a liking to totally accurate battle royale which I've had a lot more fun with friends but I'd say PUBG is the game to go too for realism. I still of course recommend a not decent but powerful pc to run it. To be honest I'd also wait for it to actually become a 1.0 and not the t they publlshed as 1.0 because honestly it is still the same way even in beta with its tweaking. Over powered weaponry though has become more balanced. I do wish melee pistols and shotguns where more viable weapons but I am happy with the meta guns. I do have to mention the optimization again because come on it is made in the unreal engine how do you up performance in the unreal engine? Anyways I do recommend but if you don't want to grab a beta game just yet I'd say wait for majority and play the free totally accurate battle royale. Much love for this game though.Update 2 So as of this update I can and can't recommend this game. Steam neutral option? Anyways aside from that this game has seen improvement. Overall though I can't recommend it anymore. Since time has gone by (and as mentioned above I have gotten a much better PC) this game hasn't been as much fun for me. There's the hackers which I don't see often but once or twice every two days or so. The graphics are actually garbage to me compared to a game like cuisine royal. I have upgraded to a Ryzen 7 2700X 16 GB of RAM and lastly a 1070 ti from MSI. I do play in 1080p so that probably also explains why I can run this game on ultra with no stuttering. Though for people with worst PCs I don't know that side anymore and if it is terribly affected. Anyways I still do play this game but with how the devs are with their cash grab espeically with the ever oversaturated microtransactions. Like jesus christ I would love them to stop. I don't buy into them when I play games with them and I do believe that they still exist because of others who do buy into them. There is also the stupid season pass like CS GO's that they do for "special loot" or just stupid events that should be free and not bought through a pass. Overall though guns have good balance. So far (I've only replayed a handful) the net code has improved. I still hate the desert map because of just the huge size of it and the hilly terrain but their new jungle map I love with more tight quarters fighting and how dangerous situations can get. So as it stands I don't recommend this game anymore because battle royales such as simulator or cuisine are so much better and even free. I had so much more fun with my friends on batte royale simulator than PUBG. I will come back to this game because it is the only semi realistic battle royale that I can play. If a new battel royale comes out that goes for realism like PUBG though I'd switch to it.

review: I absolutely love this game but it's not with its drawbacks. If you don't know what the gameplay is you must be living under a rock but it's totally awesome. It's extremely repetitive with only three maps as of now but it has an ever expanding roster of weaponry and attachments which does give each game more variety. Sadly the cosmetics are even harder to get now and even though they are cosmetics there used to be a bit more of an incentive to do well but now that all crates require keys to open (and keys cost real money) it takes some of the fun out of it. A lot of people are talking about connectivity issues and crashes but I haven't experienced any of this since its 1.0 release. Performance and optimization could really use some work and I think a buff to graphics would help but these are relatively minor complaints and don't do much to affect the meat of the game. If the devs want to do something to make this game better take off the microtransactions and just let us have the crates we earn and add more variety to armor. Right now you get three levels 1 2 and 3 with one having the least armor three having the most pretty basic but I feel like they could add more detail here.While I have said more bad than good I still love this game and unless it tanks for some reason I won't stop playing it.

review: 1. Log on and join a game2. Land in a few unoccupied houses and loot for 5 minutes.3. The playing field gets smaller and you are forced to move closer to your foes as the "players alive" counter ticks closer and closer to a single digit4. Stalk towards a house with the doors wide open5. Get shot from out of nowhere6. Jump out of your skin7. Spill your drink over your keyboard8. Die9. Clean up keyboard and return to step 1All jokes aside this is a very fun game and I would recommend it but you will need a decent machine to play it as it is very unoptimized at this stage of development.I have an I5 4460 a GTX 960 8GB RAM and a normal HDD and I have to play on all low settings to get a decent 45 60fps.

review: It can be a fun game to play but it is far from a finished game. About a 1/10 chance of crashing during a game all the while the developers are pushing more and more microtransactions every update. They actually have a button in the menu to restart the lobby because the game bugs are so prominent. While the was released a while ago I would still call it in the beta phase.The game has an unnecessary learning curve to it. The is no tutorial in game you have to play in either ranked random matches or the small list of private matches (that you wait in lobby more than play). Each weapon has its own amount of bullet drop which is daunting trying to figure it out your first few games. The loot/vehicles/circle is procedurally randomized which makes for a new playthrough each time.The reward system is a cruel joke. You play the game to earn BP to buy crates (that inflate the cost for each one purchased in that week). You have a 50% of getting a locked crate that you cannot open without buying a key. Each type of locked crate has a separate type of key that costs $2.50 US. The other half of the crates you get you can open for a random piece of clothing or weapon skin. Most of the time you get duplicates of that you already have. Rather than get a useless piece of clothing (that I already own) I end up selling all my crates on the Steam Marketplace for a profit. That is the 2nd biggest plus for this game IMO is that I have made more money trading crates than I spent on this game.The biggest plus is having fun with friends on the rare occurrence the game doesn t crash for one of us. I plan on continuing to play mostly to play with my friends. I would not recommend for anyone just starting out themselves.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. This is an awesome game one of the best I have ever played but the hacking and teamkilling issue is getting to be to much. Playing squads without friends is not even worth it as you will most likely get players on the wrong region server. At best you cant communicate aside from marks and at worst they teamkill you for your items or for no reason at all. I have way to many clips recorded of teamkillers or hackers killing me unfortunitly almost all these players have been from parts of Asia or China.I obviously have nothing against asian or chinease people and I enjoy the global impact of this game but instead of bringing us together it is currently driving a divide between gamers from different countries and continents.Please region lock China or hell just region lock all players whatever fixes the issue and stops the hostility in this otherwise fun and cultrally diverse community of players
