review: Going into PUBG I really wanted to enjoy this game. Sadly PUBG falls short in several areas that mean I cannot honestly recommend this game. The first elephant in the room is the abundance of hackers server lag and the fact the game randomly decides to crash my PC when I attempt to close it or the game just freezes. While these are technical issues and can be solved with time the fundamental issues with PUBG will never be solved. Unlike other FPS series like Counter Strike Call of Duty and even older titles like Unreal Tournament PUBG is not an arena based game. There is no respawning in a game of PUBG. Games can take upwards of 15 minutes and very little of that is actually spent engaging in firefights with other players. Unlike arena games where you can engage enemy players without fear of dying due to the respawn mechanics PUBG punishes you for taking bad fights. However it is not a simulator in lieu of ArmA and attracts a totally different crowd. Ultimately this ends up with a gameplay experience that is essentially many many minutes of what can only be described as vapid emptiness as the player runs around trying to collect random spawning items and several seconds of firefights with other players. While the size of the map might sound exciting you quickly learn which spots spawn the best loot and the game quickly devolves into a point and drop game where you hope to get better gear than everyone else not get sniped from a location by a player you couldn't see or encountering screaming toddlers through voice chat. Gear in PUBG is totally unbalanced and many guns are outright useless practically all of the pistols and shotguns are worthless and later anything that isn't a automatic rifle or a sniper rifle. There is also periodic supply crates dropped around the map with the chance of containing extremely powerful weapons like the Arctic Warfare Magnum / AWP or M249. These two guns break the game and getting one is basically complete luck to be in the correct place get the supply drop and not get sniped from a player you couldn't see. Then there's the issue of the controls. WASD is your standard movement key but SHIFT makes you run C makes you crouch and Z sends you prone. This is all well and good but I'm left handed. This is then compounded by the issue that the map button is bound to M the complete opposite side of the keyboard where my hand will be perched. Then there's the put away weapon button bound to X. Whoever's idea it was to put this key in between crouch and prone two very useful tools in a firefight should probably reevaluate basic control mapping. There is nothing more frustrating than dying in a firefight because you pressed X when you meant to crouch or go prone. If you're counting how many keys PUBG is using we're currently at 9. TAB opens your inventory fair enough. Buttons 1 through 9 access your items but good luck actually figuring out which button does what because the game doesn't tell you anything. You can also scroll with the mousewheel so we're up to essentially 20 buttons. Left and right mouse button fire and zoom you in and out respectively. B changes your gun's mode from single burst or auto if it has it. Pressing shift while in zoom will make you hold your breath and steady your sight and finally V changes you from first person to third person while ALT allows you to look around.So that's 26 buttons. For those of us who aren't octopi or professional Starcraft players the constant need to dance around the keyboard especially if you're a leftie like me is incredibly uncomfortable. The game itself isn't overly pretty but don't worry it's another one of /those/ games where playing on higher graphics settings obscures your vision so turn everything down to potato settings for optimal gameplay. Really why.

review: This review won't change your opinion on buying the game but i still wanna say my critisism. The game is improving but still... problamatic it runs smoother since the release but it still doesn't run smooth on my not weak computer. Crashing also occurs from times to times around once a 2 hour playing seassion. The game is buggy not Bethesda release buggy but far from smooth. It also feels kind of cheap from bad sound design to wanky animation the game shows the fact that it was done by a very small group of people. But... How's the gameplay? It's fine... Although I have a lot of hours on the game it's less of a game for me and more of a platform for friends to talk over it doesnt need a lot of atention to have the peak expirience. My biggest complain on the gameplay is the very fast area reduction speed it's probably only me but I'll like it much more if the game would take it's time and let players kill eachother slowly. Overall the game lacks a lot of polish but is an enjoyable casual game.

Generally you make stupid decisions and get your guts stomped out. But in the times in between there are plenty of laughs and even more headscratching.

review: &gt PROS &lt &gt in squad with friends you get to dunk on people.&gt great assortment of weapons.&gt fun physics.&gt tense and adrenaline rush like gameplay.&gt Fog the fog map is just great for suprise attacks.&gt you are rewarded more for how skilled you are. &gt CONS &lt &gt solo is trash and boring &gt lag just the amount of lag is bad &gt buildings somtimes don't load in and you get stuck and are killed because of it ( i'm looking at you school)&gt cheaters are more rare to see however they are still annoying&gt desync (hit reg) &gt Meh? &lt &gt Cars in garages tend to glitch out but however once you get in them they pop out of the ground and work normally&gt some rare loot only spawns in a specific area&gt poor graphic optimization&gt muddy textures (dosen't bother me much) &gt TL DC&lt The game is only fun when you are playing with friends I would also wait for better optimization the game right now is some times unplayable but if you have a spare few dollars and friends get it it's fun and entertaining. DO NOT GET FOR SOLO PLAY ONLY THAT IS A ONE WAY TICKET TO RAGE TOWN &gt Update&lt The lack of updates and constant problems with the game. it has almost been a year and there are still problems with the core of the game plus the lack of engagement with certain moments of the game like the beginning and the end there is not much in the way creativity. i just shoot the guy and then a sniper shoots you in the head. yeah git gud" in all that stuff but i don't want to this is not dark souls where when you finally defeat a boss you are happy and excited and ready for more punishment. it is honestly draining to loss to win and to play. The game needs something new in the way of gameplay like a rpg or maybe a shield. somthing that game changing would be amazing but first deal with the present issues first like the hit reg and the server lag. these are the only two ones that come to mind when they need to be dealt with immediately

review: This game was pretty fun when it was still in Early Access. It was accepted that the game was flawed and part of the fun and charm was that you would regularly encounter a bug the results of which ranged from frustrating to highly amusing. Then the game launched officially but the bugs were still there. Okay no big deal most games ship with known bugs and in the internet era these can be patched. So you wait until the first patch comes out. And then the next patch. And the one after that. Increasingly these patches do little to improve the gameplay experience. Hacking would still be pervasive rubber banding and lagging still a major issue your sights would clearly be centered on a target but you instead shoot the window sill. Meanwhile the new content being added to the game introduces things that seemingly no one asked for pay to open loot crates an emote system (???) then eventually new game styles and maps. But the original issues still persist so now you have new and exciting ways to experience bugs and suffer unoptimized gameplay. It became quite apparent that the focus of the developer was to encourage micro transactions with little regard for stabilization or optimization to the actual game. Understandably those things cost money and take time and are therefore kicked to the bottom of the priority list while emulating Fortnite has suddenly become the top concern. But it's too late. Fortnite has already eaten PUBG's lunch and PUBG is more concerned with legal disputes than trying to make the better game. It's a shame. I used to have a lot of fun playing this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I ve put many hours into this game since before release and it had a lot of potential but don t buy it. PUBG Corp has killed this game by continuously ignoring community feedback on core game issues such as desync server issues vehicle bugs etc. Instead of spending any resources to improve the gaming experience PUBG Corp has relentlessly pushed out untested patches that have made the gameplay experience worse than it has ever been before. In addition to these patches further breaking the game PUBG Corp has also consistently pushed out an absurd amount of purchasable cosmetic content indcluding the recent event pass. The event pass missions are broken and rewards that players have already paid for are often unable to be redeemed despite accomplishing the mission objectives. PUBG Corp also has continuously pushed out crates that can only be unlocked by purchasing keys. Last year with cost and taxes factored out PUBG Corp made $750 million and they still refuse to dedicate resources to fix the game. To put that into perspective it costs $450 million to carry out an entire space shuttle mission and PUBG Corp will not spend the money needed in order to deliver a game experience that anyone would consider acceptable in 2018. I love the idea of this game but greed and incompetence have completely destroyed what it could have been. Save your money on this one and wait for an inevitable release of a AAA title that will deliver a good game experience with a similar concept.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: ok i played it a bit now.Meh ealry game lag &gt can't fight for a lot of players need to fix it (tip don't loot with tab early game it's slower at least for me). since new update fights doesn't feel the same seems like you sometimes need a ton of bullets to kill someone. map might be a bit big (especially the new one) &gt add players i feel like 200 could fit easily in a game. still a lot of bugs to resolve (cars bump vaulting) one thing that annoys me when you loot if you are full you can't remove accesories of weapons even if you try to put them on the ground make you loose time maybe they can do something about it. Game still crash sometimes but most of the time i can reconnect and continue playing.Yay Best fps game i ever played (my opinion) not talking about story line games tho. BR gamemode is entertaining this is next step gaming it's not just a trend. They keep adding content even if they should work on fixing issues first this will keep the game from dying and i doubt it will stop so no you are not wasting your money. Zone is well balanced keep pushing you but not too much. Different situations all the time.Conclusion this is my favourite game but they really need to work on servers and they surely will they showed us that they listen to us it take some time but it should happen give them a chance ) . (1000 euro compo and it runs really fine (without the lags) i play on lowest graphics tho but by choice not for perfomences). I recommand this game but will put this in negatives because they need to know that they really have to work on servers first.

review: More often than not you're gonna end up with people that you can't understand a word of. For this game you want to play with friends so that you have better communication which for this game is a very key factor in order to achive victories. Plus you know that your friends won't intentionally kill you as you'll sometimes find team killers that'll take all your stuff and then try to kill the others leaving him/her the last one standing. One game I had included a team killer that I couldn't understand a word of except for and I quote " YOUR MOTHER' to which he than killed another member of our team while driving a motorcycle than just did whatever he pleased till he died in the game. Don't depend on the report feature too much either because sure you can report a teamkiller. you can't report multiple team killers that were on the same team as you and planned to do it for giggles. Another game I had involved someone I could understand but didn't like it when I told him that I wasn't gonna use the 'push to talk' feature to that he moved over to my spot than he shot me till I was downed. He then tells me after I asked "Why did you shoot me?" to which he responds 'Arrogant s deserve to die' After he left me a friendly team member of ours brought me back up but was then... you guessed it shot down by the same guy who shot me then tried to kill me in game. Before he could kill me I shot him down than brought up my other team mate. I offered to help him back up if he was willing to put up with me not using the 'push to talk' feature as I was willing to put up with him instead he retorts before dying in a lame man's terms " off." All that just because I said 'no' to using a feature in the game. Such paper thin skin he had. I was only wanting to play the game and have fun just like the person who tried to help me but if I or anyone that doesn't like to use the push to talk feature bothers you or that guy who shot both me and my buddy down so much... then we might wanna include a mute feature as well that other players can use on those they don't want to hear from an easy fix if you ask me. Either that or they can just deal with it and not shoot at their own team mates and insult them. So while yes I did commit one act of team killing had I not shot him down he would of killed both me and my friend in game not very sporting if you ask me. So if I happen to be banned for a bit because of that one team kill I did at least allow me to show you pictures of the guy attempting to team kill both me and a friendly. I looked over the game play footage I locked it in my replays and I have the photos to prove my case. I want to see this game improve not just in gameplay but also in match making as it seems that the player is gonna likely be hearing a lot of other languages that he/she can't understand as well as have possible issues with those that'll team kill her/him for fun then take whatever he/she had on their person. Only way to avoid both issues is to play solo or with friends. In terms of graphics they're pretty good but not too important as for the gun play you have quite a selection and a lot of weapon upgrades that can batter fit your playstyle though I do feel that maybe it needs a few more guns in both of it's maps. As for melee weapons where's my fireman's ax? Where are the wooden bats with nails hammered into them? Why can't you kick anyone to get some distance or to push down the stairs? Where are the knives to stab people in the back with? There are so many melee weapons that could easily be in this game yet are no where to be found. Another feature that should be included are the maps actually having a day and night cycle. Can you imagine fighting in the desert at night? or in an open field at dawn? That would be freaking sweet. On note of the BP system... it's there... but I don't see much use in it if it's only gonna let you get clothes or for an outrageously high price of 3000 BP... change your appearence instead of being able to let you change your person's appearence for less or even free. This game could also use more game modes as well like capture the flag or something other battle royale. Hell I'd even want to play against some bots if they ever decide to have them be included. Smart bots that'll be organized and make quick work of you if you're careless. It also wouldn't be too bad if we got a new island to explore one made of ice and snow or maybe on a big jungle island with all sorts of tribal looking camps and hutts as well as a volcano that's dormant but if one falls in or gets too deep they roast alive inside of it. There's just so much that can be done for this game to make it better but all it has right now are two maps that you can't decide between as it's randomized some hackers team killers and a reporting system that really needs an update so that you can get multiple people at once for incase you end up having to deal with two or sometimes even three people that all broke the rules at somepoint during the game you had with them. The game can be fun but more so when you play with friends or by yourself not so much with randoms that you probably won't understand a word of anyways.I don't hate this game but I don't love it either. It needs work. On another side note for the report system let us be able to type in the specifics as well just so we can make detailed reports of what happened as well as being able to send both pictures and picturs that we can take as we looked over the game where we got team killed or suspected a hacker or two.Update It really does pain me to say this but with the massive lag issues the number of cheaters that plague this game as well as the net code being an overall hot mess and grief as much as I want to enjoy this game the problems it has from when I first played this game only grew as time went on. The makers of the game need to stop thinking about what sells for a moment and focus on trying to listen and fix this game so that it's more rewarding and more enjoyable to play. Region locking needs to be an option the idea of the BP system needs to be reworked entirely to where once you have certian bits of clothing you keep them they are off the list of collectables for the players to obtain. The net code needs a lot of work as players in the game still fall/jump/walk/run/drive/swim through walls. The parachutes can get stuck in nonsensical ways in the air or between a tree or two that isn't even touching it and so much more that really hurts this game's chances of being able to become a success. Sure it may of started out okay for a while but wow did this game not age well in the few years it's been around. When I first saw it I could understand why it was in early access at the time but if it still has so many glaring issues even when out of early access then I'm sorry guys but this is an undercooked game that needs more time in the oven. It needs more of the company's attention and the company itself needs to spend their money on FIXING the game not marketing it.

review: This game is bad. From a technological standpoint it's buggy glitchy unpolished and unoptimized.From a gameplay standpoint it's a whole lot worse.To put it simply this game does not reward skillful play. In fact it punishes you for actually playing the game. There is almost no reason to actually fight other players. You are rewarded with in game currency for doing so but the only thing it can be spent on is opportunites to spend real money. The only other bonus you get is the chance to loot their bodies. By the time you actually kill another player there's a good chance you've already got good equipment so the benefits you earn from killing other players becomes so miniscule that there's really no reason to pick a fight and risk dying. If you want to win hide in a bush and don't move.You could put me in a 100 player match with 20 of the world's best PUBG players and there's a good chance I would make it to the top 20 because I can just camp in a bush all game. That's not strategic. That's not smart. That's not fun. That's not fair. That's cheap. This is coming from someone who has won this way. That win was not fun. In fact I felt bad for the other player. I've lost a lot of interest in playing the game now that I know actually playing the game is a lost cause and the #1 easiest way to win is to literally not play the game.The developers have been trying to make this game an e sport. This is beyond stupid. This game has an outrageous amount of RNG. The plane spawn location is random plane flight path is random loot spawn location is random vehicle spawn location is random playzone location is random redzone location is random ect. ect.. Not only that but when prize money is offered every single player will be camping in bushes. Why would anyone risk dying when real life money is on the line? PUBG as an e sport will never work.The 1.0 release of this game is in a practically unplayable state. Unbelievably unfinished. Don't buy this game no matter what. Go outside and hit yourself over the head with a rock 50 times it's more fun and you'll at least get one kill before dying.

review: EDIT_____________________Update nearly a year on I have so many hours on this and I have no idea why what a complete pile of buggy laggy filled with Russians on their dial up net and 5 fps who some how have a major advantage!! Got to rank 76 across all EU servers with over 2million active eu players at the time after they banned a ton of players for a small period it was fantastic but it's back to being an utter pile of Original_____________Will you fix this ing game! fpp has constant mini stutters every few minutes and at the worst times ie open door freeze DEAD. What's the point of a quick draw mag if pulling my gun out and hitting fire means it doesn't fire because I pressed fire before it was fully out. The start lag is unbearable and the game is clearly catered for 3rd world s from the likes of Uzbekistan who can't run 10 fps but can see you through every unrendered ing building. Laying in the grass is ing pointless because although I can't see while im laid in it it's not loaded for any other over 15 feet away and I stand out like a ing forest in the sahara desert. When other than in the epicentre of Hurricane Katrina has the rain ever been this ing loud? I find myself waking up my entire village trying to talk to my team m8s on discord due to the sheer volume of little droplets of chinese men smashing ing gongs! The rain is so ing loud that after a single game I have a sore throat from screaming instructions to said team m8s maybe this is infact how the singer Adele lost her voice and was infact nothing to do with a trio of concerts but a single game of pubg in the rain. Parachuting why is it that you place me 3 foot above the ground and then feel the need to fling me 40 ing feet across the map and to half HP? and why when given the option to cut the cord does it take like 12 seconds? Am I cutting through rope or a chain for anchoring a cargo ships? The zone why O why am I forever chasing or rather being chased by what reminds me of the smoke monster from that shity program Lost? and why do the zones times decrease so much faster nearer the end! in fact scratch that the starts fine and the ends fine but around the middle where you decide to zone at the other end of the ing map with only a minute to go is the one that really cripples me every pigging game... All that aside I love this game but I also hate it more than I hate these new age gender nuetral freaks!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I only have about 329 hours of playtime so take my review w/a grain of salt. I've been playing FPS games since the Goldeneye era (N64) and everything in between since. I think my opinion is worth SOMETHING so I'll tell you what I think about the game. If you dont want to read the review go to the TL DR section.**My PC Setup**Ryzen 1700 3.8GTX 1060 6GB OCed16gb Ram 2933144hz Asus Monitor 148 GB SSD1TB WD HDDetc etc For starters getting into a game takes forever. It's the main reason I dont hot drop. I hate sitting in the lobby for 30 secs/min just to get into the plane. Not to mention even when I do hotdrop and land next to somebody they somehow ALWAYS find a gun while I'm still trying to pick up a weapon but cant cause the servers suck. Anyone else land next to somebody and your sitting there right clicking on a weapon but you're just not picking it up? WTF is that t?Aside from that Erangel (the better of the two maps IMO) doesnt get rotated enough between Miramar (map sucks). They USE to have a feature where you could select between the two maps and I for one would always choose Erangel Miramar NEVER got played by me when I had the option to select what map I wanted to play on. Now with the latest patch they FORCE you into playing that crap map. Wtf Blueballs?! First you take away our rain fog etc Now this? I should have the option to play whatever map I want to play. Sanhok breathed some life into the game for me when it released as I felt that Erangel/Miramar just wasnt my playstyle. I prefer fast paced shooters and not running simulators. Even w/Sanhok out I can really only stomach about 2/3 games before I rage and play Paladins. The Dsync is terrible hackers are still rampant(albeit not as bad pre 1.0) physics still suck and not to mention I have 12 crates I cant open because they're locked behind a ing paywall. As it stands I'm currently downloading IoN and if that game plays better than this mess I'll uninstall this game and possibly never play it. The game has potential for sure but I truly doubt the devs even notice it. They're too busy lining their pockets w/ $$ instead of fixing their broken game. The only time I have fun is when I'm playing w/friends. Playing this game solo is boring as Oh I almost forgot. Playing for BP in this game is a joke. Cause when you have enough to get a crate you know what you get? Copies of you already have or a crate that needs a key to be unlocked. that t. TL DRPros Good weapon mechanicsFairly RealisticCars you can DriveVOIPCons DsyncUn Optimized GraphicsFPS Drops galore when dropping in popular cities/townsKillcams suckLeveling system is garbageLoot cratesBrandon GreeneNo Region lockNOT E Sport readyWould NOT recommend this game in it's current state.

review: so ive had this game for 5x longer so what I honestly think is that the game is hard and is not for the little cod kids or people who mostly enjoy arcade shooters like fortnite but this game actually has recoil bullet drop leading and more of a tactical play style so you have to take notice of your surroundings.Hackers needs to be pointed out yes is really bad and it really is getting aimbotted from some dude with a username like Q2657606 which could be their QQ id (Chinese Platform) it obvisously isn't fun and is really annoying and frustrating but it really can't be helped.Gameplay is alright alot of running and driving the zone is something to take note of like how long you have till the next zone and the stages of damage each zone takes like the final 2 pratically can one shot you so BE careful ive died from it too many times.The gunplay is my turn off it takes alot of time to get used to THEY need to add a trainning groud like Playground LTM in fortnite to practice otherwise you will most likely get slaughtered by better players I would suggest tap firing or in small bursts at first otherwise you will have a hard time.FPS is the downer the game runs fine for me with a GTX 1060 with over 60fps at high to ultra 1080p so atleast a GTX 1050ti would do but idk about AMD i dont own one but maybe rx570 and 580 will do.Over all i recommend to more hardcore gamers who like a challenge and more tactical approach to the Battle Royale Genre this game always gets me coming back so have a shot at it see if you enjoy it! D

review: A brilliant game idea which has been immense at times. Now i play it when my day has been too good and i want to lower my mood slightly. A few questions i have to ask the dev's who seem to have abandoned thier game Why are there so few variants of weaponry? i mean seriously give us some variety...No i dont mean gimmick weapons like the crossbow. Struggling with idea's? MTar21 XM8 MP5 Lee Enfield Mosin Nagant Steyr Scout Desert Eagle M60E4 P90 Scorpion AK102 Dragonov SVD L85A2 FN FAL G36C Bison PDW AA12 Spas 12 USP40 Five Seven Undermounted Launcher. Just to throw a few out there... Maybe even the AN 94... Or a riot shield? (Could work on duo's/Squad's?)Some new armour variants? How about some leg/arm armour? Region lock China!!! i'm yet to meet one not hacking. Give us the option to choose the map we want to play instead of forcing that god awful excuse of a map Miramar down our throats. It's absolute S**t unless you land in Peado or whatever that first time unity map designer place is called. Add some additional weapon attachments! or atleast variants of the existing ones? Mix it up abit! Melee Well. If that's what you call it. How about some structured monthly Quarterly &amp maybe even a weekly content patch? Maybe an urban map? 4 5x the size of Po i?For the love of god fix the death cam It is absolutely useless. Seriously why did you remove the map weather variants? If people have pleb PC's and struggle with fog map's and they're the legal age to play this game then the problem is with them not your game...Don't pander to them and remove everything.Oh and if you are still considering buying this benjamin button of a game Please dont get on a bike and ride shotgun. You'll experience what i'd imagine it feels like to OD on crack whilst hurtling down the motorway. Seriously Just roll out monthly content patches get some new maps on the go &amp stop pandering to console players Follow the 7 Days to Die model Run the PC version several patches ahead and let the Console players catch up if/when the console can run it. Since the game is headed in the wrong direction in my opinion i'm going to have to not recommend this game at the moment. here's to hoping you turn it around...

review: I've noticed a lot of negative reviews towards this game as of lately so I thought I'd give my two cents. I've played battle royale since the arma 3 mod was initially released played h1z1 battle royale the culling etc. And I can say with complete confidence that this is the best battle royale game I have ever played. It's not perfect by any means I'd be foolish to say that. But the game is slowly progressing in the right direction. From when the game was first released on steam compared to now its almost a completely different game. And I mean that in a positive way the newest update has adjusted a lot of issues among the stability of the game the region issues and the weapons in the game. As the m416 was easily the dominant and preferred choice overall which made the game lack weapon variety. It just outmatched most weapons. But now thats not so much the case. This game will change over the course of time it will be tweaked hackers will be banned things will be added bugs will be fixed and eventually it will reach its peak. This game has gotten tons of backlash and I believe its due to the astronomical amount of players that play it. I don't think that the devs were expecting that large of an audience that quickly and obviously that would cause lots of server issues and of course hacking. Hackers are an issue and they need to focus on that before adding anything. And thats my only issue with the game why would we want new maps and new weapons if hackers are making the game unbalanced and unfair? Think about it you join a game with 99 other players what do you think the odds are of running into at least one hacker? Pretty high. Other than that this game has been a blast and I still currently play it very often. It's very competitive and has a large learning curve. Each weapon has a unique feel and different intensities of recoil. It's not an "easy" game. And thats what I like about it. I feel like there is always something for me to do something to work on weapons to master new playstyles to try. Its an amazing game for what it is and I don't feel like it deserves most of the negativity its been receiving. I would highly recommend this game.

review: I had written a pretty positive review however my mind about this game changed drastrically recently. All in all the devs do not seem to care about the quality of the game and did not fix any major bugs since release. The engine controls and performance is still the same for me pretty good. The thing is this game not only has substantial netcode/server/hit rate/region issues but the devs rather focus on bringing new skins behind a paywall with rng involved to cash even more while they seem to not invest any money into this game but they even want to go into eSports with it. Recently the game is almost unplayable due to ppl who are abusing the server regions or are simply lagswitching and even the almost useless deathcams are clearly showing the rediculous lags. There wont be the region lock so many ppl are shouting for they wont fix any of the netcode related issues cus in my honest opinion the devs are just trying to milk the game as long as it is possible and are just way to incompetent or lazy to fix game breaking issues. And finally even the sound engine seem to bug out extremely hard lately. Maybe its due to the netcode again or they just f**ked up in the last changes but ppl tend to just sprint next to me and i did not hear anything. And neither my headset nor my settings are the problem here. And if they are every other game like cs go and rbss seem to work fine with my setup. TL DR Don't get fooled by eSports PR or shiny skins. This game is a hopefully soon disappearing pile of steaming garbage that is nowhere near eSports ready. It is a laggy buggy and bad designed never finished alpha state cash grab disaster. Overhyped to the max. Save your money for upcoming titles and wait for the definetly coming replacement of this game that will hopefully be developed by a company that has more in mind than fast money.

review: PubG is unlike any other game I've played. While there are certainly some flaws and performance issues it's so refreshing to have a game that offers a truly unique experience every time I jump into it and it has something to offer ALL play styles. The Battle Royale forumula is the hottest trend in gaming right now largely because of PubG but there is much more to this game than that. It allows you to play solo or with a partner or with a squad of four all in either first or third person mode. This flexibility keeps the game fresh since I can chill and relax in a solo mission with my morning coffee taking my time to sneak up on people with silenced weapons. Or I can jump into a duo mission with my friend and discuss coordinated tactics and maybe even join a larger squad that simply wants to jump the hot zone guns blazing.THE GOOD The graphics are amazing pure and simple. The two primary maps are huge and you will play hundreds of hours and still discover interesting little areas. The player models and textures are nice as well and in my opinion very realistic. The pacing of the game is nice as well. If you are fortunate enough to win the entire Battle Royale it is usually done in about a half hour though it may seem like more time has passed because you will have done so many different things during that time. THE BAD While many gun aficionados may appreciate the efforts gone into making guns and their actions more realistic there is a strong learning curve for anyone new to the game. Having played other shooters like CS GO which are much more simplistic it has taken me a long time to start adjusting to severe bullet drop firing rate gun attachments ammo types etc. New players may find that it takes several games before they get their first kill. As of right now there is still no practice range for players to try out the guns are "git gud" but it is hopefully in the works. One other "meh" factor is more cosmetic and that is the player starting areas just before each match. The lobby is a bit wonky at times and it often doesn't remember whether you play first or third person. And while I know that most players don't care about a "storyline" it would be nice to have some kind of opening cinematic or location that brings the players together just before we all pile into the plane and prepare to parachute over the map if for no reason than to fire everyone up. Finally when you eventually get your first "Chicken Dinner" (a win) it's a bit of a let down because there is nothing except a silent piece of text on the screen that says you won. No sound effect celebretory trophy or crowd or even a short cinematic. THE UGLY I don't find much to complain about with this game but there are definitely performance issues. While certainly playable it is much harder to succeed in this game if you don't have a top end machine because framerates and processing are so important in a game like this that boils down to milliseconds. Recently since the new Sanhok expansion I have been having the game crash more often at least once per session though I expect that to clear up over time.Finally it's worth noting that very often you may find yourself spending 15 minutes running around looting managing your inventory and slowly working your way toward the center of the zone only to eventually face off with another player that you shoot cleanly in the back only to have them spin around and finish you off. Happens to me all the time. If you aren't prepared to have that happen often I don't recommend the game. BOTTOM LINE Because of the sandbox type of atmosphere and battle royale scenario every jump is a unique experience. I know of no other game like it that can make me stress about inventory and stealth engage in intense fire fights and suddenly make me burst into laughter when my motorcycle explodes in midair when hit by an artillery shell. I believe it is totally worth the price even at $30.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When I first started playing this game a few months ago I really looked forward to my hand healing so I can enjoy the game especially opening the crates. I opened 4 crates which with my broken hand took a solid 4 days of playing before my I had driven my hand into such pain I had to take about a week off. Once I came back there were these keys I had to buy. Like actually buy even though I already paid for the game. If I had not already played 100 hours I would demand a refund. Zero interest in a game that is just a micro transaction game. Main reason I have zero interest in fornight.Also this game needs to be region locked. I just tried to play three games in a row and ended up just leaving. I have zero problem playing with people from other countries. But in a game that requires effective communication to have a good time? Zero fun when you get stuck with a team 75% Chinese who you either end up killing because they are racist or get killed by because "you don't Chinese*ah* so you no good" like... on the NA server? Uh the acceptable languages are English French an Central American dialects of Spanish. Not Chinese or any other Asian language. I also have zero problem with broken as heck (insert acceptable NA language here) but neither us or them should be dealing with that awkwardness.

review: Would I reccomend this game?no.Why? I like it enough it's not too overly buggy there's definitely some things that need to be smoothed over or fixed completely. There's banwaves that can hit you randomly but over all the game is fine. So why don't I reccomend it?It's not worth it.Unless you have the horses to run it you'll probably be running at 30fps max I've got a 960 and a Ryzen 5 1500x. Not the worst build in the world but the graphics card is riding on the minimum specs for no reason. The game shouldn't be this unoptimized especially for being a "full release." The last big issue I have with it is the microtransations built into the program there's no need for all the lootboxes when there's other bugs and content to sort out for the game.Overall with friends (I don't like solos personally that's up to you so I won't rate it) I rate it a 6/10.

review: All these reviews telling Bluehole to screw off or that there are cheaters or whatever have one problem that i've seen they don't actually review the game itself. By this I mean the gameplay. And yes I've seen that people have complained about optimization and whatnot but if I can run PUBG on my laptop then everyone who has a desktop should've have a reason to complain especially since I can't really upgrade my laptop piece wise. The UI is a little clunky and if it was more like the PUBG Mobile UI then it may be more enjoyable. The combat is smooth and punishing. On one side without headphones you've got no chance and if you're ambushed you'll have to locate your target quickly before you're dead. On the other hand you gotta control the weapon and make sure your aim doesn't screw you over. When you get a kill it's rewarding since you know YOU killed them with skill instead of spitting as many bullets as possible ala Fortnite. Although there is some craze (not the good kind) over the Sanhok Pass PUBG will remain my No. 1 BR game at heart.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: On one hand this game will soon pass Minecraft for the best selling PC game of all time. On the other that stat proves that money cannot buy quality development or programming talent as even with current net sales approaching 1 Billion dollars (currently at $864 000 000) the bugs optimization issues and rampant hacking have really hurt what could have been one of the greatest PvP shooters ever made.The dev team seems to have dialed in on the core philosophy that more content released faster more money gained faster and the quality assurance of said content is of secondary concern an issue that is glaringly evident by the fact we have seen a new map and new guns but parachutes still routinely bug out and drop players for fall damage or get stuck. Fixing core gameplay mechanics at this point wont make them more money so what's the point right?Unfortunately this leads to the game's biggest downfall the inconsistency of gameplay. One night you can play for 4 hours and everything just works. The next night parachute bugs desync vehicle bugs hackers etc. Variation keeps things exciting but this kind of variation is unhealthy for a game.I would love to see them focus on algorithm's to detect hacking which has really taken over the game lately. It is not rare to have more games ended via hacker than those ended legitimately. The first three games I played today were won by a hacker and those are just the blatant ones. What about the xy axis mouse macros for no recoil? It really is a massive problem in this game.Even with those problems I would still recommend the game because it has a TON of potential. It can also be a lot of fun. But the novelty will wear off eventually and you too will be wondering how they've made the money they have and cant fix something as simple as parachutes or cant lease proper servers to handle the client load. Enter at your own risk and expect to be frustrated beyond belief at times.Edit July 7/2018. I can no longer recommend this game switched my review. Bluehole is an excuse machine greedy constantly dropping quick money grabs and not fixing the game. Constant lag hacking issues bugs that have been in the game since launch. They have a mountain of money but either an immense amount of greed or an immense lack of developer talent. Either way not worth the money unless they actually commit to better servers and bug fixes. Such a disappointment.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've gotten my time out of this game. Had many fun moments with my friends. However every time they add something new they break the game... Lag crashes glitches like not seeing teammates names. Like I said I had fun I enjoyed a lot of my time. However in the current state I cannot recommend the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I really wanted to like this game The graphics are stunning the gameplay is excellent and it has pretty good realism unlike othe BR games. But sadly there are too many bugs and optimization issues that make this game unplayable for me. I don't get good FPS which I get with ALL my other games. However I really think that if the PUBG Corp. really focused on the game's overall optimization bugs and quality instead of being so fixated on making money then it would easily outnumber Fortnite and any other battle royale game exponentionally in terms of players. I really wanted to give this game a thumbs up but sadly that's just not realistic. PUBG you need to focus on regaining all the players that you're losing or else you might not be around much longer (.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When I got the game in summer of 2017 it was really fun and enjoyable but as the game's lifespan progressed it got worse and worse. The gameplay and concept is nice (generic battle royale game) but right now the game is very poorly optimized and has frequent frame drops and bugs. If the game was optimized well then the game would be really fun like it was in the past. The large maps and vehicles are fun and the variety of attachments are nice (although a bit overwelming at first). Personally this game is a lot more fun with friends than it is solo.Very fun game but the optimization ruins it. If better optimized in the future then maybe it will see a rise in players.

review: PUBG was great when I first started. I bought it when it was still originally gaining traction and before it was released as a "full game."Now that Bluehole has made all of it's money off of the Battle Royale phenomenon they no longer seem to care if they make a good game or not. They only make small and easy fixes while ignoring the terrible glitches packet loss and other glaring problems making the game so broken. It was not ready to release as a complete game and it's clear they only did it to hype up the Xbox port.PUBG could have been a good game but it honestly feels like Bluehole no longer cares and after owning it for months I've stopped caring too.

review: As a person who has played 700+ hours on PUBG i would like to share my opinion with the game. As a European player i have encountered less than 5 cheaters since i started playing so for me cheating isn't a issue. I do think it's kinda stupid that you have a higher chance to get a crate that needs a key than receive one that is free to open. After all you played for those battlepoints and you want to get something in return. Altough that is an issue it doesn't bother me all that much. Further i would like to say something about the battle pass. Im totally fine with the fact that you have to pay for it because it adds extra content and a fresh blow to the gameplay. Now it's time to discuss the desync that's going i've always had a little bit of desync but it has increased in the last month to the point where you are behind a wall for 1 2 seconds and you get knocked killed or hit. This is the biggest problem in my opinion and needs a fix as soon as possible. BUT this isn't going to stop me from playing because PUBG has given me fantastic moments with my friends and of course some bad moments like every game. Altough there are a lot of things that need to be improved i would still buy it again and recommend it!

review: I still think this game is very fun. A lot of people are complaining about hackers getting worse and it is true that hacking is getting to be an issue but the game is still a lot of fun. If you die due to an aimbot and get #2 that is still a win in my book. I don't care so much about ranking this game is still a lot of fun.You are dropped onto an island and have to try to run and pick up loot. I love how there is no leveling system and nobody starts out with any advantage over another person other than their skill and knowledge (and I guess hacks). You can choose to drop in a hot zone and fight out for the winner to get a ton of loot or drop in a remove area and try for the sneaky approach to win. Great game to play with friends and also a ton of fun solo. I definately recomend it.

review: This is a difficult review. The game has alot of positive sides like bringing friends together easy matchmaking so when you die or win you will quickly get back into the killing and it's sure as hell competetive.It does however have alot of drawbacks aswell. Im sure alot of them will be fixed over time I just sure hope they don't go all Bohemia about this. Alot of fame and players have arrived fast thanks to Twitch.TV and for some reason this has made the development process alot slower. Patches seemes to have slowed down and new content is slowing down.Allthough at the time of writing this they have the Vaulting feature in the works aswell as new maps. The negative sides atm is Ghost bullets studdering desync and their awfull loot table. I mean when you search entire Rozhok and you only find 2 AR's and some medical stuff something is wrong. The same can be said for the military base. There should be a weapon in every room. So players get equal chances of killing one another. Hopefully this will be fixed soon and the game could be out of ''Pre Alpha'' in a couple of months.I will recommend this game for the ammount of fun i've had. But you will have some sour times aswell.

review: First and all I would like to say that this game gives a unique sense of feeling of actually being there. The silent stalking long range sniper shots point blank shooting and etc. If you enjoy Hunger Games Battle Royale or just like to be in the chance of survival by gunning down other enemies in your way then I strongly recommend this game. 10/10.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is the Time Warner of video games or PUBG should be called Glitch City.Both of these would be fully accurate titles for a review of this game.What do I mean by they are the Time Warner? They have terrible customer service IE Their anti cheat software is GARBAGE. This game has so many hackers it's actually sad If there were a better option I would drop them so fast. For the love of God someone please release a better option (no fortnight is not a better battle royale).Glitch City? Only game in history where having the high ground is a liability as you shoot into the wall while getting head shot. Constantly shoot into railings that shouldn't stop bullets but will completely block your shot Get shot around the corner because the enemy has figured out how to curve bullets Willing to half cheat by messing with key bindings? Well then feel free to jump out windows. Don't worry we've got an update coming soon (you know in the next 6 9 months) which will allow you to do the same thing. Someone get a gun before you? Charge them and watch as they helplessly shoot around you because you'll glitch their interface. Pulling the trigger on a shotgun will give you a nice small burst of lag as well. That should really help your aim.What I mean by this is the concept is great the execution is GOD AWFUL at best. Yes I'm like 350 hours into this game and yes I'll keep playing it but if a game with a similar concept would release this game will end.They have already driven off a majority of the casual players by having a LARGE population of hackers. Yes there are some really good players out there they are in a different league than I am fully admitted so running into a mix of them and hackers is SUPER fun...The hardest question is would I recommend this game? The answer used to be yes when it first came out and the glitches looked like they may go away. Too late they've already made their money and driven off the player base. That said if you like screaming curse words so loud your downstairs neighbors will think there is spousal abuse occuring (true story) it's a REALLY cool concept just terrible game management...

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS was one of my favoite games on Steam until it took a massive downfall after the popularization of the Battle Royale genre and the struggle to stay afloat amongst the other titles. Microtransactions As games like Fortnite and H1Z1 are free to play the integration of ingame skins behind paywalls while undesireable is necessary to make a profit but PUBG at $29.99 has no excuse to make nearly every crate ingame require REAL money to unlock (Only 3 crates ingame are free to open without any cash into the game.) after aquiring a random crate through the ingame currency which can only be obtained through gameplay (Which is a great and fair mechanic no hate) and increases in cost when buying more within a shorter time period. (700BP 1400BP 2800BP)Also after the debut of Fortnite and the success of the paid and free Battle Pass PUBG decided to bandwagon on the idea but rather than allowing players who paid for the game (Save The World in the case of Fortnite) to buy it through the currency which can be earned through gameplay or by paying PUBG forces it to be bought for $9.99 (The exact same as Fortnite however when buying in Fortnite you have excess to be spent in the ingame store.) and the PUBG Battle Pass features MUCH less content of which the majority is only TRIAL items which is total bullsh t when if you buy the game with the Battle Pass $40 total only rewards you with a few exclusive items. Battle Points An ingame currency which can be earned by simply playing the game is a great idea however PUBG does it totally wrong while this point may be disputed BP can only be earned through gameplay and there is no way in which you can purchase it to speed up the process of earning crates which to my knowledge at the removal of the PUBG Steam market is the only way in which the crates can be aquired another gripe about BP is that the majority of things you can buy with it are pure RNG RNG in RNG as a matter of fact as the only thing you can use BP for is buying crates and if you aren't planning on buying keys for the "specialty" 1.5k BP locked crate you will spend 700 BP on a crate which you most likely won't ever be able to open unless you buy keys to try your luck at a rare item but unlike games like CS GO no item can be sold bought or traded as of now so it's a lose lose situation. Hacking While I have not experienced this firsthand I have heard that hacking has resurfaced but I can't really describe what it is like as I have played about 3 games in the past 2 months. Overall PUBG has made me hate the Battle Royale genre (Following the PUBG Beta) that I have wanted to be a mainstream genre for a long time as of how many fond memories I have had in the Minecraft Survival Games I honestly want to love PUBG as I hate most other Battle Royale titles like H1Z1 and Fortnite but can't find a way to love PUBG after all the sh t that Bluehole has done to the game.I sadly cannot reccomend PUBG in it's current state there are better titles for similar or cheaper.

review: If whatever Playerunknown said and promised during H3's Podcast will be fulfilled by the devs I could rate this game 9.5/10.Yeah there are some issues about rubberbanding/lags optimisation also hackers. However if you watch the update progress from April 2017 you can clearly see that dev actually put efforts on making this game great. Compare this game to other massively multiplayer survival games like DayZ and you will say "holy quot . Remember that making and developing a game is not easy. I can say that this game is worth more than its current price.Despite of the positive review there is still 1 negative side of this game. Normal people (non streamer) can't make their own custom games. This shows that devs still favor streamers over us (plebs). Hopefully custom games will be available for all players. There is also another suggestion which I could give. Since modding is not possible I hope that PUBG gives us the opportunity to use their own PC/server to host games/custom games (so similar to CSGO).Overall I give this game a rating of 8.0/10. Update The fact that map selection and language selection for random squad isn't implemented yet is quite disappointing. Days ago I played with my brother and I had a bug where he can't revive me after being disconnected from the game. This bug happens after the game has been updated. This is showing lack of commitment from PUBG company. They had the option to update test server so that people can test it before implementing the game.Rating 6.5/10 Update 2 Wow so you (Blueballs) now introducing Event Pass? your system. Trying to milk the out of the players before the game is dead? Still insisting that normal players ie. those who are not famous shouldn't be able to play custom games or do modding? Get ed Bluehole you're now as as EA in my eyes.Rating 5/10As what Trump said SAD!

review: This game could be tons of fun. It has a great platform however it has been ruined by a ton of hackers with no signs that the company wants to fix the problem. Investing 45+ minutes into a game just to be Aim Botted is not what I would call a good game and this happens to me 33% of all the games that I play (as of the past 1 2 months). How many hackers have to be in every game for me to get cheated 1/3 games when there are 100 people to start? If cheating wasnt enough to ruin the game the management of the game has been poor (not a strong enough word) since its release. Huge updates from 3 6 gb occur on almost a weekly occasion and the servers shut down at the worst possible times. Rather than schedule server shut downs at times where nobody is likely to be playing they chose prime gaming hours around 9pm 1am. If you are into shooters than you probably know the importance of building a sensitivity to the guns and the arsenal to know what weapons are best for any given situation. Honestly I appreciate attempts to balance gun dynamics however the gun functions change so frequently and so dramatically that it is impossible to get a feel for the game. Whether its nurfing guns buffing guns or changing bullet speed and bullet drop in a gun specific way the constant change gets annoying and deters from wanting to get invested in the game.And to corroborate what other reviewers have stated the game is shifting to a monetary reward system is a terrible way. Already PUBG suffered from any incentive to play (i.e. lack of a sense of progression) and now any reward based system has turned almost exclusively monetary. Pay for crates pay for items pay for keys to open crates. Now thankfully the pay based scheme doesnt improve chances to win its only cosmetic but without having a reward system for others not interesting in spending real money for fake items it makes the game get dry and monotonous after a while.Also they keep resetting the ladders. This does help to bump cheaters off and give a fighting chance for others but cheaters shouldnt exist in the first place.Overall the gameplay is great but the incentive to continue and invest time is terrible and steeply declining due to cheaters and the inability of the producers to fix the issue. I dont understand how they expect their buisness model to succeed. People have created a real monetary market based around the cosmetic items which encourages cheaters to seek profit from the system. The more cheaters the less people will want to play the more the market will diminish. The more reward based systems are turned exclusively to monetary purchases the less invested players will get and the less people will want to play. People dont want to invest their time and energy into a dying game which is how PUBG is turning out. I would not recommend this game until the problems are resolved however I fear the game has been tarnished too much already to ever be able to bounce back.

review: To preface this review of the PUBG I used to advocate for this game to all my friends and wanted them to get hooked on the game like I did. Instead of the game getting better with each patch it seems that the game has been increasing in bugs and it seems like Bluehole doesn't care because they've made tens of millions of dollars on the game.Until desyncing player models getting randomly stuck when parachuting non consistent loot drops (i.e. looting an entire town to only find pistols and shotguns. Like make it so there are set amounts of AR's Sniper Rifles and SMG's in each town or something to help the game encourage exploring and engaging in combat versus hiding in the same place the entire game) environmental clipping not being accurate to the models (i.e. when shooting at someone and their head is sticking out from behind a rock or wall some of the clipping sticks out further than the actual object so you can't hit the player's head) and terrible server connections (i.e. multiple times in a game my squad will experience network lag one or twice every other game usually when in a firefight) are addressed I cannot recommend anyone play this game. If you want a fun BR game that is fun and optimized get Fornite Battle Royale. It's free and comes with loads less of bugs and frustration. Once the Bluehole stops wasting time hosting esports events adding unnecessary weather effects and bragging about player numbers on twitter for this buggy unfinished and completely broken game and starts dedicating time to fix the bugs listed and more that I can't come up with off the top of my head and improving the quality of life of PUBG then I and probably many others will start playing this game willingly and not reluctantly with friends that just got the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Dont get this game. I've given the devs so many chances to redeem this game which I see so much potential in. I dont want to make assumptions but i genuinely feel like the team does not care about its players. They released the mobile version and x box version and 1.0 way before the actual game was anywhere close to being ready. This leads me to believe they only care about money. The mobile client is actually better than the PC version. I have spent a lot of money to play this game (buy the game better PC multiple monitors good headset etc) but still cant enjoy it properly. I'm uninstalling and waiting till they 1. Optimize the ing game. I dont give two about the graphics anymore...just give me decent fps smooth gameplay without dsync/lag fix the bugs WITHOUT ADDING MORE and please let me run the game in a PC with i9 and 2080 Ti and 16 gb ram.2. Fix the language issue. I will never play solo again because why would i spend 20 minutes looting just to die to someone i cant even see? I want to play duo and squad and actually communiate with my team. Why i am ALWAYS stuck with chinese speaking players?Extra Rant Fix PUBG is the biggest joke ever. Their timeline is absolute bull. every bug they """fix""" they add 2 more.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: To start I am not known to enjoy Fortnite.I bought this game for the summer sale as my friends wanted to play it to get a break from the usual Overwatch. I was excited highlights on youtube seemed hilarious with the voice chat and all. My friends have always said they hate the actual game itself and just use it for said voice chat. The following is word for word what I left on my review ticket.The game has become an absolute cesspool of freenium elements. Upon opening multiple ads are intrustively shoved in your face (including one for their blatent rip off of "Fortnite's" battlepass). For this reason much of the player base one would have fun interactions with have fled and you are left with people who do not talk. When left with these silent warriors the game simply feels lonely.Don't buy this game. Bluehole doesn't care about anyone playing it and just wants your wallet.

Overall a great fun game when you get a good lobby however as it stands its in need of some dire work! Would I recommend it? review: Was a pretty fun game before release with the understanding that it would improve as it was early access but now... not so much. The game is riddled with glitches that have existed since before full release.Overall most games leave you running around looting for twenty minutes then dying. Lasting longer hitting people and especially getting kills earns you points to get cosmetics but those points don't get you many cosmetics of any value unless you want to pay real money for keys. This means that even if you get good you don't really get much else. Not to mention that you aren't even quaranteed the weapon and/or clothing accessories you want when you pay to get them.

review: The game's developers are out of touch with what people want. *COUGH miramar sucks dont force us to play it we altered files to get rid of it and you banned us for it COUGH* People play this game so heavily because its the best the genre offers not because the people behind the magic are making good decisions.If you want a competitive BR then play Islands of Nyne. If you want a BR that panders to children and casuals play Fortnite. PUBG basically provides aesthetic appeal with gunplay somewhere between clunky and polished and always somehow buggy.Technically it's not that great. In fact if you get technical and break it down its a horrible game. But people said the same thing about counter strike when it came out. There are a lot of flawed mechanics that detract from it's viability as an esport...or even a competitive game in any fashion. Cheating is a serious problem that is commonly downplayed by kids these days because they feel mature or something for being the bigger person and admitting they got beat fairly. Nuh uh kid you got sprayed from 400m away with a SCAR L and every shot hit you no recoil.Heres whats up A visual recoil animation is coded into the game regardless of the physics of the firearms or bullets. This means that you can run custom scripts on your mouses software that are undetectable by any anti cheat (even ESL AC) and COMPLETELY remove recoil and your opponent will STILL see recoil in the kill cam. That coupled with how freaking easy it is to subvert their anti cheat and the kid culture of downplaying cheating has made it extremely prevelant. I mean ffs before Shrouds fame he was considered a dirty CSGO player that many in the scene considered a cheater but since he never got caught and theyre contractually obligated not to they never called him out. Btw he quit shortly after a small controversy arose around him. Hmm wonder why?Thats not even the worst. There are browser based cheats that they'll literally never be able to address. Literally. If you read this and they eventually change it I will buy you any game off Steam just add me and contact me. While there are various and diverse browser based cheats the major offender is an API cheat that displays the world map of the server you're currently on as well as everyones position in real time...Yes map hacks...open in a browser window like chrome firefox palemoon you name it. Your favorite streamers probably use this. The vast majority of people in the top 100 use this. For crying out loud we have people like choco taco claiming a guy that never saw him headshotting him through a wall isnt cheating because its heinous to call someone a cheater and yet a viewer in the same match as him posts the replay and the guy is obviously cheating and then gets banned...for cheating.Grow a pair be honest to yourself at the very least. The game isnt riddled with hacks its riddled with scripters and cheaters of all kinds.Once you get past the cheats then theres the mechanics and leaderboard metrics.You can ing avoid everyone get one kill once in 100 games and be in the top 100. Pathetic.In tournaments they disable red zones and alter loot distribution and spawn pools. Why? Because its not competitive? Because its not fair and heavily luck based? Thats not fun. Thats not even ing smart.Its the same t we see in most Asian games. Most people dont even realize that PUBG before you ever played it was bought up and completely developed by an Asian company. How many asian games have you talked about before? Probably several and if you havent then you havent played any.tl drIts worth $30 but i want you to know what you're buying into. This is the reality of it. Yes you will have fun. But you will also run into some of the most extreme t from devs and players youve ever experienced. Not moral t like you see from EA. But its still fun enough to often push through it all and enjoy it with friends.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: At launch this game was redeemable for being immersive and fun as a team Despite all the bugs. The game now at full release is plagued with hackers in which the dev's seem to do nothing about. Since the issue began its been becoming worse and each game ive played (no joke) since launch has had at least 1 2 hackers. Last game i played someone lobbed over 20 grenades at me and killed me with perfect precision aim to the head. The grenades are possible but not likely without hacks but the precision kill is what got me. Not to mention the hacking raiding parties that camp in populated locations just to ruin your game. Those are really fun!A warning to all possible buyers Don't buy this game. If by a miracle the gliches bugs and hackers are fixed before the company goes under then buy.

review: Product received for free. I'm on the fence looking whether or not this game deserves a positive or negative review.I started playing right when the game went into alpha and was met with a long loading screen and notable optimization issues such as taking an exceedingly long amount of time to render the map general lag in the pre plane lobby rubberbanding and so on and so forth. However...The game itself is fun as I've played about 10 12 games now both solo and multi player squads. The looting reacting to contact random crate drops drive bys reviving teamates taking on multiple squads while you hide in a bathroom makes a incredibly enjoyable experience when get your chicken dinner. Devs seem to be continuing their work of creating a better smoother experience unlike previous games that were abandoned as soon as the devs were happy with the amount of bank they brought in.This game is worth checking out IF you don't mind it still being a buggy experience.EDIT More lootboxes event pass and still no optimization? Yeah no thanks.

review: PUBG is broken! Lag compensation renders it unplayable!https //www.twitch.tv/videos/322583680https //www.twitch.tv/videos/322637062"DESYNCIn PUBG whether or not a player's shot succesfully hits an opponent is determined by the attacker's client. If a shot is successful from the attacker's side the target takes a hit. However if the attacker's ping is high or the server tick rate is low the attacker's shot can be wrongly counted as a hit even after the target hides behind cover (since the target will still be visible on the attacker's screen)."CS GO is still the way to go sadly..

review: My mind's telling me no.But my body... My body's telling me yeeeeesss! This game had a lot of potential. The genre it popularized is still going strong and with Triple A BR games on the horizon PUBG won't be able to keep up. This game has a grittier more realistic and in my opinion skill based enviroment than Fortnite. However it is plagued by a huge slew of problems that make it a pain to play and frustrating to top it off.If you want your BR fix wait for a Triple A studio to do it right. I've gotten more than my money's worth from this game hours and hours of fun with friends and a odd chicken dinner here or there. But I cannot say with just cause that this game is likely to ever fix its issues.Your money's better off being spent on a deserving full released Indie SP game or being saved for the next 15 steam sale games you'll buy and never play.My mind was right and my body is now in tune with it.

review: Кароч 11.07 2018 наиграл я в эту хренотень 700+ часов а чет а в игре меньше не стало. Новая карта ну на 4+ хотя и лагает даже когда ставлю 800x600 разрешение. Согласен с фразой Шрауда aka Mike "Sroud" Grzesiek " Это была лучшая катка в PUBG за все время что я играю в эту игру. Мне все равно кто и что скажет по этому поводу. Я получил столько удовольствия от игры сколько не получал уже очень давно. Все это показывает насколько разработчики PUBG если вы это слушаете принимайте на свой счет плевать на всё хотели. Потому что этого парня должны были забанить немедленно. Он уже дважды появлялся у меня на стриме. В первый раз он просто меня сбил ладно все произошло слишком быстро. Во второй раз я убил его когда он пролетал через здание. На тот момент он уже должен был быть забанен. В третий раз я решил черт с вами хоть повеселюсь с ним и посмотрим как долго все это будет продолжаться. Мы покатались вместе и он все еще не в бане." Кароч парни пора петицию создавать на тему пабга чтобы они перестали грести бабки мало того за то что люди покупают игру за 900 рублей так еще и какие то баттл пасы запихивают за 600 с лишним рублей и обратили внимание на код игры и потребление компуктерных ресурсов а пока игра 4 / 10.

review: PUBG is a game that I spent a significant amount of time in and watched it grow from its true early access form to its half way released mess that it has become as of the time of writing this review. TL DR I would not recommend this game based on the microtransactional model which the developers/publishers Microtransactions have many flavors and styles that are different for each developer and publisher some are more friendly to players than others. Many people do not have a problem with microtransactions as a whole and in 2018 microtransactions are par for the course in the gaming industry. However as a gamer I have seen many different microtransactional systems and I would argue that PUBG has gone with the model which least fits the genre and style of its game. PUBG's closest competition is a completely free to play game Fortnite. Fortnite uses a model where each item has a set price on the Fortnite store and has a season pass system similar to the one introduced to PUBG with the Sanhok update. Unlike Fortnite however PUBG uses an additional system where you earn chests through gameplay but they will randomize the chests you recieve from your gameplay. Some of these chests require $2.50 for a key to open the chest but you do not get to choose to recieve only chests which do not require keys or chests with keys. Meaning you could play for multiple days and get the maxmium weekly amount of chests for that week but not get a single chest which you can open without spending more money. This practice alone is why I do not recommend the game. Had PUBG gone with a free to play model I would not complain I would say that it is a fair compromise for a game offered for free. However this game as of writing costs $30. And it is not fair to introduce event passes and paid chests in a game which already has a healthy market for cosmetics and has one of the largest player base for a PC early access game in the history of Steam making record after record for concurrent players. This game feels as if it is merely trying to cash out the check of its popularity with monetary schemes which in my opinion are unfair for players and are a slap in the face to anyone who has been with this game since the start. Literally the only thing I ask for is that you be able to choose whether you would recieve a reward of a chest with paid keys or not. This would return fairness to the loot system of the game. In terms of gameplay it isnt that great anymore the Time to kill when someone starts firing on you is rarely if ever long enough to mount any sort of defense so essentially the gunplay has evolved into an elaborate game of hide and seek where unless you are extremely lucky someone seeing and firing at you before you see them means instant death and a waste of possibly 30 minutes of game time amounting to nothing more than a paltry sum of battle points which can't even be used fairly as outlined above.

review: People tend to fear early access titles and for good reason. They're stuck in development hell filled with bugs and inevitably get abandoned by their devs. However at the risk of sounding optimistic PUBG seems different. The devs release weekly updates with meaningful content and optimization. The framerate is sometimes choppy but the game has never crashed. Most importantly the core gameplay is ing brilliant. Gunplay is extremely solid and satisfying and the game builds tension and excitement like no other. I have complete faith in this game to eventually realize its full potential but it's already really good.

review: The game itself is solid but a full year into the game and servers still are rarely lag free. Cosmetic updates keep coming every now and then but that really isin't what the game lacks. There are several minor issues as well that haven't been dealt with at any phase of development. Early access clearly gave the developers a lot of capital to try and answer problems in this game but since very little has been done I don't excpect them to deal with any of it anymore. At this point I fear lag problems and such will probably not be answered during this games lifetime so I would recommend going for some other franchise.UPDATE few months afterwards still the same almost all bugs continue unfixed server lag and crashing is still with us and has actually spiked after a large update from bluehole. Spend your money elsewhere.

Overall PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a great Battle Royale game (Better than Fortnite i've got to say) the experience in game is brilliant and it's just an amazing game. Ever since that day PUBG has become Fortnite Battle Royale Lite. Paid loot boxes focusing on putting in emotes rather than fixing issues right down to getting the Fortnite map re made into a Vietnam like area.Overall used to be fun but got ruined. Shame.

review: Product received for free. The battle royale mode has become very stale and although they were not the first they did do a very good job at the time however it too has become flooded with micro transactions on top of the 27 purchase which although does not ruin the experience is a bit annoying. The maps are massive however i would deem this a slightly bad thing as you rarely get into combat for the first 5 minutes or be killed in a minute. I do enjoy driving around the map in the buggies with team mates hanging out of it. The desert map is in my opinion the worst as you can see players from a mile away but again there are several maps to keep the game less repetitive compared to other more popular games in the genre. Overall I do enjoy playing the game however you are probably better buying it in the sale.
