review: Intro Where to begin. I've been playing PUBG since the day it came out I didn't pre order which of course I regret every single day since I bought it literally a few hours after it was available for Order rather than pre order. Playability/Graphics/Smoothness The game has come a VERY long way it's now very smooth at least on fairly high end setups. I've played the game on a variety of Graphics cards and CPU's 1060 1070 1080 1080 Ti and 1080 Ti's x2 in SLI mode. CPUS i7 6700K OC'd at 4.8Ghz i7 8700k also at 4.8Ghz (pesky 5Ghz I can't get it to run at stable speeds ( ) Back to the subject with these setups I've been able to get frames of up to 130 140 FPS in the past 4 6 months I don't think I ever drop below 100 FPS under any circumstance with settings which are mostly set to Ultra/other than effects and shadows which I've got set to either low or med. The guns feel very realistic. GUI/UI So this is a tough one. I think for a game this huge maybe it's not as huge as it once was and it could even be on the decline it has a pretty mediocre UI that's being fairly kind here. They could add the following A) Allow you to tag buildings/positions of enemies/trees/whatever the hell you want so that you don't have to shout to your squadmates "behind you!" or "to the left of the green building" or "174!" Which 90% are completely meaningless or by the time you figiure it out you are dead or they are gone.B) Allow you to place a marker on the map which is visible to your squad mates in 3D like in Fortnite basically so you dont have to use the minimap in anyway. Perhaps this hasn't been done for a legitimate reason like realism? I don't know but I'd personally love to have this. Surely if we were Navy Seals we would have some kind of way to know where we are parashooting into with some kind of smoke which only we can see etc.C) Re design the front page/shop. It's far to laggy clunky and it just feels like a very poorly written game from the very start it's nothing like COD BF Fornite LOL Any Blizzard game basically any other great game out there right now.D) Give us more information in the GUI for example how far a team mate is from you in meters when you are looking toward them. This is a tiny little recommendation. I'm sure many other people could come up with far better suggestions. Sound Now this is a VERY important aspect of any combat game especially FPS games and when you are for example doing a 1 v 1 in a building or you are simply hiding in the bushes... I don't know but I don't always feel like I get a sense for where people are coming from. I'm using high end 7.1 Gaming headsets the latest Corsair Void 7.1 and also the Logitech 7.1 cabled one I don't know exactly which model but it's a good one I've also just tried good stereo headphones. I'm still not sure 7.1 makes any difference at all. The sound quality for the shots can be pretty terrible on some guns like the M15. Does it really sound like that in real life? Some of the silenced shots sound pretty sweet... so it really depends on the gun. Re Playability For me personally it's about having a group of friends who are willing to play with you on a regular basis. If you have that this game is extremely fun. With the release of COD Blackout I've yet to compare as I've not had the chance to play COD Blackout with a group of friends as I can't seem to find any friend who play COD Blackout they play Zombies or Multi... which really surprised me. Anyway. In Summary... PUBG is a great game which I'll forever hold dear as the best Battle Royale game that was ever made up until this point. Perhaps after I play COD Blackout enough with friends I will update this review... that game is highly polished the gun play is amazing and most of the aspects I described above are addressed in this game though not all.

review: 25 hours into the game. This is what I know so far.First off there are TONS AND TONS AND TONS AND TONS AND TONS of cheaters. Yes you can report them and yes the developer takes the reports seriously. It won't do much good as there are so many cheating these days that it'll not even start to make a dent to report every cheater you get.Second this game is an exercise in how to not have fun. The learning curve is ENORMOUS. You're just now starting out and for those few people not cheating they've been playing long enough that they're superhuman. VERY few people will give you any information or help.Third the problem with Chinese people getting into US servers is still a very big thing. Mroe than 70% of my teammates are still Chinese even after the patch that "fixed" that problem. Of course they almost never have a mic or speak english so if they do have a mic they don't speak at all. The ones that do speak so little english that they may as well not speak.Fourth this game will cause you to lose because of the desync a LOT and by a LOT I mean almost every map you are going to lose because of desync or because the other guy is cheating like crazy or because weird glitches happen like "a floating bush appears in front of you so if you touch it you explode".The game is so seriously flawed it's not really playable. You will not win a chicken dinner unless you've already played for a very very long time or you're cheating like crazy. It's just not possible. But it can still be fun if you recognize that fact and play anyways right?Not usually. You'll die by the cheapest stuff ever imagined like "you nose dive immediately when the plane allows you to jump out so you should land absolutely first. When you get towards the ground three dozen people pass you. They get guns immediately and shoot you as soon as you drop your chute". Or "you land as fast as possible. As you move towards the building only two feet from you a guy that somehow already landed and found a vehicle runs you over as his buddy who already landed and found a gun that is hitching a ride shoots you".The game is just unplayable. I can't get my 30 bucks back from steam because I've had it for a week but you can't tell that it's an unplayable broken game within the time frame they give you for refunds it takes longer than that to install. So instead I'll be doing a bank fee reversal for the cost of this game and if steam bans my account for doing so I really don't care because they allowed a game as broken as this to be on the store for this long without forcing the developer to fix the game or pull it from the site until it is fixed. I don't care. This was MY money for a working game that can be possible to enjoy not broken crap that you can't possibly enjoy due to cheaters server problems and maps seeming to think it's fun to never give people weapons (land in named areas to find weapons my ).Oh and the "we're sorry for the problems here's free RP" was a slap in the face. review: 10/10. I have sunk 101 hours into this game and continue to play. There are a few problems such as the very low and unstable tickrate and the subpar anti cheat ( although i havent encounterd any cheaters for almost a month now so i think that the problem is prettey much solved ). The Newest Update has caused performance crippiling issues but im positive that they will be patched immediatley ( also you can fix the issue if you dissable replays and deathcam)Before the last update the game ran fareley well but i would recomend a somewhat strong cpu otherwise you may see fps drops into the 30s or below in higly populated areas. If you need 1080p and 60 fps i recomend a minumum of a 750 ti / r7 360 (which will acheive that on low settings ) on amd but the game is playable with a 660 (or lower if youre willing to lower the resalution ). I am able to reach 1080p 60fps with A mix of very low to medium settings with this game.The game is amazing with friends. especially a squad of 4 and has great momments but also delivers an enjoyable expereincemy system specs Gpu Radeon r7 360Cpu Amd a10 7700k ( Deffinitely should avoid a cpu this weak for this game)Mobo Asus a68h EMemory 8gb of ddr3 ( 8Gb is fine but most people reccomend 16Gb)

review: So I have only played it maybe 15hrs so far and I love every second of it EXCEPT clunky mechanics. It isn't to the point where it's unplayable but everything is kinda sluggish and "have to give it another go" type stuff. That really gets under my skin. It's annoying and frustrating especially if you're in a firefight with people. For example to open a door you press "F". You might have to push F three times before the game registers you pushed F and then it might close in your face when you try to go through. Then (my worst comaplint) is when you're prone and you try to get up and run and your guy just sits there or goes into a crouched position. Super annoying and detrimental. Z needs to be overwritten by "Shift" C needs to be overwritten by "Shift" You should never have to push the same button twice to return to your previous position. If i'm prone and I press "Shift" to run I expect my guy to get his off the floor and haul Not ing sit there like a sitting duck until I mash Z 600 times before he finally decides to move. Another annoying "feature" is not being able to shoot through windows (very easily). Sometimes if you get too close to a window your gun will just pop up and not allow you to fire. Super convienient when you're in a firefight and you have 4 bullets / second coming towards you. Like seriously? It's a window you pillock. Sometimes the splash screen will freeze the game too. Hit detection is kinda garbage and the frames drop sometimes if you're in a heavy firefight. Not good. With all these complaints being said I really would reccomed the game to anyone because its super ing addictive especially if you play with a duo or a squad and the fun kinda overlooks the bad stuff. It's a load of fun looting buildings and posting up and strategizing with people. All in all I give this game a 6/10. cons laggy glitchy buggy poor hit detection mechanics are clunkypros a ton of fun auto matchmaking for squads (thank christ) replayable lots of places and items to explore the UI is goodAfter a while you start to overlook the bad stuff and just adapt to it but it shouldn't be that way. Please don't let this review stray you from buying it becuase you would seriously miss out on fun be be mindful of what I said before. This comment is more or less for devs to read and fix and less to scare people off.TLDR download it it's a ton of fun mechanics are clunky.

review: Game has been optimized and runs smoothly on my pc save for the occasional ui lag which affects everyone. The 2018 road map looks great as 2 new maps are being added one of them just finishing its closed beta. I started playing recently and I have no idea how i already have this many hours. If you are coming from fortnite expect a much harder aiming/ ballistics system as well as slower gameplay if you land far from the plane and avoid hotdrops. So far the only real t I die from that isnt my fault is getting run over by my own vehicle. (admittedly my fault after the third or fourth time). Even if you dont win this game is very satisfying no matter what playstyle you choose unless you are a camper in which case you wont even be able to turn or switch weapons without being heard. Also sounds that depend on what you are carrying are to be added. The price is reasonable and I would buy again if i had a choice.

review: My opinion on PUBG is one of extremes. On one hand I absolutely love PUBG while on the other I absolutely hate it sometimes.At it's core it's really a dynamic experience game to game and the possibilities of engagements and fights you can get in are seemingly limitless. It's fun and engaging rage inducing and adrenaline pumping and as you get used to the game and the victories and losses mount you notice problems but up until last patch they were not game breaking for me.This game has got simultaneously better and worse with each big patch and with 1.0 I decided it was time to review this game.I do not recommend it as of now.This game is broken and has become worse the past two major patches. From effects and environmental objects not rendering in consistently between players to server registry of shots. Both players shooting at each other face to face but half of one players shots not registering is a huge problem. On more than one occasion it decided the fight and I have been on both ends of this exchange and have won rounds and lost rounds because of it.Cheaters are becoming more prevelant in the game where I went from seeing a few potential cheaters to people with pans in front of their faces getting repeated neck shot at 200m by a guy with a red dot and watching replays of players track me and my teamates through a wall. It really can put a damper on an otherwise good time. I cannot speak for third person but I have been getting more and more in first person.Lastly the loot distribution in this game is awful. I believe that although there are good spots in almost every major zone the loot seems a little TOO random. Although this is part of the game if the loot were a little more balanced or predictable in spawning the game I believe would be much better (Ex One AR one SMG one shotgun with chances at more spawning per major house cluster or One AR/Shotgun/SMG and one Lvl 2 equippable item per warehouse with chances of spawning more). This is personal preference but it is something that I see as a problem where randomization is a bit too extreme.I have gotten my money worth but I may not have if I started playing after 1.0.

review: October 15th 2018 Servers run well but not outstandingly. Some things that could definitly help with making this game more complete is with these changes Add flaregun into vanilla games Add bullet penetration to thin objects Add grenade penetration to thin objects Make armor more durable Reduce bluezone speed and duration between phases Reduce weapon punch somewhat Remove shotgun bullet loops attachment and buff reload speed of pump shotgun Fix grenade not throwing where you look Fix floating gunsSeptember 3rd 2018 Netcode got 2 3x better and is now enjoyable. Now all we need is bullet penetration for objects and its all smooth sailing from here on out.July 12th 2018 Game is much better weapons are near perfectly balanced and maps are well polished... Last thing they need to fix and have needed to fix since release is the Netcode and server performace. It's so abysmally harsh at times that you have to take breaks for days otherwise you will lose your grasp of what skill is tetermined by in this game. I would NOT recomend getting until its fixed.April 14th 2018 Game has gotten good enough to the point of being a AA rating but still needs some more options and server optimization. (Terrible latency servers run badly and some of unregistered shots) But other than that the game has gotten monumentally better. Very true to tactical play rewards the skilled player and punishes the noob. Game on.Dec 23rd 2017 Game actually runs to most people's standards in 1.0 release and vaulting is in. From here on out it's looking pretty good so I changed my rating to a thumbs up! Give this game a go!

review: I have fun sometimes but the laggy sh*tfest it is with Chinese players is beyond horrible. Simple solution is to region lock the game other than create some all in one international servers for everyone to join. They have region servers for a reason yet they exploit the lag to their advantage as usual. And before some politically correct idiot says that it's racist it's not and it's just a simple observation. The Chinese players happen to be the majority of the well proven cheaters as well go figure. These Asian players are a plaque on the playability of this game from the many hours of game play just from myself all the way back to early alpha. These same players ruined Battlefield games as well. Asian and South American players with bad or high pings and using cheats to boot. The tick rate on this game is horrid as well. I love to play with my family and friends from around the world but not in a competitive environment such as this game trying to be an eventual E league game from what we've heard. I just want a fair battleground is that too much to ask for when I pay for a game? NO!!!

review: It's fun as hell. Still needs improvement in terms of performance granted it is still in Early Access so there's surely improvements coming down the road. EDIT This game is just simply unacceptably broken even after 10 months of it's initial release. Over a year ago I bought this game during early access and despite the fact that it was broken in many ways I trusted it would get better when coming out of early access. As I update this review the game still has a ton of broken netcode issues matchingmaking issues and broken game mechanics. This game is on it's death bed and honestly deserves nobody's attention. The approach that Bluehole has taken to resolve the game's issues seem admirable but incredibly ineffective as with each patch things seem to get worse.Don't buy this game. If you want a BR experience there are better options out there.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have 300+ hours on the game at first it was amazing. Nothing compared to the game. This compared to Fortnite was like Gods to men. For months i looked forward to playing this game everyday as the days went on i started noticing things. Things like players teleporting across the map people randomly shooting in the air and killing me over 5km away the desync slowly progressively getting worse and worse. It has gotten to the point i dont even touch the game anymore and forget i even have it for the most part. At time i try to pick it back up hopping it will be better but every time i am let down once again. This game opened up the world to what a great genre this is. Sadly its become derailed everything this game could have been is gone far out the window being picked up by other companies who are doing those things so much better. I love this game for what its done for me throught the time i have played it but it has lost me as well as many others for the lack of communication dedication and maintenence form the developers. I would go as far as saying this game was better as and Alpha and Beta compared to the "FULL" release of the game. If you are looking for a good BR game this was one of them just not anymore. Maybe Bluehole will get their act together and bring this game back into the light but until then i can not play it any further without wanting to smash my keyboard into my monitor.

I just prefer different games.

review: PUBG is really fun game BUT if u want to enjoy it completly u need decent pc (for good fps and nice looking graphics) i have plenty of hours in this game and i can say snice very first early access till now they improve alot of things also now u can encounter less cheaters less lag but while you playing there're always some people that sit in bush for hours and do nothing and if u play like me (im moving around looking for people) and some lad backstab u with hit fire is rly annoying someone whos actually very bad in this game killed u and ruined ur game because till he get into the zone he gonna probably die because he cant gunfight he can only kill some1 with bush camp but yeah...you must have lots of nerves for this game because some campers are annoying also there're some new kind of cheat which is not aimbot but some sort of wallhack which is kinda obvious if u watch the whole replay of the match also the no recoil is annoying ....but i guess its better than aimbot.In the end if you really do enjoy battle royal this game is really for you most of my bad experience is from Solo games but Duo's and Squad even if some1 with wallhack/no recoil kill us we still having fun not big deal after all i hope my review helped someone

review: The game use to be great! I loved playing with family and friends. In the beginning 95% of the players were legit! Now my advice to you is purchase this Game only if you want a running simulator and a hack fest! This game seems to be the most hacked out game 2018! If you play 5 games you will get headshot with iron sites from 1000 meters away in 3 of the games for sure. Don't waste your time or money on this trash! Seems that the Devs got rich fast then gave up on the game. I spent hours making videos sending proof to their twitter and reporting players that were Hacking for sure just to find out that they are still hacking a month later. This shows that "OUR" reports dont mean a thing to them. Seems they added that feature in the game to make us "THINK" they are going to do something about it. When you join the NA server you will find that there are more players from china in your match than there are actual Americans. 75% of those are hacking. This games needs a new anti cheat system a region lock and someone that will actually view the reported gameplay that comes in. Until then... Waste your money and post your opinion.

review: Simple answer is this game is not fun. Long answer is that I can see why people like this game. It really draws you in and gives you the urge to keep playing. You spend 30 minutes running around trying to find better items. The last 10 minutes of a match you spend trying to dodge the oddest firearm controls I have ever seen in a game. As an example I just finished a round where the player who killed me first nearly blind fired a sniper rifle at me and hit then pulls out his M4 with a holographic sight and proceeds to just lob bullets at me killing me. The match before that I was toe to toe with an enemy. On my screen I unloaded an entire magazine into him he ended up killing me. Upon watching the replay it showed I didn't make a single dent in his heath. Ultimately this is my biggest issue with this game. The gun mechanics do not make any sense and are not natural. The graphics are nice but I have had instances where because my graphic settings are different from other players they may not see the vegetation I am hiding in so to them I am just crouched in the middle of a field. The network backend always has some form of lag in it and constantly throws error messages saying it couldn't connect. Other than that the game is solid. Looking at other players feedback it seems I am not the only person to feel this way. If it is on sale I say go for it but I wouldn't pay full price for it again.

review: yes i recommend this game. I see all of these reviews complaining about chinese players and cheaters. I have only played a few matches of PUBG on PC. Within those matches i never ran into a cheater. Everytime i lost it was fair and square (and somtimes hilarious) I Have started to put some decent play time into the xbox one S version as well since my friends play the game on xbox. We have a blast every single time and we have even won a few matches together and dammit all never ran into a single 'cheater'. Idk if a lot of you are just blaming 'cheating' on why some players are kicking your or maybe this game does have a problem (or previously did?) either way i have not experienced really any issues..... except for 2 things. Games needs to be optimized better (which they have been improving noticablly hats off to the devs for the hard work) and a couple game crashes. Even with those it comes down to game optimization. Hopefully they will continue to improve on the game as they have been.Final note all the guns feel AMAZING to shoot! as the games stands unfinished I rate a 8/10. I will be playing more and more. Once the optimization is resolved this game could be unstoppable. Keep It up Devs you got a fanboy

review: This is my first review on Steam but I wanted to post one on this game. The biggest reasons for me wanting to post this review are 1. This game has been a lot of fun for me and I haven't been this addicted to a game since WoW back in 2004ish. I don't know if it's the rush of dropping into School/Hacienda and actually surviving or getting to those last 10 players but it's been one that keeps me engaged.2. I've never been a big player of FPS games. Counter Strike was the one I played the most back in early 2000s which wasn't all that much. However this game has been a lot of fun.3. This game gets a lot of flak.Let me preface this by saying that I am very calm person I don't think I have ever gotten mad about a game. I may get slightly frustrated at myself for doing something dumb but never raged over a bug or losing. So take that into consideration as this game may not be for those who are quick to anger at games. Anyways here the list of pros and cons from my point of view. PROS Easy to learn hard to masterVariety of play stylesFun with friendsVariety of weapons that are fun to mess withVery exciting when in combat and in top 10 situationsQuick to get into a new roundStrategyMultiple towns/locations to explore and learnGraphics are pretty good CONS No region lock Biggest complaint I see. I rarely play squads without people I know so I'm not too familiar here. Cheaters I have encountered a few cheaters however like I said above I don't get upset with games so I just start a new match. Bugs These have been worked on quite a bit since the release of 1.0 but you do still get occasional crashes or load screen freezing. RNG This one can be slightly irritating at times but it's part of the game so nothing to really stress over. As an example I looted two whole apartments one time and only got a pistol. On the flip side dropped into a house one time and found 2 level 3 helmets and vests. Sometimes loot just doesn't make sense but I know it's randomly generated so whatever. Unfulfilling This one is subject to opinion but I know at times it can feel like a waste as you spend 20 minutes looting only to be one shotted by an AWM from someone you didn't see. A lot of people hate that part of this game.Overall like I said above. I would recommend this game as it's given me plenty of enjoyment. Most games nowadays I'll play for maybe 10 20 hours tops and either get bored or feel like I've completed everything I want to. This one keeps pulling me back because it's always a rush. There's just something different about a free for all survival than the typical FPS deathmatch. Hopefully they will continue to work out the issues that are still out there but I'll continue playing either way because I'm enjoying it. That's really all I can ask for from a game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While I have played this game for quite a while and found much of my time enjoyable the quality of matches has plumitted. This is almost exclusivly due to the number of hackers this game harbors. Unfortunatly this renders a game that is purly based on enjoyment through compitition rather worthless. Examples of hacking include enemies firing wildly into the ocean from a moving vehical and headshotting 4 5 people per magazine who are in a different dirrection across the map as well as enimies who can see your possition and throw an infinite number of grenades resembling an airstrike. Please don't waste your time or your money games are about enjoyment and there is very little to be found here now.

review: It's a good game i want to like it even more but the main graphic and connection optimization issues are keeping me from recommending it to anyone to buy at its current state as it is far from a 3xa title and yet it's priced like one. I want to love it but i can't and it's very unfortunate i just wish the issues get fixed in the future and pubg manages to get itself unstuck from the hole it's in at the moment. Now if you want a really good well optimized game to play and you love the idea of pubg i'd say try pubg mobile the rank system graphic and connection optimizations as well as the free crate system and of course the FREE price make it an ideal game to spend time on with or without friends all in all the best alternative currently until hopefully this game sorts itself out.

review: I've been with pubg from nearly the beginning as it started as 'early access.' While it claims to be a full release the game still plays like an early access title. I've had fun with friends and this game is exactly what I wanted in terms of vision just not execution. Lag terrible optimiztion glitches buggy interface and occassional crashes mean you are fighting the game as much as other players. Speaking of players the player base may still be huge but it has fallen considerably and those that leave are the more casual players. The overall skill of the pool feels much higher than even a few months ago meaning that if you are new this game is much tougher to dive into than before. The game can certainly be fun (there's a reason for the hours I have) but there are issues the developer seems unable to address. Instead they focus on monetization with crates and passes. These days my friends and I still have fun games but they are less frequent than before including for those who have only started more recently. That said if I saw real progress on the issues and less focus on monetization I would recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Loved this game! I loved that you had no tutorials and you just have to learn everything by yourself. Well now there's plenty of videos on youtube explaining how to use every weapon. It's a hard game with a lot of excitement when you're in a top 10. It's not perfect of course there's still server problems like lags that allowed your ennemy shoot you 1 or 2 times while you're behind a wall. There's still cheaters but I found one rarely. Very addictive and I will keep playing it and getting better! Very funny when you play with your mates in squad! And if you're solo queu you might fnd funny guys. Rarely played with really salty guys. Don't take it seriously and have fun!

review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because this game gave me cancer anyway.

review: I was really excited when i first saw this game I think it is an excellent concept that has been poorly executed..I am very disapointed in this game so far it is an incomplete buggy game I understand it is early access but they are releasing the game on console before even getting the game to a remotely playable state on pc.The updates are months and months apart I believe the last 2 updates were released 6+ months apart and instead of fixing most of the bugs glitches and optimization they are releasing new guns maps and vehicles. I dont believe I have played a single game without running into some pretty serious/ annoying issue. I found running the game on the lowest possible settings got rid of half of the issues but its already such an ugly game I could hardly justify lowering graphics to make the game run slightly better. Basically after 30 hours I gave up on the game and will not be back until i see some serious overhauling.

review: When I bought this game I had high hopes. I played a bit and quickly got a team together with my firends. For the first (roughly) ten matches it was fun. Eventually the game became mostly running and getting shot. Depending on your play style and skill you could avoid this (I could not as I was bad) but that isn't really the complaint I have with this game. The main complaint I have is trying to play with my friends and having the game crash well over 5 6 times. You could get the game running with enough determination but honestly it is not worth it. There are many other battle royal games that are actually functional (fornite). Just go play that game if you like this type of gameplay.In conclusion The game has good mechanics if you like battle royal games. But is nearly unplayable with the crashes and lag. You would think that with only 5 days until the full game is released the developers would have made it more stable. If you are considering buying this game do not.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well worth the money. I've almost played this game every day since I've bought it in early access. Ridiculous value for money given how much replayability this has. Even though it's exactly one of two scenarios every time (desert or original map) it still feels fresh due to the unpredictability of other players. I've spent a lot of time playing all the other battle royale styled games prior to this and this is the leader by a long shot. After watching an interview with Brendan Greene (the creator of PUBG / Battle royale format) I have a whole new perspective and appreciation for the game. It takes time and skill to perfect such a large map with such high player numbers.If you're on the fence about buying please just do it it's insane value for the price. I wouldn't be upset if this game had cost me $50+ I've paid much for games I've played a lot less of.

With upto 100 people in each game you are likely to run into a hacker every single time. For what it is the price of this game is very steep. so it makes no sense that someone would hack only to be banned and waste the 20 + quid that they have payed to play it.Honestly if you're thinking of buying this on PC... I would urge you to reconsider. That is unless you like looting/death simulators

review: GAMEPLAYYou can play this game solo duo or squad. If you play solo you have two options. Drop in populated areas and probably die before the first 5 minutes of the game or drop where nobody else is and run for 20 minutes not seeing a single person only to get shot and killed and not even know where it came from. Do not play solo if you are easily angered. You will undoubtedly end up enraged. If you have poor self control you will probably break your monitor. I learned that the hard way. Duo and squad is a lot and I mean A LOT more fun. Having friends to play with makes pretty much every game better but in my opinion it is an absolute necessity for PUBG. As long as you don't take the game too seriously and are playing with friends (and don't experience any of the techinical/optimization issues or bugs listed below) you will probably have a good time and only rage a little bit. On the other hand if you play solo I doubt you will have any fun at all. OPTIMIZATION/SUPPORTThis is probably one of the most poorly optimized games I have ever played. Horrible hit detection ping spikes rubber banding and tons of latency is common for a lot of players. Despite having a decent PC (GTX 1050 i7 Core 16 gigs of ram) and the fastest internet plan my provider offers (300mbps) I have experienced those problems before. Those problems don't occur every time you play the game but they will happen every once in a while. Now lets talk about the devs. Man are they COMPLETE garbage. I know people who have been banned because a they killed a popular streamer and that streamer accused them of hacking even though they werent hacking. Not to mention all of the stupid micro transactions and the recent "Battle Pass". The devs are so busy trying to milk their players for every last penny and suing their competition (Fortnite) that they won't even fix their own f*cking game. The funniest part about this is that before they could even fix the optimization and bugs in the PC version of the game they tried to port it to the Xbox. Needless to say it is probably one of the worst if not THE worst port in the history of video games. If that doesn't scream that the devs only care about the money then I don't know what does. F*ck you Bluehole. YOU MADE OVER $720 MILLION SO STOP TRYING TO MAKE MORE MONEY AND USE THE MONEY YOU ALREADY MADE TO FIX YOUR GAME. Watch this YouTube video. It pretty much goes over everything wrong with PUBG. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v Ns3bp2yWA1MMY THOUGHTSDespite all of its te al issues bugs atrocious optimization and pretty much always getting angry playing it my friends and I always find ourselves coming back for more. Our conversations usually go along the lines of "Hey what should we play?" "I dont know." "PUBG?" "I f*cking hate that game though." "Yeah its pretty garbage.""We got nothing else to do though.""So yeah?" "Sure. But still f*ck this game" This game is like a drug just like League of Legends. You get so god damn angry playing it (particularly in solos) yet you always come back for more. I really want to not recommend this game but for some reason I cant bring myself to click that thumbs down.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Oh PUBG. How the mighty have fallen. This WAS one of the most fun battle royale games to play with quite the active community that had so much potential to be one of the best games on steam. But that potential was squandered by BlueHole by attempting to copy elements of Fortnite while simultaneously suing Epic Games claiming that Fortnite copied them. I remember back in late 2017 and early 2018 when all of my friends and I would hop on this game together and enjoy a couple rounds to try and get that Chicken Dinner but from the looks of it those days are all but over. The servers are full of cheaters and hackers that make the game unplayable. Bugs are still rampant and the developers don't care about anything but making money. But one of the biggest slaps to the face was the Battle Pass system and loot crate design. Expecting people to pay $10 USD on top of the $30 USD for the base game for a buggy cobbled together piece of trash is just insulting and the current loot crate system is just a shameless ripoff of other systems like CS GO except this one is poorly put together and not fun to utilize. As much fun as I had with this game in the past I cannot recommend it in it's current state due to careless developers cheaters bugs/glitches and overall horrible experience. As much as I hate to say it you're probably better off playing Fortnite at this point.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is far too camper friendly and RNG based to be a good battle royale game. All of the spawns of the guns vehicles and the zone are completely RANDOM. As soon as you get into any kind of action in gunplay the entire map knows where you are leading the players to not want to engage into any gunfights. The risk of engaging enemy players is never worth the risk as killing them and achieving their loot is probably not worth it. Despite battleye the game has far too many hackers that come in especially from China. Battlegrounds has also banned people for "stream sniping" by killing someone who is streaming the game without ANY evidence whatsoever in the past before match replays and recordings. They cater too much for their streamers and make it so that they are the only one who have CUSTOM GAMES. The price of the game is currently at $30 yet it is still unoptimized and unfinished and broken as hell. Why would anyone buy this game AT ALL when you can get other battle royale style games like H1Z1 and Fortnite for free.

review: Honestly to play this game you need to have the right computer specs. I'm writing this review based on my own gameplay. If you can stand the constant spewing of asians screeching and memes in the pre game lobby then you're on your way to a good time. I enjoy the pop culture cancer that erupts from that environment. Once you're in game if you have above average specs you can expect to see loot from when you pop your parachute but if not you have to wait till you land and on top of that hide in a corner for 15 30 seconds until everything renders. Then you may proceed to loot the scraps left behind by the professional e sports ready players with $3 000 Titan Vs. After all this you can put your sheer raw talent to the test. With my case this game has come a long away after nearing 500 hours on it and I can safely say it's my favorite game on steam. I strongly recommend it with all the memeing aside it's honestly a good game with devs that are slowly working on making it better although it's taking forever they truly listen and do try to listen to the community. They've shown that before and although the hype has died down because of fortnite this game still has all the potential to be the best game on the market. Currently they're working on a 3rd map but in my opinion I think what they need to work on is movement and fluidity because the game still feels really clunky and slow which some people might enjoy because it resembles reality. I prefer a fast paced corner cutting edgy feel that puts you to the test when bullets are flying at you.All in all with the current state of the game I give it a *************************** 7.5/10 ***************************.This is because I'm used to the game and the mechanics. Note for new players This game is hard to get into because people are already good. Don't give up when you get shot from out of nowhere this happens all the time. All you have to do is discover the common spots people go to and to always keep an eye on your surroundings. Use the keybind for free look and set it to something comfortable because I honestly use free look more than my left mouse button! The key to winning in this game is to see your enemy before they see you and to position yourself with an advantage. Always think before you shoot.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: ## EVENT PASS ##I immediately bought the event pass because I thought it was a nice addition to the game.Finally I could enjoy getting nice items without having to gamble but by actually playing instead....or so I thought.Those 10 will get a low skill player like me nothing but a grind he can't win. The event takes only 30 days and there are 30 levels (400xp each). That means you would need to get at least 1 level every day in order to get your money's worth. And yes Since I paid for it I am at least entitled to a very good chance of getting all the items.400xp/day don't sound that much but most of the missions reward only 40xp. A "Premium" User who purchased the Event Pass does get a bonus to daily XP from just playing but that bonus is laughable at best. Instead of the standard 80xp/day we should be able to get 400xp/day in the same amount of time it takes non premium users to get 80xp.I don't understand why they need to milk PC players in such a disgusting way. These "pay to have a chance" tactics should be reserved for their mobile version.I'm ing MAD.I thought this event pass will push PUBG to the next level but instead it died in the red zone while using a bandage.

review: I don't understand all this negativety. I'm certain some of it is valid but most of it is just little heads getting mad over nothing. The game is amazing. The only major flaws it has that actually effect gameplay are a lack of optimization and occasional and random server lag. Outside of that it's really ing good. I'm not saying there are no other valid criticisms but those seems to be the major ones from sound minded people. I feel bad if you got unjustly banned from the game but before you got banned how many hours of gameplay did you have on the game? For most it's a whole lot of hours most of which was a positive experience. I know it's still unjust that they banned you(if it was invalid) because it is your property after you buy it(that is of course as long as you don't violate their terms) but most people can't say they didn't get their money's worth out of the game. And did you try talking to support to get your account unbanned? I personally haven't talked to their support or know anyone that has but I really doubt they are mass banning people falsely. And if they were I doubt they would perma ban all those people. And for the people complaining about the microtransactions just shut the up. It's not like they are limiting gameplay. THEY ARE COSMETICS and most can be acquired by just playing the game. And if you can't get a certain item it's typically just 10 30 cents(of course outside of the really rare ones). They do the same in every other major shooter and yet no one complains there. How do you think they are going to monetize the game after launch? Map packs? That would separate the community and there wouldn't be a need to so long as they have harmless cosmetic microtansactions. I really do hate microtransactions but this is one of the few cases where they aren't out for your money purely out of greed. The game has lots of replay value and there is certainly going to be updates long after the full release thanks to these microtransactions. Not to mention they have frequently added to the game since it was put up on steam and continue to do so. In summary people gotta shut the up and enjoy the quality games served to them and stop supporting the ones that do even worse
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The Game itself is fun don't get me wrong. But it has been in beta so long people are starting to hack there way into the system and it just ruins it for everyone. Now no system is flawless but a good friend of mine was banned for no reason and yet I play with hackers every game now... One person landing and killing half the people in the first 2 minutes something's fishy. Lately there has been numberous updates that have done nothing but change the load up screen and the available weapons on the map. Graphics and physics still need some serious work for a game that has been out for over 7 months now with no real improvement.

review: Where to start? The game is broken in so many ways the optimalization is horrible and amount of those chinese ching chongs is just way to ing big. But aside from that (and the fact that there are free unity assets used in game XD) it has a huge potential and is incredibly fun with friends. Also the excitement when u are in top 5 then top 3 and finally u are 1 v 1 with the last guy in the zone is just something incredible ofc after some wins it is not so interesting but still worth time spent. 65 hours (at the time of writing this) isn't much but im going to spent much more time in this game with my m8's. The best actions happen with 3 4 man squads when u have 4 vehicles and decide to make a race to second part of the map cuz why not? The game has it's problems mainly 3 (but not only) horrible optimalization amount of cheaters (tho BattleEye is doing good job with purging them) and last but certainly not least the Miramar map.... i honestly don't understand why this map is in the game and why u can't turn off searching it in matchmaking. Remember Erangel&gt Miramar. The game doesn't forgive your mistakes the locations are interesting and offer multiple choices and random loot. Guns are really good looking and have that really nice semi realistic feeling to them some may say it is a flaw but not for me. If u read this u probably don't give a damn XD but still if u are interested if i recommend it here is the simple answer. No don't buy it it is not worth the money NOW as of July 2018.Update 10.07.2018Game is still broken still funny with other players but after considering how much money they got it is just disgusting that they did not fixed most of the bugs and performace drops. Also the map select option after it was added got removed cuz nobody played Miramar and it them so much that they needed to force players to play on it. Game is fun but don't buy it it does not deserve to be bought.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I believe this game will soon be forgotten about if they dont remove their lootbox system so the incentive for cheaters to make a quick buck wont exist anymore I think customization and the ability to have unique clothing is great even let the players sell the rare clothes between eachother...WITHOUT BLUEHOLE TAKING MORE MONEY FOR THEMSELVES. NONE OF THIS MONEY HAS GONE INTO THE RECENT DEVELOPEMENT OF THE GAME. Their needs to be new maps every month WITHOUT copied structures pasted all over the map...complet with new guns vehicles and even enviromental dangers to beware of such as cold or radiation...after all this is supposed to be a survival game at its core. Personally I think the game is better off without hunger or thirst mechanics so its great they havent made that mistake yet. I think what Im trying to say is USE YOUR MONEY TO PUSH THE GAME INTO A REAL EXPERIENCE OR CREATE A PUBG2 WITH A BETTER DEVELOPMENT TEAM. Like star citizen is taking some time too but you can see the work they are trying to do and PUBG has 1 major update from last year that seems like a ENORMOUS mistake and even though Bluehole has to know people are starting to look at their game as if it is maybe the biggest joke(middle finger) to every single player in the gaming community they seem as if they have intentions to give us what we really want to play. A TRUE BATTLE ROYAL PUBG MAY NEVER BE.

review: An absolute disgrace in video game form.The game is terrible. Sluggish slow horribly paced terrible performance hackers everywhere desync horrible map design bugs galore paid lootboxes EVERYWHERE long queue times loot spawns are abysmal god awful mechanics across the board I mean seriously are they trying to run this game into the dirt?It's like the playerbase doesn't exist. They continuously add new content (mostly stuff NOBODY asked for) instead of fixing their damn game. How long has #fixPUBG been a thing? Like a ing year. When we say fix PUBG we don't mean add more loot boxes. I seriously do not understand what this game turned into.Actually I do. It's another company that values cosmetics marketing and money making more than they value the structural integrity of their own game.I don't want to touch this game ever again. It's like playing the same game it was over 2 years ago. I have absolutely no clue how Bluehole managed to mess this game up THIS badly. PUBG Corp. When you're done with this game I would stop. Like forever. You've shown everyone over the past two years that you cannot handle making a solid game in a genre YOU helped create. And now you're seeing that tons of other companies are FAR more capable and willing to create a great battle royale game that is actually fun to play and WORKS. Unlike yourselves where all you care about is what's in the next paid loot box or what Shrouds next skins will look like. Your priorities are completely off track. And for that I cannot support you as a company.Uninstalled. Blackout here we come baby.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The main thing I think they should consider is a ranking system because the matching system matches beginners up with maybe lots of professionals so I think you devs should also use a bit of what the mobile game does by matching people with similar skills. I struggled a lot in the early parts of when I played the game so having a beginner system would really benefit me and a lot of people still needing guidance on the game.About the battle pass and stuff like that I am not bothered by skins battle passes and other purchasable items in the game because I don't buy in game products and I play this game because it's fun not a game where you customize your characte by using real money. review: Product received for free. The game is fun and my favorite BR to play regularly. Bluehole had no idea that their game PUBG would be such a popular game. Ever since early access Bluehole has been playing catchup to fix bugs and add quality of life features. The game is fun and I recognize it has come a long way since the early days but I still have some pretty significant criticisms. 1. Lacking quality of life features2. UI is underwhelming and needs work3. Netcode/servers can be wonky occasionally4. Optimizations needed for smoother game5. There is no offline firing range for practicing and there is also no online custom servers for everyone. (Everyone not just pubg partners aka streamers Bluehole approves)6. Loot box system is beyond underwhelming and lame7. Movement on foot is sluggish and driving is deadly bananas in FPP. These mechanics need refined.8. Asking for money after every single patch.9. You'll feel the game's potential but don t expect a polished AAA experience now or any time soon. At least it is only $30 and a good time. It's just not a great time like it could be.

review: I went into this game excited to see what all the fuss was about. I played for a while dealing with constant framerate issues as low as 3 seconds/frame at times (yes you read that right) even on Very Low settings where the game looks like Half Life 1. My computer isn't a monster but I can play much better looking modern games with no issues whatsoever. I had no choice but to ask for a refund.On the gameplay side I didn't get a lot of time with the game so I can't say a lot. I don't understand how this game has gained so much popularity. It's a broken unfinished mess. It has very little in the way of content. It feels like one of the asset flip games that Jim Sterling would dunk on.This experience all comes right before the 1.0 update so maybe it will be better in the future. I don't know. Based on my experience I have to give it a big thumbs down. You might enjoy the game if your computer can handle it and you enjoy survival focused large arena shooters.

review: Would not buy this game if you're looking for a consistently good/reliable product of video game entertainment.PUBG is just like any other early access game that is being released these days. The game is an unfinished poorly optimized mess. Cannot play the game with graphics settings any higher than 'low' on an nvidia gtx 970. It's been like this for months. And instead of fixing tons of bugs/obvious issues that people have repeatedly complained about they try to grow the esports scene add weather modes to the games that are illogically designed and disregard essential improvements that need to be made to the game.I feel as though the only reason it is still popular is because of the amount of coverage it gets on streams and because there are no other similar battle royale games out there.

review: As a person who's put almost 200 hours into this game as of writing this review I am utterly disappointed with the product that's been released. A game that implements a ban system for hacking but only uses it to punish those who kill streamers is a terribly poor ban system. The North American server is dominated by wall hackers half the time it's impossible to land on the ground and immediately open a door and the only good thing about this game is the fact that I can laugh at it's terrible physics engine with my friends. I'm absolutely confident when I say this game is still in Beta yet it's apparently in "full release" but still it tries to pass itself off as the next "big competitive E Sports" game. The first PUBG competition left it's viewers completely off.Honestly Devs if you do even read these reviews. I hope you stop trying to tweak the gun balance in this game and actually start working on the real issues. Get the ban system to start working fix the terrible physics make it so people stop breaking their legs when parachutes get caught on invisible roofs and work on the hit box so bullets stop phasing through people. I don't know how many times I've shot completely through a person because of "lag" or another ridiculous excuse. This is just a bad game in it's current state.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: You see all the negative reviews that the game has and most of them do touch on important issues but the game is in EARLY ACCESS. Sure Bluehole could step up the game a bit but I feel like people are too critical of things. A large part of the game is understood through trial and error and pure common sense for example the game is only a walking/running simulator if a) you make it one OR b) you get unlucky. There are vehicles in the game guys... use them. If you can't find them learn potential spawns or drop in a more strategic area. Also you can mostly CHOOSE where and when you will get into combat again by learning from trial and error. and common sense. Dropping on the school combat and about 9 in 10 chance of dying within one minute. Drop somewhere secluded or go to high loot areas that aren't as popular depending on your drop zone (like the shooting range port town or even the bunker system if it's far enough away from the plane's path). See people expect an easy run but it just isn't like that especially near the end you just have to be persistent when you die and keep on going. Also try different modes. Play single player I find it much easier than duo or squad since people don't get downed and there is normally no teaming I average 5th place when I'm put into a single player game opposed to about an average of 20th place when I play with friends consistently. Or try a first person only server it makes the game surprisingly different and quite balanced in my opinion. And for the love of god don't play non stop. Some people can do it good on them but I personally need a break from multiplayer games sometimes. Consider a solid story based game and then re visit when a new update comes out or when you feel like playing again. The game is fun but just like any other it will get boring so instead of complaining about no new content do something else for a change. All in all I think it's worth it. Obviously the devs are going to keep the work up and they even plan a console release so that alone should justify the $30 (or whatever it costs for you). Get it now before it's a AAA title cost. I believe it's worth the money. Thanks for reading all of this hopefully I helped you make a choice in regards to purchasing or if you already own it maybe you learnt or thought of a new strategy! 40 hours playtimeAlso just a side note for the micro transaction haters if it isn't pay to win who cares? Just play the game and have fun. Most things on the Steam Marketplace can be obtained through playing the game.

review: So Ive given this game a go for the last few weeks and while I have mixed feelings overall I still kinda like it.First off lets be real this is a social game first and foremost and isn't always about getting that chicken dinner. I forget exactly what it was before the leaderboard was wiped but it seems maybe 20% of players EVER win a game. If you're a rich troglodyte kid amped up on redbul and sitting on a 1080 GTX system with a T1 connection I'm sure you'd have a blast going solo and wiping the floor with folks. For the rest of us though we neither have the hardware superiority nor the time to "get gud". This is where squad games come in.In my experience playing PUBG is best when playing with friends and getting into all sorts of hijinks (and dying... a lot). For the average aged gamer late 20's to mid 30's this game is pretty damn fun. It's pick up and play it's social and it has enough depth to give the option of getting REAAAALLY into it if you so choose. Hell it took me a month before I figured out going barefoot gave you a slight advantage when moving near enemy players.On the negatives The game engine is not even close to optimized if you're playing with less than 16GB of RAM and bleeding edge Mobo transfers (15 year old me would have a heart attack at this) your game is not going to run smoothly. The U.I. needs work developers are saying that this is a work in progress and will be changed but as of the open beta it's ugly as sin Community support is limited the Steam forums have been abandoned by the developers and their official forums are... unhelpful at best. NOTE If you play this game don't around with the engine unless you know how to code! The pacing of the game is kind of... meh. I think this will improve over time but as it is now you really need to go looking for a fight if you want one before final circle. This can be a good thing and will play to individual playstyles but the devs need to introduce more mechanics that encourage players to converge on an area before reaching final circle. In balancing weapons of the game devs seem to have relinquished realism and tried to gamify their mechanics. Of course this happens with any game but PUBG seemed to be different at first.The positives Excellent for social gaming (I've had some problems with adding friends and whatnot but I think this is a Steam issue rather than a problem with Bluehole) Depth and breadth of gaming experience THERE"S LOTS OF RANDOM TO DO and many different ways to play FPS elements are highly appreciated for those of us used to that experience versus 3rd person games there's a stark difference in playstyles between the 3rd person and 1st person servers that such a simple fix encourages a broader group of gamers to join in. Mechanics of the game may not be innovative but they are executed well.All in all I'd advise giving this game a shot if you have a weekend a few friends and a semi modern gaming rig. However I don't think this is a game worth making a system upgrade for or putting hundreds of hours of your life into it's decent but it isn't that dense.P.S. Hey Bluehole! You should offer 4 pack deals for your game! I can think of a dozen people that I would bring in for the experience if I could get them to have a taste.

review: This game is love/hate relationship really. If the game is going well for you and you're striving for greatness then hell yeah! On the other hand if the game is crashing and not going well then damn it!This game is honestly great fun I love the randomness of it and how different each game will be and that is one of the main reasons I keep coming back to it you never know how that match is going play out. You could win or be the first to die who knows!?There is a lot of skill involved but it didn't take me too long to really get the hang of the concept and which weapons to use or to not use etc. Just takes a little bit of expierence and time.I was really surprised by how crisp the game feels I mean It's not perfect but pretty dang good if you ask me. All the guns feel great and different etc.The sounds are incredible thrilling and very scary at times! Play the game on high volume if possible it's definetly the best way to play it.So the only thing I really dislike about this game is the crashes (they happen quite often compared to other shooters I've played). It's going to be different for everyone but for me it crashes about 1 or 2 times every 2 games or so. One thing that's nice though is that if you launch the game back quickly enough it will let you jump back in that match assuming you haven't died yet.Overall a very fun game that I recommend! Expect a very good time and a bit of frustration here and there.

review: PUBG is a very fun battle royale game with a lot of different weapons attachments and more. The objective is jump out of a plane flying over the map land loot kill and win. This game is also very laggy at times and there is little effort put into this game (at the moment) I am writing this review hoping that the new pubg update will make this game a lot better because lag is something that ruins the game for me at times.

review: This game offers a fresh take on battle royale style games. Each match is slightly different from the next and depending on where you choose to start the action can begin from the time you hit the ground to take out the players around you. Of course you do have the option to parachute to a location that is away from the chaos and simply try to stay low and survive. You'll want to loot quick and move across the map as the playable area becomes smaller and smaller.Although I'm not the best at the game it does offer a fun exciting gameplay that keeps me coming back.

review: Ladies and gents boys and girls I am here today to tell you about the brief rise and ever quicker fall of this game. Having just hit the 1000 hour mark for this game i can assure you that PUBG is not a bad concept in fact its rather great having some of the most satisfying gaming moments with friends that ive experienced for some time now. But thats all it is now a concept because behind the idea of this battle royale is an ever mounting problem involving key factors such as poor community support blatent and quite rampent plagues of cheaters a seemingly better but not quite polished net code / optimizations and the result of this? a dying player database. The corporate higher ups filled with the bloodlust of greed from their once financial gold mine cling at straws such as "we are taking legal action against fortnite for copyright infringement" and the "fix PUBG" campaign as a way to justify their laziness towards further meaningful updates and entisements to keep this game alive.I end with this whilst i do not regret my time invested into this game i simply no longer have the drive i once did to continue the grind for the glorious taste of a protein bird main course with friends.

review: This game is by no means perfect. There are flaws here and there with my main complaint being the servers can be randomly wacky and lag me outside of cover which is always annoying. There are other gripes you can make as well but honestly they ultimately dont matter enough to me for me to hate this game. This game is one of the best games I have played on my PC. Albeit this is my first battle royale game and im fairly new to PC gaming (about a year) so my opinion may be a little skewed however i have played all other AAA games on consoles etc and i do truly enjoy PUBG very much. Its really fun especially if you have a good amount of friends that can consistently play with you. The best feeling is having those 5 8+ kill games and ultimately getting that chicken dinner. The combat is great and fun and bluehole has made numerous optimizations to the game along with more to come. Of course the game is by NO means perfect but it is a truly enjoyable experience.

review: I personally think this game is pretty good but as far as overall score goes I give it a 6/10 here's why Pros Great with your friends if you want to spend the night gaming Great player match system it fits to your skill level Although combat does not have a whole lot of variety it is enjoyable to fight other players in a tight space which is usually where you will fight Map is nice and spacious for 100 players it does not at all feel claustrophobic like a lot of other similar games did Gets you on the edge of your seat and really feels rewarding when you get your chicken dinner especially in squad play One of the better Early acess games I have playedCons Weapon damage is inconsistant I have shot a person with a shotgun in the chest on two ocassions and they weren't wearing armor and one died instantly the other took three shts and they killed me in a couple with a pistol (starter weapon) Not a lot of variety to guns for the game it is nor attachments. You have to play this game on low graphics or you won't see S**t and get killed by players that will for sure see you in a field Little variety on vehicles there is only 3 MICROTRANSACTIONS (but honestly it isn't that big of a deal you don't get anything out of the crates anyways) Graphics sometimes don't load properly when you first drop (can be bad in a hot zone) and the game crashes ocassionally Chinese Players always are the hackers in the gameI don't have that much claim because I have less than 50 but overall wait till launch so they can Iron out the kinks in the game and shape up their buisness practices. Don't listen to too many people on here this is an early acess game after all.

review: I wish I could give this game a thumbs up. When I first played it the experience was magical Everything was suspenseful you were constantly thinking and planning your next move as the blue zone shrinked further and further and after hundreds of "almost there"s later you win your first chicken dinner. I know how mine was Adrenaline was pumping I was screaming and hollering and telling everyone how I finally won a game of PUBG.But over time I pretty much lost all interest.The system is horribly engineered. If you can get past the loading screen into the lounge and then into the game without crashing good luck not lagging horribly both client wise and network wise at the beginning of every game and every time you're near another player. How good of a rig you have barely affects this if at all. For a game that's announcing that they will soon be releasing "version 1.0" the whole experience still(!) feels incredibly pre alpha. And for a game that got so incredibly popular for a company that must be swimming in money at this point it feels very little effort is being put into making the game stable. Every time they publish release notes they talk about how they added this and tweaked that and all the bugfixes are rarely related to network connectivity and client stability but rather how they fixed various rare bugs where some object or action glitches out.It's been many months now and it hardly got any better. Not even Dice is this neglectful of their Battlefield franchise. Hell it sometimes feels that it actually has gotten worse. My experience with this game just keeps getting worse and worse I keep crashing and lagging more and more frequently and I don't want to play this game anymore.Wake me up when the PUBG gets its act together.

review: As of the time of writing this review I have over 200 hours played on Early access. I'd recommend the game overall. Obviously it's not perfect but it's very fun especially if you have friends to play with. The game is so intense especially when you're in the top 10. I've won a few games and it's so rewarding to win. Just knowing that you bested 99 other players. Now to name the problems. I have come across some obvious cheaters/hackers. And the Chinese players are overrunning the NA servers. This ruins grouping with randoms because you can't communicate. The game crashes sometimes and is terribly optimized. Being early access I can let that slide it does improve with every patch. Overall it's a great game and I would recommend this game.

Optimization is being worked on and will put your PC to the test however with the release of 1.0 they have optimized the game to run better and more optimization will be coming further in the future. If you are in between whether to buy this game or not just do it. It 110% worth the money!

review: The game is still in beta and the devs have already brought in the dreaded lootboxes. Now keep in mind they are just cosmetics but its clear to see where the intention of the developer lies. Horrible optimisation disgusting lagging even on my Legion laptop cheaters and hackers galore. This game was fun. The keyword being here *WAS*. BlueHole really needs to get it their priorities right otherwise this fun game will go through the same debacle that Star Wars Battlefront 2 already has. But from what I've heard i.e. Microsoft is planning on buying the game and I think the team don't count on it. Even if they have Microsoft the game might still be a mess. Remember Rare?Do not buy this game until and unless the glaring problems are fixed. The game has been in beta for some time now and yet the optimisation problem continues to persist.

review: lootboxes and season passes have went way to ing far with this game.1. The game was no where near completed2. The devs seem to refuse or ignore entirely where the game needs worked on the most dispite the fact money is no longer a object for the company.3. This game is not worth your time because it treats you like cow to milk.This game you have to pay up to 30 dallors for and it has microtransactions. The microtranactions were stated beforehand as something they weren't going to put into the game until full release. They had also promised by the time they came out with the microtransactions that they would be going free to play. niether promise was kept and early in the beta they crammed the microtransactions into it. This is not a product worth its price tag and it has yet to achieve that value. The player base is going to start falling rapidly unless something is done fast.

review: In it's current state the game is fun to play but is plagued with bugs and is in dire need of an optimisation patch.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a game about survival and the standard format of a BattleRoyale game.The one thing that makes this game stand apart from other games of the same genre is that each match feels unique and each match plays differently.PROS Amazing Virtual 3D Sound EngineBallisticsGunplayGameplayVisuals (to an extent)CONS Bad Performance (as of now)Gibberish Vehicle PhysicsServer instabilityBad UIHitboxesAs of now I'd say the game is far from being Perfect but for an Early Access game it's a lot of fun especially if you get that tasty Chicken Dinner

review: This game is what I would call a dynasty game this is reffering to dynasty warriors. Tant means that this game is only fun in short bursts and gets stale fairly quick. Another issue I have with this game is it's favortism to certin playstyles. A problem many modern shooter games have. I grew up a variety of fps games (doom halo TF2 before it became ) many of these games accomadated multiple playstyles whatever you want to play tacticly (halo/tf2) or if you want to just run and gun like there is no more bullets in the world (doom). This is a prime example to me of why steam needs a rateing system that does not only include thumbs up/down since it is a game I have a more meh feeling to.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly this is one of the most poorly created games I've played. I believe the server tic rate is approximately 17 and it shows grenades do not throw correctly shooting is a ridiculously off (e.g. someone will be holding still you shoot at their head with maybe 20 meters from them and it misses) and jumping over things is literally the hardest thing to do in this game. My understanding is that a vaulting update will be pushed soon and that's great! It's literally the first update I've seen done to this game since it was in beta (which by the way it basically is even though it's being sold as a full game). I'm upset with the network lag the delays in actions (shooting picking up items reloading) and I'm sure others are as well. I do NOT recommend this game until further patches are implemented.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I think the biggest knock on this game is that its STILL in early access.. It was suppose to be out of early access awhile back but it keeps getting extended. So i think the "despite early access" excuse is played it for this game at this point. It still suffers from crashes poor optimization and a horrible netcode. Bluehole seems to be scared of competition because they did not really enjoy fortnite getting into the foray. Wonder how they will feel if DICE ever feels like doing a Battle Royale?However it is extremely fun and that outweighs a lot of the negative aspects of the game. As those negative aspects dont make the game unplayable just frustrating.

review: It's got it's flaws but the overall fun is real.Steep learning curve hopefully some sort of training arena is put in so you can spawn into a solo event and try out all the guns shoot targets etc. Would go a long way.If you're just starting start with random out of the way areas to get a feel for looting. Then drop at hot spots (School or the Hacienda Del Patron). Die a lot try to learn to kill. The more you die the more you can learn. Use the Nvidia reply and the killcam to try to learn from your deaths.Look up tips for sensitivity for your mouse setting this up can help quite a bit if you have high sensitivity.I really enjoy the game solo duo and squad are all fun for different reasons.

review: My steam account was hacked all my PUBG items were sold off by the hacker and Steam acknowledged my account had been compromised and reset accordingly. Ha! If only PUBG had the same mind set they basically responded stating it s your account and the security is your responsibility. Imagine that cop out answer from your insurance company it s your house your responsible for it s security oh sorry I didn t expect someone to pick my lock and go in when I m out and steal all my belongings. I really think it s so poor how easy they pass judgement without any form of formal review just look at my stats.. I m not exactly doing well but love playing it with my friends. If steam have acknowledged my account was compromised and I sent this email to PUBG as proof of their response why will they not lift the ban. 5 mins of google and you will see this is an incident for MANY innocent victims and the general response from PUBG is we do t care you already paid out for the game at worst you don t play anymore and at best for us you make another account and buy it again and there s literally nothing you can do little man. DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THIS DEVELOPER. There are several petitions going online one is even up to 2256 signatures so it shows the frequency of this problem. Buy this game and you play the numbers game as if you get hacked they don t care it s your account and you suffer the consequences of someone else s actions.
