review: Pros Gunplay system is one of the best in the FPS genre (when it works) easy to learn hard to master Sahnok map is well designed and is a good change of pace compared to the slower Erengel and Miramar maps Erengel map still plays very well Weapon choice and balance is the best it has ever been most weapon serve a purpose throughtout the whole game Driving has improved a lot Killing people and winning games still have a great feelingCons Network performance is still extremely poor game breaking at times Desync is very apparent at the beginning of matches also game breaking at times UI is buggy and fails to work consistently especially when playing with others Miramar map is poorly designed far too large and far too many empty areas Game optimization is still very poor you must turn most of the settings to low or very low to get semi high frame rates Graphics look very dated big improvement from early access but this game can't even run on Ultra so I guess it's for the best Event Pass is a walmart branded Fortnite Battle Pass except it isn't "great value" Bluehole sues Epic Games for "copying their game" Player base is decreasing due to everything above Would I reccomend at this time?Hell no I'm only on this developed game beacuse I've been on it since the beginning. I will see it through while it last.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Been with the game since Alpha.My review here is mixed. As it currently stands I cannot recommend buying this game. I chose a negative review in order to so my displeasure with the progression of this game. And to put pressure on the Dev to listen to its consumers. This game is a blast to get if you just want something to play with your friends. Its High pace exciting and can be quite comical but only when the game/server let you be. I say that because the game still has a long way until it s an AAA game. With poorly optimized maps and servers to FPS and Desync problems it can really break the immersion in during critical. Nothings more of a boner killer then when you are in the middle of a firefight or an instance moment and rather than have a satisficed conclusion win or lose you die because of something outside of your control. Moving away from the playable aspect of the game the other issues is with PUBGs choice to implement hard paywalls for content and Season Passes that unlock more content is when the game is in need of bug fixes and optimization. If at anything Keys &amp Creates should be purchasable for in game currency rather than actual money. If people want to spend actual money so be it. But the price to unlock said Create is pretty steep if you think about it $2.50 for a single key for a random create for random rewards most of which you will get duplicates for. And guess what? You then get to recycle that item for in game currency to buy ONLY a create. There is no other way to unlock said Creates. Only get the game if you got someone to play with. Otherwise stay away as it not worth it to play solo dolo.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Changing my review unfortunately. My original review is below the dotted line.Game has issues. One is cheaters read anyone's review and you already know that. Next up is terrible hit registration. Anyone with a high ping gets compensated on the server end which ends up with a dead player if he has a low ping. The really need to ping cap their servers.Next issue their bandwidth. Their servers are buried usually 25+ hops into Amazon's network. Amazon cheap bandwidth and it shows. Any ping of 100 or more means when you finally land you'lll be in a sort of LAG as the textures load meaning you get a delay/stuttering on looting and a few seconds later someone killed you with a pistol.This game needs 4 core elements to be playable by the masses 1 Get rid of the cheats2 Better netcode/hit registration3 get their servers off of Amazon's cheap solution. Amazon is fine for data not for gaming.4 Add in a fully stocked training area. FFS this is 2018... FPS games should have this by default. Like the fast action Unreal engine. Nice maps fun game.Dislike high amount of hacks/cheats being used by other players but not as bad as people are saying but noticeable none the less. Also dislike NO training area to aquaint oneself with the weapons physics UI and mouse settings and graphic settings. Last dislike is the poor optimization. Max GPU usage in the Lobby. Video stuttering happens often.Overall I think patience is due while the DEV's work on optimization/performance and whittling down the cheaters. NEEDS a training area badly.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Not the first and not the last Battle Royale but this is the on everyone tries to be. You never know what you are going to get your self into when you pick a place to drop in. This game isn't for everyone. It has a bit of a slower tactical pace to it. It is best with a group of friends to work together with and joke around with during the slow moments. It isn't without it's issues either. Server lag and random bugs will pop up and probably get you unfairly killed more than once. But if you take into account the scale of this game these things are bound to happen. The developers seem to continually be working on the issues and adding content along the way. Even with all the issues this is the game most of my friends get together to play.

review: Ok ive seen a thousand reviews saying "this game requires a high end pc" and what not but they're full of I play PUBG at 60 80 fps low very low settings with an amd rx 460 2gb card and a amd fx8320 (a 400$ pc) and its playable and enjoyable. And about the bugs and glitches yea the exist but you only really get them 1 out of like 500 games. Also the netcode isnt that bad it can be laggy at times (most notably at the start of the match) but for the most part its fine.All in all the games not perfect but its fun can be competetive and actually requires skill to play a solid 8/10 from me.

The FPS has increased drastically after the last patches desync has not often been a problem for me and I seldom encounter cheaters (EU FPP). I have no clue why everybody is complaining yet they put tons of hours into the game they seem to hate so much. I suppose that many players crying about desync are just too bad adapting to the mechanics of the game. Stop ing whining and play something else if you don't like the game. PUBG is far from dead.

review: After the last two months ive seen a decline in care with this game. So i've decided that I would re write my review and not recommend this game. In all honesty I love the concept for this game the military / Arma tone in a battle royale with pretty decent gun play. A lot of fun for the first 20 hours or so. Amazing concept. The main gripe about this game that is killing it is the lack of care from the devs. Not enough bug fixes server support half the time is awful because they are too cheap to pay for actual servers. A recent influx in hackers and now the battle pass that costs another 10$ over a 30$ game. Two months ago with the kind of constant and slow updating I had hope maybe they would fix the game and make it the game that we all want and at one point it was going in that direction. But ever since bluehole decided to sue fortnite and try and get more money it was appearent that all they had cared about all of this time was money. Ill say it again great concept and after two years its a pretty alright game to play half the time but with it still being in its alpha esq state and just a cash grab for the developers I sadly cannot recommend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've had a long time to play have good times and a lot of bad times. Today I hit my breaking point. Played a game and right in the middle of a battle with a buddy BOOM! the game crashed! You can imagine the emotions running through me. This was after countless encounters in which my shots would not connect no matter how on target the reticle was. I also recently experienced a moment when I was running from the danger zone and bam! I was victim to kar98 headshot from no where. I'm thinking wow! someone has some skill. I followed by watching the deathcam. I was amazed by what I saw. A player way behind me catches a glimpse of me sprinting for my life. He proceeds to pull out the sniper and take aim. His aim was literally (at least) 15 20 feet behind me. Once the shot was taken my body falls to the floor. Split seconds later you see the player fling his aim to the right thinking oh that shot was off until he stood their for about 5 seconds. I would imagine he was stunned.Anyways here is how I really feel about this game. There is so much potential. However the game is so far from production ready. 1.) Why is this game so heavy into graphics?! I don't give two s# ts how good the environment looks. I just want a competitive and fun experience.2.) Please clean this game up!!!!!!!!! Countless times have I watch deathcams and seen someone clearly have a (I guess you could call) lag advantage. I don't have a chance if I'm literally spraying bullets in a controlled pattern around a corner and someone pokes their head out and gets to spend 4 seconds shooting to get the kill! WTF!!!!!3.) Weapon pick ups. Some games are clean but not very many. I should be able to pick a gun up instantly. The pick up abilities are terrible even when doing so in the inventory screen. I've lost many battles just because it would take 4 or 5 seconds to pick up a dang gun!Honestly I know I said this game has potential but this is a sorry excuse for a battleground game. Please either gather a team that knows what they are doing. This game should provide almost a perfectly even playing field for everyone. Right now it is very lopsided.Sincerely Robert
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG has some of the best shooting mechanics in any game. The weapons all feel very different from each other with the esceptions of a few pistols the recoil is very easy to control and every kill you get feels very satisfying. Most of the bugs have been ironed out in the recent patches and the servers feel much better with the recent update they got. The only parts that are noticibly buggy are landing around many buildings/trees or trying to pick items up using the pickup key and not the inventory. In conclusion PUBG is fun the bugs are not as bad as people make it out to be and its fun to shoot things

review: So let's get one thing clear before I do this I NEVER REVIEW GAMES LIKE EVER... I can't stand trying to put my seemingly austistic screeching down in type (sorry if that offended you but its my honest opinion about MY thoughts sometimes). With that out of the way here I go...1. This game is AMAZING to play with friends and can really let you get involved in learning how to work as a 2 4 man squad. You can devise tactics flank oponets bang &amp clear etc etc freaking etc... With you and a squad of your besties you are gonna have a blast FOR SURE.2. You ARE going to need a therapist after playing this game for just a few hours. "Why?" you may ask... Imagine some of the most ludicris deaths you can that would just tick you off to no end... THEY WILL HAPPEN! e.g. Headshot death by crossbow from 500+ yards? Check. Self Inflicted grenade death from magic boomarang gernades? Check. Insta Teleportation to over 9000 miles into the air followed by the inevitable fall from heaven? Kablooey Check. No joke people if you can dream it up just give it time and watch the magic of imaginary physics take hold of your game.3. Do NOT let your kids play or play near you if the all channel mic option is on and you aren't wearing headphones. What noise will grace you or your kids ears? Single handedly the most vile toxic racist and hate filled sewer wateresque garbage you wouldn't dream up in your worst nightmare. Not that I care but if you tend to get hurt fee fees easy best to beware. (LOOKING AT YOU guy who chases darker colored characters around screaming... well... yea...)D. Lastly while this game has been some of the most fun I've ever had I am in complete agreement with all the negative reviews that have been spiking. HACKERS ARE KILLING THIS GAME! So I personally am putting this game away until I start hearing some amazing reports about these guys getting VAC banned or hardware banned. I've been magic killed too many times to even consider dealing with #2 again.Yo BlueHole come hit me up when you fix this garbage. I'll be waiting to play another 80 hours until then.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: More functional than H1Z1 KOTK less functional than Fortnite. But you know how the old saying goes if you can't beat 'em try and sue the hell out of them out of spite.When PUBG came out it was the big head honcho of BR games almost instantly dethroning H1 as the go to BR game. And if I'm going to be honest it was actually pretty fun for the first few hours. However it wasn't without faults. It uses Battle eye anticheat which is about as effective as using a window screen to filter water. So there's random hackers everywhere. Bullet hit registration (hit reg) is wonky at best having shot someone in the leg (with included blood splatter) only to have not even actually hit them at all. You can crash into a tree or a drop crate with a car and kill whoever's on the other side because the game de synches so badly. Shotgun pellet spread is so horrendous that you should just leave the game if that's all you can find. Landing fights while still a complete crapshoot are more balanced than fortnite's. In fortnite all weapons have set damage and specs based on rarity meaning if that across the street finds a rifle and all you have is a grey pistol you may as well disconnect. In PUBG however unless that person manages to find a helmet or body armor you actually stand a chance if you find a beretta and they have an M4. The PUBG devs are incompetent tools. They'd rather sue someone over "taking their idea" than they would implement more original content into their own game. This isn't the name you want for a company but it's the one they have now. Then they have the nerve to attempt and copy Fortnite's "battle pass" system with none of the rewards or incentives then wonder why noboby bought it. I'm not a Fortnite fanboy by any means I haven't even touched the game since season 4 but as it stands as the one of the only 3 BR games its really the only comparison to quality standards I can make. Fortnite is free unique and most importantly actually works. If Bluehole would just take the time to fix everything instead of adding new outfits crates keys maps and a 9 gigabyte update every week I'm certain that PUBG can become an exceptional game.There's an actual adage that goes "Winners focus on winning losers focus on winners" and that's exactly whats happening between Fortnite and PUBG Bluehole is so focused on the numbers that fortnite is taking from them that they're more concerned about trying to kill the competition than actually improving their own player experience. Until they pull their collective heads out of their asses my review will stay negative.

review: PUBG is one of the most elegantly designed shooters ever created. Here s how it works up to a hundred unarmed players parachute down into a vast map. They find weapons armor and vehicles. As time passes the safe play area shrinks forcing players into the same region of the map. The last person alive wins.Basically anyone can jump in and have a meaningful experience. Everyone starts in the same vulnerable situation and every kill is significant. Winning or being the last person standing is immensely difficult but since the scoring system is so simple it s always tempting to try to improve your ranking next time. And PUBG isn t shy about including elements of luck even the most skilled player might find themselves landing in an area oddly bereft of weaponry beyond a frying pan and getting rifled in the back.Every time I ve managed to be one of the last ten players remaining has been among the most intense gaming experiences of my life. Everything you do becomes a small but profound decision. Do you wait inside that room and stay safe for now but risk having to blow your own cover when the play area gets smaller? Do you attack that other player now or hope she doesn t notice you and wanders into a more compromised position down the line? Do you draw attention to yourself by using a loud vehicle to cover more ground or can you make it to the safe zone in time while keeping quiet?#lowkeyaddictedtoPUBG

review: The people that give this negative reviews don't really know what they are talking about. People complain about how there are so many pubg. I rarely encounter bugs at all not nearly as often as people describe them to be. Almost all the time the bug doesn't affect anyone at all. They wont intefere with the game. Even if there is a bug that makes you die once in a blue moon that shouldn't make PUBG the worst game in the world.This isn't fornite either. There is little to no aim assist. If you died and the other person didn't well then it's not because the game didn't "read your shots". You just didn't hit the person. PUBG is much more realistic than fortnite. You need to be accurate and there is much more strategy than fortnite. Unlike fortnite all guns have ADS(basically scoping in). This makes aiming so much more important. And if someone is shooting at you you can't build a wall. You need to be able to aim or you're dead.Lots of people complain about FPS simply because they didn't look into the game enough. This game is graphics card heavy and you will need an ok computer overall to run this game. I have a very solid computer and max out on FPS on the highest settings. You dont need a 1080 ti to run the game but you can't use something garbage. I will admit there used to be a lot of hackers. USED TO. The problem today isn't hackers. It's the death cam making people look like hackers. The death cam and spectating are all messed up and it looks like the person doesn't have a line of sight even though they do. People see this and think everyone that kills them is hacking. You died. Get over it. At this point fortnite probably has more hackers than PUBG. When you first buy the game you can't expect to win. Most likely you wont even get a single kill. As you keep playing and playing you will get better and better getting more and more kills. Maybe even get that Chicken Dinner. Take the time needed to get better and the game will get addictive.There is still much to be done for this game to get better but it is still one of the best games i've ever played. The realistic feeling you get is unlike any other game. The feeling when there is just one other person besides you left is uncomparable. I would totally recommend this game. You won't regret it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After playing a lot more in the past few weeks and the devs actively fixing stuff I can finaly change this review to positive. I can also not agree with all the people on here crying about chinese cheaters because I have never seen one in game. Performance is okay now and the lags and netcode aren't even remotely as bad as they were a few months ago.So now I can recommend this game to anyone who's looking for a good BR game. And with the incoming passes there will also be a lot more incentive to actually play the game.I thought the old "reward" system was pretty bad and I'm way more comfortable to hand out 10$ once and get a few skins that I can unlock through continous playing than buying stupid keys for stupid lootboxes which give me ugly at random.

review: TL DR Poor optimization and a money hungry developer make this game a piece of trash. Don't buy it it is not worth the money (anymore)When I first got into this game it was early access. I loved it. I didn't have problems with bugs here and there because it was early access. When playing some time I could buy and open a lootbox and actually felt rewarded ( even tho the items were always some boring crap it still felt like I was getting something.Now almost one year after I started this game is a sad heap of ****. You can't enjoy the game because of hackers (not every game but the frequency of hackers is too high). The performance is still even wit ha high end pc I still run into lag (not on my side my internet connection is godlike) and bugs. You still can't drive cars on normal terrain without suddenly dying (especially motorcycles). And the worst part is you get NOTHING there is nothing to strive for. You get this ingame currency for winning which you can spend on a lootbox a lootbox that comes from a pool of boxes more than half of which are locked behind a paywall (you need to buy a key). I already have 10 locked boxes sitting around ( would be a lot more if I'd be still playing this game). Furthermore even if you buy a key the drop chances are so abysmally it isn't even worth it most of the time it's just money thrown out the window. Now they'll introduce a progression system in the form of an event pass. BUT IN ORDER TO GET YOU HAVE TO PAY 10 BUCKS.This pitiful excuse for a finished game already costs 30 bucks . They already made so much money BUT THEY CAN'T STOP MILKING IT. I have lost all respect for this company they reside along EA and Activi$ion in my book. I always thought Brendan (playerunkown) himself was a gamer who had a vision and surely his creation wouldn't turn into this moneyhungry monster that gamers despise. But here we are. VERY dissapointed in you Brendan. And very dissapointed at everyone else making the financial decisions. Shame on you.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'd highly recommend leaving this terrible game aloneWas an alright game however the terrible shooting mechanics lack of updates no meaningful content for months and now the game descending into a horrid cash cow they re planning on adding a subscription service for some reason when they ve easily made well over $100 millionBluehole the developers of PUBG are doing exactly what they did with TERA they re going down the same route of hiding new content behind pay walls and barely updating the game wouldn t be surprised if they start pulling older content out of the game soonYou re not gonna miss much if you pass up on PUBG it s just a bad unbalanced battle royale there s like 50 million more out there try and arena shooter or something they re usually more fun and chaotic

review: Bevezetés * Az egyik legnehezebb Multiplayer játék valaha. Akinek inkább a CS GO s vonal a zsánere és nem biztos hogy pénzt szeretne áldozni a játékra az ne vegye meg. A játékról * Tele van bugokkal és még e sport ready nek akarják kinyilvánítani. Ha így halad a játék akkor egy darab szemét lesz ami játszhatatlanul tele lesz kijavítatlan hibákkal. Minden update ban több bug jön mint bugfix majd próbálják kicsi de sok update el kifixálni a bugokat de ezt a mennyiséget lehetetlen. 7500 Ft az ember pénztárcájából. A csapatról * Rendkívül undorítónak tartom hogy amúgy egy eddig 100% ig indie csapat sikeres lett egy (amúgy zseniális koncepcióval rendelkező) játékkal majd szentesítik le sem tervezik árazni (csak egy adott mérföldkőnél árazták itt Steam en én is akkor vettem meg) mondva hogy a játékuk túl jó és ezért örökre fullos áron fogják adni. Felkéne nyitni a Tencent szemét nagyon gyorsan. A közösségről * Egész jó ez mondjuk példaértékű. Összegzés * Maradok a Fortnite nál valahogy jobban tetszik a Dev ek hozzáállása a játékhoz és a Fortnite szerintem sokkal zseniálisabb. review: simple and fun survival battle royale gameplane drops 99 players off on island (you choose when to drop) and everyone runs around frantically trying to grab gear. haven't seen any crafting. after a few minutes a circle is drawn on the island and you have a couple minutes to get inside or die from electric storm. on a regular basis that circle shrinks and the storm pulls in.if you live long enough the circle is down to the size of a large room so the final battle is inevitable. the pace is fairly quick so games go quickly. 99 players and good chunk of lag. playercount always at the top of your screen showing your progress.lots of suspense and dopamine. some cosmetic progression. Anytime you're in the open you worry about being sniped but it doesn't happen much because people don't want to give away their position. You don't really have that much health even with armor and a helmet (with face cover otherwise face shot owns you) so anyone can feasibly kill you. Useables generally require channeling.

review: PUBG has become a huge hit and has topped the charts of the most played game. The game itself is thrilling and exciting. It's especially fun when playing with friends in a party. In spite of this the game needs many improvements. There are just too many game breaking bugs. Some mechanics need to be fixed to make the gaming experience better. Despite the mediocre graphics quality it can have annoying lag spikes even on high end PCs. You will also experience the occasional team killers and hackers.PUBG is still at its early stage. With some improvements the game will undoubtedly be the top of its class. For now I'm just eager to see what it has in store for us!

review: Hi I bought this game when it was still on Early Acces I liked it instantly it offered something different for me that i had never feeled before. Start looked good with the updates and stuff and no one took this game seriously at the start. ( Okey maybe i did bit bcs i wanted in scoreboard's) I was top 50 sometime)I think first mistakes was the anticheat system because it took so long to come. Im glad its somewhat fixed now.You do sometimes still encouter a cheaters but its better.I didnt like that u blocked the trading either it makes u seem more money hungry and wanting people to open more boxes( I think it was partly because the Chinese cheaters farmed BP and then sold them for earnings )I was really excited for Miramar from the videos it was beatiful atleast for me but then the truth hit me.So many houses with literally nothing in them i covered more house ground than entire RozHok and still had pistol and some bad loot. And the circle would fk me badly if i tried to go for "Safe Loot" Witch i dont really do but this wasn't fun and thats what this should be about I dont really like that u removed fog either i was really liking it. It brought whole another playstyle you could sneak up to players and stuff it was fun. Why did u add 6x scope? No one asked for them. They were what i call "Useless Update" simply because that time there was alot more critical things to address.Also i think you'r devs handled accusations by Mr.Grimmz towards other players unfairly.( This was long time ago )I love Shroud and so does alot of people but if you have rules you need to follow them yourself aswell.I dont think StreamSniping is allowed by rules and Shroud stream's literally everyday so why didnt u ban them?It was probably due to marketing trick. And that also makes u seem bad in my eyes. I know company needs money I do really. But rates on the "Rare" drops are insane aswell. Im most likely going to win lottery and fk Kim Kardashian in same day rather than getting one of those items. And now you cant even sell them.There was alot of good aswell in this game its fun with friends games CAN be fast paced if u land on " HotSpots "and when u die u are going to find new game almost instantly. review: I would love to recommend this game as I have enjoyed it in the past. But I have gotten fed up with the greedy devs and the various other problems that come with this. I like a lot about this game. You don't encounter hackers often I have played this game a lot and have only ever encountered one. Most people that say otherwise are just salty that people are killing them. It is fun and difficult and you get a nice adrenaline rush late game that leaves your heart racing for 10 minutes afterwards. There is a lot to do and a good amount of content.But there is also a lot of cons. Terribly optimized to the point it can become unplayable at certain times. Devs do not care about players and are greedy pigs.These are general pros and cons and I don't really feel like sitting around for 15 minutes thinking of more. But let me be clear DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNLESS IT IS ON SALE. It is definitely NOT WORTH the asking price. This game has a lot of potential it is already better than Fortnite and most other battle royale games out there. But there are just too many problems for this game to be worth 30 dollars.

review: Oh PUBG... We've had our ups and downs but I think it's time to quit. This game really is a love/hate relationship. Do not buy it if you haven't already.After a couple months of initial infatuation with the concept and scale of this game the love part has definitely died down. It's clear this game has some massive core gameplay issues that are not being addressed and the studio is using time and resources adding other less impactful stuff to the game. I always see PUBG videos and it gets me stoked to play because of how good it COULD be and then I play and end up Alt+F4ing in frustration after a couple rounds every time. Conversely I can play Battlefield 4 for hours in a sitting and find it enjoyable.Pros Big dynamic maps that feel like you're really exploring and people could be anywhere Searching for weapons/loot is pretty funCons Terrible desync when being shot at or picking up items in the game feels awful and inconsistent. Guns still "feel" bad compared to other AAA games like Battlefield CS GO and Overwatch. Unreliable shotguns bad automatic fire etc. Weird sound bugs. Tons of useless cosmetic content being pumped into the game to keep people hooked. Right at the same time as community outcry about lootboxes these guys decide to go ALL IN on cosmetic and collectible items. They also ripped the "battle pass" idea from Fortnite probably out of spite. Hey Bluehole it doesn't fix your terrible game. Vehicles are still dangerous to use and can cause you to die unexpectedly. Unless you're totally stranded and need to MOVE I would avoid using them. Lack of hotkey/gameplay options for picking up loot etc.In short looting and the maps are the best part of this game. The actual combat with other players feels terrible when really that should be the part that is most enjoyable and fun in FPS games. Incredibly frustrating and unpolished and the studio is wasting resources instead of fixing the problem. Time to uninstall.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

And before PUBG and H1Z1 were "released" I even thought about how awesome such an game mode would be but I played GTA V at the time so I was expecting something like it.I played this Game a lot before and after release and I have to say I like it.I now own a rather powerful PC with a GTX 1070 in it. And the game runs very well on it Ultra 80 FPS High 100 FPS . I sadly can't test it on an older Video Card but from what I heard performance is getting better for older series cards.But still it is far from perfect there are still many bugs the Death Cam is basically useless the game is randomly crashing sometimes its freezing in loading screen not letting me access other programs (e.g. Task Manager to stop it you can create a .cmd in the Start menu to kill TslGame.exe ).But all in all after it got fixed in the official release I can now confidently recommend PUBG.)

review: Brilliant game very fun to play. The gameplay is very slow paced and tactical.There are however major issues in the game that are yet to be fixed. Buildings regularly do not render even on a mid tier pc the buildings do not render initially leaving you at a huge disadvantage. Sometimes the buildings do not spawn at all.Sometimes I'll spawn in go to a building and cannot enter it until the building has rendered by this point fellow players may be armed to the teeth ready to roll over me.I cannot currently recommend the game in this current state however after these critical bugs have been fixed the game will be a solid 8/10.

review: I will begin my review by saying DO NOT listen to the people who downvote this game yet give it hundreds of hours. Despite the fact that this game is a buggy mess and that the developers are more incompotent than they are greedy it is absolutely worth your money if you are into battle royale. You will spend hours and hours of this game angry happy nervous and in the midst of combat. If you see someone who has sunk in hundreds of hours into this game and continues to do so yet they give this game a bad review they're just angry about an issue within the game. Doesn't change the fact that they actually do like the game. PUBG isn't even that expensive. If you think 30$ is not worth 100+ hours of gameplay then there must be something wrong with you. It's not a great game but you will absolutely get your money's worth if you're into this game. The developers suck and so does the game but the value of entertainment that this game will provide you far surpasses those two setbacks. Get this game if you're into battle royale and you think you can run it without any issues. It's a must have.

review: Definitely one of the best Battle Royale style games. More realistic gameplay better graphics and longer/slower games when compared to fortnite. However there are still MANY minor bugs. I wish the Devs would stop trying to add features/maps and instead fix the bugs and smooth over gameplay. That being said this is still very playable. Dying from bugs doesnt happen often if you know what you're doing. I haven't had any issues with hackers the people who complain about this game being flooded with hackers are probably bad players who are just salty.Over the last 8 months I've casually gamed PUBG and sold $40.2 worth of pubg crates which more than pays for the game itself. When the game literally pays you to play it's hard to complain.

review: Expect weekly if not daily "Server Maintenance" rendering the game unplayable for a minimum of 3 hours right in the middle of peak play time. Expect there to be unmitigated cheating.Expect your settings to reset randomly after starting a game forcing you to frantically attempt to change your button commands before you get killed.Expect to spend countless hours dying for no apparent reason until you finally learn you have to turn your graphics settings to the bare minimum just so you can see other players before they see you. Expect unrealistic weapon damage scales where inferior weapons are disproportionately more deadly than superior weapons.Expect near useless killcam renderings. Expect to wait way too long to start a game where you may die immediately or play 20 minutes collecting loot only to die without even shooting your weapon. And then you wait again. So much potential so many problems so little care from the devs.

review: Wow...I don't even know where to start. I've stood behind this game for so long. I really have. I've always been the guy in my friend group that's on PUBG's side vs Fortnite but if I'm gonna be honest with myself now I can't stand behind it anymore. The reason I felt like I had to change this review is strictly because of one thing Bluehole did The Event Pass. I'll admit I bought into it. I "fell" for it. Bluehole came out with something I thought I might just be able to get behind. They finally gave me a reason to play instead of getting off every time I play. I go into the game and within 5 games I get the XP for a mission I definitely didn't do and I don't get the XP for missions I definitely did. Not only is the tracking of missions absolute garbage but so is the timeframe. They only gave us 30 days to do this. Unlike whoever dislikes this review I have other things to do than sit and scream at my computer screen all day. If you want to get level 30 and still have a life you might as well quit now because it can't happen. The missions aren't even good or rewarding either. They re weird and don t encourage you to play the game the way it's supposed to be played. It doesn t feel very rewarding to play on Miramar for an hour and a half to get 80 XP when I was supposed to only play for an hour. Here s an example of the absolute absurdity of the mission progression and how broken it is. Mission 1 Kill a player with the QBZ. Ok I can do that. *done*. Mission 2 Play 3 games on Sanhok where you get at least 1 headshot. Ok shouldn t be too hard. *done*. But here s the catch the game failed to register that I did it even once. Here s another one I have definitely done but it hasn t registered 60% of it Revive 10 teammates on Sanhok. It only counted 3. Another one? Ok. Play on Sanhok at least 10 times. Completed it after about 20 games. The next mission? Play on Sanhok for at least 5 hours. Do you really think I m gonna play a small map designed for short games for 5 ing hours when the time doesn t even register anyways? I haven t even mentioned the fact that there s a daily limit to the amount of XP you can get by just playing the game. I paid for this (it should have been free anyways) and I expected it to be good not some rushed cash grab. I guess I put too much faith in Bluehole. This Event Pass is a joke and a money grab from Bluehole to line their pockets to prepare for the eventual downfall of their game. I m sorry PUBG Corp. but based on your blatant disregard for what your players wanted over the past few months to finally deliver this steaming pile of horse I think I m done.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: LOVE IT! i may be a starving Etheopian child this week so far but the chicken Dinner awaits. I've been playing since a little before day 1. All i have seen is improvements. As well as the dev team try to make the game more fun more playable and start to communicate with their player base more. i havent had issues with he game in a while and the game play is very fun. WAAAAYYY better than that garbage FortNight. if you prefer realism over cartoony or realistic gunplay or being able to drive a vehical or getting shot in the head while you are running along minding your own business. then this game is for you!ps ive had no instances in over a month where ive thaught some one was cheating or hacking. just saying.And to all the people out there who have almost 500 Hours in this game and gave it a bad review... why? you have put almost 20 days straight worth of playing this game and you decide now that you dont like it.... for shame. thats like going to a movie 9 times then saying oh i didnt really like it LOLI like to think of games like movies if a movie costs $13 for 2 hours of entertainment then 30 should only get you about 5 hours but if you put 450 hours into the game and you got the game at 30 bucks thats a little less than $.07 per hour that you are paying. to me thats well worth it.

review: I made a review for PUBG. I loved PUBG. I honestly did. But it really seemes like Sanhok was the falling period in the peak. Before in late 2017 was probably the prime for PUBG for me at least. Me and friends would sit down and enjoy a few games here and there we would spot a hacker or maybe we just were really bad compared to the rest. And that's how I saw the game up until about this month when it's become nearly unplayable with the sheer amount of hackers and cheaters. Leaping from a car and getting shot directly in the head immediately seems a bit too lucky to happen several times in different matches. I hate to trash the game especially since the older versions were so much fun. But not to mention the cash grab of the event pass although it may be optional it seems like a very weird idea to have in such a succesful game. I hope this review at least helped somebody realize that this game really isn't what it used to be.

review: After the 1.0 patch the game got better.UI is usable textures got way better and overall performance went up.Went from 85 fps to about 120. That's nice. Vaulting and climbing is the thing the game was missing all the time.BUT the primary thing devs should concentrate on is buying more and better servers and optimizing server performance. Matchmaking errors and laggy servers.You earnes a of money. Use it to get the platform stable!Still the same problem as always. 2 seconds lag ingame is not acceptable for a competetive shooter! Yesterdays situation in TeamSpeak Mate "wow..ups" Me "What is going on?"Mate "I accidentially shot once"*you hear a gunshot*His comment on the situation came 2 seconds BEFORE I heard the shot!

review: Too many hackersNot optimized using 95% of my gpu which is a 1080 gforce gtx at medium settings2 maps are nice but you can not choose which one you get (played the same map for over 20 rounds before it switched)Vehicles will fly all over the map even if you drive on a straight road (literally will fly in the air like a rocket)Devs add skins and loot boxes all the time but never address any actual bugsServers tend to be busy every game you finish make you have to play "a mini game" of how many times do i have to click reconnect before it actually doesGame crashes every time i report a hacker (only report when i have video proof) This game has been out a year and it seems the devs want the hackers since they just buy another copy of the game and feeding the company money. If they decide to come out with a proper anti cheat and fixed some of their major bugs with vehicles and allowed the players to choose whiche map they would like to play instead of forcing the same on us so many times this game would be a recommend for me. The currernt state this game is in this is a hard NO.

review: This is Alpha done right. They released a playable (mostly) game that they continue to improve very frequently. And let me tell you this has been the one game in years that has gotten my heart rate up. There's something about that encroachign circle being the last few alive...you know they are close by but you can't see them. You suspect they're behind that rock...or maybe that tree? 5 seconds to move need to make that decision. You run out from behind cover and rush! When it's all over your heart is beating. Heck of a game. Even if it never progresses past its current patch it is well worth it. Most fun I've had in ages.

review: This game is not worth $30 it's battlefield with fewer maps fewer weapons fewer vehicles and the added "fun" of RNG loot boxes in the shape of 1 and 2 story bulidings. Gun mechanics are bad there are only a couple weapons even worth picking up. The servers are so laggy you might empty an entire clip into someone's back and get awarded zero "hit" points on your death screen. Movement is hitchy you'll get stuck on 2ft tall broken walls. turn your GFX to minimum to reduce hitching and remove the illusion of light and shadow. Running simulator 2017 needs some major updates. Play any other shooter have more fun.

review: Edit Now that the game is out. The client side is mostly stable (except for some wierd mic issues and parachuting). The server side is still bad. Horrendous rubber banding in the first 2 minutes and network lag issues. Its still ways off to be even decently polished. Its like it went from Alpha to Beta. It is clear that a lot of polishing is needed to clear the bugs. But it is still extremely playable in its current state. Other reviewers mentioned hackers but I have yet to see any. Maybe the problem is almost resolved by now but thats just my experience. If you are still on the fence wait till the 1.0 update.

review: Such potential. Again lost by lack of region and ping lock. This is not a co op ARPG MMO or dungeon crawler. it is a COMPETITIVE shooter that requires those featues to create a fair playing field cheating and actual skill aside.The development cycle started out so well. Weekly updates new items bug fixing COMMUNICATION and posts within steam where you BUY the game. All this was then replaced by huge broken monthly updates of which you had to search the internet or check Facebook (after scrolling through the constant sea of daily "server down" "server up" posts) to find any sort of patch notes. This down hill trot turned into a straight sprint with that change of development and lack of communication. After that they decided to host multiple $100's of thousands of dollars worth of "tournaments" when the game was clearly unfinished unpolished lacking content and still in EARLY ACCESS.

I also spent money on a video card just for this freaking game EVGA Geforce 1060 GTX 6 GB SSC. Very happy with my new video card and I love the game.Update 1.0 is great. I m getting on average 80 100fps ( everything is high and ultra except textures and effects are at medium setting) and it s optimized. Such a great game. I m looking forward to its additional content. 2017 GOTY for me.

review: Don't buy this game just because it's $20 (sale). If you want a good battle royal game this is not the game. If the game ran like Fornite than yeah it's a great deal but it does not. Don't bother with this game. This game could had beaten Fortnite if they weren't to busy stuck up each other butts. If they really wanted to improve they would've improve the game early on and not now when its to late already. Everybody now is stuck playing Fortnite. Which is FREE. Why would anyone from Fortnite come to play PUBG. PUBG is not optimized like Fortnite. PUBG was everything and Fortnite was in it's shadow. Now it's the other way around. PUBG is now in Fortnite shadow. PUBG can't say that they don't have enough funds for the game because the game sold very well without out any offical advertisment. The game at this point should be made FREE and to those who had paid for the game already should get idk skins or something better a refund.

When I was about 10 years old my mother told him "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately". Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what was exactly up at stake. He gave it up immediately. Two years later he died of lung cancer. It was really depressing and destroyed me. At 28 I have never touched a cigarette because of this. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done so because this game gave me cancer anyway.

review: TLDR It's a fun and simple battle royal that can easily be played with friendsIf you aren't keen on early access game and have zero tolerence for possible (and honestly rare) glitches I'd say pass. But if you enjoy on the spot critical thinking a constantly changing battle and the rewarding feeling of knowing you are in fact the best than this is you're game. So here are a few main points that are critical for knowing when thinking of owning this game are The map is big plain and simple. Like most sandbox survivors it has scattered homes/building a handful of small towns and few large sites guarenteed to attract attention. It can get annoying trying to stay in the combat zones at first but to be honest you can easily predict where they will be (hint they are almost always within a mile of the flight path of the plane). There are a small sample of vehicles (cars mortorcycles and boats) if you need to get somewhere fast but mostly they just make lots of noise.The weapon selection is admittedly lacking (a few identical pistols 2 shotguns around 10 assault weapons one sniper a terrible crossbow and a handful of basically useless melee weapons) and can sometimes blend together in a grey blur. It doesn't take long to discover them. While there are attachments for most guns it doesn't really spice up the gameplay because are you really not going to add it anyways? And earning the in game currency "BP" takes an honestly too long commitment. Without winning everygame it takes about 7 or 8 games to open the first loot box. Then the price doubles... and then it doubles again (god help me)The combat is exactly like any other mainstream shooter. You can play in 1st or 3rd person you find gear and armor and shoot anyone who you find (It's killed or be killed Hanzi). The beginning of the matches can sometimes be quiet and feel like every other match but near 30 players left it begins to heat up. At the final 10 I'd say is the most fun part and seeing the words "Winner Winner Chicken Dinner" makes it all worth while.As far a glitches/bug/general issues I'd have to say most of the complaints are exaggerated. If you have optimal internet the suggested hardware and the mindset that this is a constantly updated early access game you will really have next to no issues. I've played on PC and even the recently released XBOX One version and have had literally zero issues. In most cases with these beta games people get one lag spike and rush to the negative review button. The only issue you may have is if the host of the game themselves leaves/disconnects but that's a salty player and can't be blamed on the game. As for the common notion that "Guns are too hard to find and everyone else always gets good stuff" this should just be tuned out. That is exactly what a friend of mine said his first game after he made the mistake of parachuting into a live firefight. Then 1 hour later we were one of the last teams armed to the teeth and having a great time. If you expect to be handed a SCAR L right off the bat go play Battlefield. No one in the Hunger Games was armed at the start and everyone else starts empty handed.In conclusion I'd say this game is a clean 7/10+High stakes combat+A large map with both wide open areas and stressful cityscapes+A variety of ways to play loud and mean quiet and patient the hermit who never moves the team of gun toating killers etc.+Enjoyable solo or with 1 partner or 3+Appealing gamestyle (sure it's been done but this is one of the only ones you don't have to gather resourses which is nice)+New experiences and constantly learning to adapt and use your surroundings (this games has me always thinking tactical)+It's only in beta and more is sure to come from this promising team Can be frustrating at first if you die immedately (it does happen a lot at first) leading to the "this game sucks" mindset Being killed without ever seeing who did it or from where is kind of just a "Well that's it don't let the door hit you on the way out". It can make the player feel as though it was all for nothing The players use any and all exploits possible (Constant reality breaking jumping teleporting into vehicles in a flash using prone/crouch to dodge bullets and the age old camp with you gun aimed at the door) and it just makes you regret even trying to engage sometimes

review: To be fair you have to have a very high IQ to understand Rick and Morty. The humour is extremely subtle and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the jokes will go over a typical viewer s head. There s also Rick s nihilistic outlook which is deftly woven into his characterisation his personal philosophy draws heavily from Narodnaya Volya literature for instance. The fans understand this stuff they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of these jokes to realise that they re not just funny they say something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike Rick &amp Morty truly ARE idiots of course they wouldn t appreciate for instance the humour in Rick s existential catchphrase Wubba Lubba Dub Dub which itself is a cryptic reference to Turgenev s Russian epic Fathers and Sons. I m smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Dan Harmon s genius wit unfolds itself on their television screens. What fools.. how I pity them.

review: Revised Review after a year of playing First let me start off by saying that I am no longer fan of PUBG. There are things that I like and things that I dislike about the game. Most often I find myself in a position recognizing that I can be mad at PLAYERUNKNOWN and his dev team. This game was released as an EARLY ACCESS and under that alone I could not have a reason to complain whatsoever. However since this game was released and has become wildly popular the leadership and dev team have been dragging their f*cking feet. Each and every patch has so many new bugs and issues and rarely solve any problems that players have been asking to be resolved for nearly a year.This game was released as a fairly polished game with considerably good mechanics gameplay logic and balance. Since then nothing truly tremendous has been done to improve the game. The best upgrade was them changing the tick rate of servers from 20 to 60 and that was merely a switch of the servers and nothing technical done as a result of the devs that alone took months to get done. Now I am going to dive a little deeper into each of thsoe topics and a little more.Mechanics This game at times can feel pretty clunky especially when driving but for the most part looting shooting and running feel very consistent and smooth. The camera system is helpful and useful (considering you can't Alt + Drag in prone and limited in crouch and when looking around buildings). A complaint is that the driving mechanics are clunky when traveling over bumps and the parachutes can be unreliable sometimes don't ever drive a bike or you are 50% likely to flip and die by hitting a microscopic pebble on the road. The developers will likely take another year to either revert the bikes or make any improvement at all.Gameplay The shooting system is phenominal in this game just about the only thing that makes this game good. The Duo system is very nice. It leads to a very tactical and strategical approach to the game but the playerbase only knows how to drop hot and play like it's Call of Duty... so... instead of playing to survive and not play to get kills you end up playing to get kills and not playing to survive. I like intelligent kind of gameplay which is very rewarding for patient players that are capable of strategizing but at a higher level don't expect anyone to care. I consistently place top 250 if I play for the season.Logic Some things in the game just make sense and other things are just down right stupid. The scenery is right the locations are meh the loot spawns are complete RNG the plane routes can be complete and utter trash on Mirimar especially. The circles can lose you a game on Erangel. Too much RNG in this game for it to be worth a damn at a higher level of competition. The game just doesn't feel right anymore. Things such as bullet compatibility and attachments might seem fishy and I'd give this game a break if it were still a month away from release or launch but they've had more than enough time to fix critical issues and they have failed to even fix half of the issues within an entire year. I guess $1 500 000 000 isn't enough to higher a good dev team...Balance This the single most important thing that the developers have actually gotten right which is why the game is actually playable. Grenades can't be thrown 500 ft guns have accurate bullet drop accurate sounds (beyond popular belief) accurate damage and generally good recoil balance. The Zones don't do nearly enough damage but move at a manageable speed but can select completely a$$ areas. The loot is not really balanced because you can very commonly loot 3 4 buildings and not find a single weapon at times. Cars are balanced and each serve their own purpose. They actually removed lvl 3 helms from world spawns and balanced ARs SMGs DMRs and Snipers... which actually made the game a lot more balanced and was one of the actually decent patches the game released.Overall this is a good game but I can't rate it thumbs up because teh developers are very incompitent. This game favors the agressor due to desync and lag (which at times can seem like so during the first 5 mins of the game) it should be about playing tactical and being able to strategize and create a plan on where you are going to find the best loot. Where to loot and have the advantage over anyone impeding your immediate area. What part of the map to loot in order to give you most time to be in the first circle. What part of the circle to go to (where you think on the path of the plane and how likely you are to run into somebody at a specific location on the map) where to hide or setup where to scout and scan where to strafe and peek. Every single game you should be rewarded for being able to answer these questions and it used to be like that but not really any more. Don't get me wrong I love this game but it has too many problems. With the recent addition of the event pass I don't even think that I can stomach the stupidity of the developers. I wish they would have adopted a system of progression like Rainbow Six Siege or copied Fortnite exactly but instead they wanted to basically make their event pass cost 3 times as much. $10/month instead of Fortnite's $10/3 months. A lot of these problems aren't being fixed. The developers aren't good at acknowledging the community and communicating with the community. They don't seem to have any haste and they don't seem to care about improving the game. They make random inprovements and the only patches or improvements that are ever worth a damn are weapon and armor balances and nothing much else. This game has server issues (which are coding abssed issues that will never seem to be addressed) this game rubberbands (told it would be improved???) the sounds are inconsistent (seemingly always bugged) vehicles are scetchy (were fixed and then they managed to f*ck them up again) draw distance (not fixed bushes and brush don't load at 200m+ which is completely ) spectator issues (not fixed) revives issues (fixed) map issues (fixed) spawn issues (fixed) lagout issues (not fixed) BP issues (fixed) various other glitches and troubles (fixed/being fixed or address/scheduled to be fixed) desync (not fixed). &lt made this list over a year ago and updated it just so you can see a list of things that haven't been fixed and what has. To add to the list a ranking system was never implemented leveling system was never implemented still no challenges crates are pretty much all worthless and only openable with keys. It seems like they do nothing to cater to players that play this game at the highest level and it's so ing irritating losing a gun battle to a complete ter when on my screen I'm behind a tree and they still see me due to desync.Here are my adjusted ratings Gameplay 7/10Mechanics 8/10Logic 7/10Balancing 9/10Developers 4/10 &lt only team that regularly puts things out is the art team with PAID crates... I buy a game and can't even get any ing skins for free...Community 9/10 community is actually really nice. Every agrees that the devs are as .. lmaoOverall 7/10Future Overall 6/10 game just keeps going downhill. Optimization is a$$ and devs are picking their noses. Could have been a 10/10 if they were compitent.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Been having a blast with my friends on this game. I really hated H1Z1 and was reluctant to give this a try but I am so glad I did. The devs seem to be making good on their promises towards optimization and other issues hurting the game so give them some time to iron out the bugs hackers and other issues and this game will be great. It hasn't been out long so please keep that in mind when you see negative reviews.***UPDATE***I cannot recommend this game to anyone now. Ever since the introduction of Steam crates the hacker playerbase has skyrocketed. After a few failed attempts to get the hacker problem under control there are still some running around but not as much as before perhaps but now the company seems to care about milking more money from its playerbase than fixing their game and making it better. Go play Fortnite or Cuisine Royale stay away from Bluehole and Tencent.

review: Product received for free. Fun game. Sunk many hours in it. People are complaining about the microtransactions for cosmetics or the new battle pass. You can still earn items through the pass for free. Buying the pass just gives you more cosmetics and free BP. Not having to go through the crate system is great.You'll want to play on lower graphical settings for some but it is very easy to get 60 144fps. Server side the game has gotten much better. The start of the game still has some bumps in tick rate and stability but it's around 30 ticks/s (compared to 8 ticks/s 3 4 months ago). Once the game is about 2 minutes in it rises to a pretty steady 55 60 ticks/s.

review: This game is pretty fun with a squad. HOWEVER it gets quite repetitive and monotonous. Same thing happens over and over and it goes like this....Jump out of plane land and hope you have time to get a weapon if not you will be in a boxing match. Once you are satsfied you have found the items you think you will need you CONSTANTLY are moving to stay in a white circle. If you aren't in the white circle you are moving towards it. Once you avoid conflict and get down to the final 20 or so it becomes a game of luck. Hopefully you got the SKS AWM etc with a nice scope so you can finish the other people off. If you don't you repeat the cycle.If you are the last alive you get a "winner winner chicken dinner" phrase on your screen and guess what else....you repeat the same cycle!!

review: One of the few games that I solely picked up because my friends all recommended it to me. After hours of matches there's just something so addictive about the game. Being so early in its development there's so much potential but the game is great even in the state that it's in currently. The first person view is done very well and the varying weather changes the game feel completely keeping it fresh. I'm excited to see what else will get put into the game in the future.

review: Game is good in its actual state the battle royale style is fresh and the gunplay is tight. Hand to hand combat needs improvement.Had some crashing issues (RX480 8G FX8350 4GHz 16G RAM) but after updating to last non WHQL amd drivers and following the forum official recomendations the crashes are gone.The major weaknesses are the lack of more maps and the need for greater mobility (being able to jump over fences through windows etc.).The crates are very cosmetic and only apply to the beggining of the game since when you start looting you will change your looks completely so it's not an issue at all. However devs should improve other things before adding microtransactions to a best selling game. Greedy people.If they add more maps and improve mobility the game will be very good.

review: I used to love this game. But the overflow of hackers and PUBG's unwillingness to institute a method to decrease the amount of hackers over the past several months have heavily contributed to its decline. With over a million bans one would believe that hackers would be less of a problem but they are still a problem and a very large one. Hopefully the developers do pair some anti cheat software with the program in the future. Until they do I would not recommend this game unless you enjoy spending countless hours getting shot through walls and hills by other's with aimbots.

review: This game is nothing but bugs and error messages. If you manage to get past the endless problems and enter a game you run the risk of losing everything due to poorly coded gravity horrid item hitboxes or another one of the endless coding issues. They along with the enormous amount of cheaters has made this game nigh impossible to enjoy for more than two rounds even with wins thrown into the mix. It's a mess yet without fixing the problems that have existed since day one they are pumping out updates containing pay to open crates emotes and weapon skins.This game is a mess.I don't know why I'm still addicted to attempting to play it.

review: Game itself is very fun and exhilarating. I would recommend but I keep getting BSOD irql_not_less_or_equal which may or may not be hardware related. This is the only game I've had any kind of bluescreens while running them on my system ever. Excluding crashes due to my last PSU dying.For my friends the game runs fine enough meaning no fatal crashes at least.I will recommend this to anyone who is tech savvy enough to dig into these kinds of problems.4/5 it would be nice for once to see who killed me.

review: Now that I have almost 750 hours I can really put my input into this game. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is honestly a overall 7/10.The desert map really pisses me off more than anything as everyone hotdrops so there are like 30 people alive before the first circle even hits the gameplay is very slow and doesn't allow for me to get the number of kills I would like to.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is honestly the game for you if you're looking for a good battle royale wether you came from Fortnite Arma 3 Mods or H1Z1 this is the right game for you.At first you might thing that this game is horrible trust me I've been there and I'm still mixed inside of this stance but I think that PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS has really stepped up their game since the release of "Fortnite" I really expect great things from this game and it's honestly the best 30 dollars I have ever spent.Honestly the only con of this game would be dsync and other issues such as ping lag (for lower end computers) and other aspects of gameplay.If you're wondering what you should AT LEAST want to run this game DECENTLY i5 Processor 1050ti 4gb single fan 8gb of RAM. My specs get about 130 144 most of the time those specs being i7 7700K 16gb DDR4 RAM 1070ti 8gbIf you have the specs to run this game buy this game if you don't try fortnite as a second option and if you can't run fortnite buy a new computer because yours is clearly a peice of junk from the 80's. Creepy

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is a great concept executed poorly even after 1.0 was released. The maps are still filled with glitches where you can get stuck and die outside the play zone. The main menu is still buggy and you have to 'restart the lobby' in order to get it to work again. Most frustrating of all though is the lack of anti cheat. Aim bots are very common and I have gone an entire day's worth of gameplay without having a single round where I wasn't killed by someone using an aimbot. For a multi player only game this makes it basically unplayable in any competitive way. Not recommended until some form of anti cheat is established and the maps are fixed.

If you're lucky they will lose their helmet.. highly likely some Asian hacker with snap at you and instantly put you down b/ anti cheat measures are abysmol and they have a unsecured data feed that any Packet sniffer can pull up the info you are sending. Item locations Vehicle locations Player location You want to talk about terrible anti cheat placement this game takes the damn oscar.Now they are coming out with a moblie lunch? review: This game and I have a love hate relationship. I don't really know if I love it or hate it. It's been 200 hours and a rocky road. I have moments of extreme happiness with winning and sorrow after making it to top ten with no action just to get headshotted by a Kar98 or get jumped by someone i could never have seen. I will continue playing this game because of those moments. I can relate this game to a drug. You know it hurts but the ecstasy of winning landing that moving headshot with a sniper running someone over and 1v4ing successfully is what brings me back. You need to be dedicated to have fun and I understand that many people don't want that. I obviously did and i have had a net positive time. Always play with friends unless you are really good or else it isn't fun. A review can't really tell you whether to buy in this particular game. One more thing this game is really buggy(though I enjoy the gunplay). Ok update this game.

review: One idea I would like to put out before a basic review of the game The map currently has 3 different styles Sun rain and fog. What I would like to see and think would make the games more interesting would be to change this system so that all 3 weather types are mixed into one. As you travel through the white circles away from the blues this would definitely give the game a higher level of intensity going from sun to fog or rain as the playstyle would need to change.I think this would give the game a major improvement and is definitely something I am looking forward to seeing happen.This would need to be randomized for each game so that the same place is not always foggy.This game is very addictive! Not perfect but has so much potential. At the moment it is just a fight to the death battle Royale but you could easily add extra modes in like a headquarters type mode where a certain part of the map needs to be captured by a team and defended etc... PUBGs is quite difficult to get good at but has been fun the entire time. The movement is quite clunky and takes a little while to get used to. Shootouts are fun and exciting... Even hiding from people in a bush or laying in grass is intense! There has been a large increase in hackers recently which is starting to ruin it a bit and makes those chicken dinners hard to winner winner.I do however love this game even though it frustrates the hell outta me at times!

review: 1. This game continously freezes for my duo partner.2. In game lag makes product unplayable.3. Head glitching in first person makes this game beyond unplayable.4. Loot spawn rate is so bad it's unfathomable.5. Foliage makes everyone invisible (also bushes will looks like players) more so than the Ghillie suit.6. Crates will be dropped outside of safe zone which renders them unable to get.7. Hitting a tiny bump will result in your vehicle doing a 720 and dying.8. Response time in this game is very bad.9. Poor optimization is something I do not even want to touch upon.10. Things not rendering when I land.11. Desync and rubber banding12. RNG is so beyond bad with circle game turns into a running simulator and most of the time vehicles do not spawn so you can get to where you have to go.13. Top 60 25 is a drool fest due to the majority of players camping and hiding from any interaction14. Crates spawn Groza15. Your car will get stuck in a fence and then it will proceed to blow up.16. Getting out of your vehicle near a wall and then falling incessantly which results in death.17. Shotguns not one tapping people when you hit them point blank (could be desync).18. Vehicles hit boxes are so unbelievably large that even when you are around three body lengths away you will still get hit and die.19. Cannot shoot people while they are in water.20. Cannot reload gun unless I drop it and pick it back up.21. Cannot remove or add attachments onto my gun unless I drop it and pick it back up.22. Getting disconnected from a server.23. The Red zone serves no purpose other than ruining a deep run with annoying RNG.Until the awful freezing glitches and ugly server lag dissipates I would not recommend buying this game.

review: Product received for free. PlayerUknown's Battlegrounds has been officially released for just over 4 months and to this day conitunes to have issues that not only prevent the game from being considered a true E sports title but that should not be present in a game that is regarded as complete. I say this especially due to the fact that the greedy developers took it upon themselves to charge money for you to be able to access a large amount of the cosmetic items in the game.Aside from the well documented bugs there are also issues that affect gameplay in a way that prevents the player from being able to properly utilize some weapons in the game.Because of this I DO NOT RECOMMEND YOU BUY THIS GAME. Not at least until the bugs have been fixed and even then i would be unlikely to do so due to the egregious implementation of MICROTRANSACTIONS IN A PAID FOR GAME.Steer clear and do not waste your money the game is enjoyable but cannot be excused of it's flaws based on this alone. I hope the developers read their feedback and try to improve their product but i do not see this happening as they are more than happy to forego the satisfaction of the customer and extract maximum profit at the expense of it.

review: Why is this game popular?!The answer? Because its battle Royale.Why shouldn't it be popular? &gt One of the most poorly optimized Unreal Engine 4 games out there.I personally do game developement on Unreal Engine and I feel like I could have done a better job making the game look and play better. This game is undoubtedly attrocious when it comes to playability. Glitchyness poor animation system forgets to set playermodel hidden to the posessing player lag just lal these issues. Their main menu UI doesn't even work consistently and instead of fixing it they've just chosen to accept it and added in a little refresh button. Probably the second most clicked icon in the game next to the play button. &gt Poor gunplay Gunplay one should hope is skill based responsive and enjoyable. Here its seemingly none of these 3 things. Recoil is odd inconsistent and excessive Time to Kill at range is huge properly aiming with any zoomed optic on a gun you wanna use like a DMR is damn near impossible and it is evident that luck defines hit detection seemingly half the time.Furthermore due to netcode worse than... Actually I'm not quite sure if there's any worse example of netcode... Maybe BF4 on release idk...Anyways netcode is tied to gun shooting. You will literally have a random delay before the gun shoots after you click. It is so unsatisfying. SO UNSATISFYING. &gt Movement So this is supposedly gonna be fixed soon but regardless right now the movememnt is pretty bad. You can jump out of windows/ over walls but its very difficult to do so and some objects have odd colission boxes. &gt To be completely honest there's a higher quality IOS game that pulls off PUBG perfectly called rules of survival. Given it runs smooth 30 fps at least on ios its pretty incredible. It is well optimized and generally just the same thing but slightly improved FOR FREE on a PHONE. If thats not saying something I don't know what is.This game is popular because it hopped onto the battle royale bandwagon and with it came the swarm of people wanting to play this genre. Fortnite is a very different game in how it plays but in regard to quality and playability really any other game is better than PUBG right now.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Bugs glitches and hackers are all over the place and the official PC lauch barely introduces any real improvements compared to previous beta versions. The new map seems better polished but much more frustrated to play than the old one. I played this game solely because my friends played too and I still don't get why they would think this game was so much fun. That being said if you got no friends to play alongside you there's really no need buying it.

review: UPDATED OVERALL 2/10 the game has progressively gotten worse with desync audio spam bots glitches hackers etc. The developers choose to work on $5 dollar skins DLC bs and suing the competition rather than fixing their game. The patches they do release are like 8+ GBs and literally nothing changes..... I know many people who are leaving this game due to the failed management. Original Review Overall rating 7.0/10 at this time despite any negative criticism I would recommend this game as long as you feel the positives outweigh the negatives and keep in mind this is still alpha though this will be changing soon and I'm not sure if all the issues will be fixed by the time it releases which is why I wrote this review. I hope this helps in your buying decision. Note I only have 12+ hours of game play due to a 2 year old gaming laptop not being able to handle low settings causing graphic lag low detail etc. (I was doing traveling work) and also playing on the test server. I was basically a mule/medic in my squad. Since relocating back to where my desktop was located and having a GTX1070 / 16GB RAM / Phenom 2 (3.4 Ghz) etc. I am able to play on medium high settings with none of these issues. Please note if you would like to enjoy this game you should have a pretty decent and modern build. Pros +Great team based game (can solo but definitely more fun in a squad)+Forces players to continue moving/looting (circle gets smaller and smaller) mitigates long term snipe camping. +Graphics are actually pretty decent if your PC can handle max graphics. However most can only run low medium without sacrificing frames. +diversity in weapons and vehicles (I would like to see this expanded on further). +There is a degree of luck that plays into this game whether it is finding the right gear or dropping in the right location which is a nice variation to standard shooter games. Cons Optimization needs work need a really modern video card to be somewhat competitive (lower graphics lower ability to see enemies). Rubberbanding major issue especially at the start of any game where finding a weapon is important for immediate survival. Random crashes not often but does occur to almost everyone at one point or another. Cannot heal in vehicles while they are moving which seems counter intuitive (I can understand why you can't gas a vehicle up while moving). However no reason you can't drink/use pain meds/heal in vehicle. There is only one map (second on test server) I would like to see more.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I actually enjoy PUBG its a very competitive game with a realistic feeling to gun play and a challenging environment to master that being said Blue Hole's developement team and CEO are actively ruining this game. After publicly admitting thats its player base is rife with cheaters 90% of whom are Chinese players and after experiencing death in this game due to cheating multiple times when I have the advantage its quite disenheartening. Especially so when they do ban cheaters for said cheaters to literally just turn around and buy another copy of the game and continue cheating. Their proposed solution of banning cheating players has been proven to be ineffective and yet they continue to do nothing about it. I've been fully in support of a region lock for some time now not only to stop the blatant cheating but when I play on a North American server I'm hoping that I can meet players I can converse with and develope friendships and find more people to continue to play with. At the moment its almost impossible to be matched in a North American server with any players that arent Chinese and this hampers my desire to play with friends even more. In summation its a game rife with cheaters that the developers continue to merely offer lip service in their attempts to address the problem dont buy this game until Blue Hole region locks servers for ALL areas and continents.Update Whatever the new update that was implemented has drastically made this game even worse. Where as before the game ran smoothly now the first 5 minutes being anywhere near another player is a rubberbanding lag fest which devolves into extreme frustration as you become incapable of manuevering your character due to extreme latency issues. seriously Bluehole you have a popular game formula fix it and stuck being such lazy morons. You have an insane revenue stream put more than the bare minimum of it back into the product that made you rich in the first place.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
