review: Don't get me wrong. It's a fun game. I think I like this game despite its obvious shortcomings. Those shortcomings being (a) movement is horrendous (give us climbing for fracks sake) (b) you might grab an item 3x before it actually decides to be a part of your inventory (c) the mid game is lacking (basically early game has some action and late game as well) (d) the loot crates give you nothing good in the way of cool looking gear or customization (e) network lag make close quarters fire fights a crap shoot at best(f) loot spawning needs to be tuned upAnyways I have logged a ton of hours playing this game and I've come to love it in spite of its flaws but I can't really recommend it.

review: New update for this game really improved the experience. Getting high 80s 90s in FPS vs. 40 50 in the early access stages. The new map (desert) is even better than the first in my opinion lots more action goes on. Most weapons are balanced (some argue the Win94 needs some nerfing some say it is fine I don't really care.) Is the game worth $30? In my opinion it really depends on your situation. If you have buddies who have/want this game it's worth it without a doubt. I've had some amazing times with friends playing this game. If you're going lone wolf into matches you may have difficulty finding as much enjoyment out of it.Overall I definitely recommend it. Even an absolute turd like me can win a couple chicken dinners here and there everyone should have an equal opportunity to win.

review: 其实这款游戏的可玩性很高 但我却不推荐 真的是很累心 服务器不稳定的问题我觉得可以接受 无非是挂加速 我可以忍受你们服务器够烂 可是现在的外挂横行 真的是一点游戏体验都没有 当你在丛林里和别人对枪 对方蹲着出来比摩托车还快 怼到你脸上给你一盆子 还各种嘲讽 真的感觉没意思 从以前的团队指向性很明确的游戏到现在的神仙打架 我是个爱国的人 但在这里我要骂一些国人 开外挂的大部分都是国人 我真的是感到羞耻 开外挂的那些中国人 我希望你们能自知廉耻 不是你开挂杀了几个外国人你就牛逼了 有本事就公平竞技 杀不掉至少输得起 开外挂玩游戏 真他妈的丢人 除了丢人我无话可说 真正让中国电子竞技不能蓬勃的不是人家广电 就是你们这帮开发外挂和买外挂的 不要总推锅给人家广电 输又输不起 打还打不过 这就是这些开挂玩游戏的人脆弱心灵 开个挂找点自尊心 以为有钱买挂多了不起 真的是畸形心理 蓝洞如果再不重视这个问题 抓紧修复这个外挂问题 那真的是离黄不远了 说真的 外挂问题要比服务器问题严重的多 以至于现在可以先抓紧治理外挂再修复服务器了 不然只能自食苦果 .

review: Product received for free. Disclaimer butthurt pubg fans will dislike my review.This game is overall unfinished. laggy servers zero optimization low options. In quality it's pretty much a cash grab.Now about fun. It's extremely boring. One match of driving simultator 'battle royale' that takes twenty minutes. Most of a match consists you 'farming' for weapons rather than actually shooting people btw the term 'farming' is used in rpgs. The other rest is driving your uaz or dacia or whatever to 'farm' or find a good spot. After you find a good spot you just hide there like a complete coward and wait till idiots run toward you then start shooting your gun and loot them again. I mean come on play mario kart than this waste of a time. There are many good playable games out there and you definitely would rather play them. It isnt worth giving money to a company who 'claims' the battle royale genre to be theirs. There's no patent for that.

review: Player unknowns battlegrounds is quickly becoming one of my new favorite games with a little over 120+ hours into it I think I am at the point to give a pretty fair review so lets begin.Pros Graphics are decent nothing mind blowing but still beautiful. Variety of guns melee and explosive weapons to chose from if found while looting. So far seems to have a decent gun modification/attachment system. This game is perfect for you and 3 buddies to play togeather as a squad this game helps reinforce teamwork and cooperation with other players on duo/squad gamemodes. So far seems to be really trucking along nicely weekly and monthly updates 2 new maps in dev as we speak more weapons to come. I think this is a great game and I would def recommend to anyone who likes survival of the fittest competitive FPS games.Cons Lower end PC's will typically not run this game good at all it is system intensive and also in public access so it will take time before the bigger opimizations come along. Seems to crash every so often which isn't that big of a deal. Vehicles can be pretty buggy and kill you randomly at times if you don't pay attention to what your doing. Lots of running in this game if you can't find a car most of this game depends on where you drop and what you loot. I personally don't find this too big of a deal but I am sure there are lots of people who dislike the blue circle drawing in while it keeps the game fast moving and competitive by adding yet another danger some people might not like the constant necessity to be forced to run from something you can do nothing about.I AM NOW 350 HOURS INTO THIS GAME! UPDATE BELOW!All was well in the beginning now when playing on NA servers you rarely get matched with teammates who speak english this makes communication impossible. Chinese hackers are riddled throughout teamkilling is still prevelant aswell. The game needs some major updates to be considered a complete game. They just came out of EA but it didn't change anything they released a 2nd map which I love. At the current state I would not recommend this game unless you have friends to play with and have patience because of hackers foreigners on NA servers rubber band lag and de sync. I simply would not buy this game as of now.I went from recommending this game to not recommending this game. REGULAR PLAYERS STILL CANNOT HOST CUSTOM MATCHES THAT IS A BENEFIT ONLY GIVEN TO THE ELITE STREAMERS OF WHOM PUBG STAFF DECIDES. Regular players are 2nd class to streamers.

review: PUBG 1.0 release is a jokeHere's why 1. Still have a lot of MEMORY leak the devs doesnt know how delete stack and heap in c++ language at all. The game run on Unreal Engine so there's no GARBAGE collector on it. This game need at least 16gb of ram to run while the specs requirements are 6gb. LuL2. Lots of bug stuck in place horrible bug3. Optimisation is a joke the in game model render still has a lot of texture size and file. Some other game only use less than 2gb ram to handle the game. While pubg can't do that at all. (PS there's a couple of game ported from mobile to pc and can handle better than this game).4. Best multiplayer game? the server tick are so great. You can see in your death cam by yourself where the enemy is shooting at and where's your character location PS I have a good internet even Dota run on SEA at 40 ping LuL. 5. Lot of cheater which use wallhack auto aim etc.6. The server can't handle the packet data really well lots of lag. Note I play this game before the release and wait it after release hoping the game will run perfectly. The game mecanic is still horrible this game has future but handled by ppl who didn't focus on fixing something

Death cam and replay system are so desynced its laughable.ALL this in a released! 25+ game is pretty shocking definitely as core aspects like hit registration dont work properly and they want this to be a Esports game good luck.NOT RECOMMENDEDUPDATE 7 13/3/18 They have fixed alot of things replay system now works and hit registration is fixed or really improved also server and general game optimisations have improved the game alot parachuting is still but that hopefully gets fixed i can now recommend this game as i see alot of improvments and also the future potential of this game.RECOMMENDED

review: This game is a disapointment from terrible optimization to rampant cheating. The developers have made their priorities clear with their latest patch asking a further $9.99 a month on top of the $29.99 price for the base game. It would seem that Blue Hole has placed making money over customer satisfaction. I understand that they need to make money they are a business but it is a real slap in the face to their fanbase to tack on a free to play pay model on top of the price of the game. The sad thing is I enjoy this game and have over 850 hours across the test and regular servers. I dislike being taken advantage of and the game isn't good enough to further charge more money for a product that does not even feel complete. Its been more than a year since full release and this game still runs like trash even after a 2 year beta. I do not understand is it ignorance toward the fact that the game doesn't run that smooth or is it incompetance and the development team is incapable of fixing issues that have plagued this game since launch either way it is pathetic and to top it all off you are suing a company that subjectively has a better BR game than you do and it was tacked on in an after thought. Your priorities should be delivering the game that you set out to make but it seems the devs are content with "good enough" and that from a customers stand point is simply not good enough. In short game runs bad devs are treating player base bad free to play pay model in a not free to play game is bad and playing this game just all around feels bad man.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Yeah I know at the time of writing this i have a measly 7.5 hours on the game so take what i say with a pinch of salt.I downloaded the free mobile port of the game and loved playing it even if there are a bunch of super easy to kill bots and the controls are clunky as all hell its fun exchanging battles with the real players you come across every now and then and now i play it with my girlfriend and we have a great time.So i thought to myself it why not buy the real game? After seeing youtube videos of shroud tearing it up I thought hell this could actually be some fun. I was severely dissapointed.I wish there was at least something positive about this but in the time I've spent on this game I havent enjoyed a single minute of it. Any time i play on OC servers (in my home country of australia) im just flooded with Chinese players and when they're in duos with me they only ever know enough english to say that they cant speak english and they want to be my friend. I love the concept of this game and the idea of playing it with my friends and winning some games but i find myself just stopping playing after like one or two games in a session. When you dont even want to play the brand spanking new adrenaline rush of a shooting game you just bought for about $45 australian dollars... what are you supposed to say?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I wanted to get into PUBG and have it be a worthwile game as much as the next guy. It was reccomended to me by a friend the enemies are difficult to see at first and it takes some getting used to. Most of the deaths you encounter are you plainly getting sniped and are more or less unavoidable. As well as an increase in hackers and cheaters PUBG is now a game I would not reccomend. Bluehole itself is so ballsy that they are pursuing lawsuits against Epic and not realizing that their game is losing players because Bluehole can (or doesn't want to) keep up with its competitors who release new items and balance changes weekly. PUBG has now hit the sale stage of a popular game meaning they are so desperate for players that they must decrease the value of the game to try and scrape in as many new players as they can. Do not buy this game It'll be dead by the end of the Summer 2018.

review: It's a fun game but still has a few issues from its early access days. Before I go into that here are a few positives. The game looks a little better now and movement has been improved. The new guns are also great and I enjoy the new map. Playing solo or queued are both entertaining most of the time. The game is still heavily based on RNG so your satisfaction may vary. Now for the negatives there's still some stuttering you experience even if you have a mid or high range PC. It's been patched a little but it still is there sometimes. Also lag and rubberbanding do occur from time to time. The price tag to me still seems a bit off putting because of the content available but I think for now I would recommend it if you find it on sale.

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds (or simply PUBG) is a well paced battle royale style online OTS/FPS game where you must scavenge hunt and survive to win.PROS Very well fleshed out for an early access Tactical gameplay multiple approaches to victory Nice balance between realism and gameplay High replay value Constant improvements Fun with friendsCONS Rather unoptimized prone to hang or lag Gets frustrating when you have a bad streak As of the writing of this review no vault system implementedAll in all I play this game a lot and I like it very much. I'm looking forward to all the improvements and it's well worth its price.

review: First match i ran into a house and got my blasted off by a shotgun. Second match i landed next to some guys and had a fist fight wich i won then got my blasted off by a shotgun. Third match i landed on top of an apratment complex got an AK and pump action shotgun looked out the window and shot some kid in the face and ran then i herd footsteps below me pulled out my shotgun and dropped another guy then it got quiet. There was gunshots in the distance that was when the redzone started bombs dropping everywhere people dying. Then the circle got smaller so i had to move i started moving and a sniper hits my leg i run into a house to patch my self up little did i know there was a guy with an crossbow in there and i got my shot off. 10/10 would play again
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I love this game but I have a few complaints. It feels very cartoony and unrealistic.Guns don't do nearly enough damage it can take 7+ shots to kill someone. Bullet travel times laughable you can throw a baseball faster than most the bullets in player unknowns travel.And your aimer is often your worst enemy because it deceives you. Your biggest mistake when playing PUBG would be to assume because your aiming at someone you're going to hit them. I've shot right at people with my reticle right on them at 20 metres away and watched my bullet fly off to the left or right on video replay. I wish the game would remain more about skill and less about the RNG when my bullet leaves the gun.Hopefully the devs will release a hardcore mode with features like more bullet damage higher bullet velocities more weapon accuracy and locked first person view.

review: Fiirst off let's talk glitches. While the negative reviews aren't too far off the mark I don't believe a few crashes and a bit of rubber banding makes this game so bad it isn't worth playing. The test servers are a bit glitchy but the primary game has been fine tuned and actually runs very smoothly. As far as bullets not registering I don't believe I've ever had that issue and I have shot a lot of players. Perhaps they simply missed?THE GAMEPLAY IS FLIPPING EPIC. You can expect hours of fun with heavy doses of adrenaline and seizure inducing frustration to boot. Long time CS and Battlefield player love me some Fallout and Elder Scrolls I've even been known to dabble in some Civilization. PUBG is hands down the absolute best game in my library. I have to peel myself away from it. I actually might have a problem. Enjoy!

review: First of all I just wanna point out to all new players that this game has no tutorial whatsoever not even little pop up tips. So if you want to learn how to play you'll have to either look it up online or just dive in head first and wing it from there.Overall the game is very tense and exciting throughout and keeps you on your toes the whole time. The guns do tons of damage and even if you manage to get the drop on someone and kill them you'll rarely leave a gunfight unscathed. Even someone armed with just a pistol can take down someone with a shotgun and sniper rifle if they're lucky. This can be a blessing and a curse as you can easily die if you so much as stop moving for a second to pick something up or look around.

review: 我从来没有开过外挂 最终还是被封了 我只是和外挂匹配到过然后我就被封了 我实在没有办法 要是你们匹配到外挂你们也有可能被封 我没有任何提示的情况下被封一百年 我真的拿98块喂狗都比这个强 不知道当初瞎了眼买这个游戏 我人生中第一个花钱买的游戏就是这样的 实在是太烂了 我非常无力对于蓝洞的封禁 机器就把我封了一百年 现在我在玩lol 至少不会误封我 他们封外挂不厉害 误封正常游戏玩家和你好然后公布说自己封了多少多少外挂 就算你要封你也要给我说明为什么封了 我什么也没收到就被封了 实在是很气愤 希望大家不要买 这游戏 外挂多治理不了 但是各种充钱皮肤到时很勤快 现在这游戏对外挂已经没有办法 加上各种看不懂的游戏更新 再加上没有任何作用的道歉 假如别人给你道歉然后你就要给人家98块你愿意么 对新手太不友好 前一百多两百个小时基本全是落地成盒 完全没游戏体验 各种外挂 各种bug 所欲要入手的朋友们 希望这条评论能给你们帮助 谢谢

review: If it weren't for so many prominent Youtubers and streamers this game would be considered trash. It's really a tale of great marketing but little else. $30 to basically beta test this game is way too steep to recommend to anyone. It can be fun but the amount of issues and missing SIMPLE game mechanics is absurd. PUBG is just a decent game that gained prominence at a time when large titles have turned off a lot of fans Battlefront 2 CoD etc. So this seems to be the only alternative for multiplayer battle royale kind of games. If you haven't bought it already just wait a year for all the clones to come out (such as the zombie horde game survival genre or minecraft type games) which will most likely have vast improvements.

review: I want my money back even after playing over 30 hours. I feel scammed and I would rather have given the 30 euro I spent on this piece of to a friend for them to buy something better like MGSV or Rainbow Six Siege. I regret funding these bastards and their cash grab of a game. Spent far less for far better games in the past such as MGSV (24 euro on sale) Rainbow Six Siege (20 euro) and Spec Ops the Line (2.50 euro on sale). Meanwhile this game is only getting '33%' sales now because they are losing a lot of their player base including me.Unoptimised riddled with microtransactions and the majority of team mates I've played with were toxic as (teamkilling and screaming through mic) or didn't speak any english on a European server. Stay away unless on sale and unless you think you're a big Battle Royal fan.

I am writting this review in the hopes that the developers see this and finally realize the mistakes they are making with this game. I already payed real money to purchase and play this game. I shouldnt have to spend real money to gamble on a skin if i want one. fortnite allows you to actually pick the skin you want and its free to play. so its more understandable on their terms. this game was much better when i first started playing then now. you guys have changed way to much and not fixed the problems that need to be corrected. like getting shot through walls? or gettting ran over by a vehicle that is barely moving that you are next to/on the side of trying to get in. fix your current issues before trying to become more like fortnite. this game was better than fortnite prior to all of the changes.

review: ***UPDATED***My first Battle Royal type game ever and lets just say its solid where it is right now...not complete by anymeans obviously. I mean look how many people are online at a given time im hoping all that revenue gets invested well and i have full confidence that the devs will pull through with an amazing and polished game! i usually never purchase early access and i held my breath while i bought this one....but man am i glad i didProsan array of weapons from all shapes and sizes are present with semi realistic handling and loads of customizable gear you can find on the battlegrounds.Movement is semi fluid...well..atleast for me i know some may disagree and i feel like some improvements could be made of course (like being able to pull yourself up over a ledge that isnt even above your chest) but at the stage right now its solid. I also liked the idea of being able to roll in with a sqaud of people and try to make it as a team communication is rare but still its nice knowing i can loot with someone watching my back. Being able to drop into the map from a plane is great as well being able to pick the point in the map that you wanna start and seeing all the opposition falling in all around you its kinda exciting. And lets talk about heart pounding action!!! Try looting and then you hear a door open in the house your in or vice versa! You enter a house and hear a dude upstairs running around like a dying gazelle with tapdancing shoes on man the RUSH! Serious tho at this stage its apparent this is Early Access but everything is so nice at this stage that it can only go up from here!ConsNetwork isnt the best as aspected with most games shoot AAA games cant get it right i dont expect an Early Access game to either in its first month of being out. And my own personal complaint is the Inventory system...just feels very..barebones...idk i just personally feel like it needs something else. other than that....well lets just say this game is exactly what its trying to be and with alil work it could be the best at it.***Updated section***OK well....wow...hmm...as you can see i used to love this game mechanically it has improved abit. People like to complain because they cant believe they get killed in any way shape or form. Or most people "believe" they hit a dude one place when they really didnt. The game is broken in some places and i wont deny it. But man oh man does it take just ONE thing to mess it all up? Yeah it does but guess what we get two doozies! ONE being the god forsaken 2.50 keys for crates you EARNED. BS Bunghole....BS....TWO being the useless event pass. Also corp....how are you gonna sue a company for copying you and then attempt to copy them...but fail?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Before the most recent update this game was great. And the update itself was fine the new content was cool and they didn't mess up the gameplay. But the update messed up literally everything else. Whenever I finish a match the game will crash making me force quit it. But even after that the game continues to run in the background and can't even be closed by task manager forcing a system restart if i want to launch it again. If you do manage to play a game there's a 50 percent chance that it will just give you a message on your screen that says "Lost connection to steam". If i was having connectivity problems while playing this would make sense but i wasnt. I was in a long distance fire fight and everything was going fine. But then this window pops up. One you get that screen your only option is to hit "ok" which then instantly closes the entire application. But remember whenever the game closes it keeps running in the background and you have to restart your system. Honestly before this update i would have totally given a positive review. But at this stage the game is barely playable. Bluehole needs to fix this as soon as possible.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I enjoyed pubg for the most part. I owned this through early access and it was pretty fun. Although as soon as they started focusing more on microtransactions and crates and other cash grab practices it quickly went downhill for me. Now with this latest update releasing the new map "Sanhok" This map seems less optimized than the already poorly optimized maps before it (even though this is much smaller). The UI is still laggy and full of bugs. It seems like they are trying the mimic fortnite's battlepass system which would be fine BUT this is a paid game. This costs $30 fortnite is free. These games may not be the same type of battle royale subgenre but we can clearly see which one is choosing the ethical route. If you are planning on buying pubg I personally don't recommend it because it seems like they are focusing more on microtransactions than actual gameplay and progression.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly this game has been ruined. If you like playing with your team mates this isn't the game for you. When I first got this game i really loved it. I still love it but this game and it's developers have let me down and it's unacceptable.The first problem 95 98% of players on north american server are chinese. I have played roughly 25 games since i have talked to someone whose first language is chinese. Most people at least can say hello in english but there always remains a huge language barrier which gets them and often me killed in the process. It is awful and has ruined the teamwork part of the game. LOCK THEM TO THEIR OWN REGIONA SERVER OR THIS GAME WILL SUFFER.Problem #2 Chinese hackers tons of em. You should see the number that has been banned i can't imagine they've even reached the tip of the iceburg. The hacks are blatant and you hve no way of seeing if your reports are doing anything. If someone is clrealy hacking but another enemy happens to finish you off you are unable to report that hacker (really dumb devs have 0 foresight.)Problem #3 This game is way too much looting. It shouldn't take 15 minutes to find a SCOPE and sometimes a RED DOT! Yes you heard me! I've been unable to find them for that long before. Magnification is a fundamental part of playing the game just as fundamental as HAVING a gun. The nature of the combat garuntees you will need a scope if you plan on traveling any distance in anywhere that isnt a city. Scopes are just wayy too rare. The 2x at least needs to be a bit more common.... Every time someone i know quits this game it's because thy say th #4 Random bugs Despite nearing a billion dollars in sales in this game the devs still are going slow and suck at fixing and identifity MAJOR ISSUES. Just two games ago I vaulted a normal barrier with nothing obstructing and i was killed instantly from "falling." That is unnacceptable in my opinion. There were also people not thinking when they put together the map because there are many places you can get permanantly stuck. I was once stuck and after about 30 seconds I dropped dead. There also still remains an insane amount of unvaultable perfectly low barriers. There are also tree trunks to hide you body in and shoot out of without even being seen#5 To my knowledge smoke grenade patterns are decided clientside. I've been hididen in a smoke that's blowing to the right only to be targeted and shot then realising that on their screen it's blowing a completely different way that me and to him im just standing in the open. #6 This one is a huge joke/ The death cam and . When you see the crosshair it's not even on the spot you were aiming. The movements aren't fluidto a much much bigger extent replay system is basically a huge broken mess.i don't even know what to say. The crosshair isn't where it belongs the movements look like someone has parkinson's When you fire and moreso for first shots where it's nearly 100% that don't make a sound flash or show recoil.#7 This is a problem i have personally. They've made so much money off of us and they can't even fix the game. They're approaching 1billion in sales with all the copies they sold. There are probelms everywhere I can't mention them all because i don't know about more. The game is fun but if the devs don't make a big change this game is going to run into the ground.Yes I am mad. I'm level 5 mad I paid 30 bucks for this and i cant even get an english team mate who isn't hacking. I just want a normal functional game.

review: I really tried to like the Game and if I look at the Gameplay alone I do but it has a lot of flaws and feels unpolished. About 65% of the time you're not dying because of lack of skill you're dying becuse you ran for 10min without seeing anyone and then someone is behind you or as soon as you move in a bit more visible space there is already a camper with a sniper and 8x scope waiting 400m away. Another big problem is the loot system you can run through two big houses and the only thing you find are gloves and a extended mag for a pistol while the other person who is with you on the spot found a scar m4 lvl3 vest and a backpack. This makes Solos nearly impossible to play while duos and Squads are fun most of my friends already gave up on the Game. I know a lot of pubg players do not want to hear this for whatever reasons they might have but they should copy some things from Fortnite so that this game becomes actually fun and not just frustrating 8 out of 10 rounds.

review: This game is as if the DEV teams of H1Z1 and Arma got together and made a game.Except unlike h1z1 this game doesn't suck. And it's a lot more like Arma in the combat mechanics where you have to think tactically and not just run and shoot everything.UPDATED REVIEW 19/06/18 I made this review had only been in early access for a week or two which is when i bought it. And while making this review i accepted that an early access game would be buggy unoptimized and lacking content. I realized that when i had bought an early access game and looked past it.However now that it has been out of early access for a while now it is honestly shameful to see that they haven't much improved the situation in terms of the content and optimization. Granted they've fixed many game breaking bugs (which they HAVE to do may i add) and improved the optimization but for a game that is now fully released and has been for a while now the optimization and the sever lack of content is concerning. They rushed the 1.0 update in my opinion (maybe so they could add skins quicker without breaking their promise of not adding them during early access?). Honestly the game should be coming out of early access with the release of the winter map this coming November not when it did.And as someone who plays a lot of CS GO i know how important a good netcode low ping and high tickrate is in a first person shooter. Let me say this the net code in this game is a joke. The servers run on very low tickrates and as a result some shots that should register dont and because for some reason they refuse to region lock players you sometimes have players from Asia or NA running around on 200+ping shooting you while you're in cover simply because of this fact.Also region lock should be implemented simply because such a disproportionately high amount of cheaters originate from China (remember proportions matter). If the anti cheat can't always catch them i don't see why we should deal with cheaters from other regions who also use high ping to their advantage.My overall verdict is that if you do not already own this game DON'T BUY IT for another year or two. Let them get their s**t together and actually make this worth the 27 (or 18 as its on sale as im writing this).

review: TL DR at the bottom PUBG is an amazing game when it works. The combat is intense the map is detailed and lively your heart races when you get near the last zone playing duos and squads is awesome. If PUBG didn't have the following flaw it would be my all time favourite game.And what is that flaw?The game was rushed into early access.Bluehole was so desperate to get PUBG out there they esentially created a barebones game then chucked it on early access and decided to update it from there. I suppose that's not all bad. We get to play it earlier than we would've done without early access. And we get to contribute to development. Sounds pretty damn good actually.Or at least it would have been if they added useful updates. Most of PUBGs early access updates have been graphical patches new items sounds and a more frontend polished feel. But it seems to me that Bluehole have completely forgotten about the backend of things.Optimisation server performance and fatal bug fixes have all been forgotten about. I'll go into more detail.Optimisational Flaws It's very hard to get PUBG to run at a decent speed without turning graphics to the minimum and even then you can run into errors. This isn't just a problem with potato PCs though everyone seems to have this.Server Performance &amp Networking You will soon come to hate the infamous 'Network Lag' box that pops up about 50 times in a game. The black box pops up and stops you from doing anything until it's sorted itself out. Most of the time it goes away in a few seconds sometimes it can take a minute. And quite often you'll have to Alt F4 your way out and reconnect to the game sometimes killing you.Again multiple case studies show that this isn't a client side issue and that even people on super high speed stable internet connections are often disconnected from games. It's not blamable on the game engine either. Squad and Fornite both use Unreal Engine (just like PUBG) and their servers are flawless.Fatal Bug Fixes PUBG crashes. A lot. More than it should. And it goes without saying it's not a client side issue (99% of the time anyway).Overall On the frontend side of things PUBG looks and feels amazing to play. It comes across at first as a very polished game with no reason to dislike. But once you put a few hours in you start to really see the carelessness and lack of effort that was put into the core mechanics. Many games have small flaws. ArmA 3 has a lot of issues sometimes and it can be a real pain to play. But it makes up for it in other aspects. Unfortunately PUBG just doesn't do this. And more often than not you're left pretty dissapointed because you crashed out when you could of won the game.Example Earlier today I was in a game. I was doing really well full gear and a perfect spot. Last 10 players I had this game in the bag. Then up comes our friend the Network Lag. I patiently waited for about a minute then opened up my Steam browser to check if my wifi was down. Nope running just as it should be. Waited another minute still got this 'Network Lag'. So I Alt F4 out and rejoin. As soon as I rejoin I am killed by the blue zone. Great I guess I'll join into another game. But oh no PUBG wasn't done with me. I didn't get a 'You Died' screen after this so I couldn't back out to the lobby. Tried to Alt F4 and I get some crazy error which then corrupts my game files and I have to validate them through Steam.TL DR / Conclusion PUBG is a great concept and in some aspects a great game. However I feel that the development should focus more on the backend areas to create a more stable frame. The release was too early and the updates focus on the wrong things.I would recommend keeping updated with the game and purchasing it once stability has been improved so that you don't end up with Network Lag PTSD.

review: Fantastic game. There is a learning curve and even when you get better you will sometimes still die in the first 2 minutes of a game sometimes but then onto the next one. Other than that this game is absolutely amazing!Blue hole has done exactly what they said they would and optimized the game got rid of most hackers made the game far less laggy and got rid of most glitches. The replay system is really good now and there are new maps coming out all the time. There is a lot more cosmetic options for clothes and guns now as well.There is still some lag misses on your shots but maybe once out of 5 hours of play with a half decent computer(i run a 1050ti and do just fine). A hacker will pop up every now and then but less and less. There is a reason so many people have 500+ hours on this(even negative reviewers). I say if you enjoy something enough to play 500 hours then you got your money's worth stop ing. Still the best battle royal game out there.

review: So I promised I would rewrite my review when my pc wouldn t crash anymore because of this game and it seems like the launch update did the trick. It plays much more stable right now and it even looks like the FPS has been increased a bit as well. The game however still crashes sometimes when returning to the main menu but luckily it doesn t happen often and it doesn t make my pc crash like before. It s also important to say that my friend doesn t have this problem at all which means that my problem might be rare and thus it might not affect you. The new desert map is really enjoyable and the vault mechanics work great. There are also a few new weapons and vehicles added and some of the sounds like the red zone bombs and engines of the vehicles have been improved. So since my main issue has been fixed because of the launch update and the addition of the new free content I will give this game a thumbs up now.Orginal ReviewI love the game it's fun to play yet I have to give it a thumbs down at the moment due to it's incredibly bad technical state. I had 160+ hours playtime before the last patch of 26 october 2017 the game worked fine. My system meets the recommended specs and I played with 45 80 FPS. Sure the game did glitch out a few times and it wasn't really well optimized but it still worked and it was fun. After this patch however the game causes my PC to randomly freeze / crash. I only have this problem while playing PUBG. This is why I can not give it a thumbs up at the moment the game is literally making my PC crash. When the problem is fixed I will change the review and definitely recommend it but for now it's a thumbs down for me.

review: I love playing this game as you can probably tell from the amount of hours i have put into it. However the sheer amount of absolute t from the developers especially with this last update is just baffling. The vast majority of the platerbase hates playing on miramar and even very high profile players like jackfrags have publicly said that they do not want to play it. Instead of doing something about it they added the map select feature but now they have removed it again because it supposedly impacted the queue times. If nobody wants to play miramar and map selection messes with the queue time wouldn't the logical decision be to remove the map and fix the issues before forcing people to play it? Anyways. By far the biggest issue is the disgusting cash grabbing attitude of the developers. I usually don't have a problem with paid items in games as long as they are only cosmetics but when the developers would rather make a ripoff of the fortnite battlepass for 10$ on top of the initial **30$ price of the game itself** than fix big issues that a lot of people have been complaining about you have to wonder what the intention of the devs is.

review: Since Ive played this for 300+ hours ima give a positive review. Its fun better with friends. When you get killed by a number tho for example NA 240 413 or as if its a code not like a name or anything chances are its possibly a hacker. Its rare to get killed by hackers or if you made it to top ten maybe u might meet one. Ive encountered two hackers when I've reached top 10 usually in the kill feed ull see it appear multiple times when it kills people. Usually a sniper would take two shots to kill someone one to see where the shot goes the other to finally hit its mark. But what if a sniper just constantly gets hit with just one shot in the head not a test shot. If you died by a number its probably likely a hacker. I have yet to encounter hackers in duos or squads.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is absolutely fantastic. Yes it has bugs due to it's engine and early access status but it's clear they are working to update the game and iron out bugs. It's beyond me why the toxic community from CS and H1Z1 have the attitude towards this game that they do. Maybe when they grow up and learn how these things work they'll understand. Or not.It's a great 3rd/1st person shooter in a battle royale (think Hunger Games) where you parachute in look around for weapons and armour then procede to take down the other 99 players. When it was first announced I thought it would just be another of the cash ins on FPS games that Steam was cursed with at the time (asset flippers low quality games badly supported titles poor devs etc) so I didn't pre order it. I really regret that now as I like the look of the items you got with preorder!Still I've got nearly 500 hours in this game and while I'm not much more than an average player the game is so addictive. The worst thing about this game are the toxic players out there so it's probably best to turn off ingame world speak until Bluehole add some form of player identification so you can report players for racism etc. As for cheating it's rife in most games out there but if you look at the ban reports there are huge amounts of people that have been removed. Clearly the anti cheat and report feature is working. I'd defintely recommend this especially if you have a group of friends to play in duos or squads of 4. To my mind the group games are much more fun as you can add in communications team tactics etc. I can honestly say it's the best money I've spent in a long time. It's onwards and upwards for this game. Buy it. Buy it now.

review: I nejoy the gameplay quite a bit but the way microtransactions have been implemented is unforgivable. There is in game currency earned through playing and you can spend real money. However most (I have heard most but to me it is ALL) of the loot boxes require a key to unlock and keys can only be bought with real money. After my first five hours of play i had not obtained a single new item. Not one. EVERY crate I bought with my in game currency had a lock on it. It takes a special kind of sadist (or unabashed greed) to design a system like that. These guys won't get another cent of my money on this or any other game they might make in the future.

review: Heard some users were misbanned some time ago. Never thought much about it until it hit me today. I woke up played one round died at 15th with ZERO kill. And then I got banned. I have put 954hours plus 77hours of test server into this game. Like many others I've also grown tired by the increaingly disgusting environment in third person mode by cheaters/hackers from (you know which country it is). I mean I get that bluehole is trying to make this game better? But hey are you guys experiencing any improvement? No! The Cheating/hacking is getting worse! With each god damn update! And who's to blame? Honest users like us?! I loved this game. For better or worse it is a unique experience and an addicted one. And I know this's just a 24hour softban. But this is the day I delete this game for good. Spent your time on something more promising and less irritating. This game is DONE.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Fun game very competitive for an early release. This is not a complete game in anyway. On top of that every single update they say "etc. time" but when the time is up they say "Sorry... We have to add another hour for maintenance for 'unseen technical issue' " and this happens on every update. Yeah every update... Its like a repition of unseen technical issues. OH and another thing is that most of the time they update is peak hours of playing. Why would any business shutdown for updates while most customers are using the product? Sad that I love this game but it just becoming way to much of a hasle to try to play. Maybe in the future it will get better but for now it gets a thumbs down until they can do something about it.

review: This game is currently a hype. If you have not heard about it you live behind a rock. It is by far one of the most played games on steam and might break some console games in the top 10 this year so we pc master race can finally say its not just pokemon which is the most sold game. well except it comes out on consoles then probably the console version of it itself will beat itself dayum.It is nothing new however neither in mechanics nor gameplay. You can have the same game in thousand different ways since years but nobody until now cared. Since none of them mixed it so well together with the east european arma/dayz style the correct amount of cold war era weaponry and the good hommage to the original movies of battle royale.It is just a coincidence dayz got a huge amount of negative reviews recently for not finally finishing up while this early access game clearly can do it better with stock assets and stuff.I do not recommend you to buy this if you still read comments to buy it. I do recommend you to buy this if you want the game anyway since it's fun. But make no mistake it has pro's and cons... Pros map with different highlights and theme parks stuffed with weapons and a circle that gets smaller proven game concept straight execution literally start with parachutes only after game lobby burning people from lobby make nice effect on plane voice chat optional thank the heavens pan deflects bullets 100 player servers random teamups instead of trying to pimp one of those half baked 3d engines like arma or h1z1 into becoming a shooter they successfully nerfed the unreal engine into feeling slightly less smooth but still better than the other alternatives. no arctic monkeys or acid rain just plain good old artillery no rain in buildings your skill in this game is visible on the amount of viewers on your twitch account everybody in this game is a pro not a starving simulator so no food and drink and stuff so far no micro transaction based weapon drops good to make streams because emergent gameplay and people watch it no cover for your enemies because trees respect each others private space and grow far from each other or sometimes you even can enjoy that your building models do not load so you can just enjoy poor mans wallhack you can get into a car of an enemy since its not just a mod from another game where the modder didnt figure out how to circumvent teams because the modder didnt have to write code Cons no skill gameplay with little improvement curve first person might make you think you are a hamster some people are taking the molotovs and throw them away way to early in the lobby srsly first come first served encounters yes they said no microtransactions but then there was some and i include it but i dont care more hackers than they admit but luckily who cares as long as the worst get banned from time to time seriously who hacks in a game where no one gives a flying f* if you are good at it unneccessary to blame yourself if you fail syndrome inclusive ragequits eventual unwanted hunger on victory you could make the same game after a week learning any 3d engine and buying assets in a store but you will never get rich by it so you can try the next best thing and spend as much time in steam market as you spend in playing this game solo because you think you have to exercise a gameplay that is based on a books someone wrote about russian roulette because most people have voice off you cant play herbert the pervert dont you get stuck on a prop or get killed by a player whose houses didnt load refresh button is not the best solution for not being smart enough to integrate coherentui into your blueprint based UDK "code".

review: certain aspects of the gunplay are pretty good and the mode in general can be really exciting the management behind this game is absolutely diabolical at every stage they have been trying to milk the game and the player base for what its worth they rushed to get the game out on console in the buggiest state possible they rushed to give us the most halfassed cosmetic lootbox system where a 'premium skin' would just be a fullbright orange weapon and they also rushed to get the game out on mobile.truly shameless a game that made an absolute ton of money on a very small investment (alot of the PUBG art assets come from an Asset Store!!!!) that proceeds to use this success to make even more money in the laziest ways possible. the game is fun but i have to not recommend so that we teach developpers that this is not acceptable. thankfully it seems the player base has had enough of their t and the game is on a severe decline.

review: 这是一个非常神奇的世界 在里面会遇到各路神仙大显神通 堪比封神时期 他们均来自不同的修真门派 天眼宗 独门秘术 天神之眼 神识覆盖整座岛屿 活人死人 枪支弹药尽收眼底 无视任何掩体及障碍物 死射门 独门秘技 死亡锁定 遇人秒锁 开抢即爆 指哪打哪 无论是头还是心脏 无论目标是在高速移动 还是在千里之外 阅后即秒 冷酷无情 神拳寺 独门秘技 无影神拳 无论目标身在何方 或身在何种掩体保护中 击拳即可命中 敌人只能在绝望中哀嚎 在哀嚎中被拳打成盒 人无处可寻 己无处可逃 风行阁 独门身法 凌波微步 百米一秒八 谜踪身法秀遍全场 子弹射速再快 永远无法触及他们的身影 瑜伽派 独门身法 橡胶之体 可让四肢躯干无限伸缩 杀人角度堪称刁钻至极 若幸运 也许在你倒地的一瞬间 你可以看到他们诡异且漫长的双手拿着枪对着你 法宝门 独门秘术 地爆天星 以咒术催动手雷变大 直至顶破苍穹 众人目睹后无一不瞠目结舌 随之引爆 其威力大过原子弹数倍不止 顷刻间全岛生灵灰飞烟灭 黑洞门 独门秘术 万象天引 以秘术将全岛所有人吸附到自己面前 无视距离 并将其定住屠杀之 堪称惨绝人寰 灭绝人性 由于修仙界向来以造福修真者为道 且所有的修真者都刻守此道 顾各大门派之间从未有过门派之别 所以各路修真人士都汇集各家所长 熟练运用各门各派之秘术 秘技及身法 以至融会贯通 其中以天眼宗和死射门为首 入门门槛最低 秘术也最容易精通 顾人数最多 因此大部分修真者至少都会 天神之眼 和 死亡锁定 而少数天赋异禀的修真者除了这两项秘术以外 还会一些其他门派的秘技 更有不出世大罗神仙所有秘术 秘技及身法全部精通 其通天彻地之能 堪称比创世之神 蓝洞 所以再此奉劝各位妄想踏足修仙界的麻瓜和无灵根者 趁早悬崖勒马 切勿误入歧途

review: Well I bought this game before I knew Fortnite existed....and don't regret it a single bit. In all honesty I don't know why people compare them that much but here I am. I mean yeah they are both a shooter you have to scavenge your gear and you fall from a plane of sorts into some island...yet that's where all similarities end. In PUBG you'll find the most reallistic scenario weapons and mechanics. Yet don't be fooled into thinking that bullets get affected by wind like in Sniper Elite.The good everything....when it works. Hell I find it frustrating getting stuck on some random piece of wood just to get my brain splattered all over the ground...or the car suddently deciding that gravity is just a meme and chooses to lift from the ground for no apparent reason....but the worst thing of them all by miles are cheaters. If I let myself go explaining that one my review and account would surely get banned due to "some" extremely accurate yet offensive words.So yeah thats about it. Great game it is still evolving for good but it has a lot of ground to cover while keeping new content coming in. Which speaking of it it's a shame that the PUBG Corporation had to get it's butt kicked by some random free game in order to achieve this level of content development.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game 5/5 Playing experience 2/5While the game itself is excellent in its simplicity (a bunch of people scavenging for weapons and going at it with the last one(s) remaining the winner) it would be even better if it actually worked relatively well. Small bugs that make you run while blinking back a couple of paces now and again are annoying but now not even that incomplete gaming experience is availabe as servers are offline.In short the game itself is excellent (at least during the early access phase it was). It does not run smoothly though and we probably have millions of patches (as usual) to look forward to... Yay...Anyone interested in buying this game would probably do well to wait a few months as the game is nearly unplayable at times at the moment. When it IS playable however it is one of the most exciting and addictive games out there. Regardless of whether you like 1st person shooters or not.I recommend this game to everyone... ...when it's finally ready in a few months.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Positive and Negative honest review Unfortunately i have to write this review in a negative tone not because of the game literally just because of the influx of cheaters i've come across... At first i'd accept it and move on the odd 1 or 2 cheaters in every 10 15 games i played but now its becoming a joke they are so obvious to someone who has alot of experience in this game in the last 5 games i've played i have ran into cheaters with a burst fire M16A4 downing me from 400 metres+ and watching them in duo's with a buddy who isn't cheating and obviously letting the cheater push first to kill us before we even have a chance to fire our weapons. I understand that the people at Bluehole Studio are doing their best to deal with this but in my opinion if you don't deal with these cheaters RIGHT NOW it will be the one and only thing to destroy the game thats gotten it so right and so good so far. I still play this game every day in a hope that I run into a cheater just to report them so i can help clean up the cheater infestation but for now i'd hold off on buying this game until its cheater free and return when its back to itself in full glory.TL DR I do recommend this game but NOT right now due to massive cheater influx.

review: I enjoy this game a ton. Its a different experience every time you never know what youll get yourself into. The gunplay is great and fun and you may surprise yourself about what situations you survive. But this game is underdeveloped the devs are focusing their resources on a lawsuit rather than updating and adding more to this already good game. There is a communication issue between the players and the devs and the players really need to know whats going on with the game. There are connection issues performance issues and many more. All these need to be fixed to keep its player base this game needs to be updated more often and more content is needed more often to keep its player base. I cant see myself leaving this game because i love it so much but its player base is drastically dropping and the devs are playing a very dangerous game of not fixing the game and going after other companies for pitiful reasons. Over all I would recommend this game but I also think you should know whats going on so you are not disappointed with what is happening. With recent things happening i feel the team is trying to turn around what theyve been doing and communication more often and they recently started a reddit thread that will hopefully be happening every friday for information on certain things and bugs noticed by the community.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) is a battle royal genre video game. It's enticing graphics and immense competitive gameplay puts you the player in a map (currently two) with 99 other players. It's up to you to scavenge the surrounding areas and find loot like weapons armor medicinal supplies and ammo to survive until you are the last man standing.PUBG was a unique experience for me. It was fun exhilarating yet slow and meh paced. Gun fights are really fun especially if they're quite the distance away and both players have scopes. Close combat gun fights are also really fun but not my cup of tea. It is especially easy to be picked off if you don't know what you're doing.I've only had about 3 hours of gameplay before I gave up for a while. The game is really fun really exciting and it lives to it's tale. I don't quite understand the issue with loot boxes and the need for keys. Accessories do not apply any in game advantages except for looking cool.PUBG is a really fun really worth thirty bucks to spend. I recommend it as the game is only growing more and more popular. It's fun exciting thrilling but can be slow at times. It's fun!Rating 8.3/10.

review: Most of the negative reviews on this game are whats to be expected with an Alpha game. To be fair its what Id expect from a beta so all in all very good. Ive played alot of h1z1 and this game is by far the best.Few pros and cons Pros More weapon options in game Full customizable wepons in game can change mags and grips and best of all SCOPES Maps are more "full" Lots of places to go and explore You choose where you land on the map. No random drops in the middle of nowhere YOU CAN DRIVE A BOAT People in the lobby are hillarious. You will here IM A SNAKE being shouted all the time.Cons Im not sure how servers are hosted but alot of lagging issues (I play squad alot with 3 other friends from around the country and when I have lagging issues they all experience this too) Few hackers. There is no spectate mode when you die (on solo play) so you cant see if people are hacking or not. You can litteraly walk in 2 rooms and get all your armor and 3 great wepons or you could walking into 10 houses and just find a crow bar. Loot isnt always well ballecedOverall a great game. Got 31 hours played so far will update this review if anything changes.

review: I think I've finally zeroed in on why this game is fundamentally unenjoyable to me.Although it's considered the "father" of Battle Royale this is the most generic form of the game mode. Out of the flavors of Battle Royale you have Fantasy Realm RoyaleBuilder FortniteMilsim Arma3 BR (My personal favorite)But what is PUBG? It's not milsim like its predecessor and it has no nuances. There isn't that much in terms of item variety... every round feels essentially identical. It has a few nice features (vaulting was well done) but for me that's the only thing this game does well over other games.They took something great and simplified it for the masses but now they have nowhere to expand. They're being outpaced by every other development team which can explore their respective flavors more and update far more frequently.I hope they can find their strength and make the game something that expands on their particular subgenre of Battle Royale before it ends up dead in the water. As my friends stop wanting to play I'll most likely as well. I used to enjoy ARMA BR solo but haven't had the urge to play this game unless friends coerce me.

review: It's an interesting concept but I'm not sure I really like it that much. Maybe it's just me but running around a large open map for 5 minutes before being killed in two shots by a player I didn't see with much better gear than me didn't really make for an engaging experience.On top of that the customisation options are laughably limited. Apparently there's more available through a lootbox system which is quite frankly a stupid idea. You buy lootboxes using points earned in game and get random cosmetic rewards from them. Why not just have a cosmetics shop and let us pick what we want to spend the points on? Or better yet don't start us off with such a laughably small collection of cosmetics just so you can stick a bunch of them in a token gambling system.The game seems stable enough. I heard a lot of complains about glitches and hackers but I didn't run into any during the three matches I played. What I did find incredibly annoying was half the time I tried to play the game refused to work because the servers were too busy. I didn't pay 25.99 for a game that I can't play if it decides it has a headache.Which brings me on to my final but by no means least relevant complaint the price. This is NOT a 26 game this is a 15 game at best and even that might be being generous. What you get for the ridiculous price is nowhere near worth it even if you enjoy the 100 player battle royale thing. I complained earlier about the lack of cosmetics and frankly I'd say any game that has the gall to lock half its content behind a lootbox system should not be charging this much as the base price. This is probably just down to my taste but if you like shooters there are better games out there and if you like survival games there are better games out there. This is really just an okay at best game that was massively overhyped by livesteamers and I wouldn't recommend buying it until the price drops considerably. It's not a bad game but it's certainly not worth the price.

review: I awake on a small island gun shots are heard everywhere. A strange man who looks to be chinese confronts me. The loud and beckoning words "CHINA NUMBER 1" fill the air. I am rivetted shocked to the core realising we only have 12 seconds until something but until what!? That I do not know. Before I knew it I was sky diving out of a plane plummiting towards earth are speeds that I thought not possible. My paracute deploys I am in a panic. I see a plethora of fellow combatants paracuting to what I could only describe as a school. I on the other hand land in a peaceful compund not a person in sight. I enter one of the houses I find weapons helmets and gas cans alike sprawlled across the floor. Hmm I think to myself must be Russia. I pick myself up my weapon of choice. A pan... I weild this pan with might. What felt like hours pass I stay laying in the floor on the house. I can see out the window a blue transparent wall closing in all around me. Gun shots grow louder as the forcefield grows smaller. The blue is tiny now surrounding nothing buy my house. As a door opens a man fully kitted with weapons a SCAR L shotgun backpacks you name it he had it. "This is it I thought to myself." I stood up wearing nothing but my underwear I swung my pan with such ferocity. *CLANG* a red mist sprayed from his torso. He was dead. It was over the circle disappeared and infront of me a chicken dinner.I then brought PUBG good game. I rate 8//8

review: It s a great Idea of a Survival of the fittest Title it brough revolution to the "King of the Hill" Games but is sadly nothing more than an Inspiration for future Developers coming up with a better made Survival Game. I understand the hype all around this revolutionary Game. But I dont understand why People play it.Reason why ? You want to shot at someone while you are behind Cover the Red Dot points perfect on your Target s Head you take a last breath and maybe an Aimcorrection Boom you shot...you wait for the Bullet to approach his target...you are still waiting you are dead. You waited 5 Seconds with big Eyes shining with hope and adrenalin but you Bullet never approached his target because it was stopped by the Rock you are behind taking cover at. Simply a *Texturebug*. PC Version 1.0 you could not wait for it...you played on the Testserver already experienced that Rubberbending(getting teleport back all the time while moving) and you see the Countdown on Steam "Version 1.0 come out in 2 00 Hours" wondering how they could fix that bug so fast just like the Texturebug mentioned above. Finaly it s out you download it you play it and ...you realised...they ...they dont ? Isn t it great to be able to play with randoms in Squads in Duos when you don t find someone on the Steam Discussions which is no wonder because these Forums are overfilled with dumb fo.ols ? Definately but not when you Que on EU and you met Chinese people talking in their Native Language going Kamikaze harder than on Pearl Harbor all the time. Servers should be locked to your Account depending from which Country you play from you should not be able to switch Servers. Deathcam with 1.0 great! Well if it wouldn t load forever and with forever I mean endless I tested it several times waiting for 1 Hour at loading Screen of course went in the Meantime for a Meal or something and when I came back it was still loading. And you thought you could get that Hackers banned easily now with reports? Hah! Nope! I count it as Point too to release something like...that!?! This Ladys &amp Gentleman is how we get out the Beta and release it.I could easily go for more but I want to smoke a Cig now cause I need a break from writting as Grammatic as possible and when I am back I wont continue it is not worth the time anyway surely no one read it or getting that hate on me.Some Promo if you read so far I dont know why but I do play PUBG ESL at GosuGamer.net my Nick is KarlHeinzVonIrgendwoher recently 2. Place. If you are a Scout which you are by the chance of 0 00001% keep an Eye on me!

Now PUBG is currently in the stage where they're adding filling and getting all over the place and stuff is spilling out onto the kitchen bench yet people are complaining they're adding new content before adding fixes and optimisation that's kinda how the process works. review: I don't even know where to begin with this game but i'm going to go ahead and give it a shot. For starters this game is absolutely FLOODED with just about every language spoken EXCEPT ENGLISH. It has a rough learning curve and how you work with your team if you're not doing solo games will either make or break you. All is fair in the hunt for the Glorious Chicken Dinner!Pros Extremely team oriented outside of Solo play. Wepons are significantly balanced. Player base is MASSIVE. Virtually no wait time for games. Character customization. Visuals look very decent.Cons Introduced microtransactions for Keys (gambling) Playerbase consists of everybody that doesn't speak english Optimization is very sketchy on lower end computers still Server connection issues are always causing trouble Black screens on loading into a match can cause you to miss your drop or even disconnect and crash your game This game is absolutely FLOODED with cheaters right now. Battleye is struggling to keep up. Working on your leaderboard stats is pretty much pointless as they are CONSTANTLY resetting the leaderboards due to hackersWhile the Idea for this game is very good. The execution is terrible. Theres no region locked servers so every other country in the world connects to US servers just to "Troll the Americans" and it just ruins the game. Trying to play the game solo is your only chance if you don't have friends that play. Attempting to find a team in solo play that speaks english is virtually impossible. The Cons far outweigh the pros in this game and I find myself only on it when i play with a full team of friends. That being said I give it a 4/10 and i would not recommend this game unless you have a fairly decent size group that plays it.

review: I mean it's okay most of the time. However it can be quite pleasing when you are doing pretty good during a match. Then the other times you ask why you support a game with the worst developers since Plants vs Zombies. The game has an ridiculous amount of bugs and issues that exists and will continue to exist for long time. This game is worth it but will slowly drive you insane because of the issues you WILL face in this game. You can be fully decked out in gear where you can easily win the game with to reach the moist Winner Winner Chicken Dinner. Then all of a sudden on your three seater bike you flip over a hill and barely land the bike right side up. Then you die in a minor fiery explosion and cry on the inside. Then you play another round completely unsatisfied that you lost such easy game or go play an actually decent game like Iron Snout. #godbless

review: Great game but not for anyone who rages a lot. You land with nothing but that doesn't make it equal. Different people find different loot and some loot is better than others.The biggest problem is the wait times. It takes very long from the time you press play to the time that the play starts flying overhead. This means that a lot of the time people wait all that time then die within the first few seconds of landing. This can be very frustrating and time consuming.The main other problem is lag and performance. There is server lag sometimes and you need an above average computer to run this game let alone well.Other than that the game is revolutionary and will completely change the gaming genre. The devs are constantly improving the game and optimizing it so it will only get better from here.

review: Technically speaking this game is STILL a dumpster fire. I actually enjoy the gameplay itself well enough when I'm not being screwed by terrible hit registration or the abundance of hackers that plague the servers but that doesn't change the fact that this game is still FULL of bugs and glitches it's STILL the only game my high end PC has trouble running/crashes with and I get the feeling these issues aren't really going anywhere all this time and millions in profits for the developer later.If you don't have a crazy good computer I'd really recommend just getting Fortnite. It's obviously a much different experience and a lot of PUBG purists sneer at that game but it's fun in its own way and it won't make your computer suffer to run it. As is I really can't recommend spending money on this if only because it's further encouraging the people who made it that their broken unfinished product is worth the money.

review: I love this game but I love to hate it more. The sheer amount of chinese hackers on the OC server is absurd. Rubber banding when you first land (where the most critical fights happen) players with high ping that purposefully take advantage of this by chasing you down and punching you to death and squad members who speak no english are the worst parts of this game.I am still unsure how they are managing to call this game 1.0 when they are still having stability issues and havent implimented a reigon lock. I will change my review once these features are implemented. I feel like it was kinda rushed out the door for xmas and a company that does this to make $$$ to screw over it's players is not one that will have my support.

review: As you can see I have played this game quite a bit. People and about Bluehole only working on the loot crates. Who ing cares. Don't buy the stuff if you don't want it. It is all purely cosmetic. They ignore all the ACTUAL updates the game gets and about what it doesn't get. Everytime the devolopers update something that people wanted they find something else to about. People wanted more maps we have more maps. People wanted map selection we have map selection. People wanted performance improvements we also got that! Just not good enough for everyone apparently. I have had almost no performance issues in the past 3 updates.I love this game for everything it is. The realism the rush of getting a kill the waiting knowing someone is around and only having a pistol wondering if you're going to make it out alive. I love this game have since I got it and will probably continue to do so for years.

review: Owned PUBG on Xbox had about 10 days played built a gaming PC and bought it again lol. Overall I think it's an awesome game that's just a lot of fun to play solo or with friends. Guess I'll do a quick PRO/CON of my opinions since that's easy.PRO Good gunplay Good graphics Good terrain diversity Good weapon variation(feels like just about anything is viable) Good communityCON Crate microtransactions(take that as you will I know they need developement money) Controls can be a little clunky(movement) both on PC and Xbox(but it's not that bad) Vehicle mechanics although they've improved Like with many games the Devs can have very poor communication about know issues/bugsAt the end of the day most of the issues I think are wrong with the game are more Developer related than actual gameplay so it doesn't have THAT big of an impact more like annoyances. Anyway great game would highly recommend for anyone interested in shooters both casual and serious alike.

review: Well I tried PUBG today ended up refunding it before the 2 hour limit. I just didn't find it fun.Let me explain I HATE the gun balancing in Fortnite I hate that you can be killed by glitched gun damage I hate that every gun has the ability to instant kill you even with full health and shields. That all said at least Fortnite is not boring.I played 5 rounds of PUBG and spent 90% of my time running through areas looting stuff and never encountering anyone. When I bumped into someone I killed them with little effort and then continued doing nothing for another 20 mins. Rinse Repeat until it gets down to about top 5 and I get sniped from across the map by someone who the death cam shows is clearly hacking. This was exactly the same for all 5 games.Fortnite is a pain in the in many ways but at least when I get into a game it's fast paced filled with action and things to do and anything but boring. PUBG felt like Day Z with no zombies and that came was the worst I've ever played.

review: Edit on 1.0 I was playing a lot on test server (actually only played test server couldn't touch live game it was so bad in comparison) up until 1.0. The test server was a massive improvement over the state of the game at the time of original review. The lags are now gone FPS is great optimization overall has improved a lot. Of all the stuff mentioned below if the cheaters are gone (I hope they will be thanks to region/ping lock) the game is overall good and will get better. So yeah December out of EA gg BlueBalls!Original review The game itself would be awesome if it wasn't for super laggy servers with silly low tick rate first half of the match (until there are like 50 40 players left) you have trouble opening doors picking up loot registering shots stupid loot placement system basically broken RNG sometimes you loot 3 houses to only find comsetics (pants shirts etc) and pistol mags or smoke grenades then you die to a dude that had 3 rifles and armor in his house hackers now you see cheaters everyday headshot punching people across the map speedhacking aimbotting all the good stuff terrible optimization FPS drops lag spikes memory leak very bad experience overall very bad audio quiet is too quiet and loud is too loud you need to have the volume up to hear footsteps then you are deafened by the plane nearby shot etc. and your ears bleed when you're driving a car this is overall tiring and harmful to your ears bugs glitches 50% of the time you'll die for utterly stupid reasons like your vehicle exploding or your full mag hitting tiny wooden railing on the stairs while the enemy loads you full of lead or getting stuck on the parachute when landing close to a hous or a treeThey are trying to add more features to milk it before it's dead but there a lot of old bugs that don't get fixed and brak the game. December out of EA? Pffffft.

review: This game had the potential to be the biggest game on the market for years to come. It's a shame the developers took their initial success for granted and did not give the players what they asked for.I've had countless hours (528) of fun on this game with my friends however towards their "release" the game went horrifically downhill &amp it almost turned in to a money grab. None of the games real issues were and still mostly have not been addressed. The engine that this games runs off of is f**ked. They need some serious work in the development part of the team.PUBG Corp have recently announced some good changes that should have been made many months ago (i.e map selection) that would have kept their playerbase intact. If they want to keep their remaining players and perhaps draw old ones back they need to keep up with these USEFUL updates instead of the pointless crap that is skins.Fortnite has become my game of choice over PUBG recently simply because the game works. You join you win or die and then you restart with little wait time.In PUBG you join you walk around for 30 minutes before seeing anyone and then you usually die to some stupid bug or chinese hackers. Don't get me wrong the game was fun before the hackers.I think the game needs to close out faster. I hope the new map will be so much better. I believe that as it is a smaller scale map the games will run faster &amp that is what this game needs. I rate this game currently 7/10. Please continue to work and bring out updates the players actually want to see. Don't be the money grabbers. Don't be H1Z1.&lt Only buy this game if you don't get tilted quickly &amp enjoy crushed dreams/broken hearts monthly&gt
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So I was waiting for the official launch to post my review and that day has finally come so here it is!PUBG is a solid Battle Royale / Hunger Games style game with you and up to 98 other people air dropping onto an island (Or desert!) to fight for survival in a last man standing deathmatch. It caters to veterans of more realistic shooters like Arma as opposed to Call of Duty since the distances you'll be engaging most people in is quite large. That said it does get a bit frantic in close quarters so run and gun tactics are totally viable when in those situations. Prior to launch the game was a bit clunky at times seeming to crash every 5th game on rigs that are not 100% up to snuff but with the 1.0 update there has been a large amount of optimization and (as of writing this review) I have not crashed once despite playing on some definitely dated hardware.The main thing I can recommend for new players is patience. It's gonna take some time to adjust to the game and learn its nuances. There's no aim assist like you'd find in other FPS games like Call of Duty or Battlefield so you gotta get skilled at hitting your targets by yourself and realizing that the guns have a more realistic recoil pattern than games like Counter Strike. An AK is gonna kick like a horse and full auto spray with any weapon is gonna be difficult to hit anything at a range greater than 50m. That said it heavily rewards those with the patience and ability to adapt to its unique style of gameplay.Definitely play this game if you like a challenging multiplayer shooter.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly had seen this game around for a while and thought it was just gonna fade away like most games that come and go. But then I broke down and bought it man was this game worth $30. I have only won 3 game and I've played nearly 100+ hours. Games are very often never the same. Do you go school military base prison etc. and fight it out 20+ people for better gear do you try to land somewhere out in the middle of nowhere and hope you can find gear. The circle concept forces the games to close the distance between competitors which helps keep games shorter and makes people move instead of trying to camp (though camping inside the circle happens all the time). I have played exclusivly FPP servers since they came out and honeslty hate TPP now I just feel it's gimmicky since you can just use the camera to peek at people around corners and trees without exposing yourself to fire. It runs ok on my computer but the servers are not always the best.Bring back weather make events 3rd and 1st person etc.

Its too late to "get good" at this game. Id recommend the Mobile port over this its free and has all the aspects of this full version.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I would honestly not recommand getting this game at its current stage. The game had some nice concepts decent execution but its a game destoryed by the devs. Pros and Cons Pros Interesting play style surviving based on killing others getting stronger as you play through. Decent execution the server problem parachute problem optimisation has all been fixed. Despite me hating the game there are times which i play with my friend and all shout in excitement when we do something awesome. Highly replayable Nice ranking system I would consider it to be friendly to both veterans and new players joining the game. Cons Vehicle physics. What the actual is wrong with your ing roads? if i drive a ing motorcycle on the road it shouldnt flip and kill all of us on it every other time. The buggy feels like it has a magnet stuck onto the ground the thing barely flips. The amount of hackers in this game. There are simply too many it runis your 15 minutes of hard work searching through houses jumping fences and careful looting. The system doesnt even have any response for reporting you never know if the guy you reported is actually being banned or not. Too many times does the lobby jam which we see one player being ready but he actually isnt or vice versa. The ready screen is simply a joke if you ask me sometimes we'd have random region changes or random mode changes for seemingly no reason at all. Instead of working on a reliable anti cheat system working on a better loading screen better vehicle physics better optimisation the game devs decided.. all of you here have some new skins not happy? have some gun skins not happy? alright alright have this flare gun. There should be an option to select which ever weather/day time you want some of us did like the fog. Instead they just deleted it. The emote system made me hate cheaters sooooo much more goddamn it . The devs really need to reconsider their priorities.. They are a small company but PUBG made big sales and they made a very large sum of money personally I dont think its wrong to come up with new skins or new ways to cash(keys and such) but i do think that they might wanna fix their game and make it smooth first.
